<s>  review by david wilcock ? 1998 
<s>   " you know , for kids " - norville barnes 
<s>  no film in recent has left me with such conflicted feelings as neil jordan's harrowing , humorous , horrifying adaptation of patrick mccabe's novel about young lad francie brady's ( eamonn owens ) descent into madness in 1960s ireland . 
<s>  on one hand , it was difficult for me to become invested in francie's story because he is such an unsavory character , unjustifyably venting his rage at his nosy but otherwise harmless neighbor mrs . nugent ( fiona shaw ) . 
<s>  on another hand , i found it difficult to laugh at some of francie's darkly comic shenanigans because he obviously is such a sick , needy child , having been raised by a drunken father ( stephen rea ) and a suicidal mother ( aisling o'sullivan ) . 
<s>  on yet another hand , i also found it difficult to completely sympathize with francie during his more emotional scenes because some of his , for lack of a better word , " bad " deeds are so incredibly shocking in their brutality and the malicious glee in which he performs them . 
<s>  however , the butcher boy's power is undeniable , and the film as a whole is unforgettable--perhaps because it is so disturbing . 
<s>  what makes it so unsettling is the francie's overall wink-wink yet matter-of-fact attitude about everything , expressed in a cheeky voiceover narration delivered by the adult francie ( rea again ) . 
<s>  think heavenly creatures played largely for laughs , and you'll sort of understand . 
<s>  anchoring the whole film is the astonishing debut performance of owens ; love francie or hate him , you cannot take your eyes off of owens . 
<s>  the butcher boy truly is a twisted , unusual film that is bound to make just about anyone uncomfortable . 
<s>  in the lobby after the screening , i overheard one man raving about how great yet disturbing it was ; i also heard one particularly offended woman say with disgust , " that movie was so unfunny ! " 
<s>   " i didn't know what to expect . 
<s>  it's like something you chase for so long , but then you don't know how to react when you get it . 
<s>  i still don't know how to react . " 
<s>  --michael jordan , on winning his first nba championship in 1991 . . . or , 
<s>  my thoughts after meeting him on november 21 , 1997 
<s>  just how inseparable is the team of sgt . 
<s>  martin riggs ( mel gibson ) and sgt . 
<s>  roger murtaugh ( danny glover ) ? 
<s>  let's just say that when one partner asks the other partner to strip to his boxer shorts and then further asks him to run out into the middle of the road , flapping his arms while feverishly cackling like a chicken just to create a distraction , his partner actually does it ! 
<s>  the familiar lethal weapon family is back , including rene russo , who is now the expectant mother of riggs' child and joe pesci as the soprana-like , foul-mouthed former accountant who has decided to become a private eye . 
<s>  new to the team is chris rock , also a fast-talking , up and coming detective . 
<s>  trouble seems to follow the two veteran detectives where ever they go , and in this film , that is no exception . 
<s>  even when they are just taking a leisurely boat ride , they somehow manage to collide with a freighter ship . 
<s>  we here some ominous music , which clues us that a confrontation is about to happen . 
<s>  gunfire ensues , and when it's all over , the detectives want to learn more about this freighter by questioning a chinatown crime lord . 
<s>  although they don't know what they're looking for , their inquisitiveness causes the bad guys to take some action . 
<s>  and there's plenty of action here for two movies . 
<s>  led by fighting sensation jet li , whose martial arts skill is nothing less than impressive , he does what he can to make sure that no one finds out what they are up to . 
<s>  li is ruthless in his approach , will kill anyone just to make a point , and develops enormous disdain for the two detectives . 
<s>  there are terrific car chases , explosions and gunshot galore . 
<s>  it's a summer action recipe followed to the letter , and the result is nothing less than pure , unadulterated summer fun . 
<s>  but even too many explosions can get boring . 
<s>  to counter that , we are treated to several amazingly choreographed fight sequences with jet li . 
<s>  luckily , he'd rather fight hand-to-hand instead of firing off guns . 
<s>  meanwhile , when the detectives aren't reloading their guns or running from fireballs , they're engaged in sophomoric banter and silly conversations that provide a nice diversion from the hail of bullets . 
<s>  everybody gets in on the shtick . 
<s>  russo screams during her delivery , the crime lord has a few funny bits when he's being interrogated while being given laughing gas , and pesci and rock are very funny as they go at it discussing the drawbacks of having cellular phones . 
<s>  gibson and glover are always in sync and the film moves at a brisk pace to get to the final and terrific mano a mano . 
<s>  score one for the old guard . 
<s>  since 1990 , the dramatic picture has undergone a certain change of style . 
<s>  now , instead of emphasizing feel-good stories replete with characters of noble virtues , the screenplays and direction point toward human struggle and sorrow . 
<s>  this realist tendancy can be inspiring at times , as 1993's schindler's list shows . 
<s>  most of today's mainstream drama , however , creates an overabundance of emoting that can turn off members of the audience . 
<s>  that's why pictures like october sky , which are a throwback to the good ol' dramas of yesteryear , are such a welcome relief in contemporary cinema . 
<s>  the movie is based on the true story of homer hickam ( jake gyllenhaal ) , a teenager in the 1950's company town of coalwood , west virginia . 
<s>  it's a well-known fact that the only boys to make a name for themselves are the ones that get out of the town on football scholarships ; the rest grow up to work in the coal mine . 
<s>  the mine , which is run by homer's father ( chris cooper ) , is not the place for homer , however . 
<s>  after watching the soviet satellite sputnik shoot across the october sky in 1957 , homer feels a connection with the outside world -- as he puts it , " anyone in the world could look up and see the same thing i did . " 
<s>  drafting two of his best friends and the brainiac outcast , homer begins to construct rockets . 
<s>  with the help of their history teacher , miss riley ( laura dern ) , and several mine workers , the four are soon bound for great things . 
<s>  october sky is a skillfully crafted film , and most of that credit must go to director joe johnston . 
<s>  johnston -- whose career in the film industry includes everything from directing well-known titles like jumanji and the rocketeer down to an uncredited role as a death star trooper in star wars -- certainly knows what he's doing here . 
<s>  he molds characters which are true to life and also fun to watch into a plot that is straightforward and robust . 
<s>  he does not push any barriers , but instead adopts a conservative style of filmmaking which enhances the film's charm . 
<s>  his finesse brings out elements which might otherwise be lost -- such as the relationships between homer and various mine workers , or the silent struggle between homer's mother and father . 
<s>  the cast is well chosen , although the true bright spots are the supporting roles . 
<s>  laura dern ( jurassic park ) lends a strong performance in the role of the history teacher , giving the boys the support and guidance they need . 
<s>  her role is instantly likeable . 
<s>  chris cooper ( the horse whisperer ) , as homer's father , is less likeable -- even downright despicable at times -- but his turn here gives gravity to the movie . 
<s>  he's definitely a driving force in homer's life , and his more humane moments give the piece a certain dynamic that is commendable . 
<s>  the script is generally cheerful , projecting the boys' endeavors in a lighthearted manner . 
<s>  there are moments when it becomes predictable -- such as the train tracks scene -- and there are moments when it sacrifices orginality for the need to come up with an emotional plot twist . 
<s>  it highlights the essence of youth , however , and for its exceptional job at this it can be forgiven other missteps . 
<s>  october sky should be a success with audiences . 
<s>  although it doesn't have the appeal of current teen flicks like varsity blues or she's all that , it certainly holds an undeniable quality that older crowds will lean towards . 
<s>  it's a welcome change to the dramatic genre , and one that everyone should see . 
<s>  a big surprise to me .

<s>  they replaced him just fine . 
<s>  not with john goodman , he didn't do much of anything , but with the brilliant actor joe morton , who can really sing .

<s>  peter o'toole 
<s>  after having heard so many critics describe " return to me " as an old-fashioned hollywood romance , i kept asking myself going into this movie : what exactly is an old-fashioned hollywood romance ? 
<s>  what made " return to me " old-fashioned and old-hollywood ? 
<s>  was it the tunes from sinatra , etc . , legendary singers the senior citizens in the film constantly harp on ? 
<s>  was it the glamorous , sophisticated feel ? 
<s>  the charisma of the two leads ? 
<s>  even now i can't say that i have gotten any closer to the real answer , because i haven't see that many old-fashioned hollywood romances . 
<s>  i don't think any of the romances i've seen have been classified as such . 
<s>  which leaves me the option of vaguely agreeing with my fellow critics -- " return to me " was old-fashioned in the sense that it reminded me of the way the younger generation perceive venerated old hollywood magic , the way i perceive cinnamon spice and apple cider . 
<s>  it was traditional , magical . 
<s>  we knew it couldn't be too daring , or have any surprising plot twists that many cynical modern romances are apt to throw in . 
<s>  it was a romance told with such endearing simplicity , tenderness , and love ( from director bonnie hunt ) that it couldn't help but sparkle with charm despite its shortcomings . 
<s>  the film owes a lot of what it has to bonnie hunt's direction . 
<s>  from the very first bird's eye view of chicago , zooming in slowly toward the insignificant bob rueland ( david duchovny ) , accompanied by the " return to me " ballad ( by whom ? ) , we can tell we're in for something sweet . 
<s>  the scenes between the characters are endearing , truthful , with just a hint of fantasy . 
<s>  real people don't act that way ; real people aren't that nice . 
<s>  we know all this , and yet we want to believe in these folks' existence . 
<s>  the premise itself seems to have sprung out of a fairytale , but hunt's rooting the fairytale in common chicago folk simultaneously lends credit to the scenario and tinges everyday urban life with a hint of the ethereal . 
<s>  everything is ordinary--yet beautiful--in this film . 
<s>  >from the festive little family restaurant to grace ( minnie driver ) and bob's wardrobes . 
<s>  from the eloquent , not-in-a-hurry to progress storyline to the dainty watercolors that grace paints . 
<s>  from the animal stars to the way all the characters interact on screen -- the most beautiful part . 
<s>   " return to me " has done an excellent job of assembling together a group of actors who blend in effortlessly as a family : the audience has no trouble at all believing that this rambunctious family actually does exist . 
<s>  we care for them , laugh with them , cry with them ; we're concerned that the little boy will pick up cursing from his father . 
<s>  whatever hunt did , she brought out the naturalism in all of the actors . 
<s>  disappointingly , david alan grier's charlie , however much i like him , was the most flatly-written . 
<s>  duchovny here does a laudable job of shaking off his fox mulder persona -- with the help of his fellow co-stars rarely do we see any hint of special agent fox mulder . 
<s>  instead we have a normal guy who when he falls in love shows more delight than fox mulder will show over the span of an entire season of " the x-files . " 
<s>  duchovny , who is excellent at understatement and self-deprecation as an actor showcases his considerable comedic talent on screen . 
<s>  minnie driver is engaging as always as the sweet , innocent grace with nothing but a good heart to offer . 
<s>  though an unlikely pair , duchovny and driver gradually warm up to each other as the movie progresses . 
<s>  while " return to me " functions remarkably as a laugh-out-loud comedy , a romantic scenic tour through chicago , and a tearjerker , the story is set up so the film ends up having nowhere to develop . 
<s>  the entire climax of the film hinges on when and how grace is going to tell bob that she actually was the recipient of his wife's heart . 
<s>  we already know that there's going to be a happy ending ; we feel like we spend the entire film , however enjoyably , in a straight line going towards that point . 
<s>  as a result bob and grace click almost too quickly--yes , i know she's supposed to have his ex-wife's heart and everything--it seems too effortless . 
<s>  the main subject is a love story , and the family scenes i love so much unfortunately are overused and distract from the turmoil of the two main characters ( whose story might not have that much meat after all ) . 
<s>  however , in the spirit of " return to me , " it won't do to be too picky about how " old " hollywood tells its stories . 
<s>  i loved knowing that this was a labor of love for bonnie hunt . 
<s>  it shows . 
<s>  the bottom line : " return to me " is nothing remarkable , and yet its sweetness , sincerity , and charm might touch your heart in ways that you hadn't imagined . 
<s>  wild things is a suspenseful thriller starring matt dillon , denise richards , and neve campbell that deals with all the issues ; sex , love , murder , and betrayal . 
<s>  the setting of the film is a town named blue bay . 
<s>  it consists of many swamps and slums and , on the other hand , rich estates owned by the town's different benefactors . 
<s>  the film opens just before the beginning of a senior seminar at the town's ritzy , expensive high school .

<s>  there's guidance counselor sam lombardo , police officers ray duquette and gloria perez , dark mysterious senior suzie toller , and the popular head cheerleader kelly van ryan .

<s>  shortly after , suzie , too , confesses that sam raped her as well .

<s>  after sam is cleared , kelly's mother pays sam a very substantial amount of cash in order for him not to sue her . 
<s>  it is then revealed that sam , kelly , and suzie were all in on it together . 
<s>  it is here that the film starts to reveal just who is being honest with each other and who has their own hidden agenda .

<s>  playing kelly van ryan is denise richards .

<s>  denise richards , still hot off the press from starship troopers , gives the most interesting performance in the entire film . 
<s>  in the beginning , kelly looks to be a paper thin character , but richards adds a little more spice and ultimately makes the character not only sexy , but dominating as well . 
<s>  kevin bacon gives one of his fair performances as ray duquette . 
<s>  this character looks to be one of the most boring , predictable in the film . 
<s>  however , it is a relationship revealed between him and suzie that adds depth to his story . 
<s>  still , the film doesn't seem to gain much from bacon's performance , only his name . 
<s>  in the supporting cast , theresa russell plays the much oversexed sandra van ryan , daphne rubin-vega gives an unappealing performance as cop gloria perez , and bill murray shines as sam's lawyer , ken bowden . 
<s>  hats off to murray for adding the perfect touch of comedy to the film . 
<s>  although wild things was displayed by the press as being an erotic thriller , the eroticism , which is portrayed with good taste , is kept to a minimum and focuses more on the plot and the relationships between the characters . 
<s>  this is truly a very good film worth seeing if your looking for a movie with a thick plot filled with it's share of twists .

<s>  welcome to sarajevo 
<s>  in light of america's recent intervention in kosovo , welcome to sarajevo is a reminder of the horror america and the world ignored for years . 
<s>  set in sarajevo 1992 and based on actual events , this picture examines the human and societal casualties of war . 
<s>  the picture opens with a family escorting their young bride to her wedding . 
<s>  as they make their way down the street , a sniper shoots the mother of the bride . 
<s>  yet another reminder that daily life in war torn sarajevo can never escape the horror of war . 
<s>  in this scene , we meet joe flynn ( woody harrelson ) , an american reporter who stops reporting to help a priest carry the mortally wounded mother into a church . 
<s>  joe is cocky , but also good at heart as he continues to carry out kind deeds for people he doesn't even know . 
<s>  his fellow reporter is the british michael henderson ( stephen dillane ) . 
<s>  michael is quickly growing tired of the horror that surrounds him and the world's lack of interest . 
<s>  henderson is haunted by the memory of an altar boy who witnesses the mother's death as well as a young girl who he finds orphaned in a hospital after a mortar attack on citizens waiting in line for bread . 
<s>  he decides to take action when a united nations' delegation descends upon the area to declare yugoslavia the fourteenth most dangerous place on earth . 
<s>  henderson begins a series profiling an orphanage located on the front lines . 
<s>  he finds children of all ages living in fear and taking care of each other with the help of one adult . 
<s>  during his visits , he befriends a pre-teen girl , emira ( emira nuseric ) who serves as surrogate mother to baby roadrunner . 
<s>  he promises to get emira out of harm's way if he gets the chance . 
<s>  after the un delegation leaves the country without rescuing any of the children , henderson loses hope . 
<s>  however , his reporting has grabbed the attention of nina ( marisa tomei ) and her children's aid group that helps to find homes for the yugoslavian orphans . 
<s>  unfortunately , only babies are wanted for adoption , so henderson pledges to take emira to england . 
<s>  the group of children , nina and henderson depart the front lines on a dangerous escape for italy . 
<s>  can they complete this dangerous trek through the war torn countryside and avoid hostile troops gathering up muslims for concentration camps ? 
<s>  the movie was beautifully and sensitively made . 
<s>  director michael winterbottom and screenwriter frank cottrell boyce vividly express the societal destruction that has occurred . 
<s>  they show the destroyed lives , families that have been split up , and the desolation that everyone attempts to cope with . 
<s>  this is best exemplified by the group of yugoslavians henderson , his producer and flynn have befriended . 
<s>  the group of twenty-somethings reside in a bombed out bar without life's simplest pleasures and amenities . 
<s>  one of them is an accomplished musician who spends his days playing the piano and promising to play a concert when sarajevo is declared the most dangerous place on earth . 
<s>  like the rest of those deeply effected by the war , this small group tries to survive instead of trying to live . 
<s>  winterbottom brilliantly intersplices scenes with actual news footage to give the film the feel of a documentary and keeps the viewer aware that many of these horrors are being carried out thousands of miles away as you sit safely in your living room . 
<s>  the picture is also bolstered by beautiful cinematography that captures the devastation of this city that hosted the 1984 olympics . 
<s>  winterbottom and boyce also produce a realistic portrayal of the reporters covering the atrocities . 
<s>  this portrayal is much more flattering to reporters than earlier wafflemovies . com 
<s>  selection mad city . 
<s>  we watch them struggle to cover the horror , while trying to remain professionally detached . 
<s>  however , they are human and question the reason behind it all , why no one cares , and how they can get out . 
<s>  stephen dillane is wonderful as henderson . 
<s>  he portrays the character as an everyman caught in the middle of extraordinary events . 
<s>  dillane avoids making the character overly heroic and preachy . 
<s>  henderson realizes that he cannot save the world , but he can help a few . 
<s>  it is a wonderful opportunity for dillane after he had to suffer through the denis leary-sandra bullock disaster two if by sea . 
<s>  woody harrelson continues to prove that he is one of the finest , most versatile actors of his generation .

<s>  harrelson is equally adept at taking on roles as zany leading men ( cheers , white men can't jump ) as well as excellent supporting roles such as this one . 
<s>  this ability will serve him well and give him a long , successful career . 
<s>  america's involvement in this struggle comes seven years after the events of the movie take place . 
<s>  for those who do not have a full understanding of the history of the conflict , the entire movie , most importantly the opening scenes , provide a history lesson . 
<s>  war is a foreign concept to most of us in america . 
<s>  battles are fought thousands of miles away among people we have no attachment to . 
<s>  televised images of the gulf war are all the experience most of us have with war . 
<s>  this picture brings it right into your living room and makes you think outside of our own small world , something we don't do enough of in 90's america . 
<s>  many people dislike french films for their lack of closure . 
<s>  while possibly shallow , i've often had a desire for a sense of epiphany , or at least a resolution , in the films which i view . 
<s>  there is no revelation in un coeur en hiver in the traditional ; however , the film is incredibly successful in its passionate dramatization of a passion-denying protagonist , stephane ( daniel auteuil ) . 
<s>  stephane ( daniel auteuil ) is a master violin maker . 
<s>  he is passionless about all that which surrounds him except his craft and the music which his craft is responsible for producing . 
<s>  even the relationship between he and his boss , maxime ( andre dussollier ) is a controlled , and almost manipulated association , highlighted by the fact that stephane permits maxime to win close squash matches . 
<s>  in the beginning of the movie , stephane is a closed , solitary individual and the audience is carefully left to wonder about the depth of emotion behind this enigmatic man . 
<s>  camille kessler ( emmanuelle beart ) is a master violinist and the new love of maximes . 
<s>  maxime is so much in love with camille that he plans to and does leave his wife . 
<s>  like stephane , camille is outwardly very controlled and reserved , sacrificing all thought and emotion to her violin and the music which emerges . 
<s>  when stephane and camille meet , there is a recognition of a bonding by both individuals . 
<s>  however , whereas camille submits to the wild interplay of emotions which she now feels for stephane , stephane only admits that camille is attracted to him . 
<s>  stephane ignores his feelings for camille , which the audience cannot help but to see is present . 
<s>  as the movie progresses , the two characters become more and more polarized in their views and emotions for one another . 
<s>  these two people , with very similar approaches to life initially , react to their new circumstance very differently . 
<s>  stephane becomes even more rational and controlled , while camille becomes more tempestuous , until she almost borders on suffering a nervous breakdown due to the inability to consummate their relationship . 
<s>  however , their approach to each other is perhaps not surprising considering their vocation . 
<s>  the audience is led to believe that stephane may have been a genius as a violinist as well , due to his relationship with a master violin teacher . 
<s>  however , apparently , he could not be a violinist due to his intolerance for flaws in his playing . 
<s>  consequently , stephane becomes a precision craftsmen with the instrument and no longer plays . 
<s>  in contrast , camille had almost given the violin , years earlier . 
<s>  however , with the aid of her manager , she has progressed to being almost one of the world's finest , successfully submerging herself to her playing . 
<s>  during the course of the movie , we see both characters evolve as they struggle to meet the challenge of their new emotions . 
<s>  stephane attempts to remain unchanged . 
<s>  however , we do see subtle hints of his transformation . 
<s>  one of the most obvious is when he defeats maxime in squash . 
<s>  the development of all of the characters , many of which is not included in this synopsis , is incredible . 
<s>  american movies , with rare exceptions , have not and i would daresay cannot approach foreign films in character development . 
<s>  in its essence , this movie is about the development and growth of the characters , camille and stephane . 
<s>  the portrayal of all the other characters in the movie , including a death , is to further the development of camille's and stepahne's characters . 
<s>  i am not sure why berardinelli says , " at times it becomes difficult to determine whether stephane should be pitied or vilified , and it is to auteuil's credit that he manages to maintain this uncertainty . " 
<s>  this movie is not about judging stephane's actions as being right or wrong , but about viewing their growth and accepting the characters as who they are . 
<s>  i find the ending appropriate ; unfortunately , i found the last ten minutes which led up to the final scene to be very unfulfilling . 
<s>  this portion of the film is where the " sense of closure " could have been successfully accomplished . 
<s>  unfortunately , there is a hurried and almost a soap opera-type surge of emotions from all of the characters . 
<s>  while ravel may not be quite as accomplished as schubert or mozart , ravel has his day in this film . 
<s>  the synergism of the tension of ravel's music and tension on the screen is the best i have ever seen . 
<s>  the directing in this movie is wonderful . 
<s>  the actors and actresses are excellent , each playing their part with great sincerity and warmth . 
<s>  emmanuelle beart's personality is beautiful . 
<s>  and needless to say , i must say that emmanuelle beart , herself , is beautiful . 
<s>  besides the near ending , the only other criticism of the movie which i have is that the movie is almost too cerebral . 
<s>  i almost left with the sense little happened because almost all the changes which occur in the movie happen in deep in their psyches and little in their personalities or the situations which they end as part of . 
<s>  the one question which i am left with is while they have accepted their lot , has their attitude towards love changed ? 
<s>  i have several possibilities which i believe the movie hints at , but i am unsure of which the director is espousing . 
<s>  in summary , this movie is solely about the character growth of two characters who almost develop a relationship . 
<s>  in the process , we see their attitude towards life and other people . 
<s>  in itself , i do not believe un coeur is a complicated movie . 
<s>  where it does become complicated is when we juxtapose the scenes of the movie into the greater walk of life where we , as americans , have preconceived american notions of relationship , love , and people . 
<s>  i do wonder how the movie translates when viewed within its native french culture . 
<s>  however , i , bringing my american preconceptions , enjoyed the film . 
<s>  i would welcome any comments about this movie from any who have seen it . 
<s>  the keen wisdom of an elderly bank robber , the naive ambitions of a sexy hospital nurse , and a partnership that blossoms between the two are the fine components that make up a modest , little caper adventure entitled `where the money is . ' 
<s>  the elderly bank robber is henry ( paul newman ) , a famous criminal that was only recently caught . 
<s>  he has pulled off dozens of successful heists and has probably stashed away a small fortune . 
<s>  always the shrewd thinker , he begins working on a plan to get out of jail . 
<s>  this involves years of studying buddhism and self-hypnosis . 
<s>  when he is prepared to execute his plan , he uses what he has learned to fake a stroke . 
<s>  now a seemingly twitching vegetable , he is temporarily transferred to a state-run home . 
<s>  carol ( linda fiorentino ) is the nurse that cares for him . 
<s>  she's a very bright person with a good heart . 
<s>  yet , her life is a miserable waste of time . 
<s>  the most exciting thing to do in town is to fix cars . 
<s>  her days at the hospital facility are spent leading wheelchair calisthenics . 
<s>  worse , she's in a dead-end relationship with high-school sweetheart wayne ( dylan mcdermott ) . 
<s>  they became a couple because they were king and queen of the prom . 
<s>  to her , this made sense long ago . 
<s>  but now , it's a different story . 
<s>  wayne seems equally bored with his life , but is content enough to stay put . 
<s>  wayne's greatest ambition is to become a night shift supervising foreman . 
<s>  carol feels as lifeless as many of the other hospital patients , but she's never been anywhere else and doesn't see many other opportunities in life . 
<s>  however , when henry falls under her care , her outlook begins to change . 
<s>  the medical reports may state that he suffered a massive stroke . 
<s>  carol , however , begins to grow suspicious that henry may just be faking it after all . 
<s>  maybe she can get through to him , and maybe she can learn something about the money that he has stashed away . 
<s>  the opening 30 minutes are filled with hilarious attempts of carol trying to bring henry ? back to life . ' 
<s>  and what are some of carol's resuscitation techniques ? 
<s>  perhaps an erotic lapdance might stir his senses . 
<s>  if that fails , maybe she'll try a little shock therapy by pushing him off a 20-foot high pier into the cold lake below . 
<s>  when he finally comes out of his state of self-trance , the movie's direction changes , though it remains equally if not more entertaining . 
<s>  carol sees that henry is filled with charisma and self-assuredness . 
<s>  she is invigorated by his commanding presence and refreshed by his vibrancy . 
<s>  this , of course , puts wayne in an odd situation . 
<s>  henry and carol's bond grows stronger when they enter into an agreement to rob an armored car . 
<s>  henry needs this heist because he is unable to retrieve his original stash . 
<s>  meanwhile , this is carol's ticket to a better life . 
<s>  wayne is uncomfortable with the situation , but helps out nonetheless . 
<s>  however , his lack of commitment threatens their success . 
<s>  the heist sequence is suspenseful , well paced , and casts the uneasy feeling that something will horribly go wrong . 
<s>  `where the money is' does more to spotlight newman and fiorentino than it does to showcase a story about a nifty heist . 
<s>  newman is the real joy of the film , adroitly showing that at age 75 , he's still really hot stuff . 
<s>  he possesses a sly smile , displays a dominating attitude , and a projects a demeanor that is undeniably attractive . 
<s>  fiorentino is also a fun presence . 
<s>  you root for her despite her sense of amorality . 
<s>  sure , she wants to commit robbery and has little compunction about pushing a wheelchair-stricken man into a lake , but we can see that to escape her dead-end world , she needs to do something drastic . 
<s>  with two charismatic characters such as these , it's hard to ignore that `where the money is' is where the fun is . 
<s>  robert benton has assembled a stellar , mature cast for his latest feature , twilight , a film noir mystery set amid the fading stars of hollywood . 
<s>  paul newman stars as retired detective harry ross . 
<s>  harry has spent the last couple of years doing odd jobs for jack and catherine ames ( gene hackman and susan sarandon ) , a pair of married actors who have fallen from the limelight . 
<s>  when jack sends him on a routine delivery job , however , the old instincts kick in . 
<s>  soon , harry is wading through a mystery where friendships and lives are on the line , and he no longer knows who to trust . 
<s>  there are plenty of familiar faces throughout twilight , in addition to newman , hackman and sarandon . 
<s>  james garner plays raymond hope , a former cop and one of harry's best friends . 
<s>  stockard channing plays verna , harry's former partner , and possibly a former love interest . 
<s>  reese witherspoon is mel , the distrustful daughter of the ames' , and liev schrieber is her scuzzy boyfriend . 
<s>  giancarlo esposito appears as harry's bumbling detective protigi , and john spencer is a suspicious police captain . 
<s>  with a cast like that , it's almost worth watching twilight just to stargaze . 
<s>  luckily , there's more to the film than some sort of actor's recognition ceremony . 
<s>  twilight has a solid film noir-ish plot . 
<s>  it may not have as many twists and turns as some of the classics , but it has much more than a lot of what passes for film these days . 
<s>  the major cast members all deliver strong performances , as can be expected of their caliber . 
<s>  however , none of them have that little extra oomph which would make them memorable . 
<s>  the supporting cast is enjoyable , if a little underdrawn . 
<s>  stockard channing's character , in particular , is a cipher . 
<s>  there's more to her character than the film takes the time to describe . 
<s>  it's a minor , but irritating , flaw . 
<s>  with a solid cast , and a good plot , there's a lot to recommend about twilight .

<s>  a bleak look at how the boston underworld operates , a film which was based on the best-seller by george v . , higgins .

<s>  as i walked out of crouching tiger , hidden dragon i thought to myself that i had had just seen a great film . 
<s>  with the passage of a few hours i tempered my enthusiasm and started pondering the question of whether a masterpiece must implicitly be a " great " piece of work and viceversa . 
<s>  attempting to make a distinction may be a matter of splitting hairs . 
<s>  i avoided a commitment by appealing to etymology . 
<s>  as the word implies , a masterpiece is any work which embodies the skills of a master . 
<s>  as such it should suffice to say that it is a product of exceptional quality . 
<s>  crouching tiger , hidden dragon fits comfortably in that category . 
<s>  crouching tiger , hidden dragon immerses the viewer in an idealized world of oriental folklore , with the requisite blend of legend , fantasy , magic and mythology . 
<s>  it is reminiscent of a wagnerian epic with characters which might as well be half-gods - greater than life , purer than life , stronger than life , physically invincible and able to accomplish superhuman feats , but with a human soul that makes them ultimately vulnerable . 
<s>  all the classic elements of the oriental mystique are thrown into the mix , including the art of contemplation and the concept of martial dexterity as the physical equivalent of spiritual advancement . 
<s>  the classic struggle between good and evil is the inevitable backdrop , with advanced masters of each and a golden pupil , which must choose between the two . 
<s>  it is the gifted pupil who , under the influence of the evil master steals the holy grail in the form of a magic sword which is the focus of the conflict at the heart of the legend . 
<s>  the elements of romance at two different levels of enlightenment ( a pair of masters and a pair of youngsters ) are poignantly represented . 
<s>  the paradox of oriental restraint existing side by side with all consuming passion in the same breast is projected effectively . 
<s>  the fight scenes are stunning balletic tours-de-force , not to be taken literally but clearly to be enjoyed as superb cinematic art , as are the prodigious leaps and flights to , from and between rooftops , the martial combat at the top of swaying bamboo branches and the combatants skipping like pebbles along the surface of a lake . 
<s>  there need be no question of suspended disbelief when one is in the presence of poetry . 
<s>  as in a wagnerian opera there is a substantial story line , which takes place at an ordinary human level , yet the entire project is to be accepted as a work of art rooted in fantasy . 
<s>  do not assume , however , that the art is limp-wristed . 
<s>  for those who are put off by the " art " label this film can be confidently recommended as engrossing entertainment at the levels of adventure , action and romance . 
<s>  there are no weak performances in this movie . 
<s>  michelle yeoh imbues her character with depth , humanity and wisdom . 
<s>  chow yon fat projects dignity and purity of heart . 
<s>  zhang ziyi is a budding superstar . 
<s>  she is radiantly beautiful and totally persuasive in a multifaceted role . 
<s>  cheng pei pei as the evil master and chang cheng as the bandit prince acquit themselves admirably . 
<s>  kudos to screenwriters james schamus , wang hui ling and tsai kuo jing , choreographer yuen wo-ping , photography director peter pau and music director tan dun , each of which contribute quality components to this extraordinary film . 
<s>  ang lee as the director , co-producer and mastermind of the project gets the lion share of the credit . 
<s>  this is destined to be one of those films that everybody likes , including those who hate martial arts movies . 
<s>  don't miss it . 
<s>   " crazy/beautiful " suffers from the damned-if-you-do , damned-if-you-don't syndrome . 
<s>  after a spate of flighty , cookie-cutter teen films , the romantic drama addresses alcoholism and parental loss along with its love story . 
<s>  but rather than applaud the production , early reviews have dismissed it as an overblown " afterschool special . " 
<s>  even worse , in the wake of federal trade commission hearings that blasted the industry for marketing violent and sexual movies to young people , the studio got a case of the heebie-jeebies and forced director john stockwell to re-shoot scenes and cut footage to " tone things down . " 
<s>  needless to say , the filmmaker was frustrated . 
<s>   " we were trying to make a cautionary tale , " he told newsweek , " and we couldn't show the behavior we were trying to caution people away from . " 
<s>  regardless , the film works , thanks to exceptional performances from its lead players and a script determined to transcend stereotypes . 
<s>   " crazy/beautiful " is quality fare , good enough that i half-expected the summer movie crap police to walk into the press screening and confiscate the print for " failure to incorporate explosions and poop jokes . " 
<s>  set in pacific palisades , calif . , the story follows the burgeoning relationship between two teens . 
<s>  every morning and evening , carlos nunez ( jay hernandez ) takes a two-hour bus ride in order to attend pacific high school . 
<s>  an honor student and star athlete , carlos is responsible , modest and focused as he works on securing a place in the naval academy . 
<s>  all is well until he meets nicole oakley ( kirsten dunst ) , the daughter of a rich congressman ( bruce davison ) . 
<s>  nicole is a drunk apparently hell-bent on self-destruction . 
<s>  carlos is smart enough to recognize the danger in getting involved with her , but he is only human and she has the greatest smile . 
<s>  plus , as her father notes , she has a real knack for drawing others into her downward spiral . 
<s>  as with " save the last dance , " " crazy/beautiful " ( god , how i hate lower-case titles ) takes situations that look stale on paper and makes them seem fresh . 
<s>  while noting the racial and social differences between the kids , the screenplay dances around most of the clich ? s ( there are still several mtv moments , though ) . 
<s>  the filmmakers make a point to give characters that crucial extra bit of shading that turns them into individuals instead of stereotypes and the actors take it from there . 
<s>  cute-as-a-button dunst forces the viewer to share the pain beneath nicole's behavior . 
<s>  she is credible enough that when dad urges carlos to get away from her before she drags him down , i hoped the boy would listen . 
<s>  as carlos , hernandez is a revelation .

<s>  aside from its title , the biggest problem with " crazy/beautiful " is its ending , which wraps everything up too fast and too tidy . 
<s>  after carefully presenting credible characters and situations , the conclusion feels rushed and lazy . 
<s>  still , this is the kind of film that deserves accolades from critics instead of cheap shots .

<s>  everyone knows someone like giles de'ath : stuffy , arrogant , set in his ways , and at war with anything that could in any way be associated with " progress . " 
<s>  giles is a writer , but the product of his typewriter is the kind of scholarly stuff that is immediately put onto library stacks where it can gather dust until some graduate student needs another reference for his or her thesis . 
<s>  his house looks like an immaculate museum ? with no television , microwave , word processor , or other technological gadgets , only the electric lights betray that he's living in the twentieth century , not the nineteenth . 
<s>  this is the kind of role that could easily be turned into a flat stereotype , but john hurt , in what is certainly his best performance in a decade and possibly the most impressive of his long and distinguished career , turns " erstwhile fogy " giles into a three-dimensional human being . 
<s>  despite his tunnel vision , it's impossible not to like the man , especially after his entire being is transformed by that singular affliction to which no one is immune : love . 
<s>  and , as giles discovers during the course of this amusing , warm-hearted motion picture , it's possible to find the object of one's affection in the most unusual places . 
<s>  giles , who is a widower and a recluse , does not frequent the cinema , but when he learns that an e . m . forster film is playing at the local theater , he screws up his courage and decides to go . 
<s>  what he doesn't realize is that the movie house is showing two films : the forster adaptation and a teen exploitation flick called hotpants college ii .

<s>  giles is enraptured , and the moment hotpants college ii is over , he beings to scour stores for bostock memorabilia , including teen magazines and video tapes . 
<s>   ( in order to watch those tapes , giles must buy a vcr , but he initially doesn't realize that he needs a tv to use the vcr . ) 
<s>  eventually , not satisfied with being the world's foremost authority on bostock , giles boards a plane and travels to long island , where his idol's home is located . 
<s>  bostock is away when giles arrives , but the wily englishman manages to befriend ronnie's supermodel girlfriend , audrey ( fiona loewi ) . 
<s>  eventually , the actor arrives home and , impressed with giles' demeanor and intelligence , he begins to rely on the older man's advice . 
<s>  but , while giles' affection runs deep , ronnie's feelings are less constant . 
<s>  love and death on long island is a comedy , and a very funny one at that . 
<s>  in fact , for its first half , the film is nearly-perfect . 
<s>  it suffers a fall-off once giles reaches new york , and the ending , with its none-too-subtle homosexual overtones , is a little too overbearing for the lighthearted material that precedes it . 
<s>  in his gently satirical approach to popular culture and movie stardom , writer/director richard kwietniowski , adapting from the novel by gilbert adair , is 100% on- target . 
<s>  in the process , he not only creates a truly likable and memorable character in giles , but says a few things about the transforming power of love , even if it is unrequited . 
<s>  from start to finish , this is clearly hurt's movie ? he's in almost every frame . 
<s>  it's a role that the veteran actor must have relished , because he makes giles an unforgettable motion picture figure , and does so by means of dialogue delivery , body language , and ever-changing facial expressions . 
<s>  jason priestley , cashing in on his beverly hills 90210 image , is surprisingly effective as the shallow ronnie . 
<s>  he is charismatic , and it's not hard to understand why giles is attracted to ronnie . 
<s>  meanwhile , solid support is provided by the appealing fiona loewi and the always-reliable maury chaykin . 
<s>  love and death on long island is many things wrapped into one : a social commentary ( it tackles the thorny issue of film as pure art versus film as mindless entertainment ) , a buddy picture/love story ( ronnie and giles have one of the most interesting relationships found anywhere on a movie screen these days ) , and a " fish out of water " tale ( victorian relic giles forced into the modern world ) . 
<s>  yet , despite the many laughs love and death offers , it never takes cheap shots . 
<s>  it has a vibrant , beating heart ? and that makes the comedy all the more worthwhile .

<s>  meet joe black ( reviewed on nov . 27/98 ) 
<s>  starring brad pitt , anthony hopkins , claire forlani 
<s>  in " meet joe black " , brad pitt plays death . 
<s>  that's all that really needs to be said , but nevertheless , i will provide the three of you that have seemingly been living in a cave with a plot description . 
<s>  death decides to take a holiday , what with all the rigors of soul-collecting and all , and forces anthony hopkins into showing him what it's like to be human . 
<s>  death assumes the body of brad pitt , and from there , much trouble ensues . 
<s>  for one thing , death-as-pitt falls in love with hopkins daughter , played by claire forlani . 
<s>  obviously this enrages hopkins , because really , what can death offer ? 
<s>  besides eternal damnation , of course . 
<s>  there is also a sub-plot about forlani's ex-boyfriend ( she dumps him for pitt ) trying to take over hopkins company . 
<s>   " meet joe black " runs just under three hours . 
<s>  i've always thought that such obscene running times should be limited to historical epics . 
<s>   " meet joe black " is neither historical nor is it an epic , though i get the feeling martin brest ( the director ) desperately wants it to be . 
<s>  every single scene in the movie goes on about 3-4 minutes too long . 
<s>  and the ending takes about 20 minutes longer than it really should . 
<s>  a severe editing job could have made this movie excellent , instead of just good , which is what it is . 
<s>  pitt , an actor i normally loathe , is actually quite engaging as death . 
<s>  i believed his performance , and i could see why forlani's character would fall in love with him . 
<s>  i have to agree with roger ebert , though , who found it hard to believe that an entity that's been around for all time wouldn't know what peanut butter was . 
<s>  that has nothing to do with pitt's performance , of course , but it is a little distracting . 
<s>  hopkins gives his usual excellent performance . 
<s>  he's able to portray the angst of a man who knows he has very little time left , without making him an obnoxious whiner . 
<s>  and in her first major studio role , claire forlani is surprisingly good . 
<s>  she has a sweet tenderness that allows the audience to instantly root for her . 
<s>  so , " meet joe black " is a good movie hampered by it's ridiculous running time . 
<s>  had the film been cut by an hour or so , i have no doubt that i would be calling it one of the best movies of the year in this review .

<s>  the biggest failing of fallen is that , although it's consistently interesting , it's not always as edgy and suspenseful as one might hope . 
<s>  a serial killer ( elias koteas ) has been on the loose in philadephia , but detective john hobbes ( denzel washington ) , the noblest man on the police force , has brought him to justice . 
<s>  now , during his last hours on death row awaiting his inevitable date with the gas chamber , the mass murderer cryptically tells hobbes , " what goes around really goes around . " 
<s>  shortly thereafter , he begins to sing " time is on my side " as he's taken on his last walk . 
<s>  minutes later , the state of pennsylvania has carried out the execution and edgar reese is dead . 
<s>  but for hobbes , the nightmare is just beginning , because reese wasn't a normal psychopath ? he was the host body for a mythical dark angel named azazel . 
<s>  and , with reese's death , azazel is free to hop from body to body , murdering and wreaking havoc at will . 
<s>  only hobbes and a pretty , female theology teacher ( embeth davidtz ) have an inkling of what they're up against . 
<s>  the rest of the cops , including hobbes' partner , jonesy ( john goodman ) ; lou ( james gandolfini ) , a newcomer to the department ; and lieutenant stanton ( donald sutherland ) , don't have a clue , and , as a result , they are in mortal danger . 
<s>  as depicted by hoblit ( primal fear ) and cinematographer newton thomas sigel , philadelphia is a dark , dreary place ? a gothic city rather than a modern one . 
<s>  no skyscrapers or other monoliths of current architecture or technology are shown . 
<s>  the most famous landmark to appear isn't the liberty bell or independence hall ; it's geno's steaks . 
<s>  shadows and night scenes abound . 
<s>  the days are cloudy and unpromising . 
<s>  this is the kind of setting where it's easy to believe that fallen angels walk among men . 
<s>  fallen's plot is brimming with potential , not all of which is realized . 
<s>  somehow , i would have expected a more frightening tale to emerge from something with this kind of premise . 
<s>  but the level of terror , like that of gore , is kept in check . 
<s>  nevertheless , there are several creepily effective scenes as the spirit of azazel moves from body to body when people bump against each other on crowded city sidewalks . 
<s>  the film also boasts a chase sequence of a kind that can best be described as unusual . 
<s>  of the several dozen actors to play azazel , the best is by far elias koteas ( exotica , crash ) , who , despite only being on screen for about ten minutes , gives a fantastically charged performance . 
<s>  john goodman also seems to be enjoying himself , although his role for most of the film is relegated to that of a burly sidekick . 
<s>  sadly , however , these two are the only ones who excel . 
<s>  everyone else , including denzel washington , is boring . 
<s>  washington's flat performance is the most disappointing surprise of the film . 
<s>  it's not that he's bad per se , but he's not very interesting . 
<s>  there's no real sense of vulnerability or desperation in the way he portrays his character , and that keeps us distanced , however slightly , from hobbes . 
<s>  as circumstances become progressively more dire for the cop , and as his life-or-death chess game with azazel approaches the point of checkmate , i expected to be more on the edge of my seat than i was . 
<s>  washington's subdued approach is part of the reason for this ; i never felt a sense of urgency . 
<s>  however , at least washington was believable , which is more than can be said for embeth davidtz ( schindler's list ) and donald sutherland . 
<s>  to be fair , the flaws in their characters aren't all acting-related ; neither stanton nor gretta milano are well-written . 
<s>  that said , however , there's nothing inspired about either davidtz's or sutherland's work . 
<s>  both appear to be sleepwalking their way through the parts , as if they know that their contribution to the film is one of advancing the plot rather than developing a multi-dimensional individual . 
<s>  narratively , fallen has a few glaring weaknesses . 
<s>  although the plot proceeds with a convoluted , game-like structure , it uses a denzel washington-supplied voiceover to overexplain matters . 
<s>  at times , this is actually helpful , and it has a use beyond the obvious , but there are occasions when ponderous lines like " i like the night ? sometimes you come face to face with yourself " become a little hard to swallow . 
<s>  in addition , fallen is saddled with the same kind of disgustingly bland , generic theology embraced by numerous movies and tv shows like touched by an angel . 
<s>  however , despite the negatives , i'm still recommending fallen on the strength of its complex plot and especially its ending , which i loved . 
<s>  the final scenes are startling , audacious , and unexpected . 
<s>  it's not often that a plot development takes me by surprise the way this one did . 
<s>  at a time when most movies fall apart in the last ten minutes , fallen manages to buck the trend and redeem itself . 
<s>  this is not a great motion picture , but , considering how bad most january releases are , it's a reasonably entertaining way to spend two hours . 
<s>  and , whatever you do , don't walk out on the film before the end credits have begun to roll .

<s>  the movie is a bit overlong , but nicholson is such good fun that the running time passes by pretty quickly . 
<s>  overall , as good as it gets is a fun movie , even though it may be unbelivable , and certainly worth seeing ( if just for jack nicholsons performance . )

<s>  after a stylistic detour with mrs . 
<s>  parker and the vicious circle ( which , despite its uncomfortable tone , was close to being a conventional movie ) , director alan rudolph has returned to his unique brand of film making with afterglow , a romantic black comedy about love , betrayal , and self-absorption . 
<s>  while these may not be the most unusual themes to fashion into a motion picture , rudolph's atypical approach to the characters and their situations makes for an intriguing , if not always pleasant , movie . 
<s>  it is said that rudolph is a polarizing director ? meaning that most viewers either love his work or hate it . 
<s>  until mrs . 
<s>  parker , i had not been overly impressed by his movies . 
<s>  i found equinox , his last pre- mrs . 
<s>  parker effort , to be irritating and frustrating . 
<s>  i was somewhat surprised , therefore , to discover that i liked afterglow . 
<s>  there are several reasons for this , but the paramount one is that rudolph seems to have muted some of the most strident , mannered aspects of his approach . 
<s>  the characters here are more like real people with genuine problems , the story is absorbing , and the acting is top-notch . 
<s>  in short , rudolph has created a world that it's worth spending two hours in . 
<s>  afterglow introduces us to two unhappily married couples . 
<s>  jeffrey byron ( jonny lee miller ) is a cold , seemingly-heartless businessman who is sexually indifferent to his young wife , marianne ( lara flynn boyle ) . 
<s>  for her part , marianne is so obsessed with having a baby that she never attempts to interact with her husband on a human level . 
<s>  all she's interested in is seducing him during those few days when she's ovulating . 
<s>  after he refuses to make love , she decides to find someone else to play the role of sperm donor . 
<s>  the other couple , lucky ( nick nolte ) and phyllis mann ( julie christie ) , are an older pair , but they're no more content than jeffrey and marianne . 
<s>  a mysterious fracture in their past relationship has driven them apart . 
<s>  they remain married as a matter of convenience , but , since phyllis won't allow lucky to touch her , they have an unspoken agreement whereby he can fool around as much as he wants provided that no lasting bond is established as a result of these affairs . 
<s>  the landscape of emotional pain between them is palpable . 
<s>  the four characters begin interacting when marianne hires lucky as a handyman to fix up the inside of the apartment she shares with jeffrey . 
<s>  the two of them are immediately attracted to one another , and it doesn't take long before they're lounging together , naked , in her pool . 
<s>  meanwhile , jeffrey , who is captivated by older women , runs into phyllis in a hotel bar , is smitten , and invites her to accompany him on a weekend retreat to the mountains . 
<s>  the romantic couplings of the characters are interesting in that they illustrate the multiple faces of love . 
<s>  sex means something different to everyone ? to jeffrey , it's an unpleasant chore , a loss of control ; to marianne , it's a means to a maternal end ; to lucky , it's an enjoyable distraction that blocks out his marital troubles ; and to phyllis , it's a method of establishing or denying emotional closeness . 
<s>  ultimately , none of these characters appears to love anyone else as much as they love themselves . 
<s>  the greatest strength of the film lies not in the script , but in the performances . 
<s>  jonny lee miller is perfect as the selfish , callous , suit-and-tie businessman . 
<s>  those who recall him as sickboy in trainspotting will find that he is almost unrecognizable here as the image of conformity . 
<s>  lara flynn boyle , who wasn't impressive in rudolph's equinox , is greatly improved , making marianne a jumble of sexiness and vulnerability . 
<s>  nick nolte is delightful as the uninhibited lucky , and he manages to deliver some of rudolph's most pregnant lines with practiced ease . 
<s>  the clear standout , however , is julie christie , who is nothing short of delicious as the world-weary phyllis . 
<s>  her often wry , occasionally cutting asides are the source of much of the film's humor , and there's hardly ever a moment when she doesn't steal the spotlight from her co-stars . 
<s>  i don't know if afterglow is the film to convert rudolph- detractors , but it seems that this movie is a little more accessible than some of the director's earlier productions . 
<s>  enough of his trademark style remains , however , to reassure his supporters . 
<s>  afterglow is basically a four-pronged character study . 
<s>  the plot is not especially compelling , but the character interaction is , and that's the real reason to see this motion picture . 
<s>  rudolph has painted an able picture of the non-romantic side of love -- the one that has more to do with tolerance and familiarity than with affection and attraction . 
<s>   " the fugitive " is probably one of the greatest thrillers ever made . 
<s>  it takes realistic , believable characters and tells an exciting story that's totally believable throughout . 
<s>  this isn't an over-the-top action flick for the sake of action , this is an intelligent adventure story with a real sense of mystery to it and it works perfectly . 
<s>  harrison ford stars as dr . richard kimble , a man who is wrongly accused and convicted of murdering his wife . 
<s>  the entire premise of the story revolves around this murder , but is not told in a straightforward manner . 
<s>  we constantly see flashbacks to the murder from kimble's perspective . 
<s>  hints are dropped from various times of the night kimble's wife , helen ( sela ward ) was murdered . 
<s>  we don't get to see who the killer is until much further into the story . 
<s>  in fact , we might even have a little doubt about kimble's innocence ourselves . 
<s>  the film doesn't spend much time on the details of kimble's trial and conviction as it is not the point of the story . 
<s>  one of the greatest action scenes ensues as we get a botched escape attempt by his fellow inmates which leads to a fantastic train wreck . 
<s>  but it does not at all seem gratuitous or formulated , it is actually suspenseful to watch . 
<s>  this movie is so incredible because it's able to take elements like these and make them wholly original and believable . 
<s>  tommy lee jones almost steals the show as deputy sam gerard , a u . s . marshall who is an expert in hunting fugitives . 
<s>  from the moment he appears we know a huge game of cat and mouse is about to occur . 
<s>  kimble and gerard are equally matched as there is no way to tell how one is going to outsmart the other . 
<s>  most of the film deals with richard's complex investigation as he tries to find the one-armed man who killed his wife . 
<s>  ford does not have a lot of lines here , so it is stuart and twohy's script and davis's outstanding direction that make the film as great as it is .

<s>  we know just as little as he does as to why his wife was killed , so as he learns more so do we . 
<s>  meanwhile gerard and his staff are using all their skills to hunt him down . 
<s>  at one point they run into each other and a great chase ensues , but richard is just too smart for them . 
<s>  he leaves clues for gerard to show his innocence and to help him solve the mystery . 
<s>  one of the greatest charms to the film is its sense of humor . 
<s>  there is a great sense of comradeship between gerard and his two closest deputies cosmo renfo ( pantoliano ) and biggs ( roebuck ) . 
<s>  they are trying to catch what they believe to be a dangerous murderer , yet they constantly start up small talk with each other , making funny wisecracks and one-liners , but not in any kind of distracting manner . 
<s>  the final act concludes with another terrific chase . 
<s>  richard figures out who the killer is and confronts him , and although we get a typical fight scene , the case is far from solved . 
<s>  the man who ordered the murder has been under our nose all along , and we don't realize this until the end when both richard and gerard put the pieces together . 
<s>  maybe the finally scene is a bit much , but it still has a believable atmosphere to it . 
<s>  we're so relieved when justice is served . 
<s>  it's not the plot is that makes " the fugitive " great , it's all the motions the characters go through to make for an intriguing story . 
<s>  watching a seemingly average man go through as much as this is what makes the movie so adventurous . 
<s>  if only hollywood could produce more movies like this .

<s>  on re-watching italian writer/director dario argento's much lauded murder mystery tenebrae , i was struck more than anything else by how many sins he commits as a storyteller and manages to get away with . 
<s>  in emphasising style over matters of plot argento is somewhat notorious in cult film circles , but some aficionados still praise tenebrae as the greatest of his " giallo " murder mysteries . 
<s>  while it's certainly not perfect , repeated viewings reveal it to be nonetheless a densely plotted and terrifically stylish thriller . 
<s>  the story follows a promotional visit to rome by famous american mystery novelist peter neal ( anthony franciosa ) where he discovers that a serial killer is on the loose inspired by his latest book " tenebrae " . 
<s>  with the police on his back for leads , he decides to take a personal interest in the case and he soon becomes drawn into a mystery where all is not as it seems . 
<s>  the film benefits enormously from a fine central performance by franciosa . 
<s>  he brings grace , charm and a deceptive benigness to his character which provides an interesting foil to both the violence of the books he writes and the unfolding real-life horror around him . 
<s>  the film is awash with a fascinating psychosexual tension . 
<s>  argento peels back the facade of showbiz and jetset lifestyles to reveal an amoral , ambivalent , shadowy world where desire in all its forms has become a dangerous business . 
<s>  tenebrae is perhaps the most multi-layered of argento's scripts to date and there is much bubbling underneath the surface here . 
<s>  it may take at least two or three viewings to appreciate all the psychological themes at play . 
<s>  in that respect it strongly recalls his previous giallo deep red/profondo rosso ( the full-length italian language version ) and fans will enjoy spotting the recurring themes . 
<s>  needless to say for argento fans , there is no denying the director's brilliance as a stylist . 
<s>  many of the action and murder sequences are directed with his characteristic finesse and feature plenty of intriguing camerawork . 
<s>  they are all the more impressive for the fact that in this film argento creates mood by filling his scenes with light , rather than the dark shadows and deep rich colours of earlier works like deep red and suspiria . 
<s>  instead , tenebrae's set design and lighting paints a sleek , clinical , chilly vision of a vaguely futuristic urban world . 
<s>  and the soundtrack's mix of electronic atmospheres and gothic rock by frequent argento collaborators goblin is the perfect accompaniment . 
<s>  so tenebrae has much to recommend it , no question . 
<s>  still , constantly nagging at the back of this viewers mind is several lumps in the narrative . 
<s>  some critics argue that logic doesn't matter in argento films , but damnit , it matters in all films to the point where viewers don't deserve to feel cheated . 
<s>  by the way , if you don't want to know the solution to the mystery then skip the next three paragraphs . 
<s>  about an hour into tenebrae the story takes an unexpected twist which , properly handled , could have proved ingenious . 
<s>  we witness the murder of the serial killer himself by a man who , we later discover , is none other than the author peter neal . 
<s>  he is insane , apparently . 
<s>  the murders then continue for the remainder of the film as neal decides it's time to settle some personal business involving his neurotic wife . 
<s>  he is finally revealed to us as this " second killer " in the film's bloody climax . 
<s>  but argento muffs the twist , both technically and narratively . 
<s>  you see , we are supposed to be tricked into thinking that during this scene peter neal is actually an innocent witness who was crouching in the bushes nearby the whole time and spying on the killer's house . 
<s>  but thanks to poor editing , its had to believe neal could have murdered the killer anyway . 
<s>  bad cutting puts the timing way out . 
<s>  in other words , he's almost in two places at once . 
<s>  during this crucial scene we are also thrown a ridiculous red herring . 
<s>  by the film's end you realise that for the sake of an alibi neal must have self-inflicted a nasty injury in this earlier scene to make it look like he was attacked by a fleeing assailant . 
<s>  the injury ? 
<s>  he banged himself on the head with a bloody great rock ! 
<s>  thus , the revelation of the " hero " as a killer ( and anti-hero ) in the final scenes may still prove shocking , but its all somewhat implausible by the time the end credits have rolled . 
<s>  helpfully , in the end we do learn that the bizarre flashbacks of personal humiliation and murder that have permeated the film belonged to neal all along . 
<s>  but there too is a problem , as the explanations offered for his motivations are psychologically fuzzy to say the least . 
<s>  the story owes us a better understanding of franciosa's mind , his concealed madness and his sudden murderous rampage . 
<s>  tenebrae is also marred by annoying little inconsistencies . 
<s>  for instance , a teenage boy and girl leave a hotel room and minutes later we see the girl riding off on the back of a motorbike . 
<s>  we would assume the rider is the same boy , but it turns out to be some male character we aren't even introduced too ! 
<s>  that's careless filmmaking , pure and simple . 
<s>  why , you may ask , do i go on about the story's flaws ? 
<s>  because when it comes to visuals and set pieces , argento is one of the most exciting filmmakers in the world . 
<s>  take one of the extended scenes in tenebrae . 
<s>  an upset girl wandering the streets at night needlessly taunts a guard dog to the point where - almost unbelievably - it jumps a high fence and chases her across town . 
<s>  finally , as she desperately seeks escape from this crazed canine , she accidentally stumbles on the serial killer's lair . 
<s>  it's an absolutely masterful sequence , tense and exciting , and communicating a wealth of information through visuals alone . 
<s>  and that's exactly the kind of thing that makes the flaws so frustrating . 
<s>  too often , it seems , argento's films as a whole are less than the sum of their impressive parts . 
<s>  mind you , if you love murder mysteries then tenebrae is still worth a look . 
<s>  and if you're a fan of argento's unique style of giallo thriller then it's essential .

<s>  a shame , because it doesn't have to be that way . 
<s>  take argento's more recent stendhal syndrome ( 1992 ) , where with the aid of co-writer franco ferrini he fashioned a solid storyline without sacrificing any of his surreal weirdness or visual panache . 
<s>  proof that he can do it , if he tries . . . 
<s>  as any sociologist will attest , your childhood and the types of parents that you have will heavily influence your happiness as an adult . 
<s>  parents that are supportive and environments that are nurturing will yield children who will embrace the values and norms that can allow them to live healthy and productive lives . 
<s>  but if your upbringing is marred with violence , hate and dysfunctionality , then your journey towards a happy adulthood will be saddled with psychological obstacles almost too great to overcome . 
<s>  `affliction' explores how a man never truly escapes the grip of an unforgivingly nightmarish childhood . 
<s>  the man in question is wade whitehouse ( nick nolte ) . 
<s>  here is a man who is like any other citizen on the surface . 
<s>  he is a productive member of the community and goes about his daily routine much like you and me . 
<s>  but as you scratch beneath the surface , something scary and evil begins to rear its ugly head . 
<s>  we see that he is a mean-tempered person . 
<s>  he has a hard time taking control of his emotions , which usually gets the better of him . 
<s>  he is quick to apologize for his actions and wants to be a gentle person , but something is sparking a tendency towards violence . 
<s>  he also has tremendous problems with relationships . 
<s>  he is divorced and his only connection to love is his daughter . 
<s>  but his bearish persona and stature alienates her . 
<s>  he is visibly shaken by her rejection even though she says that she loves him . 
<s>  his demeanor also puts his relationship with a local townsgirl ( sissy spacek ) at risk .

<s>  finally , he is spiteful and vindictive . 
<s>  as a rejected father , he initiates a custody battle that seems hopeless . 
<s>  as the town's only police officer , he issues a speeding ticket to a man whose father has just died . 
<s>  we can see that this is a man that is both afflicted and living with pain . 
<s>  he is a prisoner and a slave to it . 
<s>  he is moving towards a level of madness and insanity that defies comprehension . 
<s>  what kind of force can move a man to the edge of his emotions and beyond the reach of people who genuinely care for him ? 
<s>  we learn that the answer is his father ( james coburn ) . 
<s>  this is the kind of father that every son would be ashamed to have and that any woman would be afraid to meet . 
<s>  he is an overbearingly misogynistic and frequent drunk who rules with an iron fist . 
<s>  we see his tyrannical behavior through flashbacks . 
<s>  to heighten the father's churlishness , the flashbacks are shown as home video footage taken by a very frightened person . 
<s>  very effective . 
<s>  today , wade's dad is quite elderly , but still manages to instill fear into a grown man . 
<s>  the influence that the father possesses is inescapable , and its unsavory effect clamps down hard on the tortured wade . 
<s>  the result is every son's nightmare ? becoming like the father that one has always dreaded to be . 
<s>  this is a terrifically presented piece of psychological drama , and nolte turns in a strong performance as a man whose pain seems to become a detriment as well as a necessity . 
<s>  he's a hulking person who is still reduced to whimpers when in the presence of his father . 
<s>  coburn displays heft as the bitter dad .

<s>  there's nothing light or fluffy about this film . 
<s>  that may turn many moviegoers away . 
<s>  but it's certainly worth noting that this is a well-acted drama showcasing nolte's and coburn's raw acting talents .

<s>  while fincher's films have never suffered from a lack of shock value ( his major character killings in both alien 3 and seven are fine examples ) , fight club marks the distillation of his pitch-black comedic sensibility ( see 1997's the game ) into something like a definitive statement .

<s>  >from the commercials , this looks like a mild-mannered neil simonesque tale with mary tyler moore baring her bra touted as the highlight . 
<s>  instead it turns out to be a hilarious film running in high gear from beginning to end .
