<s>  then they have to get the toys . 
<s>  oh , the video came out ? 
<s>  got to buy it , or risk little billy's temper tantrums for the next month . 
<s>  all of this culminates in the childhood equivalent of a pilgrimage to mecca : a visit to the magic kingdom . 
<s>  stay at the disneyland hotel ! 
<s>  buy a disney t-shirt ! 
<s>  eat an ice cream mickey mouse on a stick ! 
<s>  it's both a vertical and horizontal monopoly when you think about it . 
<s>  dale carnegie should have had it so good . 
<s>  what's most amazing is that all this success is in spite of a severe lack of originality . 
<s>  you see , disney animated features these days have two components : theme and plot . 
<s>  the theme changes with each new movie ; the plot does not . 
<s>  the plot is a mold into which the characters of some ancient fable are dropped , and try as they might to rise above the characters of previous features , they are nearly always destined to do no more than the same . 
<s>  however , while the success of a disney animated feature is generally a given as far as box-office receipts , merchandising dollars , and glimmers in the eyes of little children , critically they are as varied as anything else that hollywood has to offer . 
<s>  luckily , disney's latest animated offering , mulan , manages to be engaging and refreshing , even while rife with formula . 
<s>  the film starts with the invasion of ancient china by the huns , led by the imposing shan-yu ( miguel ferrer ) . 
<s>  soon , china's emperor ( pat morita ) mobilizes his armies and decrees that one male from each family in the country shall serve to fight in china's defense . 
<s>  when the fa family is served notice , it is the elderly father , fa zhou ( soon-tek oh ) who must answer the call , as there are no other males in the household . 
<s>  fearing her father will surely be killed in battle , fa mulan ( ming-na wen ) disguises herself as a man and sneaks off with the royal orders to join the chinese army . 
<s>  mulan , based on a chinese epic poem , is a classic tale of the triumph of the ugly duckling . 
<s>  mulan herself is a disgrace to her loving family , as she has a difficult time fitting into the traditional woman's role , and in a very amusing scene where a matchmaker attempts to assess her value to a potential husband , we see that " grace " is not one of her strong points . 
<s>  very early on , we are presented with the high importance of bringing honor to one's family , and by botching her chance at gaining the favor of the matchmaker , mulan fails at that task . 
<s>  by leaving home to fight in her father's place , she may not only spare his life , but bring honor , too . 
<s>  as is the case with most disney musicals , the songs are first rate and pervasive throughout the film . 
<s>  i'm not sure if they will get much airplay , but at least one of the songs will no doubt receive recognition come oscar time . 
<s>  both lea salonga , who provides the singing voice for mulan , and donny osmond who sings for shang , the captain of mulan's army unit and obligatory love interest , are more than competent , although salonga's voice translates much better to animation . 
<s>  you have to hear it to understand . 
<s>  interestingly , the musical numbers which are so often done with big flourishes are surprisingly muted in mulan . 
<s>  there is no significantly big number , which is customary as the second or third song in a disney film , but this does not detract significantly from the rest of the movie . 
<s>  it is , however , an expectation which has been built by disney's own formulaic history , and some viewers may feel as if something is missing . 
<s>  artistically , the animators have chosen to adopt the more subdued pastels of chinese artwork , and although this may not live up to the vibrance so associated with many of the other disney works , it helps to contribute a more authentic , and therefore more credible , nature to what otherwise may be seen as a typically " disneyfied " ethnic tale . 
<s>  there are also a couple of visually standout scenes , one involving the charge of shan-yu's hun army , which utilizes the same computer-enhanced imagery disney animators have employed since the chandelier in beauty and the beast . 
<s>  the other scene worth mentioning is so quick you might miss it . 
<s>  when mulan resolves to take her father's place , she dons her father's old battle armor , and unsheathes a sword . 
<s>  as she does so , you can see her reflection in the polished metal . 
<s>  it just left me thinking , " that was really cool . " 
<s>  a wonderful range of performances delight the audience throughout the film , varying from the straight , such as soon-tek oh as fa zhou , to the comical , such as harvey fierstein as yao , a gruff , pugilistic member of shang's conscripted army . 
<s>  even more outrageous is eddie murphy as mushu , the diminutive guardian dragon sent to look after mulan . 
<s>  although an obvious attempt to relive the chemistry brought forth by robin williams in aladdin , murphy nevertheless distinguishes himself with his own winning performance . 
<s>  i found the choice of b . d . 
<s>  wong as shang a little strange ( you may remember him as martin short's wedding planner assistant in the father of the bride ) , but they used robbie benson for the voice of the beast in beauty and the beast , so i guess anything's possible . 
<s>  in any event , wong performs admirably as well . 
<s>  one character which provides a significant amount of humor is grandmother fa . 
<s>  she deserves recognition not only because of the levity she brings to the movie , but also because she is voiced by two very remarkable people . 
<s>  june foray , who supplies grandmother fa's speaking voice , is a venerable voice actress who may be best known for her work as rocky the squirrel and natasha fatale ( as in boris and natasha ) . 
<s>  marni nixon , who provides grandmother fa's singing voice , is the same vocalist who dubbed the voices for anna in the king and i , maria in west side story , and eliza in my fair lady . 
<s>  with this in mind , hearing grandmother fa is like listening to a little piece of history . 
<s>  mulan is the latest disney animated feature to get away from some of the eurocentrism which for so long dominated disney films . 
<s>  in an effort to be culturally sensitive ( and to avoid a " miss saigon " -type debacle ) , disney has also wisely chosen to employ many asian-american actors for both lead and supporting roles . 
<s>  in addition to the actors already mentioned , the cast includes such ubiquitous talents as james hong , gedde watanabe , james shigeta , and george takei .

<s>  it makes the most of a talented but not particularly well-known cast--goran visnjic plays alek with a suave likeability , jonathan tucker shines as the conflicted beau , peter donat is amusing as grandfather hall , and josh lucas has an equally small but effective role as the hapless darby reese . 
<s>  the film is also lovingly photographed by giles nuttgens and features an evocative score , courtesy peter nashel . 
<s>  but it owes everything to british actress tilda swinton . 
<s>  swinton , whose pale-faced ethereal beauty has graced many of derek jarman's films ( " caravaggio , " " edward ii , " " the last of england " ) , plays margaret hall in " the deep end " and , like charlotte rampling in this year's " under the sand , " turns in a commanding and accomplished performance . 
<s>  margaret is a devoted mother who is willing to risk everything to protect the ones she loves , and swinton captures every frustration , every fear , every subtle examination and every fervent realization and every nervous oscillation of her being . 
<s>  the role calls for an extremely wide range of emotions none the least of which is simply playing a mother beset with a multitude of domestic responsibilities . 
<s>  many can relate to that , of course ; it's the murder cover-up and the blackmail and the fear of losing one's son that swinton so gracefully , so graciously , makes resonate with the truest of colors . 
<s>  the end is deep all right , and there isn't a single shallow moment in tilda swinton's canon . 
<s>  i hate to burst your bubble , but after all the star power , mega bucks , screenwriters , directors , and cool trailers , men in black is not the best movie of the summer .

<s>  susan granger's review of " osmosis jones " ( warner bros . ) 
<s>  if the farrelly brothers taught anatomy & physiology in school , no one would cut ever class . 
<s>  this hip , live action/animation story begins as a monkey snatches a hard-boiled egg from frank , a zookeeper ( bill murray ) , who grabs it back , drops it , then gobbles up the contaminated morsel , explaining , " if it hits and ground and you pick it up within 10 seconds , you can eat it . " 
<s>  like " fantastic voyage " ( 1966 ) , the pseudo-science animation then takes over when his body's immune system contacts traffic control as an ingested virus hits the digestive system : " be on the alert for illegal organisms ! " 
<s>  eager to right " a stomach evacuation mistake " he once made , a cocky , clever , courageous white blood cell ( chris rock ) declares , " this is a crime scene ! " 
<s>  and teams up with a conscientious " phi beta capsule " 12-hour cold remedy called drixenol ( david hyde pierce ) to chase down and destroy the deadly " red death " virus ( laurence fishburne ) that's determined to take frank down in 48 hours , beating ebola and e . coli to a medical record . 
<s>  watch out for mucus mudslides , chaos in cerebellum hall and the detritus from booger dam ( runny nose ) , along with comic turns from molly shannon and chris elliot , plus the voices of william shatner and brandy norwood . 
<s>  peter and bobby farrelly , along with writer mark hyman and animation directors piet kroon and tom sito , have turned their penchant for gross-out comedy , encompassing flatulence , festering sores and " popping a pimple without a permit , " into a funny , farrelly-funny family film . 
<s>  on the granger movie gauge of 1 to 10 , " osmosis jones " is a wildly imaginative , original , explosive 7 . 
<s>  and perhaps , as they're laughing , kids will learn where to find their uvula , along with nuggets about nutrition and hygiene . 
<s>  i must say from the outset that i have never been much of a kurt russell fan . 
<s>  i've seen some of his films ( silkwood , backdraft , unlawful entry ) and while he gave adequate performances , i have never been impressed with his work . 
<s>  breakdown , then , is something of a surprise . 
<s>  russell gives a fine performance , as do most of the cast , one that is not upstaged by the action orchestrated in the second half of the film . 
<s>  to say that he holds the film together would not be completely true , but he does it no harm . 
<s>  russell plays jeff , one half of a married couple travelling with his wife amy ( kathleen quinlan ) cross country to san diego to start a new job and a new life . 
<s>  while journeying through the desert their car breaks down and , left helpless and stranded , jeff waves down a passing truck driver ( j . t . 
<s>  walsh ) who offers to take them to a nearby diner to call for a tow truck . 
<s>  because of a nasty incident earlier with a couple of ruffians , jeff decides to stay with the car while amy gets help . 
<s>  that , it seems , is the last time jeff ( or anyone else ) sees her . 
<s>  breakdown has been compared to several movies : george sluizer's the vanishing ( the original , hopefully , not his appalling hollywood remake ) , steven spielberg's duel and any number of hitchcock films . 
<s>  as with these , breakdown does not , for the most part , stray down the conventional path of the american action-thriller . 
<s>  jeff does not become a gun-toting vigilante on the hunt for his wife , but instead becomes a scared , confused everyman who has no idea what the hell is going on . 
<s>  when we do find out what has happened to amy , it does come as a slight disappointment , if only because it's too early in the film ; i for one could have done with an extra twenty minutes or so of mystery and bewilderment , but this affects the film little . 
<s>  russell , as mentioned earlier , is very good in his role , and kathleen quinlan is nowhere near as annoying as she was in apollo 13 . 
<s>  j . t . 
<s>  walsh , as the possibly evil truck driver , is terrific ; he is one of the best of the fine batch of character actors hollywood doesn't seem to know what to do with , but director jonathan mostow is on the right track here . 
<s>  the reason he makes such a great villain is that he actually looks like a real person , one anyone would be able to trust , which makes the plot that much more believable . 
<s>  breakdown is what hollywood doesn't make enough of , a great thriller with believable characters and scenes that do , indeed , have viewers on the edge of their seats . 
<s>  one of the most genuinely exciting films i've seen in a long time . 
<s>  with the success of the surprise hit alien , directed by ridley scott , a sequel was inevitable . 
<s>  in fact , after watching the first film , a sequel was wanted , particularly by this reviewer . 
<s>  handing over the director's chair to recent box office gem james cameron , who had only made two films previous to this one ( pirahna ii , a surprisingly dull film , and terminator , making cameron a household name ) , the alien series got a face-lift of immense proportions . 
<s>  instead of being a suspense/science fiction film , cameron alters the series and changing it into an action picture . 
<s>  what results is one of the most terrifying films ever created . 
<s>  a film like aliens comes along only once in a while , and when it does , audiences are usually unprepared for it . 
<s>  i never saw this movie in theaters , but i wish i could have . 
<s>  the terror and fright must have been unimaginable , most likely with audiences members literally shrieking in fear . 
<s>  aliens is an action film unlike any i have ever seen . 
<s>  with a science fiction plot , cameron gives aliens added testosterone , pumping up the action and fire power from the original film . 
<s>  in fact , aliens is one of those few sequels which tops the original . 
<s>  perhaps what makes the alien series so impressive is the hero--or heroine , as the case may be . 
<s>  never have we had a more sympathetic hero in an action film , and never have i seen such an impressive acting job done by the main character . 
<s>  sigourney weaver is possibly the only actress who could play this character and make her realistic enough for us to care about . 
<s>  placing a woman in these situations would sometimes seem unusual , but because of weaver's presence , a woman is the only suitable hero . 
<s>  aliens begins 57 years after alien ended . 
<s>  lieutenant ellen ripley ( weaver ) is discovered in hypersleep on the nostromo and is awakened . 
<s>  she explains how she is the only survivor of her past encounter with the aliens , but " the company " is doubtful . 
<s>  they explain that a colony of families is flourishing on the same planet from which she just left . 
<s>  despite stern warnings from ripley , the company remains rigid and won't call the families back . 
<s>  however , when the company loses contact with the colony , ripley's story seems much more feasible . 
<s>  one of the company's directors , carter burke ( paul reiser ) , wants to gather a team to travel to the planet . 
<s>  this team includes a buff private vasquez ( jenette goldstein ) , a questionable corporal hicks ( michael biehn ) , and a loyal android bishop ( lance henriksen ) . 
<s>  burke tags along with ripley as they fly to the planet in order to locate the members of the colony . 
<s>  arriving on the planet , the team finds most of the human life extinguished in a cocoon-type environment . 
<s>  the only survivor is 12 year old rebecca " newt " jorden ( carrie henn ) . 
<s>  ripley finds this a chance to be the mother she never had the opportunity to become , and she becomes newt's surrogate mother . 
<s>  ripley and newt are the only ones who knows what has happened , and soon , all hell breaks loose . 
<s>  aliens not only multiplies the thrills and suspense from scott's version , it also multiplies the number of aliens in general . 
<s>  alien focused on one alien in particular which systematically killed each crew member , except ripley , who managed to jettison the alien out of the nostromo . 
<s>  aliens focuses on an entire race of these aliens , and as a result , the chills are incredibly heightened . 
<s>  then again , this is james cameron , the guy who has given us true lies and terminator 2 : judgment day . 
<s>  he is the best action director out there ( topping renny harlin , who directed cliffhanger ) , and only he could create something as terrifying as this film . 
<s>  it seems that every alien film seems to have some memorable scene or scenes , and aliens has the motherload . 
<s>  with perhaps one of the most astonishing endings ever created for an action film , aliens climax never seems to hit until the viewer is nearly pushed to extreme exhaustion . 
<s>  i can't recall another film ever to sustain this level of intensity throughout , never dropping for a moment . 
<s>  just when you think the movie is over , something else will occur , and it starts right back up again . 
<s>  with a seemingly endless conclusion , aliens ends with one of the greatest moments in film history . 
<s>  this scene is usually the one remembered most from the film , as lieutenant ripley steps into one of the lifting machines to fight the alien queen . 
<s>  using flawless special effects , the climax is exhausting , leaving any audience member drained from extreme anxiety . 
<s>  of course , for a film of this genre to work properly , the technical aspects must be realistic enough for us to believe what we see . 
<s>  aliens is completely realistic , even a decade after its initial release . 
<s>  the special effects are wonderfully seamless , with a terrifying alien to go with them . 
<s>  one of the most overlooked aspects of this film is the music , composed by cameron-regular james horner . 
<s>  horner has created a terrific score , receiving an oscar nomination for his work . 
<s>  not only that , horner has also created one of the best scores for any action film , or science fiction film ever ( and that includes 2001 : a space odyssey , which was mainly a compilation of well-known composers ) . 
<s>  in fact , the climax music is also some of the most recognized of film music . 
<s>  the production design is incredible , which also happened to snag a nomination from the academy . 
<s>  dark corridors lit by red lights are very impressive , but more impressive is the amount of terror which arises from well-lit locations . 
<s>  normally a film will be very dark in order to scare a viewer ; aliens uses lights to scare the viewer . 
<s>  then , of course , is the cinematography , which uses point of view shots , along with video feeds in order to build suspense . 
<s>  some of the scariest scenes involve the perspective of ripley . 
<s>  surprisingly , the acting is not only above average for this genre , but some of the best . 
<s>  sigourney weaver received an oscar nomination for her portrayal of ripley , incorporating the right amount of sympathy into her hard-edged persona . 
<s>  weaver soars above the rest in this film , but she is supposed to . 
<s>  carrie henn gives an above average performance for a child , developing a three-dimensional character from her quiet attitude . 
<s>  lance henriksen is terrific as bishop , showing that androids don't always have to be flat characters . 
<s>  jenette goldstein shows a fair amount of enthusiasm with her role , and steals several scenes of her own ( though her personality becomes slightly annoying when she isn't fighting ) . 
<s>  michael biehn gives a very nice performance in the most obligatory role of the film . 
<s>  however , biehn does a good job , making it seem original again . 
<s>  paul reiser may seem like an odd choice to play the sleazy corporate director , but reiser manages to pull it off quite well ( however , i still see him as paul on tv's " mad about you " ) . 
<s>  a very good cast ( which also includes bill paxton and william hope ) highlights this action film , making it stand out from others . 
<s>  aliens is rightfully rated r for violence , gore , language , and terror . 
<s>  aliens is sort of the redefining moment of the science fiction genre , as alien was more of a suspense/horror film . 
<s>  aliens pumps up the stakes , and cameron directs it with professional quality . 
<s>  cameron certainly knows how to make a good action film , but here he proves how he can create some truly horrific moments on screen . 
<s>  technically astonishing , aliens' only flaw is small characters who are only there to get killed . 
<s>  aside from this , you probably won't experience anything like aliens for quite a while . 
<s>  ingredients : neophyte lawyer , legal situations , corrupt insurance company , 
<s>  synopsis : rudy baylor ( matt damon ) is an ethical kid fresh out of law school who must juggle three legal situations at the same time . 
<s>  rudy's girlfriend is attacked by her violent husband ; rudy's elderly landlady wants to arrange her will so that her children are excluded , and ; the family of rudy's friend with leukemia is suing the corrupt insurance company that wouldn't pay for a bone marrow transplant . 
<s>  rudy is new to being a lawyer and is thoroughly outgunned , but luckily he is aided by a sleazy ambulance chaser ( danny devito ) who has failed the bar exam six times as well as by the kindly presiding judge ( danny glover ) . 
<s>  jon voight plays leo f . drummond , the intimidating and arrogant leader of the all-powerful insurance company's team of lawyers who will do anything to oppose justice . 
<s>  will rudy defeat leo ? 
<s>  will he enjoy being a lawyer ? 
<s>  opinion : the good news is that this movie has a happy ending , and it features a guy trying to do the right thing . 
<s>  director francis ford coppola does this film a little differently than the stereotypical law movie . 
<s>  in the typical lawyer movie there's one big case and the movie focuses on solving it , and somewhere along the line surprise witnesses and motives turn up before the good guy wins ( after lots of gripping courtroom drama ) . 
<s>  however , coppola's movie is deliberately more low key . 
<s>  'the rainmaker' plays out like a personality sketch of young rudy as he gets emotionally involved with and tries to save various little quirky side characters . 
<s>  in the background rudy's voice narrates his feelings and makes half-cynical jokes about the legal profession in general . 
<s>  two factors combine to make this movie less heavy than it can be . 
<s>  first , rudy's time is split juggling three cases , rather than concentrating on a single high-stakes case . 
<s>  also , rudy's use of voice narration in place of acting makes the film lose some of its dramatic edge . 
<s>  the end result is an entertaining low key law movie where the good guys win , and rudy narrates his way into coming of age .

<s>  extended review : you know , i remember when hitmen were evil , murderous scum . 
<s>  alas , the times are a-changin' .

<s>  advertised as a quirky comedy with hints of action , it turned out to have a suprising dosage of it . 
<s>  the big hit is quite the opposite . 
<s>  it was hyped as " the new film from producer john woo " , so one would it expect lots of stylized killing and action .

<s>   " when will the devil take me ? " he asks rhetorically in lulling voice over . 
<s>  the spoiled title character of _onegin_ ( pronounced oh-negg-in ) is waiting on death to relieve him after a lifetime of rapacious behaviour . 
<s>  martha fiennes' debut feature is ( quite literally ) filmed poetry ( it's based on an epic russian poem by alexander pushkin ) , a profound study of regret , of how we confuse shame with guilt . 
<s>  when we first meet eugene onegin ( ralph , acting for his sister ; another brother , magnus , composed the score ) , a philandering aristocrat from st . petersburg , he has just inherited his uncle's estate . 
<s>  with plans to sell it , onegin pays a summer visit to the manor , which is located in an underpopulated russian countryside , and not long into the trip he meets a neighbouring family of blue bloods . 
<s>  smitten with olga larina ( headey ) , he befriends olga's fianc ? , vladimir lensky ( stephens ) , while olga's sister , tatyana ( tyler ) , romanticizing his flippant attitude ( he's a nineteenth bad boy ) , falls for onegin . 
<s>  in one sweaty , inky torrent of passion , tatyana writes him a love letter . 
<s>  he is at least intrigued by the note but rejects her affections , it is implied , because he can . 
<s>  soon after , tragedy strikes , and onegin makes himself scarce . 
<s>  when we catch up with him , six years later , he has just returned to st . petersburg , where at a grand ball he discovers that an old friend ( donovan ) has married a more womanly and wordly tatyana . 
<s>  this time , onegin finds her irresistable . 
<s>  what is most amazing about ralph fiennes' performance is his subtle physical transformation from dashing snob to miserly grouch . 
<s>  overwhelmed by a top hat , the onegin who pines for tatyana seems smaller in stature than the one who brushed her off , an ebeneezer scrooge trapped in christmas past . 
<s>  the actor has been constricted playing heroes for too long now-there's room to breathe in a role that's made up of shades of gray like " onegin " . 
<s>  petula clark sang of a universal phenomenon in " parking lot " : " you don't know what you've got ? til it's gone . " 
<s>  onegin's about-face on tatyana speaks for those of us ( read : most of us ) who need confirmation that someone or something is wanted by others before we want it as well . 
<s>  what the character feels is not jealousy but remorse , embarrassment , even , at having let her go . 
<s>  out of identification we feel empathy for onegin , a callous bastard . 
<s>  tatyana's emotions echo a thousand ditties , but that makes them no less vital . 
<s>  she changes , too , from a girl in crush to a woman with divided loyalties . 
<s>  tyler acquits herself surprisingly well among her uk co-stars , filling in sketchy gaps by expressing base sentiments in a series of wanton stares . 
<s>  they both have faces , mr . fiennes and ms . tyler , capable of conveying archetypal russian misery . 
<s>  _onegin_ could have added up to little more than a distinguished episode of " masterpiece theater " , even with its current cast of thoroughbreds intact , were martha fiennes not at the helm . 
<s>  an mtv background ( she cut her teeth directing rock videos for xtc and others ) has positively influenced her sense of pace ( though , thankfully , not her shot lengths-no spasmodic cutting here ) ; at just over 100 minutes , _onegin_ clicks along like a brisk walk through valleys of despair . 
<s>  the film has an atypical period look , as well . 
<s>  absent are the sumptuous tableware and antique furnishings that stand in for plot and character in those drippy merchant ivory productions . 
<s>  the sets are almost expressionistically bare , echoing the loneliness of the protagonists . 
<s>   ( cinematographer remi adafarasin often allows space to engulf them ; i'm reminded the climax , which unfolds in a sea of white . ) 
<s>  martha fiennes has a clear command of cinema , and her spare , often painfully human visual presentation of " yevgeny onegin " is arguably the most lucid translation of pushkin's difficult text yet . 
<s>  ms . fiennes may be the most exciting female presence behind a camera since jane campion . 
<s>  bruce barth's mellow piano plays in the background as conflict erupts in a little country town of florida . 
<s>  ulee's gold feels like another fonda creation- on golden pond : it has a soft , calm surface with a tempest brewing underneath , the cinematography creates a place of gold , yellow , and olive colors , the music is stirring and tranquil . 
<s>  both deal with the hardships of family life . 
<s>  peter fonda gives his undoubtedly best performance in victor nu ? ez's new film and patricia richardson ( home improvement star ) shows she is worthy of big screen attention . 
<s>  nu ? ez is probably independent film's greatest asset , along with john sayles , and he proves his talent with a slow pace and undulating , heavy tension . 
<s>  peter fonda's performance borrows from his father henry fonda's in on golden pond- there is a great vulnerability that he gives the character ulee jackson and just like his father , peter fonda is quiet , emotional , and weary in this exceptional role . 
<s>  ulee jackson , the film's protagonist , is struggling . 
<s>  pressure is mounting at the wrong time . 
<s>  he is a beekeeper and this is his " busy " season . 
<s>  he has to deal with his two granddaughters' needs and erupting hormones , he is forced to pick up his daughter-in-law in orlando who is strung out on drugs and take care of her , and he is faced with a challenging task : unsettled business his son , who is now in prison , has left behind . 
<s>  he finds his daughter-in-law , helen , with the two men his son robbed a bank with . 
<s>  she has apparently told these two men that the money that resulted from the robbery is with her husband . 
<s>  that is why he got caught- the police found him with the money . 
<s>  now the two men are demanding they get the cash , or they will come after ulee's two granddaughters . 
<s>  ulee promises he will bring it to them and takes a deranged helen back to his serene little home where her two children that she abandoned scrutinize her with contempt . 
<s>  ulee is a man who lost his pals in war- he was the only man in his platoon to survive . 
<s>  he refuses help from anybody and does not respond to affectionate gestures . 
<s>  he is a bitter , closed-off man whose only passion is his beekeeping , his granddaughters , and his dead wife . 
<s>  connie , his next door neighbor , finally gets through to him with friendly favors . 
<s>  she is a nurse and helps helen get through her turmoil with drugs . 
<s>  ulee's gold is the story of a man who believes he is fine as he is- until the truth is revealed painfully to him : he is cold and unfeeling . 
<s>  of course , in the end , ulee softens up , but his journey is absorbing and we have fallen in love with his tiredness and weariness . 
<s>  what is admirable about the movie is peter fonda's winning turn as ulee and the story that feels like nobody's fool but , in the end , ends up in a class of its own . 
<s>  susan granger's review of " big eden " ( jour de fete ) 
<s>  it's utopia , this tiny town tucked away in the timberland of northwestern montana , where old codgers lounge on the porch of the general store to pass the time away and the local matchmakers ( nan martin , louise fletcher ) eagerly pair off the young people , regardless of sexual preference . 
<s>  there's nary a homophobe or bigot around , much to the surprise of henry hart ( arye gross ) , a successful but lonely manhattan artist who returns home to care for sam ( george coe ) , the ailing grandfather who raised him . 
<s>  and with the simultaneous re-appearance of his best-friend from high-school and object of his unrequited love ( tim dekay ) , now divorced with two young sons , the fact of his homosexuality must be faced . 
<s>  to complete the triangle , there's the tall , taciturn native american ( eric schweig ) who owns the general store and lovingly yet secretly prepares gourmet meals for henry and sam . 
<s>  this fable about home and family is a major debut for first-time film-maker thomas bezucha ( a former designer for coach and polo/ralph lauren ) who is meticulous about minding details , using ballads like " welcome to my world " and " achin' , breakin' heart " to set up the concept of our universal longing to find a place in which we can love and be loved . 
<s>  in the paradise of big eden , what you are doesn't matter as much as generosity of spirit , respect and kindness . 
<s>  sure , the plot's implausible but it's a good-natured fantasy so allowances should be made . 
<s>  and rob sweeney's photography of glacier national park is spectacular ! 
<s>  on the granger movie gauge of 1 to 10 , " big eden " is a charming , quirky , off-beat 7 . 
<s>  it's a heart-warming romantic comedy about a gay man who doesn't die of aids or wind up alone at the end . 
<s>  when you go to the movies as much as i do , you unfortunately end up seeing certain movie trailers one too many times . 
<s>  such was the case with frequency . 
<s>  every time i went to a screening , there was the frequency preview . 
<s>  it looked awful . 
<s>  it looked cheesy , sappy and ridiculous . 
<s>  it looked like a flop . 
<s>  well , whoever put that trailer together should be fired , because in terms of pure entertainment , frequency is one of the best of the year thus far . 
<s>  frequency boasts a compelling story line . 
<s>  an occurrence of freakish solar activity allows police detective john sullivan ( james caviezel ) to speak to his fireman father frank sullivan ( dennis quaid ) through a ham radio , despite the fact that frank has been dead for 30 years . 
<s>  john is able to give his father information that prevents his death in a warehouse fire , but by doing so causes other changes . 
<s>  somehow , a serial killer's reign of terror , which in the original timeline had been stopped at three murders , extends to ten victims . . . 
<s>  including john's mother . 
<s>  this is director gregory hoblit's third film ( the other two being primal fear and fallen ) . 
<s>  with all three , he's managed to attach himself to great scripts ( this one by toby emmerich , whose only previous movie experience was as a music supervisor on numerous new line films ) and add equally great direction . 
<s>  also , he apparently likes to have his films wrap up with a kick-ass ending . 
<s>  frequency is no exception , the ending is unpredictable and incredibly satisfying . 
<s>  hoblit is three for three , and i hope he can keep it up . 
<s>  now everyone can argue logic this and logic that all you want with the sci-fi elements of frequency . 
<s>  but the fact of the matter is that time travel has never been achieved . 
<s>  who's to say how something works and how it doesn't when it's never happened ? 
<s>  is it because we've become accustomed to time travel " laws " from other places like " star trek " and the back to the future trilogy and " quantum leap " ? 
<s>  yes , if you sit down and think about it , certain plot elements in this film probably won't make any sense . 
<s>  most films are like that . 
<s>  don't let that dissuade you from seeing this fantastically entertaining film however . 
<s>  when frequency was over , it made me wish i had seen it with my father so i could have given him a hug ( okay okay , shut up ) . 
<s>  when you break it down past all its sci-fi elements and serial killer antics , frequency is simply a movie about a father and his son and the bond that they share . 
<s>  it's touching , it's sincere , and it's what ultimately makes this movie work .

<s>  it must be tough to be a mob boss . 
<s>  just ask paul vitti ( robert deniro ) , a man who finds his job as mafia head to be rather stress inducing . 
<s>  i can believe it , too - one can't even begin to fathom the turmoil he must go through when he's forced to choose between an ice pick , baseball bat or sledgehammer to torture victims with . 
<s>  suffering from reoccurring panic attacks , paul decides he needs to consult some professional help . 
<s>  and who better than billy crystal .

<s>  playing vitti's private shrink , the two very different stars strike an unorthodox , but interesting relationship that carries this enjoyable comedy on a steady wave of laughs from start to finish . 
<s>  casting robert deniro as paul vitti is something of an in-joke , i think . 
<s>  placed in this mobster's shoes , deniro gets to spoof characters he himself played in films like the godfather , part ii and casino . 
<s>  it's obvious he's having a lot of fun doing so . 
<s>  the man behind the camera is harold ramis , whose credits include ghostbusters ( as writer and star ) , and his best directing effort , the bill murray vehicle , groundhog day . 
<s>  ramis has a knack for drawing laughs because he simply knows what's funny , and here he manages to accentuate the strengths of nearly all the actors . 
<s>  the only character who weakens the payoff is crystal's bride-to-be ( lisa kudrow ) . 
<s>  playing the same dumbed-down role as she does in friends , kudrow is amusing , but doesn't fit into this comedy mold as well as the director may have hoped .

<s>  the movie manages to maintain consistent chuckles throughout , putting the emphasis on 3 or 4 really big laughs that will have audiences grasping their sides . 
<s>  the situation is just too cute to resist . 
<s>  it's unfortunate that the language gets somewhat out of hand . 
<s>  but hey , if you're in the mafia , using obscenities probably comes naturally .

<s>  the caveman's valentine starring samuel l . jackson , ann magnuson , aunjanue ellis , tamara tunie screenplay by george dawes green , based on his novel directed by kasi lemmons 
<s>   * * * for more film , dvd and books about movie reviews , plus annual coverage of the toronto international film festival , visit _film freak central_ - http : //filmfreakcentral . net 
<s>  | now with search engine * * * 
<s>  a strange mixture of _shine_ , _basquiat_ , _angel heart_ , and grant morrison & dave mckean's graphic novel " arkham asylum " , _the caveman's valentine_ is a feverish tale of a homeless madman-cum-detective who , on the morning of february 14th , discovers a " valentine " just outside his new york cave : one of ella fitzgerald's strange fruit , stuck in the crotch of a tree--a young male model murdered and frozen to a branch . 
<s>  believing at first that his imagined nemesis stuyvesant , shooting evil rays into his mind from atop the chrysler building , is responsible for the murder , romulus ( samuel l . jackson ) is put on the trail of an avant-garde photographer in the mapplethorpe mould , david leppenraub ( colm feore ) . 
<s>  his minor sleuthing interrupted by the occasional delusional fit and bouts with an ecstasy of creation ( romulus was a brilliant julliard-trained pianist prior to his psychosis ) , romulus uncovers clues and harasses suspects on his way to convincing his police-woman daughter ( aunjanue ellis ) that even though he's a nut , that doesn't mean that he can't solve a high-profile society murder . 
<s>  every moment an exhausting workshop of ideas , and every character the same , _the caveman's valentine_ is a concept so " high concept " that it suddenly became clear to me that the film fits into the comic book genre of entertainment , with romulus's " caveman " a slightly more mundane version of todd mcfarlane's urban noir hero , spawn . 
<s>  with a long-vanished wife ( tamara tunie ) acting as a spiritual guide , the occasional social caste commentary , the secret base in a cave , a divergent genius personality with a network of informants and supporters , and a wickedly colourful arch-enemy , the film piles on the lurid comic book details and dizzying slapdash colours to such a lavish extent that i was vaguely surprised that the blue police cars weren't inscribed with " gotham pd . " 
<s>  that being said , _the caveman's valentine_ can only really succeed as a heroic fantasy , a frank miller graphic novel that has the audacity to portray the blood staining a field of virgin snow expanding to form the shape of a heart . 
<s>  the difficulties with the film spring from the misunderstanding that it somehow adheres to the conventions of a thriller or a police procedural when , in fact , _the caveman's valentine_ is a superhero fable that takes on the cause of the homeless ( again like mcfarlane's spawn ) while attacking the entrenched ruling classes in government and the arts . 
<s>  it is no small detail that our hero , romulus , is not only named for a member of the ruling class who lived his life ( in legend ) without knowledge of his royal birth , but also that our romulus has turned his back on the comforts of the literati in favour of a mystical existence living in a cave in a park . in the romulus mythology , signs of romulus' royal blood is brought by twelve vultures , while in the film , the call to action for our hero comes in the form of not the carrion birds , but of the carrion itself . 
<s>  whether or not romulus of _the caveman's valentine_ will found a nation , or , in the case of novelist george dawes green , upon whose novel his own screenplay is based , a franchise , the fact remains that _the caveman's valentine_ is easily the most misunderstood film of 2001 thus far . 
<s>  it , along with m . night shyamalan's _unbreakable_ , is a mature cinematic extrapolation of the graphic novel format which has , since miller's seminal " the dark knight returns " , redefined the comic medium as one suitable for mature ruminations on psychologically sticky topics . 
<s>  readers of sam keith's brilliant " the maxx " comic series ( or of mtv's short-lived animated adaptation of the same ) are already familiar with the idea of a homeless man placed in the position of knight errant and king of his own twisted demesne . 
<s>  the failure of both " the maxx " tv show and of _the caveman's valentine_ ( not forgetting the initial backlash against _unbreakable_ ) suggests that the public may not be ready for america's surprising contributions to dark fantasy . 
<s>  luxuriantly lit , brashly saturated , and comic-panel framed with a virtuoso grace by cinematographer amy vincent ( _death in venice , ca_ ) , while inhabiting robin standefer's ( _practical magic_ ) mesmerizing sets , _the caveman's valentine_ is an unremittingly gorgeous film . 
<s>  kasi lemmons , following up her brilliant 1997 debut , _eve's bayou_ , which played on similar themes of manufactured realities and mysticism , fulfills much of her immense promise with a tale of seraphs and lost boys , artists and suffering . 
<s>  _the caveman's valentine_ is an elegant and piquant expression of hope for justice in a tilted landscape . 
<s>  clearly not for every taste , when approached with the correct paradigm , it is one of the most stunning and intensely fascinating films of the year : a redefinition of the hero archetype for a post-modern audience with urine-stained wool trench coats in place of blue tights and red capes . 
<s>  _the caveman's valentine_ is a fine and a courageous film , crazy enough to suggest that the delirious yammering of an idiot savant is the best and truest paladin of order in the chaos of eliot's rat's alley wasteland . 
<s>  expand the final fifteen minutes of home alone into a feature-length film and you've got baby's day out--an agreeably amusing children's comedy about a bumbling band of kid kidnappers who are unwittingly outwitted by an innocent infant . 
<s>  the plot tracks a trio of crooks-posed-as-photographers ( mantegna , pantoliano , haley ) who steal nine-month-old bennington august cottwell iv , aka baby bink , from his old-money home . 
<s>  but the plan goes awry when baby crawls out an open window and into the streets of downtown chicago ! 
<s>  following the path of his favorite story , called " baby's day out , " baby rides a bus and visits the zoo and winds up at a skyscraper construction site . 
<s>  while baby stays unscathed , the crooks fare worse for the wear . 
<s>  the stooges get hit by boards and dropped from roofs and , of course , suffer multiple crotch injuries . 
<s>   ( john wayne bobbitt should probably steer clear of this one . ) 
<s>  like he did in planes , trains , and automobiles , john hughes again demonstrates his mastery of the simple set-up and extended execution . 
<s>  here , he's aided and abetted by a director , patrick read johnson , whose choreography could rival a coen brother . 
<s>  best bit : baby crawling across a busy city street . 
<s>  baby's day out has only two emotions--awww and ouch--and the actors play them accordingly . 
<s>  forget the cartoon concern of lara flynn boyle or cynthia nixon , disposable as mom and nanny , respectively , the ones to watch are the ones who are wincing . 
<s>  joe mantegna is a great head stooge , barking lines like " that little doo-doo machine is my retirement money . " 
<s>  brian haley has a great scene with a gorilla , while joe pantolianto plays curly to mantegna's moe . 
<s>   * he * is funny . 
<s>  needless to say , twins adam and jacob warton are adorable beyond belief . 
<s>  waiting at the train station near the beginning of fury , joe says : `after all , we're human . ' 
<s>  in the context of events to transpire , joe's line is prophetic , foreshadowing the internal conflict of the protagonist in the latter half of the film . 
<s>  does being human necessarily imply humane behavior ? 
<s>  through the baseness of human character exemplified in the formation of a mob , fritz lang prompts the viewer to consider whether our inclination towards impulsiveness supersedes our civility . 
<s>  expressing his abhorrence towards the rise of nazism in his homeland , lang takes great care in creating a sense of discomfort during the scenes of mob hysteria . 
<s>  in the scene prefacing the lynching , the mob achieves critical mass at the bar . 
<s>  deputy meyers is brought in as an exalted informant , but when he is unable to augment the mob's myth of joe , he is quickly renounced from his position as town gossip . 
<s>  we see in a shot where two bar patrons are arguing that the deputy looks around nervously at the growing monster and then carefully slips out of the bar . 
<s>  what is quietly horrifying is the realization by both the audience and the deputy that the crowd no longer exists within the confines of reason and has succumbed to what the barber referred to as impulse . 
<s>  what once was excitement to the deputy has turned into fear with the realization that he is now powerless . 
<s>  to the audience , the deputy's quiet exit concurs with their own sinking feeling of uneasiness as the mob's delirium crescendos . 
<s>  lang educes this discomfort not through movement of the camera , but rather its stillness . 
<s>  the shot's composition places the audience equidistant and directly across from the pair of arguing patrons and the deputy effectively becomes a mirror to our own apprehensions . 
<s>  as the intensity of the mob closes around deputy meyers , it does so around the viewer as well . 
<s>  the stationary camera in this shot heightens our fears because when the deputy escapes , we are deserted by our reflection and the viewer becomes the sole proprietor of sensibility amongst a swarm of irrationality . 
<s>  because the camera does not track the deputy's movement , we are left with an amplified perception of desertion and vulnerability . 
<s>  as the bar scene progresses , the camera pans 180 degrees to reveal the fury of the mob . 
<s>  this shot is unique because it is a point-of-view shot where the audience , not a character in the film is the subject . 
<s>  while a long , or dolly shot may objectively reveal the size of the mob , panning from the mob's belly distorts the audience's spatial reference and exaggerates the claustrophobia of the scene ; we feel we are at the epicenter of something infinitely large . 
<s>  we see close shots of people's faces , contorted by their rage . 
<s>  with the pivot of the pan being in the center of the mob and angry members within a short radius of the pan , lang offers the viewer a sense of what it feels like to be the subject of a lynching . 
<s>  in this shot the audience is at the mercy of the mob ; lang's camera makes us feel vulnerable and powerless as joe must have felt in the jail . 
<s>  in some greater sense , it must have been what lang felt when he saw his countrymen overcome with unjustifiable hatred towards their own humankind . 
<s>  lang's observations of his fellow man succumbing to mob behavior left him with an indelible image of malevolent human behavior . 
<s>  as joe faces his peril , trapped in his burning cell , his dog rainbow rushes to be by his side . 
<s>  lang makes rainbow a martyr to contrast his humanity against the recklessness of his human counterparts . 
<s>  using his camera to create shots that elicit disturbing images of mob mentality , lang depicts man's volatility and `impulse' towards inconceivable cruelty . 
<s>  reprising joe' s line at the train station , we are induced to question why our primeval impulses so easily transcend our humanity . 
<s>  because the press screening of " planet of the apes " was one day past last issue's deadline , i was afforded the opportunity to see the film a second time , listen to audience reactions and read a heap of reviews before writing this piece . 
<s>  the chief complaints of those who disliked the futuristic adventure appear to be that the movie focused on visuals instead of substance , that the story was thin , that mark wahlberg's character was colorless and that the surprise ending sucked . 
<s>  to those people i would like to say ? what the hell did you expect ? 
<s>  this is a tim burton movie , boys and girls . 
<s>  tim burton movies have great art direction and thin , clunky stories . 
<s>  for the blissfully nasty , disjointed and underrated " mars attacks ! "

<s>  the 1968 " apes " boasted a handful of great scenes , cool looking monkeys , a deliciously hammy performance by charlton heston ( who appears uncredited here as an aged chimp on his deathbed , re-delivering a classic line ) and a killer ending .

<s>  it also gives us another chance to experience the skewed vision of tim burton and that's nothing to complain about .

<s>  if you want some hearty laughs , then rat race is the movie for you . 
<s>  this unpretentious little comedy , which sneaks into theaters today with very little hype , will have you bouncing in your theater seat . 
<s>  and while the film fits neatly into the low-brow , slapstick school of comedy , one refreshing aspect is its lack of mean-spiritedness . 
<s>  the plot follows a group of people chosen at random by an eccentric las vegas casino owner ( john cleese ) who must race from vegas to a bus station locker 700 miles away in silver city , n . m . 
<s>  inside the locker is a duffel bag containing $2 million . 
<s>  the first one to open the locker , gets the bag and the money . 
<s>  what the group of participants doesn't know is that cleese's donald sinclair ( " i can do anything i want - i'm eccentric ! " ) is staging the race as a betting game for a group of high rollers at the hotel . 
<s>  the participants include vera ( whoopi goldberg ) and merrill ( lanai chapman ) , a newly reunited mother and daughter ; disgraced pro football referee owen templeton ( cuba gooding jr . ) ; italian tourist mr . pollini ( rowan atkinson ) ; randy pear ( jon lovitz ) and his family ; the bumbling con men duane and blaine cody ( seth green and vince vieluf ) ; and cynical young lawyer nick shaffer ( breckin meyer ) . 
<s>  various amusing encounters and mishaps befall the participants en route to silver city . 
<s>  screenwriter andy breckman adds a nice touch by not having the racers try to sabotage one another . 
<s>  the most side-splitting situations involve vera and merrill's encounter with the squirrel lady , a nice nutsy cameo by kathy bates ; owen's commandeering a charter bus full of lucille ball look-alikes on their way to a lucy convention ; the cody brothers misadventures with a hot-air balloon , a flying cow and a monster truck ; and the pear family's stopover at a barbie museum , which turns out not to be what they think it is . 
<s>  the pear family situation is a fine example of the way breckman's script builds the laughs .

<s>  the " submarine " genre of movies seems to be one of the most intriguing and compelling types of storytelling there is . 
<s>  think about it . . . 
<s>  these films are completely based in reality , yet only a handful of people have ever been on one , making them fascinating to the general public . 
<s>  they aren't like movies that take place on a plane or a train , as anybody can get on one of those . 
<s>  and they aren't like movies that happen in outer space either , because no one's done any of that stuff yet . 
<s>  when a new one comes out , you don't hear anyone say " ugh , another submarine movie " like people tend to say " ugh , another boxing movie " . 
<s>  look at modern movies that involve submarines : das boot , the abyss , the hunt for red october , crimson tide . . . 
<s>  all are well regarded as top-notch entertainment . 
<s>  gladly joining that bunch is u-571 , which stars matthew mcconaughey as the executive officer of a u . s . naval submarine during world war ii . 
<s>  we learn he has been denied a recommendation for his own command by his superior ( bill paxton ) . 
<s>  mcconaughey's crew then receives orders that they will be boarding a disabled german submarine to steal the enigma , a german communications encoding device that has stumped allied intelligence . 
<s>  the mission goes horribly wrong however , and as a result , mcconaughey and only a handful of his crew ( as well as a captured german ) become trapped aboard the u-571 in enemy waters . 
<s>  the first great thing about u-571 is the film's opening sequence . 
<s>  the german crew of u-571 are under attack , which sets the events of the rest of the film into motion . 
<s>  it's tense , exciting and fascinating . 
<s>  and i applaud the filmmakers for not copping out and instead keeping the entire sequence in german with english subtitles . 
<s>  most movies with a scene this long would have panicked and had the german crew speaking english right away . 
<s>  once the plot gets moving , u-571 gives us action sequence after action sequence , making the audience wonder " ok , now how do they get out of this ? " . 
<s>  the stakes keep raising ( much like in executive decision , an excellent action-thriller ) , and even though the audience knows how the film will end , it's a lot of fun getting there . 
<s>  i only have two minor complaints about the entire film . 
<s>  the first comes from the scenes which follow the opening sequence . 
<s>  while their purpose is to introduce us to the characters and to get the story going ( which they do ) , i feel as though it could have been done much quicker , and less conventionally . 
<s>  i mean , did we really have to see the ship's crew at a wedding ? 
<s>  because of that , you now know exactly what's going to happen to the groom ! 
<s>  my other gripe would be during the film's finale . 
<s>  there's an explosion which ends the film that is one of the weakest looking cgi effects since the president's plane crashed into the ocean at the end of air force one . 
<s>  i cannot stress this enough . . . 
<s>  until a cgi effect can be made to look like a model effect , stick with using models . 
<s>  yes , u-571 is historically incorrect and there are surely some specifics in the plot that people who have been onboard a submarine will tell you " that couldn't happen " , but the overall point of this film is entertainment . 
<s>  it succeeds fantastically .

<s>  note : some may consider portions of the following text to be spoilers . 
<s>  be forewarned . 
<s>  during the three years since the release of the groundbreaking success pulp fiction , the cinematic output from its creator , quentin tarantino , has been surprisingly low . 
<s>  oh , he's been busy -- doing the talk show circuit , taking small roles in various films , overseeing the production of his screenplay from dusk till dawn , making cameo appearances on television shows , providing a vignette for the ill-fated anthology four rooms -- everything , it seems , except direct another feature-length film . 
<s>  it's been the long intermission between projects as well as the dizzying peak which pulp fiction reached which has made mr . tarantino's new feature film , jackie brown , one of the most anticipated films of the year , and his third feature film cements his reputation as the single most important new american filmmaker to emerge from the 1990s . 
<s>  things aren't going well for jackie brown ( pam grier ) . 
<s>  she's 44 years old , stuck at a dead-end job ( " $16 , 000 a year , plus retirement benefits that aren't worth a damn " ) as a flight attendant for the worst airline in north america -- and she's just been caught at the airport by atf agent ray nicolette ( portrayed with terrific childlike enthusiasm by michael keaton ) and police officer mark dargus ( michael bowen ) smuggling $50 000 from mexico for gun-runner ordell robbie ( samuel l . jackson ) , who has her bailed out by unassuming bail bondsman max cherry ( robert forster ) . 
<s>  the loquacious ordell , based out of a hermosa beach house where his horny , bong-hitting surfer girl melanie ( bridget fonda ) and agreeable crony louis gara ( robert de niro ) hang out , operates under the policy that the best rat is a dead rat , and he's soon out to silence jackie brown . 
<s>  meanwhile , the authorities' target is ordell , and they want jackie to help them by arranging a sting to the tune of a half-million dollars . 
<s>  only through a series of clever twists , turns , and double-crosses will jackie be able to gain the upper hand on both of her nemeses . 
<s>  although jackie brown marks mr . tarantino's first produced screenplay adaptation ( based on the elmore leonard novel " rum punch " ) , there's no mistaking his distinctive fingerprints all over this film . 
<s>  while he's adhered closely to the source material in a narrative sense , the setting has been relocated to los angeles and the lead character's now black . 
<s>  in terms of ambiance , the film harkens back to the 1970s , from the wall-to-wall funk and soul music drowning the soundtrack to the nondescript look of the sets -- even the opening title credit sequence has the echo of vintage 1970s productions . 
<s>  the opening sequence featuring ms . grier wordlessly striding through the lax , funky music blaring away on the speakers , is emblematic of films of that era . 
<s>  the timeframe for the film is in fact 1995 , but the atmosphere of jackie brown is decidedly retro . 
<s>  of course , nothing in the film screams 1970s more than the casting of pam grier and robert forster as the two leads , and although the caper intrigue is fun to watch as the plot twists , backstabbing , and deceptions deliciously unfold , the strength of jackie brown is the quiet , understated relationship developed between jackie and max ; when they kiss , it's perhaps the most tender scene of the year . 
<s>  tenderness ? in a quentin tarantino film ? 
<s>  sure , there've been moments of sweetness in his prior films -- the affectionate exchanges between the bruce willis and maria de madeiros characters in pulp fiction and the unflagging dedication shared by the characters of tim roth and amanda plummer , or even in reservoir dogs , where a deep , unspoken bond develops between the harvey keitel and tim roth characters -- but for the most part , mr . tarantino's films are typified by manic energy , unexpected outbursts of violence , and clever , often wordy , banter . 
<s>  these staples of his work are all present in jackie brown , but what's new here is a different facet of his storytelling -- a willingness to imbue the film with a poignant emotional undercurrent , and a patience to draw out several scenes with great deliberation . 
<s>  this effective demonstration of range prohibits the pigeonholing of mr . tarantino as simply a helmer of slick , hip crime dramas with fast-talking lowlifes , and heralds him as a bonafide multifaceted talent ; he's the real deal . 
<s>  this new aspect of mr . tarantino's storytelling is probably best embodied in a single character -- that of the world-weary , sensitive , and exceedingly-professional max cherry , whose unspoken attraction to jackie is touching . 
<s>  mr . forster's nuanced , understated performance is the best in the film ; he creates an amiable character of such poignancy that when he gazes at jackie , we smile along with him . 
<s>  much press has been given about the casting of blaxploitation-era icon pam grier in the lead , with the wags buzzing that mr . tarantino may do for her what his pulp fiction did to bolster john travolta's then-sagging career . 
<s>  as it turns out , ms . grier is solid in the film's title role , although nothing here forces her to test her range . 
<s>  i do have to take exception to the claim that this film marks her career resurrection , though -- she's been working steadily over the years , often in direct-to-video action flicks , but also in such recent theatrical releases as tim burton's mars attacks ! 
<s>  and larry cohen's original gangstas ( where she first teamed up with mr . forster . ) 
<s>  of course , it's true that her role here was a godsend -- a meaty a part as this is rarity for * any * actress , let alone one of her age and current status in the industry . 
<s>  while jackie brown may disappoint those looking for another pulp fiction clone , it marks tremendous growth of mr . tarantino as a director whose horizons are rapidly expanding , and whose characterizations have never been better . 
<s>  and while the film's narrative doesn't really warrant a running time of 155 minutes , it's filled with such sumptuous riches , ranging from the brashness of the vivid soundtrack to entertaining , inconsequential conversations between the characters , that there wasn't an unengaging moment . 
<s>  with an impressive trio of feature films under his belt , it'll be interesting to see what he tries next . 
<s>   " last night " could have an " aka " tagged on the end of it that says , " it's the end of the world , and we feel fine " . 
<s>   " last night " is about just that . 
<s>  the last night of planet earth's existence . 
<s>  the world is going to end at precisely midnight , january 1st , 2000 . 
<s>  how scientists were so accurately able to predict when this catastrophic event would occur is never explained . 
<s>  nor is the event itself . 
<s>  throughout the entire movie , no explanation is given as to why this is happening . 
<s>  in doing this , mckellar ( who also wrote and directed the film ) seems to be trying to transcend the genre . 
<s>  he's attempted to make a film about people , and how each of them deals with their last night of life . 
<s>  the film contains no science fiction elements , which allows the viewer to concentrate on the feelings and actions of the characters . 
<s>  mckellar is largely successful in his attempt to rise above his material . 
<s>  the film is set in toronto , and follows several people in their various escapades on the last night of existence . 
<s>  there's mckellar , who plays a man who just wants to be alone when the moment occurs , but keeps getting interrupted by a woman ( sandra oh ) in search of her husband .

<s>  i appreciate the fact that mckellar didn't want the material to rule the film , and that he wanted the movie to be more of a study in human behavious . 
<s>  however , in not telling the audience what the cause of earth's destruction is , he's left a big question that is in their minds throughout the film . 
<s>  another problem is we never see anybody panicking . 
<s>  i would imagine if the world was ending , and there was nothing to be done about it , a large segment of the population would be going out of their minds . 
<s>  instead , we are treated to shots of a giant crowd partying like it's new year's eve . 
<s>  i just didn't buy the fact that everyone had completely accepted their fate . 
<s>  no one had the urge to " rage against the dying of the light " . 
<s>  despite these small problems , " last night " is one of the best movies of the year . 
<s>  as opposed to the moronic " armageddon " , " last night " treats the subject at hand with maturity and believabilty . 
<s>  and bruce willis never shows up to save the day . 
<s>   " a bug's life " may not be " toy story , " but it's more close than " antz " was . 
<s>  i really liked " antz , " basically because , yes , it is clever and witty and intelligent ( and it has the temerity to take a chance and put woody allen in the lead , perhaps the year's most inspired casting ) , but there was , in fact , something missing from it , and i'm the first to admit that . 
<s>  maybe it's that it never totally lets go and takes off into real innocent fun - it's too obsessed with its orwellian message to become totally engaging , and if it weren't for woody allen , it would have been just a really clever good-not-great flick . 
<s>   " a bug's life " has a similar premise , and it also has disney to insure that it's g-rated and not totally over kids' heads like " antz " was ( not a bad thing , believe me ) , but what it also has is a tone that's completely innocent even when it's also remaining perpetually clever . 
<s>   " antz " is still the more witty film , and i love it for it , and " a bug's life " is more for general consumption , but it's also more entertaining . 
<s>  it broadens its horizons , and when it really moves from the ant colony , it really shows us a whole new world we've never seen before , and it's take on the evolution of bugs is a lot better than the one in " antz . " 
<s>  it's also light and clever . 
<s>  the visuals are , instead of earth tones , bright worldly colors , and still gives the amazing visual technology of " antz " at least a worthy contender .

<s>  the lead character , flik ( voiced by dave foley ) , is nothing more than a slightly-less neurotic z from " antz , " but foley makes him nearly as engaging as allen made z . instead of gene hackman playing the villain , we get the much more menacing kevin spacey as the lead grasshopper , the nicely-titled hopper . 
<s>  and for the romantic lead , we don't get spacey sharon stone , but intelligent and hard-to-get julia-louis dreyfuss , who doesn't even come around until the very final frames . 
<s>  not that the plot's really any better than the one in " antz " - it's basically yet another redux of " the seven samurai , " with an ant colony under the control of giant grasshoppers forcing them to produce a product for them or else . 
<s>  when flik , a bone fide inventor , creates a time-conserving apparatus that accidentally destroys the season's donation , he puts them all in risk , and is sent away so that he won't screw anything up with the pretense that he is searching for help to fight the grasshoppers . 
<s>  he runs into a group of " warrirors " who are , unbeknownst to him , a group of carnival bugs , and they agree to help under similar false pretenses . 
<s>  these bugs are an equally wonderful assortment to anything in " toy story " : foppish walking stick slim ( david hyde-pierce ) , german caterpillar heimlich ( joe ranft ) , quick-tempered and insecure male ladybug francis ( denis leary ) , pretentious praying mantis manny ( jonathan harris ) , his assistant butterfly hypsy ( madeliene kahn ) , spider rosie ( bonnie hunt ) , and two fleas , tuck and roll ( michael mcshane ) , who speak in undiscernable jibberish . 
<s>  the writers lightly touch on each bug's place in bug society and the malleability thereof while making a wisecracks at everything they can , and blowing the audience away with wild visual treats . 
<s>  grasshoppers jumping in unison seems like a menacing earthquake . 
<s>  a small bird becomes an ominous mortal threat , whose usual mild-mannered squeal is a scream of death . 
<s>  the bug city is a modern-day metropolis , complete with fireflies temping as traffic lights and a fly sitting on the curb , holding out a cup , with a sign lying next to him that says " kid tore off wings . " 
<s>  and a rainstorm is like a giant flood , with each drop acting like a small bomb dropped at millions of miles per hour . 
<s>  around this , the pixar animators stage several large set pieces , like a resuce mission halfway through that is as wild and entertaining as anything this year , and a wonderfully exciting action piece at the end , a chase scene at night through the labyrinthine branches of a small thicket . 
<s>  meanwhile , each character gets the spotlight to be completely idisyncratic and interesting , something " antz " couldn't do , and by the end , over the end credits , " a bug's life " pulls it's final punch , out clever-ing " antz " with a series of incessantly hilarious faux-bloopers that come just at the right time , when those who leave immeadiately after the final frame of a film have left , and you can brag that you were one of the elite who stayed and got the full money's worth of entertainment . 
<s>  still , it's no " toy story . " 
<s>  that film , maybe above any animated film i've ever seen , encompassed almost true perfection in story , character , and wit . 
<s>  it proved that it didn't need to brag about it's cutting edge technology to really soar ( it's the least visually striking of the three computer animated films thus far , but is still the most satisfying ) , and created a perfect world of idiosyncratic delights and innocent fun . 
<s>  yet " a bug's life , " as well as " antz , " are still amazing films , and prove without doubt , that if you're gonna make a computer animated film , send it to the guys who created these three flicks , evne if they're not working under the same roof .

<s>   " six days , seven nights " is a summer movie that gets the summer movie experience deliciously right , a commendable achievement considering the season thus far has been littered with some pretty uneven fare .

<s>  the release of dolores claiborne into wide release this weekend adds another entry into the long list of film adaptations of stephen king's work . 
<s>  this slow-moving character study provides some outstanding acting performances by the principals , but suffers from a tepid conclusion , inconsistent direction , and may not have wide commercial appeal . 
<s>  when the maid , dolores claiborne , is found brandishing a rolling pin standing over the bloody and dead body of her employer , it seems like an open-and-shut murder case . 
<s>  upon hearing of the death via a mysterious fax , dolores' estranged and bitter daughter , esquire magazine writer selena st . george , returns from new york back to her tiny island village childhood home . 
<s>  as the two clash horns , the story behind the mysterious death of dolores' abusive husband two decades ago , ruled an accident despite the protests of detective john mackey , is revealed . 
<s>  did dolores kill her husband ? 
<s>  and did she kill her employer ? 
<s>  dolores claiborne is certainly more of a character study than a suspense thriller . 
<s>  consequently , it is fortunate that their cast includes some of hollywood's finest character actors , such as bates , leigh and strathairn . 
<s>  kathy bates plays the film's title character , and gives a sensational lead performance . 
<s>  dolores claiborne is essentially a showcase for the talent of bates , as her character has a huge amount of screen time . 
<s>  she dominates the screen , producing a character that is compelling and arresting , as we watch the character go through two decades of history via flashbacks . 
<s>  kathy bates' performance is award-calibre stuff . 
<s>  the rest of the cast is also very good . 
<s>  jennifer jason leigh plays the perpetually sour , bitter helena st . george well , and christopher plummer seems to be enjoying himself as dolores' ever-present nemesis , the determined detective john mackey . 
<s>  david strathairn is particularly interesting and suitably smarmy and despicable as dolores' husband , joe st . george . 
<s>  judy parfitt is fine as dolores' tyrannic socialite employer , vera donovan--it would have been interesting to see , say , meg foster in this role . 
<s>  child actor ellen muth is also worth noting as the young selena during the flashback sequences ; she is very impressive . 
<s>  the direction of dolores claiborne by taylor hackford wildly varies throughout the film , ranging from some parts which are quite clever in their own right , to parts which are embarrassingly hokey . 
<s>  the segues between flashbacks and the present are very hit-and-miss in terms of effectiveness . 
<s>  the pacing of the film tends to be numbingly slow , which tends to undermine any suspense which might be built up . 
<s>  however , the cinematography by gabriel beristain is wonderful--i particularly like the chilling ice-blue hue permeating the present-day scenes , contrasting well with the many nova scotia ocean shots--and danny elfman provides a surprisingly understated score for the film . 
<s>  it would seem that the commercial potential of dolores claiborne is limited . 
<s>  none of the performers in the film could be classified as a big draw , and its pacing may be a turn-off to those expecting a gripping suspense film filled with twists and turns and car crashes and axe-wielding psychopaths . 
<s>  although being essentially the only film in its genre in release now , it may also be hurt by the negative perception of king works , even with the recent critical success of the shawshank redemption and the stand . 
<s>  dolores claiborne suffers from a very unsatisfying conclusion , and moves very slowly . 
<s>  however , the performances are uniformly excellent , particularly kathy bates , and the film has its moments . 
<s>  on my four-star scale , i give dolores claiborne three stars .
