<s>  written by john grisham and robert altman ( as al hayes ) 
<s>  directed by robert altman 
<s>  some time ago , a young director was given the opportunity to direct the screen version of a popular novel . 
<s>  the novel was a summer smash , topping best-seller lists across the country and already drawing speculation as to which popular actors of the day might play the leads . 
<s>  the only problem : the novel wasn't very good . 
<s>  it was far more pulp than pulitzer . 
<s>  but the director realized that , no matter how pedestrian the prose , this book really grabbed people - that the author , while not a great writer , was a fantastic storyteller . 
<s>  so he took on the project , convinced he could make something happen on screen . 
<s>  the director ? 
<s>  francis ford coppola . 
<s>  the book , of course , was mario puzo's the godfather . 
<s>  the rest , as they say in showbiz , was history . 
<s>  by bringing up the godfather , i don't mean to suggest that robert altman's the gingerbread man is destined for that level of greatness . 
<s>  but the parallel does suggest that it is possible to create great cinema from questionable source material . 
<s>  can you get any more questionable than john grisham ? 
<s>  depends on whom you ask . 
<s>  but there's no question that grisham's work grabs people . 
<s>  like puzo , grisham is a better storyteller than a writer - unlike fellow hack michael crichton , who is a good idea man but who can't tell a well-constructed story from a can of spam . 
<s>  so something in grisham's unpublished story of a cocky savannah lawyer who gets involved in a deadly family squabble drew the attention of robert altman , who at 73 years old remains one of america's greatest living filmmakers . 
<s>  the result is a gripping thriller that , while falling short of classic cinema , deserves its place in the altman canon . 
<s>  >from its opening shot to the closing credits , the gingerbread man is permeated with a sense of dread , with a fear of the natural destructive forces of the universe . 
<s>  this terrific sense of mood is a classic altman touch . 
<s>  witness said opening shot : we see an aerial view of coastal georgia with its writhing , undulating landscape while the soundtrack grumbles ominously in our ear . 
<s>  we roll over the hills into the town of savannah , then zoom in close on a red sports car speeding over a bridge while its driver chatters oblivious on his cell phone . 
<s>  right away we know that the driver of that car is in for a few surprises . 
<s>  pay attention , boys and girls - this shot was not conceived by john grisham , but by altman . 
<s>  this is what a great director can do for questionable source material . 
<s>  the sports car belongs to rick magruder ( kenneth branagh ) , the aforementioned hotshot attorney who specializes in police brutality cases . 
<s>  magruder has just won a high profile case and celebrates that night with a catered party at his office . 
<s>  outside after the party he meets one of the waitresses , mallory doss ( embeth davidzt ) , just as she realizes her car has been stolen . 
<s>  driven by southern chivalry , a driving rainstorm and his unspoken attraction to the fragile waitress , magruder offers her a ride home . 
<s>  there he learns more about mallory's life than he bargained for . 
<s>  her car was stolen by her schizophrenic father dixon ( robert duvall ) , a ted kyzynski-style whacko who has been stalking and terrorizing his own daughter . 
<s>  magruder , perhaps influenced by mallory's decision to strip off her wet clothes in front of him , is sympathetic to her plight , and offers to help her get her father committed - right after he sleeps with her , of course . 
<s>  this simple offer of help leads magruder down a dangerous path with a black end . 
<s>  he succeeds in having dixon incarcerated in a mental hospital , and for a moment all appears well . 
<s>  but then dixon's crack team of homeless commandos bust him out of the lockup - and suddenly magruder finds himself , mallory and his own children in danger . 
<s>  the cops won't lift a finger to help a liberal attorney . 
<s>  his only allies are his faithful assistant lois ( daryl hannah ) and his bumbling private-eye sidekick clyde ( robert downey jr ) . 
<s>  if this predicament wasn't bad enough , hurricane geraldo is bearing down on savannah and throwing the world into chaos . 
<s>  altman may provide the atmosphere , but branagh's performance holds the gingerbread man together . 
<s>  an accomplished actor when he isn't directing himself in vanity productions , branagh does a fine job of making rick a sympathetic hero while casting doubt upon his motives . 
<s>  is his offer of help to mallory an act of kindness , or of egotism ? 
<s>  magruder is so sure of his place in the world that he never considers that he has bitten off more than he can chew until he has to swallow it - and by then it's too late . 
<s>  as the plot unfolds , magruder learns that none of us are as secure as we think we are . 
<s>  and life is never so bad that it can't get worse . 
<s>  if you're familiar with altman's work , you'll recognize several of his signature techniques . 
<s>  characters are not introduced in establishing shots , but rather are allowed to wander in the background of scenes until their importance becomes apparent . 
<s>  crucial scenes are shot from the outside through windows , making the audience unwitting voyeurs of the action . 
<s>  dialog overlaps and the actors seem to slip naturally into an improvisational style . 
<s>  and of course there's my favorite altman technique - the obligatory nude actress shot . 
<s>  thanks to altman , here are some of the actresses i've had the pleasure of seeing naked : sally kellerman , julianne moore , madeline stowe , even frances mcdormand . 
<s>  and now i can add embeth davidtz , who looks quite healthy in the altogether . 
<s>  the naked actress shot has become as ubiquitous to the altman film as the director cameo was to the hitchcock film . 
<s>  is it old-school sexism , or a clever in-joke ? 
<s>  you be the judge . 
<s>  but back to the picture at hand . 
<s>  in the hands of a mere mortal , the gingerbread man would have been a routine thriller , no better or worse than the countless others we've all endured . 
<s>  in the hands of a master like altman , it becomes an exercise in existential doom , in its own way far more successful than scorsese's cape fear remake , which tried for the same result . 
<s>  what may prevent it from enduring with altman's greatest work is a weak third act - in fact , there really is no third act in grisham's story , so it appears that altman had to throw in the hurricane just to jazz things up . 
<s>  but there are true moments of riveting suspense , and great performances by branagh , davidzt and downey jr - more than enough to see you through . 
<s>  that polygram so hated this picture that they tried to steal final cut from altman , and then buried the marketing campaign when he won it back , should tell you how utterly clueless of quality most studios are . 
<s>  they probably wanted it to look more like a time to kill . 
<s>  and that , my friends , should make you very afraid . 
<s>  october sky is a rare oddity in cinema : a self-proclaimed " uplifting " film that is actually uplifting ! 
<s>  based on the autobiographical book by homer hickam , rocket boys , october sky tells the struggle of four boys reaching for their dream . 
<s>  it's 1957 , and for the boys of coalwood , west virginia , there's not much hope of a rosy future . 
<s>  coalwood is a coal mining town , and , except for the few lucky ones who manage to escape on a football scholarship , most of coalwood's boys are destined to work in the mine . 
<s>  but , in october 1957 , an event happens that sparks one boy to dream . 
<s>  the launch of the soviet satellite sputnik sets homer hickam ( jake gyllenhaal ) to dream a future of rocketry and space travel . 
<s>  of course , homer's parents ( chris cooper and natalie canderday ) aren't quite sure what to make of their son's unusual interests . 
<s>  homer gets his strongest encouragement from miss riley ( laura dern ) , a teacher in his school who also informs him about the scholarships offered to the winners of a national science fair . 
<s>  and so , with stars in his eyes , and thoughts of scholarships in his head , homer enlists the help of three other boys ( william lee scott , chad lindberg and chris owen ) and begins to build a rocket . 
<s>  but , do these four backwoods boys even have the slightest hope of escaping their destiny ? 
<s>  there is a lot that could have gone wrong with october sky . 
<s>  nearly every sequence flirts with becoming syrupy and cliched . 
<s>  however , miraculously , october sky avoids nearly all of these pitfalls , making the exact right moves at the exact right times . 
<s>  a film emerges which manages to be powerful and moving without slipping into the gauzy haze of nostalgia or sliding down the sugarry slope of sappiness . 
<s>  jake gyllenhaal is outstanding as the kid at the center of this film . 
<s>  >from the outset of the film , he is immediately likable , and never seems too corny or brainy as to alienate the audience . 
<s>  unfortunately , while october sky focuses on homer , the other three kids get the short end of the stick . 
<s>  they remain little more than placeholders reading " insert friend here " . 
<s>  of the adults in the film , chris cooper is the most fully realized character . 
<s>  the film never paints him as merely the villainous parent standing in the way of his child's dreams , but , instead , shows the multihued portrait of a man who wants the best for his family and town , but is too stubborn to realize what that is . 
<s>  director joe johnson deserves much credit for successfully navigating the many obstacles that october sky manages to dodge . 
<s>  however , there are still a few occasions when he allows things to proceed just a step too far . 
<s>  scenes which were natural and inspiring start to become contrived and artificial . 
<s>  however , these lapses are minimal , and johnson quickly steers the movie back on course . 
<s>  the problem with many so-called " uplifting " films is that they attempt to force their mediciney goodness down your throat . 
<s>  october sky never resorts to that level , and yet , manages to become a truly uplifting film purely on its own merits . 
<s>  this three hour movie opens up with a view of singer/guitar player/musician/composer frank zappa rehearsing with his fellow band members . 
<s>  all the rest displays a compilation of footage , mostly from the concert at the palladium in new york city , halloween 1979 . 
<s>  other footage shows backstage foolishness , and amazing clay animation by bruce bickford .

<s>  frank's guitar solos outdo any van halen or hendrix i've ever heard . 
<s>  bruce bickford's outlandish clay animation is that beyond belief with zooms , morphings , etc . and actually , it doesn't even look like clay , it looks like meat . 
<s>  while watching boiler room , i was constantly reminded of last year's masterpiece fight club . 
<s>  both films consist of a predominately male cast . 
<s>  both films follow young men as they illicitly fight the traditional system for their own desires . 
<s>  and both films are seen through the eyes of one narrator , who eventually realizes that these men have to be stopped . 
<s>  while boiler room writer/director ben younger does not get his point across as well as david fincher does for fight club , he does contribute another impressive work to a series of films aiming to represent the new generation . 
<s>  a generation which has seen the internet prosper and where everyone wants to be a millionaire . 
<s>  paying homage to oliver stone's 1987 classic wall street , younger is almost modernizing the tale by using younger , hipper actors to play the greedy villains as opposed to the older , more experienced types . 
<s>  as is true in real life , younger minds are becoming richer and richer from their knowledge of more standard technology . 
<s>  boiler room dismisses the notion of ingenuity and shows that greed and desire for power come in all ages . 
<s>  another similarity with fight club is that both films are not action flicks . 
<s>  some people are convinced that an all-male cast automatically means there must be gory violence , here is proof that this is not true . 
<s>  if you want to see an action movie starring ben affleck , go see reindeer games this weekend . 
<s>  if you want to see a smart , insightful film with excellent acting and a clever script , see boiler room . 
<s>  giovanni ribisi gives an outstanding performance as the film's narrator , seth . 
<s>  after dropping out of college and running a lucrative gambling center for college students in his apartment , seth is offered a high paying job by a wealthy man ( nicky katt ) . 
<s>  he agrees to take the job ( in which you are guaranteed to become a millionaire within three years ) of selling stock to well-off americans from the mid-west over the telephone and begins to fit in quite well with his co-workers . 
<s>  learning tricky techniques to deceive innocent people into buying shares of a good in production , seth figures this is too good to be true . 
<s>  after stumbling into a room at the wrong time , he knows there is something no good about this company . 
<s>  at this point , seth is left with the ultimate choice ; continue with the american dream and make millions or tell the authorities that something fishy is going on . 
<s>  ribisi is believable as seth especially when he shares scenes with ron rifkin , playing seth's dad . 
<s>  the two have perfect chemistry as a troubled father and son trying to impress each other and simultaneously impress themselves . 
<s>  the transitions from anger to sympathy that these scenes contain are the standout segments of the entire film . 
<s>  the supporting cast of greedy co-workers is also flawless . 
<s>  ben affleck shines in a short but sweet performance as a recruiter for the company , nicky katt is fabulous as the ostensibly friendly boss who eventually becomes extremely jealous of seth , and vin diesel gives his best performance of his career as the foil character of nicky katt . 
<s>  the energy of the cast as a whole makes boiler room well paced and never boring . 
<s>  the only major error in the film is that nothing major happens . 
<s>  there is no big plot twist or climatic point to make the film more memorable . 
<s>  due to the lack of a major event , boiler room never finds a suitable genre to fit into . 
<s>  the movie is not intense enough to be a thriller , the romantic segments involving seth and abby ( nia long ) are not properly finalized , and the dialogue isn't funny enough to make it a comedy . 
<s>  in having trouble to characterize the movie as a whole , boiler room is slightly confused at times . 
<s>  it doesn't seem to know which category to fit itself into . 
<s>  one satisfying concluding scene could have changed the whole film for the better . 
<s>  otherwise , the movie is fun to watch thanks to its lively cast of young actors .

<s>  so maximum risk is a little different from most other action films . 
<s>  while watching it , i was surprised , and a little disappointed , in the relative lack of pyrotechnics . 
<s>  but watching some of these other action films is sort of like experiencing a sugar rush ; after the initial excitement , there's not much left . 
<s>  although it's short on spectacle , lam's film leaves a better and more lasting impression , i think . 
<s>  i'm more impressed by it now than i was while watching it , and to me , that's a good sign . 
<s>  go see maximum risk , but don't expect a typical hollywood action movie ; expect a sort of funky hong kong-hollywood action movie .

<s>  with each new feature , disney animation gets even better . 
<s>  not necessarily by leaps and bounds , but since they put out a new film each year , a steady rate of improvement is apparent , and this definitely shows in tarzan . 
<s>  there are a couple of scenes where the animation achieves a near 3-d effect , and a number of scenes which feature tarzan moving through the trees are absolutely dizzying . 
<s>  the way he slides down tree limbs and trunks is very reminiscent of skateboarding and rollerblading maneuvers , and had me thinking this isn't just tarzan , it's " extreme tarzan . " 
<s>  however , tarzan does not seem to have what i call its " chandelier scene , " which is the one scene to which the animators have chosen to devote an inordinate amount of effort , utilizing a computer-assisted process that makes the animation absolutely breathtaking . 
<s>  lasting but a few seconds at most , it's been the signature of nearly every disney animated feature since beauty and the beast , in which the castle ballroom chandelier was rendered in stunning detail . 
<s>  as usual , the voice talent is up to snuff , convincingly make you believe in the convictions of animated characters . 
<s>  the one poor choice in casting , however , was rosie o'donnell . 
<s>  going into the film , i didn't know she was even a part of it , but when terk started talking , i recognized her voice immediately . 
<s>  her performance was fine , but through the rest of the film i kept thinking , " that's no boy ape , that rosie o'donnell . " 
<s>  distracting to say the least . 
<s>  i'll admit i've never read the edgar rice burroughs story " tarzan of the apes , " so i couldn't tell you how true this film stays to the book . 
<s>  but unless you're a purist , you should have few objections to this film . 
<s>  with solid performances , action , adventure , a bit of romance , and great music and animation , tarzan should appeal to the kids and to the kid in all of us . 
<s>  note : when i wrote my review of mulan a year ago , i went off on the promotional and merchandising tie-ins prevalent with the release of a disney animated feature . 
<s>  this time , i'll just say that i went to mcdonald's yesterday to treat myself to a mcflurry , and tarzan was on the cup . 
<s>  'nuff said . 
<s>  you've got mail is a timely romance for this impersonal , computer-driven decade . 
<s>  two people who've never met confide in each other via e-mail without revealing their true identities . 
<s>  nora ephron's contemporary update of the shop around the corner retains the basic plot : two people who despise each other unwittingly become enamored with each other through their anonymous correspondence . 
<s>  ephron , who co-wrote the film with her sister , delia , as well as directed it , knew what she was doing by reteaming tom hanks and meg ryan as the at-odds couple . 
<s>  ryan is kathleen kelly , owner of a small children's bookstore , while hanks is joe fox , who heads up a chain of mega bookstores ( think barnes & noble ) . 
<s>  their charm and chemistry are the glue that binds this film , even through some of the script's rough spots . 
<s>  for the ephrons invested so much effort in their protagonists that they give short shrift to the talented supporting cast , including parker posey , greg kinnear , jean stapleton and steve zahn . 
<s>  yet no one is really going to complain because the ephrons know their audience - and what the paying public wants is hanks and ryan . 
<s>  and the two are kept busy . 
<s>  one , the other or both are in nearly every scene . 
<s>  hanks has his decent guy routine down pat , yet each time he does it , it seems effortless , spontaneous and fresh . 
<s>  ryan smoothly moves between spunky and vulnerable , with a sexy touch of winsomeness added to the brew . 
<s>  their scenes together sparkle , even though they lack the nostalgic romanticism of sleepless in seattle . 
<s>  and the shadow of that earlier hit hangs over you've got mail like dried-up mistletoe . 
<s>  the sparks created by the earlier movie are , by necessity , not evident here . 
<s>  true , these are two people seeking true love , but you've got mail is more comic and less poignant than its predecessor . 
<s>  the ephrons' script is witty and sharp . 
<s>  however , as a director nora ephron is a bit uneven . 
<s>  some scenes drag , while others , especially when hanks and ryan are revealing their souls via e-mail , are crisp and tidy . 
<s>  also , the script gets sloppy toward the end with characters merely disappearing from the story . 
<s>  a nice , romantic soundtrack adds to this date-night special . 
<s>  overall , you've got mail is a lush and cute outing , taking advantage of the star appeal of its two leads . 
<s>  it's a nice holiday movie , one for holding hands and snuggling . 
<s>  committed to lifelong learning through effective communication 
<s>  according to hollywood movies made in last few decades , life in small town is one of the worst things that could happen to a human being . 
<s>  even worse fate awaits those who were unfortunate to grow up in those dark , god-forsaken places and later forced to live forever traumatised by the experience . 
<s>  on the other hand , it seems that something more than atlantic ocean divides europe from america , because one of the most popular and beloved european films takes exactly the opposite view . 
<s>  this film is amarcord , 1974 comedy by famous italian director federico fellini , which later gave inspiration to numerous imitations and homages , and even led few american screen artists to adopt its heretical views about benefits of small town life . 
<s>  the film is based on the screenplay by fellini and tonino guerra and it lacks the plot in usual sense . 
<s>  instead we follow one year in 1930s italian summer resort town of rimini through the series of short vignettes that depict various local events and customs , as well as series of local , often very colourful characters . 
<s>  although many of those characters occasionally take the role of narrator , movie concentrates on its nominal protagonist , 14-year old boy titta ( played by bruno zanin ) and chronicles his sexual frustrations , obsession with local beauty queen named gradisca ( played by magali noel ) , problems in his lovingly dysfunctional family , as well as troubles his father ( played by armando brancia ) have with mussolini's fascist regime . 
<s>  amarcord was often noted as the ultimate nostalgia film , and it probably explains why it is very popular , even among those people who actually don't like federico fellini's work very much . 
<s>  every member of its potential audience would find part of himself or herself in this film , because fellini in this film clearly illustrates natural human desire to paint past in the best way possible . 
<s>  distortion between actual past and its subjective interpretation could be found even in the title of the film - word " amarcord " is nothing more than badly pronounced phrase " i remember " in local italian dialect . 
<s>  in the same way the word is distorted , so is the past in memories of those who remember it . 
<s>  after the premiere , fellini rejected any claims about autobiographical character of this film , but it doesn't matter whether rimini of amarcord actually resembles rimini of fellini's childhood or not ; any place and any time could resemble characters and situations of this film . 
<s>  fellini's views on nostalgia are clearly illustrated with a way he mixes reality and fantasy in this film . 
<s>  even the most naturalistic scenes are laced with dark humour and grotesque images . 
<s>  characters look like caricatures , actors playing them often deliberately overact , and women , especially those who fuel titta's sexual fantasies , often have certain body parts with gargantuan proportions . 
<s>  every now and then , scenes that depict 1930s reality gradually slide into fantasies of movie's characters and rimini becomes almost indistinguishable from the magical place in characters' visions . 
<s>  because of that , almost everything in this film looks different , and in most cases better , than it would have looked in the real life . 
<s>  even the fascism gets fellinian make-over - fellini views mussolini's totalitarian regime as nothing more than visual spectacle ( explaining why similar regimes enjoyed such popular support throughout history ) and opportunity for comedy . 
<s>  when fascists finally show their true colours and begin torturing their opponents , even this becomes opportunity for scenes of macabre humour . 
<s>  unlike many of his italian colleagues in 1970s , who had used 1930s period setting to explicitly condemn fascism and serve fashionable political agenda , fellini doesn't care that much about politics . 
<s>  lack of self-righteous moral perspective is compensated with fellini's humanistic approach to his characters . 
<s>  each of them , regardless of age , gender , social class or physical appearance , is given opportunity to express his or her views , dreams and fears . 
<s>  fellini treats all those characters with warmth and affection , even when he paints them as grotesque caricatures of real people . 
<s>  because of this warmth and democratic spirit , amarcord could be viewed as one of the most humane films of 20th century , and it keeps its general feel good atmosphere despite depicting having many uncomfortable , melancholic and even tragic moments . 
<s>  fellini couldn't produce such effects without using his own directorial talent that gave a very personal touch to this movie . 
<s>  vignettes aren't memorable because of the characters only ; fellini uses camera , painting film in bright colours , especially in the scenes that depict character's fantasies . 
<s>  fellini also knows how to use locations , whether such location happens to be luxurious hotel , bright-coloured beach or rural countryside . 
<s>  even the down-to-earth streets of rimini , where everyone knows everyone , gets magical dimension during the snowfall . 
<s>  on the other hand , lack of credible special effects somewhat diminished the same effect during the ocean liner scene . 
<s>  this atmosphere is also provided by incredible talent of composer and fellini's long-time associate nino rota . 
<s>  his amarcord theme is probably one of the most recognisable , most popular and most relaxing and uplifting pieces of film music ever produced . 
<s>  that music alone should be the reason to view amarcord as one of the indisputable classics of seventh art . 
<s>  written by mark rosenthal and lawrence konner 
<s>  starring charlize theron , bill paxton , david paymer 
<s>  as reviewed by james brundage 
<s>  i'm beginning to get fed up . 
<s>  over my four years as a critic , the thing which has kept me going is the moderate balance of films . 
<s>  the good balances the bad . 
<s>  i try to see both in equal proportions . 
<s>  but disney's mighty joe young remake marks the fourth week in which i haven't seen a truly terrible movie . 
<s>  it's a backwards machismo , i suppose , the urge to see the things which you so loathe ; but i need to see a bad film every once in a while . 
<s>  and , you know what , mighty joe young doesn't qualify . 
<s>  far from being bad , mighty joe young is actually a family fun movie . 
<s>  it's enjoyable , appropriate , cute , cuddly , and all of those other things that i've been seeing in every movie since a bug's life . 
<s>  mighty joe young tracks a 2 , 000 pound gorilla in the wilds of africa that is taken to a reserve in . . . 
<s>  california ? 
<s>   . . . 
<s>  for safe-keeping . 
<s>  okay . 
<s>  a little unrealistic , but who ever said a kid's movie had to have the slightest hint of realism . 
<s>  the first half of the movie is a gorillas in the mist-esque hatred of poachers woman-of-the-wild motif . 
<s>  the second half is a straight up parody of king kong , awestruck onlookers and all . 
<s>  mark one down . 
<s>  i'm feeling relaxed . 
<s>  it is , as a point of fact , an extremely un-creative movie . 
<s>  but , as a vetern , i can say quite honestly that creativity doesn't count for as much as it should . 
<s>  so that saves mighty joe from my wrath , although my colleagues and cohorts and surely bashing this film at this very moment . 
<s>  this is not the film to take a girl on a date to . 
<s>  it's not the film for you . 
<s>  it's the film for you and your family . 
<s>  when you're right alongside your kid , all of the normal rights and wrongs slip away . 
<s>  the same thing happens when you watch a horror movie or an action flick . 
<s>  it becomes fun . 
<s>  all you have to do to enjoy mighty joe young is shut up and watch . 
<s>  notting hill's trailer is awful : a laughless , schmaltzy montage . 
<s>  the movie was desperately marketed to the anti-phantom menace crowd , the same lovelorn females who ignored the love letter . 
<s>  and it apparently worked . 
<s>  perhaps the presence of julia roberts-whose allure beyond those perfect teeth still escapes me-had a lot to do with notting hill's opening weekend success , but the film's staying power is based on word of mouth . 
<s>  allow me to spread some more good buzz for notting hill . 
<s>  grant stars as william thacker , a travel-bookstore owner who works and resides in a tiny english district called notting hill . 
<s>  into his shop one day wanders famous actress anna scott ( roberts ) . 
<s>  a common thief , some spilled orange juice , and some stilted conversation leads to their first , highly impetuous ( or is that improbable ? ) , kiss . 
<s>  days later , william sneaks into her hotel suite under the guise of a magazine journalist , and so begins a passionate , albeit surreptitious , affair . 
<s>   ( aside : notting hill's portrayal of press junkets is deadly accurate . ) 
<s>  only anna's celebrity-or william's lack thereof-threatens to drive a wedge between them . 
<s>  richard curtis has tapped into fantasy we all have considered , and for at least its first half-hour the picture's " beauty and the beast " -like scenario is ( romantic ) escapism of the highest order . 
<s>  as with groundhog day or pleasantville , while watching the high-concept comedy notting hill one constantly imagines him/herself in the lead ; it's william's ordinaryness that entices the spoiled and bored anna . 
<s>  curtis ( who previously penned four weddings and a funeral ) is also smart enough to know that the unlikely couple's situation is not enough to fuel two hours' worth of entertainment , so some of notting hill's finest moments revolve around william's eccentric friends and family . 
<s>  by now , dear reader , you've probably heard a lot about rhys ifans' performance as william's imbecilic welsh flatmate . 
<s>  yes , he's a crowd pleaser , a walking sight gag , but his character is not nearly as involving as the wheelchair-bound ( and appropriately named ) bella ( mckee , the anguished waitress of naked ) or max ( tom mcinnerny ) , her lousy chef of a husband . 
<s>  in the movie's best sequence , william , anna , and company sit around bloated from max's latest concoction and hold a contest : the last brownie on the table goes to the diner with the saddest life . 
<s>  the scene ends only as a british writer would end it . 
<s>  if anything , fantastic bits like these dull the main plot's dramatic impact . 
<s>  roberts and grant , especially , are appealing , but their relationship is convolutedly interrupted too many times ( four weddings' suffered similar flaws ) , and william and anna ultimately only have one thing in common : they're lonely . 
<s>   ( worth noting in roberts' and grant's favour : the ubiquitous " i'm just a girl , standing across from a boy , asking him to love her " episode is not nearly so syrupy as it appears in clips , and it features some of the best emoting either actor has ever done . ) 
<s>  notting hill is nonetheless enjoyable ; on the visual side of things , i especially appreciated michell's playful changing-of-the-seasons number . 
<s>  if only ( and this is a surprisinly minor gripe ) he had lopped off the egregious epilogue ; for a story that thrives on what we bring to it , the filmmakers work too hard to tidy things up , leaving our imaginations in the lurch .

<s>  star trek : first contact a film review by michael dequina copyright 1996 michael dequina 
<s>  star trek : first contact ( pg-13 ) anyone familiar with the series of star trek movies knows of the " even-odd pattern " --the even-numbered installments of the series are good while the odd-numbered ones are , well , not-so-good . 
<s>  the pattern continues with the new star trek : first contact , an energetic sci-fi adventure that ( coincidentally ? ) is the eighth entry in the hugely popular series . 
<s>  in this first trek feature to feature only cast members from the late star trek : the next generation television series , captain jean-luc picard ( patrick stewart ) and the rest of the 24th-century crew of the starship enterprise--commander will riker ( jonathan frakes , who also directed ) , android lt . cmdr . 
<s>  data ( brent spiner ) , lt . cmdr . 
<s>  geordi laforge ( levar burton ) , lt . cmdr . 
<s>  worf ( michael dorn ) , dr . beverly crusher ( gates mcfadden ) , and counselor deanna troi ( marina sirtis ) --travel back to 21st-century earth while doing battle with the borg , a race of cybernetic beings that share a collective mind with the borg queen ( alice krige ) . 
<s>  the borg intend to alter history and assimilate all of humankind into their race--starting with the earth-orbiting crew of the enterprise and a 21st century stowaway ( alfre woodard ) . 
<s>  this is an interesting plotline that is sure to mesmerize trekkers everywhere and engage everyone else , but , unfortunately , it only makes up the star trek half of the script by brannon braga and ronald d . moore . 
<s>  the other half of the title--first contact--refers to a subplot that takes place on 21st-century earth , where riker , troi , and laforge meet legendary scientist zephram cochran ( james cromwell ) , who is about to embark on the first warp speed flight in human history , which directly leads to the first contact with extraterrestrials . 
<s>  while this story does tie into the main plot and pays off interestingly in the end , it is nowhere near as involving or exciting as the borg battles on the enterprise . 
<s>  not helping matters is the tiresome cochran character , an eccentric whose drunken schtick starts out funny but becomes too one-note after a while . 
<s>  in the end , though , the first contact subplot doesn't detract from the enjoyment of the film as a whole . 
<s>  the story is typical sci-fi fantasy , but the conviction of the cast--most notably the always-phenomenal stewart--makes you believe and care . 
<s>  frakes , making his feature directorial debut , keeps the action swiftly rolling along and delivers the action goods , even upping the violence a notch ( this is the first trek film to bear a pg-13 rating ) to greater effect . 
<s>  st : fc has a bigger budget than the last trek outing , the middling star trek generations , and it definitely shows on screen--the production design and especially visual and makeup effects are outstanding ( in particular those involving the borg queen ) . 
<s>  braga and moore's mostly sharp script will please both trek devotees and the rest ; the references to the borg storyline in the tv series , the continuity with the previous film ( e . g . 
<s>  the ongoing saga of data's emotion chip ) , and a fleeting star trek : voyager crossover will make trekkers squeal with delight , but such points are made easily accessible to those less familiar to the trek mythos . 
<s>  paramount was reportedly worried about the staying power of its trek franchise with the next generation cast now carrying the helm . 
<s>  based on the entertaining success that is star trek : first contact , i'd say the studio has nothing to worry about ( at least not until this cast retires and the crew of the wan star trek : deep space nine takes over . . . ) . 
<s>  slavery is bad . 
<s>  after hundreds of years , we've finally figured that one out . 
<s>  this almost universal belief is the both the strength and weakness of director steven spielberg's latest " serious " film . 
<s>  during the late 1830s , a portuguese slave ship carries a cargo of black men and women kidnapped from their home on africa's west coast to cuba to be sold into slavery . 
<s>  fifty-three of them are stuffed into the " la amistad " ( from a spanish word for " friendship " ) by their new spanish owners . 
<s>  freeing himself from his chains , senge pieh ( djimon hounsou ) , renamed cinque by his masters , leads a bloody revolt . 
<s>  after killing most of the crew , the africans force the remaining sailors to return them to their home - or so they think . 
<s>  instead the ship heads up the coast to the united states . 
<s>  the amistad is boarded by an american naval ship and the revolutionaries are put on trial in connecticut for murder and piracy . 
<s>  the legal question becomes are they free men fighting justly for their freedom or are they property . 
<s>  if they are property , who do they belong to ? 
<s>  their masters ? 
<s>  the spanish government ? 
<s>  salvage rights of the officers who captured the ship ? 
<s>  the us government ? 
<s>  the defendants are pawns in several games . 
<s>  abolitionists theodore joadson ( morgan freeman ) and lewis tappan ( stellan skarsgard ) want to free them , but tappan sees them primarily as a means to further the cause . 
<s>  their lawyer roger baldwin ( matthew mcconaughey ) views the case as a simple one of property rights and a chance to make his share of legal fees . 
<s>  south carolina senator john c . calhoun ( arliss howard ) pursues the case for the political advancement of the southern states . 
<s>  president martin van buren ( nigel hawthorne ) is willing to force the result towards his own political ends . 
<s>  when the verdict looks to free the africans , van buren replaces the judge with one more sympathetic to his wishes . 
<s>  even that doesn't work and the new judge frees the kidnap victims . 
<s>  at the urging of calhoun , the president then appeals the case to the supreme court , populated by a majority of slave-owners . 
<s>  this little-known ( try finding it in any history text book ) incident from america's past would have gone down a darker path were it not for former president john quincy adams ( anthony hopkins ) who is persuaded to argue the case before the supreme court . 
<s>  the slavery issue is easy pickin's for spielberg . 
<s>  much like his " shindler's list " ( which followed " jurassic park " as this follows " lost world " ) , the moral sides are not difficult ones to choose . 
<s>  nazis and slave traders : both treat groups of others as less than human . 
<s>  it's not hard to see who the bad guys are . 
<s>  without that question to ponder , the director's job is more difficult . 
<s>  he has to make the story interesting . 
<s>  spielberg succeeds for the most part . 
<s>  the visual aspect of the film is beyond reproach . 
<s>  where the movie falls down is a bit more subtle . 
<s>  there are very few _people_ in the tale . 
<s>  in fact , cinque is the only character who is fleshed out . 
<s>  tappan and joadson are " abolitionists " : symbols but not humans . 
<s>  van buren is a weak politician but nothing else . 
<s>  the rest of the " slaves " barely exist other than dressing for the set . 
<s>  like many other films about people of color , almost all the major players are white . 
<s>  the film's salvation lies in the acting strength of everyone involved and the powerful presence of hounsou . 
<s>  the former model's first major role is a winner . 
<s>  without speaking more than five words of english , he conveys more emotion than most actors with a thousand lines of dialog . 
<s>  the other stand-out is hopkins who seems to be making a career out of portraying american presidents ( he also played the title role in " nixon " ) . 
<s>  the impassioned speech by the doddering old man who phases in and out of rationality is among the best court-room drama ever on the screen . 
<s>  there are some other great moments . 
<s>  especially impressive are the african's struggle to understand what is going on in the strange land . 
<s>  their interpretation of the bible based solely on the pictures and their own experiences is poignant . 
<s>  as grand as the epic is , it would have more impact had it focused more on the experience from the point of view of the africans . 
<s>  more humanity in the fight for humanity would have made it a four-star film . 
<s>   ( michael redman has written this column for a real long time and is just now getting around to seeing some 1998 films . ) 
<s>  reflecting on " bedazzled , " a lively comedy about the devil who seeks to possess the soul of a pathetic loser , one sinful thought remains in my mind . 
<s>  if hell means having to spend an eternity with elizabeth hurley ( who portrays the fiery demon ) , then use that pitchfork and point me the way . 
<s>  with her pouty lips , irresistible british accent , and wild display of haute couture , hurley crackles with naughtiness and fills your mind with temptation . 
<s>  it's practically impossible to turn this beelzu-babe down . 
<s>  her next target is elliot ( brendan fraser ) , a tech support geek who is clumsy , awkward , and just too eager to please . 
<s>  to aptly picture him , you would have to remember a saturday night live skit featuring " steve the copy guy " who effortlessly irritated his co-workers with his unpolished social skills . 
<s>  eugene , thus , is loathed and feared by his co-workers , who do their best to stay out of his way . 
<s>  yet , beyond his annoying mannerisms , he's a lovable oaf . 
<s>  he wishes that he could get closer to allison ( frances o'connor ) , a co-worker with whom he is infatuated but who has never taken notice of him . 
<s>  however , the odds of him getting together with her are about the same as a snowball's chance in hell . 
<s>   " dear god , " he prays . 
<s>   " i would give anything to have that girl in my life . " 
<s>  guess who then shows up ? 
<s>  she makes an offer that is too hard to refuse . 
<s>   " seven utterly fabulous wishes for one piddling little soul . " 
<s>  there's even an escape clause . 
<s>  if elliot's wish doesn't go exactly the way he likes , he need only 'beep' her ( one guess as to what the three-digit number is ) and he gets to start over . 
<s>  the remainder of the film consists of elliot's various fantasies that incorporate his personal desire to have enormous amounts of wealth , power , fame and allison's love . 
<s>  but when he makes sweeping statements such as " i want to be very , very powerful and very , very rich and married to allison " , he'll soon learn that the devil is in the details . 
<s>  for example , ( and we've seen this several times in the trailers ) , he is granted his wish , but finds out that he's a columbian drug lord and that allison , while married to him , has her eyes on someone else . 
<s>  apparently , the devil is just as eager to skew his fantasies as she is to possess his soul . 
<s>  his other wishes also end up with some strange but funny twist that short-circuits his new life . 
<s>  soon , elliot wishes that he had never made that deal . 
<s>  given the mischievous nature of the devil , " bedazzled " has many amusing moments . 
<s>  a lot of the credit goes to fraser who turns in a great comic performance . 
<s>  he ably assumes various personas . 
<s>  his funniest segment is when he wishes that he could be the most sensitive man in the world . 
<s>  allison becomes so frustrated with him that she practically urges him to take advantage of her . 
<s>  hurley also heightens the humor quotient , especially in the transitional scenes when fraser waits to start his next wish after bailing out of the previous one . 
<s>  it's clear that she's having a good time with it all . 
<s>  yet , while the filmmakers work hard at creating funny scenes , they conspicuously avoid developing the allegorical underpinnings between good and evil that could have added more heft to this story . 
<s>  but that would be playing with fire . 
<s>  what they've got works , so you can easily accept it for the pleasant little comedy that it is . 
<s>  the muppet movie is the first , and the best movie among the ever-growing list of muppet movies . 
<s>  the muppet movie tells the story of how our hero , kermit the frog , came to be a star . 
<s>  a delightful movie for all ages , the muppet movie is * bursting * with cameo appearances by countless hollywood stars of the 80's and today . 
<s>  the muppet movie begins in a movie theater , where all of the muppet stars are anxiously awaiting the first showing . 
<s>  once everyone is settled down , the movie inside of the movie begins . 
<s>  it starts out with kermit in a swamp , playing his banjo and singing ( this shot required jim henson to spend hours underwater ) . 
<s>  kermit is discovered by bernie , a big-time hollywood agent who happens upon kermit by accident . 
<s>  bernie believes that kermit holds much potential to become a big star in hollywood . 
<s>  kermit ponders the idea of becoming a big movie star , where he could " make millions of people happy " . 
<s>  kermit decides to leave his swamp and make the trip out to hollywood . 
<s>  along the way , kermit befriends his now famous muppet companions , beginning with fozzie bear , who had been spending his days doing stand-up comedy at the el sleezo cafe , owned by james coburn . 
<s>  the two decide to team-up and continue on their way to hollywood . 
<s>  but , doc hopper ( charles durning ) , the owner of a chain of french fried frog leg restaurants has a different idea . 
<s>  he wants kermit to be his spokesman , but kermit is humiliated at the idea and spends the movie avoiding him and his assistants . 
<s>  the trip continues , with kermit and fozzie meeting miss piggy , rowlf , gonzo , the electric mayhem band , and more muppets who all share the same wish : to make it to hollywood . 
<s>  oh , and even more celebrities continue to appear . 
<s>  kermit and miss piggy continue to get to know each other a little better , including a rather funny scene at a restaurant with steve martin as the waiter . 
<s>  eventually , kermit and the group make it to hollywood . 
<s>  that is , after kermit is finally able to elude doc hopper and proclaim his freedom .

<s>  all great things come to an end , and the dot-com era embodies that perfectly . 
<s>  beneath a mound of bankruptcy paperwork lies the remains of a former dot-com darling , the company kozmo . com , 
<s>  an online convenience store stocked with ice cream , porn videos , and other basic necessities of a urban dweller , all hand-delivered by couriers within an hour . 
<s>  designed in 1997 by two college roommates -- joseph parks , a 27 year old goldman sachs banker , and yong kang - kozmo flamed out in three short years , raising more than $280 million in venture capital funding and from partnerships with such bigwigs as starbucks and amazon . com . 
<s>  by december 1999 , the company boasted 4 , 000 employees in 11 cities , its barking ceo park attracting all kinds of media attention . 
<s>  the company was set for an ipo in may 2000 . . . 
<s>  until april 14 , 2000 , the day the stock market took its first big dive , ending the internet era . 
<s>  by april 13 , 2001 , kozmo was out of money and ceased operations . 
<s>  unlike the earlier , similar documentary startup . com , which chronicled the rise and fall of another dot-com , govworks , e-dreams focuses both on its original founders , especially park , and on the common folks that ran the day-to-day operations . 
<s>  the contrast is amazing , showing how a cult persona can convince anyone that any idea is the next big thing . 
<s>  the film's director , wonsuk chin ( too tired to die ) , expertly juxtaposes upper management company meetings with on-the-spot interviews with the bike messengers , general managers , and floor staff that kept kozmo humming . 
<s>  the film's images give a backbone to the company and provide an emotional edge to its ultimate demise . 
<s>  the most satisfying part of the film comes in understanding , to a degree , the expectations of numerous ceos commanding these titanic-type businesses . 
<s>  in the film's final interviews with park , we learn what happens when the money dries up and backers don't return phone calls . 
<s>  in the end , the name of the game was profit , and if you couldn't make money , even the dreamers got the axe .

<s>  since their film debut in 1984 with the tightly wrought texas thriller " blood simple , " joel and ethan coen have been one of the most eclectic , original , and downright fascinating creative teams in modern hollywood . 
<s>  their films are highly stylized , deeply embedded in a particular time and place , and their characters are more often than not everyday people who get caught up in highly unusual circumstances . 
<s>  in " the big lebowski , " their first cinematic offering since the multiple academy award-winning " fargo , " the action takes place in los angeles during the gulf war , and the hero of the story is jeff lebowski , aka the dude . 
<s>  the dude is played by jeff bridges -- one of hollywood's most underrated actors -- in the best stoned performance since sean penn stumbled through the halls of ridgemont high . 
<s>  the dude is a simple man who has never quite made it out of the sixties . 
<s>  he has shaggy , shoulder-length hair , a grizzled goatee badly in need of a trim , and he wears mostly stained tee-shirts , long shorts , and gellies without socks . 
<s>  he smokes a lot of pot , drinks a lot of white russians , and is more than content to spend the majority of his time bowling with his two buddies , a slightly psychotic vietnam vet named walter sobchak ( john goodman ) and donny ( steve buscemi ) , one of those guys who always wants to be part of the conversation , but never quite makes it in . 
<s>  one day , the dude is confused with another jeff lebowski ( david huddleston ) , this one being a millionaire philanthropist whose trophy wife , bunny ( tara reid ) , owes a lot of people a lot of money . 
<s>  the main plot and all its accompanying side-plots and coenesque diatribes are far too complicated to get into here . 
<s>  suffice to say that the dude becomes deeply involved with the big lebowski when bunny is kidnaped and the dude is asked to be a courier for the ransom money . 
<s>  by the time all is said and done , walter has become deeply involved , as has the big lebowski's daughter , maude ( julianne moore ) , a feminist performance artist , a pornographer named jackie treehorn ( ben gazzara ) , and a group of german nihilists led by peter stormare , who was so great as the silent but deadly kidnaper in " fargo . " 
<s>   " the big lebowski " plays like an amalgam of all the coen brothers' earlier efforts . 
<s>  it shares their previous films' strong sense of time and place , as well as their send-ups of movie genres and political and cultural ideologies . 
<s>   " lebowski " has the same kind of crazed caricatures that made " raising arizona " such a hoot ; it has surrealistic dream sequences ( one of which involves a busby berkley-like dance number ) that characterized the ending of " barton fink " ; and it has the same kind of cartoonish look and feel that pervaded " the hudsucker proxy . " 
<s>  the film was shot by veteran cinematographer roger deakins , who has worked with the coens on three other films , " barton fink , " " the hudsucker proxy , " and " fargo . " 
<s>  deakins always gives the coens' films a distinctive visual style , and here he does a brilliant job of capturing the bright colors of seedy los angeles in the early nineties , whether that by the obnoxious blue bowling suit worn by the dude's main competitor jesus quintana ( john turturro ) , or the strikingly manic dream sequences , one of which involves the dizzy spectacle of watching a strike from a bowling ball's point of view . 
<s>  if " fargo " was the coen brothers' most restrained effort in years , " the big lebowski " marks their return to over-the-edge filmmaking . 
<s>  it is overflowing with style and attitude , which helps make up for the scattered plot fragments that never quite come together in the end . 
<s>  the coens fill the screen with lighting , set design , music , and hilarious performances from all the leads , especially bridges and the always reliable john goodman , who shows real comic timing in his untimely 'nam-inspired outbursts and his intense dedication to his adopted judaism . 
<s>  with joel directing , ethan producing , and both writing , the coen brothers seem limitless in their capacity to turn our world inside out . 
<s>  their talent lies not in their ability to reflect the norms of reality , but in their potential to dig out the darkest corners of life and bring them to light . 
<s>  the coens rejoice in the oddballs of the world , and they put them center-stage to show that it's not just guys like the dude who are nuts , but the entire planet .

<s>  1992's alien3 marked not only the death ( by suicide ) of its popular protagonist , ellen ripley ( sigourney weaver ) , but , in many ways , the alien franchise itself--box office receipts were anemic , thanks to poor audience word of mouth ; and the critics who rallied around the first two installments , 1979's alien and 1986's aliens , savaged david fincher's slog of a sendoff ( myself included ) . 
<s>  hence , weaver , director jean-pierre jeunet , and the others behind alien resurrection faced a two-fold challenge--not only somehow resurrect ripley , but also rescue this once-profitable series from the scrap heap . 
<s>  despite the odds , they have succeeded , even if the entertaining new installment does not measure up to the excellent first two . 
<s>  writer joss whedon devises a quick , easy , and painless answer to the dead ripley problem--clone her , which is what shady military scientists do using some blood left behind on fiorina 161 , the prison planet of the third film . 
<s>  that done , the _real_ challenge presents itself--what do with her . 
<s>  alien introduced ripley as smart and resourceful ; aliens simultaneously toughened her up and made her more vulnerable , exploring her maternal side ; alien3 saw her undergoing the seven stages of death . 
<s>  what could be next ? 
<s>  whedon comes up with a clever spin : since the original ripley died while impregnated with an alien queen , the blood used for the clone is also " infected " with alien dna . 
<s>  so the new ripley is , indeed , new--a human/alien hybrid blessed with heightened instincts and strength , a psychic bond with the deadly species , and a more predatory attitude . 
<s>  unfortunately , that is where alien resurrection's clever streak in writing stops . 
<s>  the alien series is known for having stronger stories than most creature features . 
<s>  but the story in resurrection is more of an afterthought . 
<s>  the movie begins with a plot involving some military types attempting to train aliens to do their bidding , but once the creatures break free , it is once again ripley and a ragtag crew ( this time a bunch of interstellar smugglers , including tough waif call , played by a game winona ryder ) trying to exterminate them . 
<s>  and the alien ripley scenario is ultimately not exploited to its full potential ; i would have liked deeper exploration into the quandary of becoming one of the species she has spent her entire life trying to destroy . 
<s>  while the settling into tried-and-true formula is a little disconcerting , the formula is tried-and-true for a reason , and jeunet tackles the proceedings with giddy abandon . 
<s>  the alien , after all these years , is still terrifying , and a new breed that is introduced is no less so . 
<s>  the violence is appropriately grisly and extreme , and the action set pieces are suspenseful and exciting , most notably an extended underwater sequence . 
<s>  the film is absolutely mesmerizing visually , thanks to the solid work done by production designer nigel phelps and cinematographer darius khondji . 
<s>  as technically adept as jeunet's direction is , perhaps his ( and , for that matter , whedon's ) greatest contribution is the infusion of humor into this notably downbeat and serious series . 
<s>  a sense of humor may seem to go against everything this horror show stands for , but the self-awareness of the excess just adds to the fun . 
<s>  no , alien resurrection is not the great film that ridley scott's alien or the even greater film that james cameron's aliens was . 
<s>  but after the dauntingly slow gloom and doom of fincher's alien3 , jeunet's resurrection is a welcome return to its roots as a wild , reckless thrill ride . 
<s>  that is what made the alien series so popular in the first place , and that is what will keep the series popular in any future installments .

<s>  far too many of them end up re-hashing the original and adding very little .

<s>  thankfully , " toy story 2 " is a wonderful exception . 
<s>  i can't remember the last time i saw a sequel as consistently fun and inventive as this one . 
<s>  it's yet another sign that pixar , the acclaimed animation studio behind " toy story " and " a bug's life , " is still at the top of its game .

<s>  woody ( voiced by tom hanks ) is preparing to leave with his owner andy for cowboy camp .

<s>  this means woody now faces a difficult choice .

<s>  as in the original film , " toy story 2 " contains first-rate animation , and pixar studios has done a remarkable job improving on the impressive work they did there . 
<s>  reportedly , the film was originally slated for a direct-to-video release , but after seeing the improvements that had been made , disney rightly decided to release it into theaters . 
<s>  the film is well worth seeing on the big screen . 
<s>  the colors are bright , the textures sharp , and even the human characters look more " human . " 
<s>  the animation is consistently seamless , with the action fast and furious and the facial expressions believable .

<s>  pixar's rendition of the family dog is also nicely done , with fur so realistic you almost feel you could reach out and touch it . 
<s>  the voice work is also perfectly complementary , and as with the first movie , does much to help further character development .

<s>  several new voices have been added , with joan cusack , kelsey grammer , and wayne knight doing fine work . 
<s>   " toy story 2 " is strong in characterization , and is able to expand on what we saw in the first movie .

<s>  the new characters are also developed quite well , especially jesse , who narrates a sarah mclachlan-aided flashback illustrating how she was loved , then forgotten by her owner .

<s>  not this one . 
<s>  we get character change , new characters , and new issues brought up .

<s>  there is always another clever idea waiting just around the corner here . 
<s>  the humor is sharp and witty , with something to amuse both kids and adults . 
<s>  there are funny asides to films such as " star wars " and " jurassic park , " among others , new takes on classic toys like barbie and rock 'em sock 'em robots , and appearances from other pixar efforts " a bug's life " and the 1997 short " geri 's game . " 
<s>   ( geri himself makes an appearance as a toy repairman who fixes woody's broken arm . ) 
<s>  the action is fast and furious , and the chases ( in the street , in a toy store , in an elevator , on a baggage carousel , and in an airplane ) keep getting bigger and better . 
<s>   " toy story 2 " never grows stagnant , because there is always something new to hold your interest . 
<s>  the more you pay attention to it , the more rewarding it is . 
<s>  it's rare to see a film like " toy story 2 " come along , because it's the kind of film that's almost impossible to dislike . 
<s>  it's created purely to entertain , and though i enjoy a thought-provoking drama as much as the next person , it's nice to see that films are still trying to do exactly what movies first tried to do : send us out with a smile . 
<s>  it's a fair bet that the whole family will have smiles on their collective faces after seeing " toy story 2 . " it's the rare sequel that manages to expand on , and live up to , the original .

<s>  it is simply amazing how " the green mile " developed in its three hour running time . 
<s>  based on the stephen king series of the same title , the film starts out painfully slow , with underdeveloped characters and idiotic dialogue . 
<s>  however , as the plot begins to progress , the film turns into pure perfection with outstanding performances and wonderful direction . 
<s>  frank darabont , who masterfully followed a prisoner's story in " the shawshank redemption " , this time follows the perspective of a prison guard , paul edgecomb ( tom hanks ) . 
<s>  through edgecomb's experiences on a cell block known as the green mile where death row prisoners wait and repent , the audience sees good and evil on both sides of the law . 
<s>  from an evil prison guard to an evil prisoner , " the green mile " is successful in creating sympathy for kind-hearted hard working guards and hard thinking prisoners . 
<s>  the plot follows edgecomb and four other guards as they meet a variety of prisoners and after having strong relationships with each eventually are forced to execute them .

<s>  if time was a matter of concern and the film was edited to the two hour mark , it would have been unsatisfactory because we would not be able to know the characters as they are or as they treat others . 
<s>  the three hour running is perfect for plot development and by the end of the film , a great amount of love or hate is attached to each character .

<s>  the lighting level is exceedingly low throughout the movie : it almost appears to be filmed in black and white .

<s>  here the doctor is intellectual and perhaps good , but certainly powerless . 
<s>  his alter ego is forceful and totally without conscience . 
<s>  two parts that make up a whole .

<s>  aggressive , bleak , and unrelenting film about an interracial couple , steve and sam ( damon jones and elexa williams respectively ) , who are viciously attacked in a parking garage one night by a gang of skinheads . 
<s>  the skinheads beat steve , then force him to watch as they brutally rape his girlfriend over and over again . 
<s>  when sam kills herself later that evening , steve decides that the skinheads must be taught a lesson . 
<s>  waiting seven months for the thuggish skinheads to forget about the incident entirely , steve shaves his head , dresses in combat boots and suspenders , tattoos his flesh with nazi symbols , and tries to infiltrate the gang . 
<s>  as he gets closer and closer to the people who committed the horrible crime against his girlfriend , he begins to learn just how vicious these people really are and starts to question his own motives for violence . 
<s>  randolph kret's script , based on two real life incidents that affected not only his life but the life of the film's producer shaun hill , is an affront on violence and intolerance . 
<s>  the film causes its audience to be subjected to such brutality and ignorance that one can't help but be disgusted by the events presented within . 
<s>  i've seen it said that this is the film fight club should have been , but david fincher's film was trying to define a generation . 
<s>  kret's film is a wake up call to a generation and his message is a powerful one . 
<s>  if fincher is the kubrick of our generation , then kret is our d . w . 
<s>  griffith ( thematically speaking ) . 
<s>  there is not a single likable character in the film . 
<s>  the skinheads are obviously the most repulsive characters in the film , not only because of their beliefs but because they are in a constant state of fury ( not just against other races but within their own circles ) . 
<s>  the african-american characters in the film are constantly shown as sexually assaulting drug abusers who are always on a joyride looking for someone to accost . 
<s>  even gay men get in on the act , locating the skinheads' lair and beating them severely with lead pipes and other blunt objects . 
<s>  the main character steve is also unlikable because of the person he becomes just to seek out revenge . 
<s>  what all of this comes down to is the simple message that violence begets violence , and the constant clashes between factions will do nothing but continue the endless cycle of violence inherent in our society .

<s>  there are no " winners " at the end of this film either . 
<s>  no character gets his or her comeuppance and the ending leaves us almost right where we began .

<s>  it is this bleak ending that carries the film's most powerful message : the message that , despite what you may be able to momentarily do to put your own mind to rest , evil will still be with us ( and in many forms ) and there is very little than can be done to eradicate it entirely . 
<s>  gothic murder-mystery yarns are not a new conceit . 
<s>  in fact , they've been around in books and on film for many , many years . 
<s>  without the proper handling , they come off as old-fashioned , bland , and outdated . 
<s>   " the gift , " directed by sam raimi , is a tried-and-true effort that surprises very little , and includes everything from a wide array of suspects and red herrings , to mansions in the deep south with moss trees out front , to the eventual discovery of a waterlogged corpse found in a nearby pond . 
<s>  it's fairly obvious who the killer is ; in fact , i predicted who it would be before the movie began and was correct in my preliminary suspicions . 
<s>  the film ultimately shouldn't work , but it does , thanks to a sparkling cast that fills each character with so many memorable nuances , the most fun to be had is in simply watching the people interact with each other . 
<s>  annie wilson ( cate blanchett ) is a recently widowed mother of three sons who makes her living giving psychic readings to the residents of her backwater southern hometown . 
<s>  some of her mainstay clients include valerie barksdale ( hilary swank ) , who is severely abused by her husband donnie ( keanu reeves ) , and buddy cole ( giovanni ribisi ) , an unstable mechanic who is confused by the nightmares he's been having about a mysterious blue diamond that is somehow linked to his father . 
<s>  for annie , she does not give the readings merely for money , but uses it as a way of seeking solace in finding the good in everyone's future . 
<s>  her late grandmother ( rosemary harris ) told her as a child that it was a gift she was given , and she should always remember that . 
<s>  when annie's eldest son is involved in a fight at school , she meets the nice-guy school principal , wayne collins ( greg kinnear ) , whom she finds herself attracted to . 
<s>  but wayne is engaged to the wealthy jessica king ( katie holmes ) , whom annie immediately gets a negative vibe about . 
<s>  at a party with her best friend linda ( kim dickens ) , annie stumbles upon jessica in a compromising position with lawyer david duncan ( gary cole ) . 
<s>  soon after , jessica has disappeared , leaving everyone in a frenzy over what could have possibly happened to her , and annie starts to have nightmares and apparitions linking jessica with the vicious redneck donnie barksdale , and the pond behind his home . 
<s>   " the gift " may be cliched on a sheer storytelling level , but the performances and tight direction from raimi ( who has redeemed himself for his embarrassing last film , 1999's " for love of the game " ) lift the picture up several notches . 
<s>  slowly enveloping the viewer into the many intriguing characters and their individual plights , the disappearance of jessica at the 30-minute mark divulges the movie's true intentions and transforms the proceedings into a taut , at times frightening , horror-mystery . 
<s>  at the center of the film is the exceptional cate blanchett ( 1999's " the talented mr . ripley " ) , who turns annie wilson from what could have been little more than a run-of-the-mill protagonist into a very exact , down-to-earth , realistic person with valid troubles and a caring attitude towards those around her . 
<s>  blanchett takes the unextraordinary material and runs with it , giving the entire film a truly classy aura that it otherwise might not have had . 
<s>  we follow her at every turn because she is so mesmerizing , both as a character and an actress . 
<s>  blanchett isn't the only bright performer , as she is ably supported by one of the best casts of the year . 
<s>  in her first role following her oscar win for 1999's " boys don't cry , " hilary swank is excellent as the confused valerie , who seeks guidance from annie , but is too scared to take her biggest advice of all : to leave the grossly abusive donnie . 
<s>  as donnie , keanu reeves ( 2000's " the watcher " ) makes an utterly convincing backwoods meanie , so much so that it is difficult to believe he is an actor at all . 
<s>  for the often-criticized reeves , whose acting abilities have never been the best , this is the biggest compliment he could possibly get , and it is also one of the better performances he has given . 
<s>  giovanni ribisi ( 2000's " the boiler room " ) is heartbreaking as a mentally slow young man who sees annie as his only friend , and wants her to do nothing but help him understand why he is being plagued by bad dreams about his dad . 
<s>  in the small , but pivotal role of the sleazy jessica king , katie holmes ( 2000's " wonder boys " ) has turned in yet another stunning supporting turn . 
<s>  her promiscuous role of jessica is one she has never played before , and she is radiant in her few scenes . 
<s>  finally , kim dickens ( 2000's " hollow man " ) makes her usual strong impression as annie's spicy best friend , linda . 
<s>  the other notable aspect of " the gift " is its moody atmosphere that lays such a thickly foreboding air over every scene it's almost suffocating . 
<s>  thanks to cleverly construed editing by arthur coburn and bob murawski , and the successful use of different eerie sounds effects and a very good music score by christopher young , the movie not only achieves a scary undercurrent , but one that is filled with dread . 
<s>  helped along by a strong screenplay by billy bob thornton and tom epperson , which makes the most of its setting and delightful cast , " the gift " is that rarest of thrillers that actually thrills , and offers up a fair share of chills , too . 
<s>  it may not be groundbreakingly original , but it sure is an entertaining ride for the duration of its running time .
