<s>  countries and legal systems that take the rule of law principle seriously , had forbidden judges and juries to make judgements in all matters that could involve them personally . 
<s>  luckily , movie reviewers aren't burdened with such legislation . 
<s>  otherwise , small pool of very special movies would be forever ignored by this reviewer . 
<s>  in case of star wars , 1977 science fiction epic by george lucas , the consequences would be even more severe , because that film is very special for tens of millions , if not hundreds of millions of fans . 
<s>  in any case , objectivity is something seldom seen in star wars reviews , because undisputed majority of reviewers rate it as one of the best , if not the best film of all times . 
<s>  those who don't usually have some difficulties in hiding their artistic snobbery . 
<s>  the author of this review must also concede his inability to use cold , objective standards in reviewing this film . 
<s>  like so many previous reviewers , i must note that i watched star wars for the first time twenty years ago , and that i remained enchanted by the experience ever since . 
<s>  perhaps it was childlike fascination with , until then unimaginable , wonders that happened long time ago , in a galaxy far away . 
<s>  or perhaps it was the rush i felt minutes before the opening shots , with my expectations already pumped up by serialised comic books and novelisation i had read before . 
<s>  anyway , watching of star wars was one of the most important movie going experiences of my life . 
<s>  and it was also unmatched for many years to come , because very few movies managed to have such a strong impact on me like george lucas' epic . 
<s>  star wars wasn't just important movie for me ( or the millions of fans who probably share the same sentiment ) . 
<s>  it was the defining moment in the history of modern cinema . 
<s>  until than , american motion picture industry was in a limbo ; social turmoil in 1960s practically destroyed the old hollywood , and new authors filled the void , mostly by using hollywood's financial and technical resources to create serious , " personal " or " artsy " movies . 
<s>  as a result , audience , traumatised of dark reality of vietnam and watergate , didn't want to see the same dark and serious content on the silver screen . 
<s>  george lucas with its science fiction epic was among the first to come into rescue . 
<s>  the audience responded with unprecedented enthusiasm , and huge financial success of the movie , later backed by supplement industry of toys , books , comics , role playing games and other merchandise , slowly began to change the face of hollywood . 
<s>  serious , adult movies with artistic ambitions faded into oblivion , and were replaced by industrial products of " blockbuster " philosophy . 
<s>  one of the biggest casualties of that trend was the science fiction movie genre . 
<s>  until 1977 , science fiction movies were mostly in b-production domain . 
<s>  in late 1960s , bigger budgets for science fiction didn't look so strange anymore , thanks to the great success of 2001 : a space odyssey . 
<s>  but the same success coincided with the surge of pesimism , and hollywood science fiction was as bleak as the rest of its production - mostly dark , dystopic movies . 
<s>  however , in 1977 star wars showed once and for all that this genre can be inspiration for popular movies , even among the audience that usually doesn't like it . 
<s>  as a result , seriousness in cinematic science fiction began fading away , although some good , dark and cult quality sf and continued to be filmed until early 1980s . 
<s>  after that , science fiction continued to be considered a synonym for family entertainment . 
<s>  ironically , the man responsible for star wars was in its time considered to be member of " new hollywood " generation of young movie authors who made " artsy " and " personal " films in early 1970s . 
<s>  george lucas established himself with the dystopic sf movie thx 1138 , and nostalgic drama american graffiti . 
<s>  both movies were considered " personal " in its time , despite latter one becoming very popular . 
<s>  in a sense , star wars is an also very " personal " film , and the thorny way to the final production shows that commercial considerations were against it , not for it . 
<s>  but unlike many " personal " movies of the era , its " personality " was in line with the wishes of the general audience . 
<s>  the plot , set " a long time ago , in a galaxy far away " , begins in a time of civil war . 
<s>  the evil empire is threatened by rebels who want to restore the old republic . 
<s>  in order to quash any opposition , the empire had built death star , superweapon powerful enough to destroy whole planets . 
<s>  the information about death star , acquired by rebel intelligence , is being transported by princess leia organa ( carrie fisher ) when her ship gets intercepted by imperial cruiser . 
<s>  princess is arrested by imperial warlord darth vader ( played by david prowse and voice by james earl jones ) , but the information is being sent to nearby desert planet of tatooine via two humanoid robots - c3po ( anthony daniels ) and r2d2 ( kenny baker ) . 
<s>  those two robots are sold to the family of luke skywalker ( mark hamill ) , young restless man who wants to leave his farm and become space pilot . 
<s>  his adventure begins when r2d2 escapes , because the information must reach mysterious local hermit obi wan kenobi ( alec guiness ) . 
<s>  old man is actually the last surviving jedi knight , member of the ancient order that defended republic through the use of mystical force . 
<s>  after some hesitation , luke agrees to join obi wan in his mission to save the princess , while the old man would teach him the ways of the force . 
<s>  their small band comes to the colourful spaceport of moss eisely , where they hire the spaceship owned by rogue pilot han solo ( harrison ford ) and his furry sidekick chewbacca ( peter mayhew ) . 
<s>  critics who don't like the movie , especially those who can't forgive lucas for his contribution to the quashing of " new hollywood " , are prone to point the lack of originality . 
<s>  on the surface , they might be right ; lucas himself admits that he found a lot of inspiration in the lore of old hollywood - westerns , wwii aviation movies , old sf cliffhanger serials of the 1930s and 1940s ; yet the most obvious element would be akira kurosawa's samurai classic the hidden fortress . 
<s>  on the other hand , those who had spent last two decades studying the movie to death would say that the inspiration for star wars went even further - into collective subconscious of western civilisation ( hinted by some mild tolkien references ) . 
<s>  the others would find the author's element within the story - star wars could be seen as an anti- establishment film ; young , long-haired , easy going , nature-loving heroes are fighting against old , uptight and oppressive forces who use supertechnology in most demonic purposes . 
<s>  even out of its historical or social context , star wars is an impressive as a strictly technical piece of the seven art . 
<s>  george lucas' direction is very good , with the clever editing and a well-paced segments between action and dramatic buildup . 
<s>  characters are well-drawn and deliver all the necessary ingredients , both for the space opera and hollywood blockbuster . 
<s>  we have a " coming-of-age " hero , damsel-in-distress ( somewhat toned down due to the popular feminist trends of the time ) , reluctant helper , benevolent mentor , diabolical villain and , finally , comic relief in form of two non-human characters . 
<s>  some of the actors are very good - alec guiness in his most famous role to date , james earl jones whose voice is enough to cause unease , peter cushing as an incarnation of pure evil in human form . 
<s>  unfortunately , the same can't be said for the main leads - among the main trio of mark hamill , carrie fisher and harrison ford , only the last one had the character three-dimensional enough to launch his further acting career . 
<s>  the thing that looked like the most important segment of star wars phenomena during its initial release was the new level of special effects technology . 
<s>  often comparisons with 2001 : space odyssey , another ground-breaking sf film , were citing the sheer number of effects as a proof of the lucas' superiority over kubrick . 
<s>  however , the special effects by john dykstra and john stears are indeed impressive , even after two decades ( although 1997 special edition did improve them significantly ) , yet they aren't the most remembered trademark of the movie . 
<s>  that honour should definitely go to the " oscar " -winning soundtrack by john williams , whose work on star wars is probably the brightest gem in his brilliant career . 
<s>  newer generations of viewers might be somewhat deprived of the enchantment that still holds those lucky enough to witness star wars original release . 
<s>  yet , even if they are immune to the george lucas' magic they should watch this film nevertheless , perhaps only to become familiar with something that is essential part of contemporary culture . 
<s>  frequency n . , 
<s>  the number of times a specified phenomenon occurs within a specified interval as the number of repetitions of a complete sequence of values of a periodic function per unit variation of an independent variable ? etc 
<s>  don't worry . 
<s>  when watching the thriller frequency , you won't have to know what the heck frequency means . 
<s>  the premise , although it may sound complex , is very basic on the big screen . 
<s>  a new york cop , john , ( jim caviezel ) finds a radio in his house , which allows him to communicate with his new york firefighter father , frank , ( dennis quaid ) who died thirty years ago . 
<s>  immediately john warns his father that he will die trying to stop a fire in an abandoned warehouse . 
<s>  when frank takes his advice and survives the accident he wasn't supposed to , the two eventually realize that by changing that one moment in the past , they have created a whole new future in which a serial killer murders john's mother and nine other women . 
<s>  it is now up to john and frank to use their special connection and save thirty years ago to make present time a better place . 
<s>   ( i told you that wasn't confusing ? ) . 
<s>  overall , i was very pleased with frequency . 
<s>  it's occasional sappy moments perfectly synchronized with its suspenseful serial killer scenes . 
<s>  i usually don't buy those cheesy " i love you dad " segments in movies , but this one surprisingly satisfied me . 
<s>  maybe because the plot is so creative and universal that i believed that this is how most people would act when talking to a dead relative . 
<s>  frequency's creepy premise left me thinking once the film ended , what if ? 
<s>  what would i do ? 
<s>  would i help my own family or save a historical figure from being assasinated ? 
<s>  or stop some kids from shooting other kids ? 
<s>  or buy stock from yahoo ! ? 
<s>   ( a character in the film does the latter with humorous consequences ) . 
<s>  frequency also reminded me of the fantastic back to the future . 
<s>  both share that " change the past slightly , and you'll change the future heavily " warning . 
<s>  the changes between the present and the past , such as different newspaper headlines or people disappearing and reappearing in photographs , are very similar . 
<s>  both are also wonderful feel-good family films that can attract to a number of generations . 
<s>  the only difference worth noting is that frequency's final scene doesn't set up a possibility for a lucrative sequel already in the making . 
<s>  there are some problems with the film though . 
<s>  first , there is a major flaw in the story towards the end that is somewhat distracting ( email me if you have seen the movie and want to know what i think it is ) . 
<s>  the plot must have confused even the filmmakers who frequently ( no pun intended ) switch from 1969 to 1999 while telling the story . 
<s>  another problem is that the supporting cast , including noah emmerich and andre braugher , are underused . 
<s>  while in the film , which is not enough , the aforementioned actors steal every scene they are in . 
<s>  frequency was a pleasant surprise for me and the audience i saw it with who cheered at the end . 
<s>  even if you know what is going to happen or if you think the preview ruined the movie for you , like it almost did for me , check this movie out . 
<s>  you may be surprised as well . 
<s>   " psycho meets the exorcist with no holds barred " . 
<s>  a blurb like that sounds like desperate publicity for some low budget , third rate rip-off . 
<s>  but no , this tacky plug comes from the poster for suspiria , perhaps italian horror director dario argento's most consistently successful film . 
<s>  what impresses most in re-watching this surrealistic , supernatural thriller is that argento's directorial flair and stylish visuals are matched by a near-fully coherent narrative . 
<s>  screenplays have always been his achilles heel ; confusing subplots , gaping holes , totally illogical incidents and reactions . 
<s>  no question : argento has always been a better director than a writer . 
<s>  fortunately , he gets the plotting pretty well right with suspiria , taking his cue from a book by thomas de quincey called " suspiria de profundis " . 
<s>  the film's storyline suffers from no major lapses in logic , provided one can accept the premise of a ballet school being a front for a coven of witches . 
<s>  jessica harper plays an american who travels to germany to further her studies in dance . 
<s>  arriving at the school late at night in driving rain , she sees a girl leave and run into the storm in a clearly distressed state . 
<s>  what happens next - and i don't make the comparison lightly - is a murder sequence that for intensity , shock value and sheer directorial flair ranks alongside alfred hitchcock's infamous shower scene in psycho . 
<s>  it's quite possibly a homage to hitchcock , but with its baroque sets , graphic gore and brilliantly chaotic musical accompaniment by the gothic rock group goblin , this stunning sequence remains very much argento's own . 
<s>  though nothing else quite equals the intensity of suspiria's opening 15 minutes , the film continues to be never anything less than engrossing as harper begins her own investigations and slowly comes to realise this is no ordinary ballet school . 
<s>  we meet an assortment of slightly sinister characters , most notably the head ballet teacher played by alida valli in another one of those delicious sour-old-matriarch-from-hell roles she does so well . 
<s>  several more violent murders ensue , including a startling scene in a deserted square where a blind man is . . . well , i wouldn't want to spoil things now , would i ? and the film's climax , staged amid secret corridors and hidden rooms , has a gothic ghoulishness that's most impressive . 
<s>  the english language versions of most argento movies usually suffer trimming , and not just for the violence - deep red and phenomena , for example , have been appallingly hacked about . 
<s>  fortunately , the cuts to suspiria ( about 7 minutes in this version ) have not adversely affected the film . 
<s>  the dubbing of the italian actors into english is quite competently done , too , excepting one appalling and unintentionally hilarious effort with a conversation between harper and a professor about the history of witchcraft in the region . 
<s>  and the soundtrack ? 
<s>  it is interesting to imagine what power the film would have lost if it had been scored by someone else . 
<s>  as it stands , the use of goblin's music in suspiria is outstanding . 
<s>  apparently , argento played the soundtrack on location while filming so the actors could hear the music as they acted out their parts . 
<s>  a stereo video player adds greatly to the viewer's overall experience . 
<s>  even better , see suspiria in a cinema , where you'll get the added bonus of widescreen . 
<s>  and the colours ! 
<s>  deep reds , eerie blues , a superb use of shadow and contrast . 
<s>  the cinematography of luciano tovoli , whose more recent credits include reversal of fortune and single white female , is uniformly superb . 
<s>  a nod also must go to production designer giuseppe bassan for his wonderful baroque interiors . 
<s>  these kinds of settings are crucial to the atmosphere of argento's more surreal excursions , the other most notable example being inferno ( 1980 ) on which bassan also worked . 
<s>  suspiria is the film that broke dario argento into the major league of european directors , and it is fully deserving of its cult status . 
<s>  the gore is at times a little excessive and overstated - that's always been one of argento's shortcomings - but overall this is a fascinating , compelling example of italian horror . 
<s>  jackie brown entered theaters with little fanfare and a lot of expectation . 
<s>  even though advance publicity on this one was fairly limited , the audiences waited for the showings with heightened anticipation . 
<s>  this is , after all , the first movie quentin tarantino has directed since the highly touted pulp fiction . 
<s>  to say he has been inactive in between would be to tell a falsehood , since he has been involved in such projects as destiny turns on the radio , desperado , four rooms , and from dusk 'til dawn . 
<s>  he was also called in at the last minute to help punch up the screenplay for crimson tide . 
<s>   ( i'm willing to wager the debate over which silver surfer is the only true silver surfer was penned by him . ) 
<s>  tarantino contributed on and off screen to these films , but never took the director's helm . 
<s>  nearly four years since gaining notoriety on the hollywood scene and making john travolta a star once more , tarantino returns with a film he can call his own . 
<s>  the film opens up with an homage to the graduate , with jackie brown ( pam grier ) on one of those airport people movers as the credits are displayed in front of her . 
<s>  jackie is a flight attendant for air cabo , which flies back and fourth between los angeles and cabo san lucas . 
<s>  this makes jackie a convenient cash courier for gun dealer ordell robbi ( samuel l . jackson ) who is currently keeping his money stashed in mexico . 
<s>  however , while bringing fifty thousand dollars back into the u . s . for ordell , jackie is apprehended by fbi agent mark dargus ( michael bowen ) and atf agent ray nicolet ( michael keaton ) , who catch her not only with the money , but with a bonus of a couple of ounces of illicit drugs . 
<s>  jackie didn't know they were in the package with the cash , but that's of no consequence to the authorities , who threaten jackie with a couple of years hard time if convicted . 
<s>  of course , dargus and nicolet are just using the sentence to get jackie to turn over the big fish , ordell . 
<s>  ordell uses honest bail bondsman max cherry ( robert forster ) to get jackie out of jail , but while max is immediately attracted to her , jackie is more concerned about her immediate safety , since ordell killed the last one of his operatives who got picked up by the police . 
<s>  sure enough , ordell shows up at jackie's apartment that evening and tries to silence jackie for good , but she " borrows " max's pistol and manages to turn the tables on ordell . 
<s>  instead of closing the irony circle and relocating a bullet from the pistol's chamber to ordell's head , jackie proposes a deal . 
<s>  since ordell wants to get his money out of mexico , jackie will get back up to her old tricks and be a courier for him once more , but this time for a more substantial fee : fifteen percent of ordell's half million dollars . 
<s>  with a gun in his face , how can ordell not agree ? 
<s>  by itself , this premise might have been interesting enough to carry the film . 
<s>  however , we are also introduced to a number of double crosses which make us pay attention and think . 
<s>  jackie claims to be bringing the money in for ordell , but she's also making a deal with the feds as well as with max . 
<s>  the film throws us off every once in a while by leading us to believe the deal we thought was authentic is actually a sham , but it is in no way done to the extent that we feel jerked around . 
<s>  instead , it's actually a nice departure from the predictability which is prevalent in so many of today's movies . 
<s>  at least this film has a little imagination . 
<s>  most of the performances in jackie brown are above par . 
<s>  pam grier , of whom i had never taken notice before , plays jackie with a mix of confidence and vulnerability which makes her character believable . 
<s>  samuel l . jackson has a kind of mesmerizing quality about him as he handles himself in situations where you know he is in total control . 
<s>  robert forster is thoroughly likable because he comes across as such an honest guy , trying to do his best . . 
<s>  never mind that he belongs to a profession where sneaking into a guy's apartment to zap him with a stun gun is simply a matter of course . 
<s>  he's just so down-to-earth , the nature of his job really doesn't occur to us , even when we're shown him bringing a handcuffed woman to prison , or when we see the tools of his trade . 
<s>  in supporting roles are robert de niro as louis gara , a recently paroled friend of ordell's , and bridget fonda as melanie , one of the girls ordell keeps around town . 
<s>  unfortunately , de niro is basically wasted as his lines are few and far between , and then they are mostly clipped sentences . 
<s>  in this film , he's not really de niro , but stereotypical de niro , uttering things like , " little bit , " and " pretty much . " 
<s>  fonda , on the other hand , plays the slightly spaced-out melanie with satisfactory relish and cuteness , such that even when she is annoying louis , we are taking her side . 
<s>  as is characteristic of any film in which tarantino has had a hand , the dialog is quick and snappy . 
<s>  it grabs our attention and is actually interesting , and in many respects , this makes jackie brown a film which needs few visuals ; the lines are a form of art in and amongst themselves . 
<s>  don't count tarantino out when it comes to using the camera , however . 
<s>  there's a scene where max is unwittingly watching a dry run of a money exchange , and he's not really sure what's happening , but by composing the scene just so , his realization of what's going on is felt simultaneously by the audience . 
<s>  we look at the screen and think , " gee , that's clever , " and then think the same thing about how the film induced us into that wonderful feeling of catching on . 
<s>  although tarantino isn't afraid to drag out a shot for dramatic effect , it unfortunately works to varying degrees in this film . 
<s>  there are shots where a character is simply driving , and we watch this person and somehow get an idea of what is going on in his or her head . 
<s>  this is a tribute to both direction and acting . 
<s>  however , there is at least one other scene where we follow jackie through a mall , and she is looking for something ; desperately looking for something . 
<s>  we get the idea of the frantic nature of her search , but we follow her for so long that we end up not really caring about what she's looking for , but instead hoping she'll just stop . 
<s>  overall , viewing jackie brown is time spent well . 
<s>  some flap has already been made about the language used in the film , but it's really not much worse than many of the other movies out there today . 
<s>  in fact , one might even be able to say that the way in which these " offensive " words are employed almost cause them to parody themselves and therefore transcend their own offensiveness . 
<s>  go see the film and see what i mean .

<s>  in 1940 , walt disney released a filmed experiment . 
<s>  fantasia was a blend of two art forms : classical music and animation . 
<s>  while it was not immediately popular with the audiences of its day , it has since become recognized as something of a classic . 
<s>  according to the program notes , it was mr . disney's intention to have fantasia be a continual work in progress . 
<s>  sixty years later , thanks to the ongoing efforts of walt's nephew , a new fantasia is being released . 
<s>  it was not only worth the waiting , it is evidence to just how far animation has come during the past half-decade . 
<s>  with seven new sequences and one old favorite , fantasia 2000 exhibits an imagination and respect for its art form that is absent from most other feature films . 
<s>  like the original , fantasia 2000 will more than likely bore the very young , although there is more narrative appeal in this newer version and the segments appear to be substantially shorter , perhaps a nod to the shorter attention span of the studio's primary audience . 
<s>  ranging from the silly to the sublime , each segment is preceded by a short , humorous introduction or interstitial by a guest celebrity host , steve martin ( bowfinger ) being the first and most effective . 
<s>  these are quickly forgotten as conductor james levine leads the chicago symphony orchestra through the musical program which , along with the images drawn by the disney team of animators , is thoughtfully and beautifully brought to a stunning synthesis . 
<s>  fantasia 2000 is being released exclusively in the giant-screened imax theaters , making for a unique viewing experience . 
<s>  there is enough variety in the program to provide something enjoyable for everyone and surely , people will exit the theaters with their own personal favorites . 
<s>  for me , that would have to be the jazz age story of four unconnected and discontented people living in nyc who , unknowingly , help each other realize their dreams . 
<s>  drawn in the style of caricaturist al hirschfeld and inspired by george gershwin's rhapsody in blue , the music and images are blended perfectly resulting in a product greater than the sum of its two parts . 
<s>  children will like the short piece set to carnival of the animals by camille saint-saens . 
<s>  here , a goofy looking flamingo irritates the rest of the flock with his yo-yo playing antics . 
<s>  they will also giggle as donald duck , playing noah's assistant , tries to load the animals into the ark to the familiar strains of pomp and circumstance by sir edward elgar . 
<s>   ( while the depiction is not biblically accurate , it is entertaining and might be excuse enough to familiarize ourselves with the true record by reading what is written in genesis 7 . ) 
<s>  a positive note is that the studio has avoided any segment which is as perversely dark as nihgt on bald mountain upon which the original film ended . 
<s>  there are some images based upon fantasy such as the flying whales in respighi's pines of rome or images which have their roots in mythology such as the ethereal creatures which tell the story of nature's cycle of life , death , and rebirth in igor stravinsky's firebird suite . 
<s>  but the stories they tell are uplifting , containing nothing too frightening for our younger children . 
<s>  the darkest segment , spiritually speaking , actually belongs to the only holdover from the original fantasia , mickey mouse in the sorcerer's apprentice by paul dukas . 
<s>  but overall , the emotions evoked from fantasia 2000 are positive ones , being full of hope and promise . 
<s>  music has an impact which can be undeniably felt , capable of leading the listener to emotional peaks and inspirational highs simply not attainable through other mediums . 
<s>  it is no wonder that the levites , as the priestly tribe of the old testament , were also the appointed musicians . 
<s>  if fantasia 2000 is able to introduce a new audience to music which inspires and exalts , it will have done an incredible service .

<s>  synopsis : in this loving film portrayal of an idyllic and pivotal time that a young boy spends with grandpa and grandma , the self recollections of an unseen narrator focus on his world view as a tennessee orphan boy learning of his heritage through his grandparents . 
<s>  the setting is after the first world war , during the great depression years . 
<s>  a nine-year-old orphan named little tree ( joseph ashton ) is taken in and taught the wondrous ways of the woods by his caucasian moonshiner grandpa ( james cromwell ) and his native american grandma ( tantoo cardinal ) in the wilderness of the mountains of tennessee .

<s>  everything is miraculous to a child . 
<s>  but it all comes crashing down for the boy when the u . s . government forcibly takes custody away from grandpa and grandma , and forces little tree to attend the notched gap boarding school , a kind of internment camp where multiracial cherokee kids are indoctrinated to dress , pray , speak , and think like white people or face solitary confinement and corporeal punishment . 
<s>  through his childhood experiences , little tree learns lessons about love , race , life , death , people , nature , and folk wisdom . 
<s>  opinion : this excellent , excellent family movie . 
<s>  it is one of those priceless screen gems that nobody knows about because it's not highly advertised . 
<s>  you won't find any formula schlock , cutesy characters , canned spirituality , sequel teasers or commercial tie ins , but you will find the education of little tree to be a refreshing , impeccably acted , original , wonderful , and touching film .

<s>  disney cements their place in the forefront of feature animation with the release of their latest animated adventure , mulan . 
<s>  while it adheres a bit too close to the disney formula to be perfect , it is nonetheless an entertaining film for both kids and adults .

<s>  there's nothing graphic , and the film resides snugly inside a g rating . 
<s>  children will probably have more questions about the restrictive ancient customs than of the slaughter of armies . 
<s>  it's ironic that a film concerned with bucking tradition is hampered because of its strict adherence to disney tradition . 
<s>  if the filmmakers had the guts to lessen the humor , ax the compulsory songs , and remove the obligatory ( and somewhat unrealistic ) romance , they could have had a classic on their hands . 
<s>  instead , they merely deliver a very good time at the movies .

<s>  with a team of 200 graphic artists and animators working on this first film production from game developer squaresoft's square pictures , final fantasy , inspired by the top-selling game franchise , is visually awe-inspiring and groundbreaking . 
<s>  no doubt , you have never seen anything like this film , and the hyperbolic fanfare surrounding its release is absolutely deserved . 
<s>  but why does such a tremendous feat of eye candy have to be weighted down with a problematic story , wooden dialogue and generally uncharismatic voice acting ? 
<s>  obviously , the primary goal of the film is to stun and amaze audiences with extremely sophisticated cgi . 
<s>  everything you see in the film is rendered in great detail : individual threads in the fabric , individual strands of hair swaying , wrinkles and pimples on skin , incredible water effects . 
<s>  overall , the expressions and lip movements fairly accurately match the emotions and dialogue ; and the times when they don't sync perfectly really stand out , since the animation is usually so dazzling . 
<s>  but you won't spend much time dwelling on those gaffes -- as soon as you catch one , the next stellar monster or effect will have you muttering , " wow . . . " 
<s>  like the series of games , final fantasy's plot and characters have little to do with its predecessors , outside of being born from the same japanese mastermind , hironobu sakaguchi . 
<s>  it's the year 2065 , and humans are prisoners in caged cities of their own making that guard them from an outside world now overrun with deadly alien " phantoms . " 
<s>  whenever a human comes in contact with the ghostly visitors , the often-invisible beings pass through the body and wrench out its soul ( for some unexplainable reason ) . 
<s>  while many humans agree with a plan by monomaniacal general hein ( james woods ) to blast the aliens with a " zeus cannon , " dr . aki ross ( ming-na ) and dr . sid ( donald sutherland ) plan to build a " wave " using eight collected " spirits " to counteract the phantoms and kill them off . 
<s>  while the images serve the sci-fi aspect of the film well , the storytelling doesn't . 
<s>  it's unfortunate , because the plot seems so intricately thought out . 
<s>  perhaps it was far too complex and enormous to be entirely incorporated into the script . 
<s>  some could blame this weakness on the fact that it was a japanese concept translated to english , except two americans wrote the screenplay . 
<s>  nevertheless , the end result is an elaborate story complicated by confusing holes . 
<s>  why do these aliens feed on souls ? 
<s>  if they can pass through bodies and ships , how can humans hurt them with guns ? 
<s>  what is so special about the " spirits " that they would create a force strong enough to destroy the aliens ? 
<s>  worse yet , the dialogue is scripted to be either like a science-heavy star trek episode , an installment of die hard , or a sappy love story , depending on who's doing the talking . 
<s>  for the most part , it's bearable considering the genre , but tedious speeches and cheesy lines don't do anything to help the actors and can get annoying in the longer scenes . 
<s>  the only exception is steve buscemi as pilot neil fleming , who always has great cracks during tense moments . 
<s>  but , when the lights come up and the credits roll , you're more likely to be remarking on how fantastic the film looked . 
<s>  there's no question that the roughly 33 million people who have bought at least one final fantasy game will be eager to see this movie , and so should anyone who enjoys being floored by the best cg animation ever put to film . 
<s>  you'd be living in a fantasy world of your own if you expected much more .

<s>  in fact , i probably could never get tired of watching this film . 
<s>  starship troopers is very reminiscient of star wars , another kick-ass space opera which reinvented the sci-fi drama altogether .

<s>  the easiest way to write a review of this film would be to compare it to other science fiction films , and i may have to .

<s>  id4 had this same style , except it was forced , most likely the cause of will smith having a major role . 
<s>  this new " star wars " has a very simple , basic plot : mankind vs . an alien species . 
<s>  the alien species in question here is the bugs , a seemingly advanced civilization of arachnid-type insects . 
<s>  however , the underlying morals of starship troopers are fleshed out with deadly accuracy .

<s>  starship troopers begins with a satirical portrayal of those strange " join the army " ads . 
<s>  mixing a web-based interface , these summations of events are refreshingly original . 
<s>  stating , " would you like to know more ? " , 
<s>  these short news bulletins give the film an immediate sense of humor , and we know we should not take it seriously . 
<s>  however , we also witness the murder of several troopers in battle , in a gory , yet funny , way . 
<s>  after witnessing the slaughter , the film jumps back one year , to setup what we just saw . 
<s>  we are introduced to johnny rico ( casper van dien ) and carmen ibanez ( denise richards ) . 
<s>  rico flirts with carmen by sending her messages over computer terminals in school classrooms .

<s>  unfortunately , rico isn't interested in dizzy .

<s>  and as a result , dizzy signs up . 
<s>  everyone is assigned a certain position in the academy : carmen gets the pilot position she wanted , carl jenkins ( neil patrick harris ) , a psychic , gets a position in the training program , and rico is left in the lowest class of the starship troopers : the mobile infantry . 
<s>  the main story follows rico through his trials and relationships .

<s>  a sense of tension grew in the audience i watched this film with .

<s>  following the training sessions , which had many dramas in themselves ( too many to mention here ) , the troopers are sent to war .

<s>  i hopefully left the plot as vague as possible , because starship troopers is not about plot . 
<s>  it's about special effects and gory violence . 
<s>  director verhoeven , most known for his nudie film showgirls and basic instinct , returns to his sci-fi days , which gave us good films like total recall . 
<s>  verhoeven likes to push the envelope of the mpaa , but despite all the violence , the comic book feel gives the film a sense of falsehood . 
<s>  starship troopers is extremely violent , with more gore than this year's event horizon . 
<s>  the r rating is well deserved , and hopefully parents will not allow their 12 year old children to see it . 
<s>  my guess is that verhoeven's target audience is the 18 to 25 male group . 
<s>  the film has a testosterone level off the charts , with chiseled men and beautiful women . 
<s>  despite these superficial elements , starship troopers also creates a world which made star wars so successful . 
<s>  while watching the film , we never second guess the character's decisions because they seem perfectly clear . 
<s>  thankfully , no hero is punching aliens in the face , which gives the flat characters some depth for which we can identify with . 
<s>  the cast of starship troopers is quite annoying to begin with , but they soon grow on you .

<s>  billed as a " feminist sex fantasy " , this spirited , imaginative and thoroughly engaging film by the award-winning canadian director cynthia roberts , is destined for extreme reactions . 
<s>  camille paglia enthusiasts will no doubt champion this heart-felt tale of the title character bubbles galore ( nina hartley ) , a porn-actress-turned-porn-producer who faces an uphill battle in her quest for sexual and economic independence . 
<s>  however , those in the andrea dworkin camp , will no doubt loathe the film's decidedly pro-porn stance . 
<s>  political considerations aside , however , this is a delightful lesbian love story as the film takes us on a whirlwind tour of bubbles' romantic entanglements with a naive and virginal young porn starlet dory drawers ( shauny sexton ) . 
<s>  in the backdrop , however is bubbles' loyal assistant vivian klitorsky ( tracy wright ) who pines longingly for the affections of her bubbly boss . 
<s>  this femme-butch-femme triangle is what provides the film with considerable humanity * and * sensuality . 
<s>  in addition to the romantic aspects of the story , bubbles is being stalked and terrorized by her ex-boyfriend godfrey montana ( daniel macivor ) , a slimy porn mogul who wishes to make her life as miserable as he can possibly make it . 
<s>  when his plans to sabotage her latest film fall through , he snaps and psychotically decides to kill her . 
<s>  these proceedings are presided over by a most heavenly presence . 
<s>  god herself - yes , in the world of this film , god , is most definitely a " her " - and a chorus of undulating , scantily-clad angels , have their most watchful and lustful eyes on the events as they unfold , adding a lovely fantasy element to this frothy concoction . 
<s>  this bright , colourful and deliriously sexy film is chock-full of great performances . 
<s>  making her dramatic debut , after appearing in over 300 triple x adult films , porn star nina hartley takes command of her role with considerable assurance and a screen presence which puts many other contemporary 'straight' actresses to shame . 
<s>  hartley has overwhelming star power , and one wonders why other non-triple-x producers haven't used her bountiful talents . 
<s>  it is also interesting to note that hartley appears in the recent release of " boogie nights " , a film which takes a far more traditional doom-and-gloom approach to the porn industry . 
<s>  making a cameo appearance in the role of god , former porn actress annie sprinkle , a true artist in her own right - gives the entire film an earthy , sensual glow and certainly solidifies and , by her very appearance , downright justifies the themes of the movie . 
<s>  the other performances are equally solid . 
<s>  daniel macivor appropriately chews up the scenery as the villainous godfrey and tracy wright lends able support with her complex role . 
<s>  shauny sexton , an erotic dancer and pin-up model , makes an impressive screen debut . 
<s>  overall , bubbles galore is a film which wears its politics on its sleeve and very proudly indeed . 
<s>  at one point , the title character declares that " instead of trying to save women from the sex trade , we should be working to ensure that the sex trade is a safe place for women to work " . 
<s>  the direction by cynthia roberts is daring and subversive . 
<s>  roberts is not afraid to plunge the otherwise straight-ahead and simple narrative into extended and extremely avant-garde montage sequences . 
<s>  the love scenes between the women are especially beautiful . 
<s>  the musical score by nicholas stirling blends cool jazz and lounge stylings , while the skilful cinematography by harald bachmann terrifically captures a blend of garish 70's porn and psychedelia . 
<s>  amazingly , this film appears to have received a good deal of its funding from a variety of canadian government cultural agencies . 
<s>  this speaks volumes towards the importance of state funding for culture , as one cannot imagine such an entertaining , original and vital film being made in a traditional setting where conformity and formula rule the day . 
<s>  bubbles galore seems to be making the film festival rounds and does not , at present , appear to have any traditional distribution in place , so keep your eye on the alternative film listings for this one . 
<s>  it's funny , sexy and subversive . 
<s>  and it shouldn't be missed .

<s>  having , in the past , made films that pulled every punch imaginable , from the family traditions ( the funeral ) , to taxes ( a taxing woman & a taxing woman returns ) , to the diabolical gangsters ( minbo ) , to hospitals ( the seriously ill ) , juzo itami , this time takes on the supermarkets' own war , to get the consumers . 
<s>  and while this film has its funny side , in the crazy situations that it creates , it also shows another side , which is very much the attitude of a corporate structure that is more concerned with its profits than it is with any customer .

<s>  bargains galore , its name , has in mind the closure of goro's humbler venue , so that in the end it can mark up its prices in any way it can . 
<s>  goro hires hanako , a housewife whose talents seem to be better suited to management , than they are in anything else . 
<s>  hanako , as she gets familiar with the operation , discovers many of the tricks of the trade , done by many of the elders in charge of each section of the market . 
<s>  and the procedures , are not always " fresh " food , but a new packaging and a new date , to try and convince the customers that quality is on the shelves . 
<s>  hanako's ideas take hold , starting with a few of the women that work in the supermarket , being that they do not even shop there at all .

<s>  as the operation gets stronger , the competition also has trickery up its sleeve , and it has been undermining much of the operation by paybacks to one of the store managers , as well as the meat and fish elder supervisors . 
<s>  eventually these people are found out , and hanako has to tread slowly and carefully , until in the end they all have a showdown . 
<s>  and here , the truth and honesty win out , and even one of the elders decides to stay rather than go to work for the corrupt opponent . 
<s>  in the process , they also find that " freshness " ( with some very funny jokes on this word as well ) becomes a much more important tool than they imagined . 
<s>  with some very nice performances , in this hectic , and fast paced film , this film gives us a sitting of two hours that is satisfying in many ways , although a failed love story between goro and hanako does not come off much , even though towards the end it is suggested . 
<s>  but this would take away from the satire and its strengths . 
<s>  with food gags all over the place , the film lets you have it . 
<s>  and what fun it is .

<s>  the paradine case ( 1947 ) , admittedly one of hitchcock's lesser movies , turned out to be one i'd missed . 
<s>  this one , like all hitchcock films , is well worth savoring . 
<s>  the story opens with the rich mrs . maddalena anna paradine being arrested in her home for poisoning her blind husband . 
<s>  as mrs . paradine , alida valli plays an aloof but alluring woman of the world . 
<s>  to franz waxman's stark and moody music , we see the prison guards divesting her of her luxurious garments and jewels . 
<s>  stripped of her fine raiment , she becomes a commoner again , which , as it turns out , was what she was before she met her husband . 
<s>   " a brief skirmish , and you'll be lunching at the savoy again , " anthony keane , her ultraconfident attorney tells her in their first meeting , predicting a fast and easy trial . 
<s>  gregory peck plays the successful and debonair barrister . 
<s>   " she's no murderess , " he argues simplistically , smitten by her beauty . 
<s>   " she's too fine a woman . " 
<s>  his attitude upsets his beautiful and increasing jealous wife , gay ( ann todd ) . 
<s>  unlike most hitchcock movies , which are centered on the thriller and the mystery , this one is more a romantic melodrama . 
<s>  typical is the scene in which gay flings her head back and shakes her hair while bathed in light . 
<s>  she deflects her husband's affections as she fears that he is beginning to fall in love with his client . 
<s>  the dramatic music then comes up high as the camera dwells on mrs . paradine's portrait nearby . 
<s>  in the relatively unsatisfying first half , little happens other than domestic squabbles and overtones of intense adulterous desires . 
<s>  to the sound of sweeping violins gay tells anthony that he must get mrs . paradine acquitted because , if mrs . paradine dies , his heart will go with her . 
<s>  if she is freed , he will be able to forget her . 
<s>  as part of the soap opera , a mysterious louis jordan plays mr . paradine's valet , who has had some not to be discussed relationships . 
<s>  charles coburn plays anthony's legal partner , sir simon flaquer . 
<s>  and charles laughton , who looks like coburn , is judge lord horfield . 
<s>  this being proper british society , they will all dine together at the judge's house not long before the case begins . 
<s>  court tv junkies will probably pick up the many differences , some subtle and others not , between the american and the british judicial systems . 
<s>  one , for example , of which i was not aware is that the barrister cannot speak to his own client during the recess if she is the process of testifying . 
<s>  one sometimes wonders what the academy is thinking when they make their oscar nominations . 
<s>  as the judge's wife , lady sophie horfield , ethel barrymore got a nomination for best supporting actress -- the film's only nomination -- for an inconsequential part with which she did little of merit .

<s>  the great master shows his hand there as the tensions build as rapidly in the second part as they lay fallow in the first .

<s>  it's wednesday , march 27 , and a murder investigation is underway in charlotte , south carolina . 
<s>  the crime : a young prostitute , elizabeth ( renee zellweger ) , has been brutally slain . 
<s>  one half of her severed body was found in a bag at the train station . 
<s>  the other half was discovered in a trunk at the harbor authority , miles away . 
<s>  the police duo of braxton ( chris penn ) and kennesaw ( michael rooker ) are strapped for leads . 
<s>  at the moment , they have only one possible suspect : wayland ( tim roth ) , a wealthy , unemployed genius who graduated summa cum laude from princeton and appears to be the least likely character to commit such a heinous act . 
<s>  that's the premise for deceiver , a new thriller from the pate brothers , jonas and josh , who made their mark on the film world two years ago at sundance with the movie the grave . 
<s>  deceiver plays out like a mind game between the intellectually superior wayland and the two not- so-bright cops ( captions early in the proceedings let us know that wayland's iq is 151 ; by contrast , kennesaw's is 122 and braxton's is 102 ) . 
<s>  the setting is a police interrogation room where a lie detector test is about to be administered . 
<s>  over three days , as wayland returns to answer more questions , the drama and tension among these three characters gradually escalates until , inevitably , it boils over . 
<s>  other plot elements are thrown in for good measure . 
<s>  wayland suffers from a peculiar kind of epilepsy that can , in stressful situations , render him virtually catatonic or extremely violent . 
<s>  braxton , a compulsive gambler , is deep in debt to a local syndicate . 
<s>  and kennesaw is haunted by a dark , abusive side that delights in terrorizing women , especially his wife ( rosanna arquette ) , whom he suspects of being unfaithful . 
<s>  the foibles and failings of these three are brought into the open as the mystery around elizabeth's death deepens and it becomes unclear who has the upper hand : the suspect or his questioners . 
<s>  deceiver , which mostly transpires in a dimly-lit room and involves a lot of smart dialogue , has the feel of a david mamet play : edgy , claustrophobic , and tense . 
<s>  the atmosphere is explosive , and some of pivotal moments of confrontation are riveting . 
<s>  deceiver has the power to grab an audience . 
<s>  unfortunately , in the end , it succumbs to the need to throw in one last , unexpected twist , and this is its undoing . 
<s>  for , while this surprise will certainly shock most viewers , it also stretches our credulity too much , and raises more questions than it answers . 
<s>  it's only an effective wrap-up if you don't think too carefully about its full implications . 
<s>  of course , the film as a whole plays fast and loose with reality and logic . 
<s>  police procedure is totally ignored and it's almost impossible to accept that any criminal investigation would or could proceed in this manner . 
<s>  but the real focus in deceiver is on character interaction , not plot details . 
<s>  deceiver only occasionally gets out of the police station , and those instances occur primarily during flashbacks featuring the prostitute . 
<s>  the pates employ a number of interesting techniques to present vignettes from elizabeth's final days and hours . 
<s>  the most intriguing of these is to use an unreliable narrator while underlining the discrepancies in his voice-over by visually showing what really happened . 
<s>  moments like this are too effective to be dismissed as gimmicks . 
<s>  the movie , obviously fashioned in the manner of classic film noir , drips atmosphere . 
<s>  there are some fascinating stylistic touches ; for example , although the setting is contemporary , all of the telephones are old-fashioned , rotary models . 
<s>  cinematographer bill butler is given an opportunity to use unconventional camera work to liven up deceiver's look . 
<s>  some of the things he tries ( mostly those that involve the contrast between light and shadow ) work exceptionally well , while others ( like any of several lazy susan shots ) seem more like unnecessary visual tricks . 
<s>  as wayland , tim roth gives the film's top performance , despite occasionally treading the tightrope between acting and overacting . 
<s>  roth makes us believe that wayland is both as brilliant and as troubled as he's supposed to be . 
<s>  the other two leads , chris penn and michael rooker , aren't as effective . 
<s>  both play their characters like familiar types . 
<s>  penn's performance is uninspired ; rooker's lacks subtlety . 
<s>  some of the best work is turned in by the supporting actors . 
<s>  renee zellweger , in a role that's miles away from her star-making turn in jerry maguire , brings a note of vulnerability and humanity to a part that could easily have become a caricature . 
<s>  rosanna arquette is solid as kennesaw's wife , and michael parks delivers several wonderful scenes as a psychiatrist who's entrusted with evaluating wayland's condition . 
<s>  one of the best things about deceiver is that it never talks down to the audience . 
<s>  plot points aren't hammered home , and , although the ending has its weaknesses , everything isn't spelled out in bold letters . 
<s>  the pates give audience members credit for having brains , which is an increasingly rare characteristic for film makers . 
<s>  occasionally gripping and never uninteresting , deceiver is a fine noir effort .

<s>  definately check this movie out ; although , as a word of warning , it does contain several scenes of rather grisly violence which certainly aren't for the squeamish . 
<s>  the grandfather of italian horror the late mario bava has credits in nearly 100 films and tv movies produced in italy between 1939 and his death in the early 80's . 
<s>  more practiced as a cinematographer than a director , bava nonetheless sat in the director's chair for beyond the door ii , the project which turned out to be his last full-length feature film . 
<s>  alongside the appalling zombie schlock of hacks like lucio fulci , beyond the door ii is simply a revelation . 
<s>  in his day bava was considered by most to be no great filmmaker , yet here he fashioned one of the finest italian horror movies of the 1970's . 
<s>   ( note that the film has no connection with the 1975 exorcist-rip off behind the door , but for some unexplained reason was given this related title for release in the usa and australia . ) 
<s>  this story focuses on dora , a women set upon by a malevolent spirit that channels itself through her young son marco . 
<s>  the film opens with dora , her son and second husband bruno returning to a house by the sea that was the scene of her first husband's suicide and her subsequent trauma 7 years earlier . 
<s>  they hope to put the past behind them , but as small accidents start to befall dora - usually while bruno is away on business - she starts to suspect that marco ( played with uncanny ability by 8 year old david colin jr . ) is somehow involved in the strange goings on . 
<s>  to reveal any more of the story would be unfair . 
<s>  suffice to say that this artfully paced study of a woman suffering a nervous breakdown offers an intriguing plot , loads of atmosphere and solid acting , though the dialogue is somewhat weakened by the dubbing into english . 
<s>  bava coaches a surprisingly good performance from the usually wooden daria nicolodi , wife of famed italian horror director dario argento . 
<s>  her character is invested with sufficient depth to allow the audience real empathy with dora's troubled soul . 
<s>  the music by italian ensemble libra is also effective , mixing odd-sounding 70's rock with classic gothic piano sequences . 
<s>  and there is at least one moment - brilliantly engineered by bava - that is guaranteed to lift you ten feet out of your chair . 
<s>  yet for italian horror , the bloodletting here is surprisingly minimal . 
<s>  lamberto bava and francesco barbieri's script is more concerned with deeper , psychological terrors , with themes of guilt and suffering , with the notion that what we sow will shall - somewhere , somehow - eventually reap . 
<s>  scholars of the genre take note : beyond the door ii is stylish , chilling , and essential . 
<s>  based on the relatively unknown ( in comparison to spider-man ) marvel comic book , blade tells the story of half-vampire half-human ( played by wesley snipes ) who was born of a vampire's latest meal . 
<s>  now swearing vengeance against all vampires , blade hunts them all . 
<s>  his latest challenge is his biggest though . . . he 
<s>  must stop the vampire deacon frost ( played by stephen dorff ) from summoning the blood god and turning the rest of the world into vampires . 
<s>  admitedly , comic books are one of the least appreciated mediums , often viewed as juvenile by most standards , even seen as illiterate by some . 
<s>  judging by a series of poorly recieved ( financial and critical ) comic book based films ( such as batman and robin , steel , barb wire , the crow : city of angels , and the list goes on ) , one would come to the conclusion that comic books are the worst medium to translate into film . 
<s>  to some degree , i agree with this sentiment . 
<s>  having read comic books since the age of nine ( i'm 21 right now ) i can count the number of good comic book based movies ( not including japanese manga ) one hand : 1 : the crow ( 1994 ) , 2 : batman ( 1989 ) , 3 : superman , 4 : the mask , and now , #5 , blade . 
<s>   ( " men in black " is not on this list because it is an extreme deviation from the original comic book ) 
<s>  why is this ? 
<s>  for the most part , it is because the filmmakers understand 
<s>  the comic book medium and come up with an appropriate atmosphere to match . 
<s>  the crow and batman comics call for a dark gothic atmosphere , which the director provided . 
<s>  the mask features a wacky superhero with off the wall antics , which the casting and cg effects reflect . 
<s>  superman 
<s>  is not over the top with colour and flash , and the film reflects this . 
<s>  blade uses common notions of vampires and incorporates them into the film , creating an appropriate atmosphere . 
<s>  this is in stark contrast to joel schumacher's contrived vision in batman and robin , reflecting the dated atmosphere in the 1960's television show . 
<s>  batman and robin proved that the director failed to realize one fundamental fact : comics have grown up , and so has the audience ( i'm working on a scathing review of batman and robin and will post it up when i'm ready ) . 
<s>  which brings me back to blade . 
<s>  although he may be a familiar character to some , due to his appearances in the spider-man animated show on fox , one will find no single trace of the warm-and-fuzzy vampire hunter as depicted in the cartoon . 
<s>  the film depicts a vicious vampire killer that 
<s>  uses every single means at his disposal to reach his ends . 
<s>  the end results are not pretty by any means . 
<s>  the story elements work very well -- for a comic book story . 
<s>  screenwriter david goyer ( who also wrote the crow ) incorporates interesting elements of vampire lore , using science to explain many of the ideas often dismissed in vampire films . 
<s>  this is presented through karen , a hematologist portrayed by n'bushe wright . 
<s>  this leads to inventive use of standard medical treatments to kill vampires . 
<s>  add this 
<s>  to the neat little gadgets that blade uses ( including a titanium sword complete with an " anti-theft device " ) , and one has an interesting premise . 
<s>  however , the film works best as an action film . 
<s>  actor wesley snipes has 
<s>  an extensive background in martial arts ( most of which comes from capoeira , a brazillian form incorporating flashy kicks ) , choreographing every single move . 
<s>  proving that quick , flash cutting edits are no substitute for choreographed fight sequences ( see batman and robin for a 
<s>  good example of that ) , wesley snipes dazzles the audience with some incredible fight scenes . 
<s>  regardless , this film is far from perfect . 
<s>  the film suffers from at least one major plot hole , regarding the summoning of the blood god . 
<s>  the ritual requires that a number of pure blood vampires are standing on 
<s>  marked squares , yet one of them is viciously murdered , allowing the ritual to pass ( and the murdered vampire is later shown standing on the square ) . 
<s>  obvious continuity errors also surface , especially during a scene where deacon frost takes a drag on his cigarette and is not exhaling it in the next frame ( there is no trace of smoke either ) . 
<s>  much of the special effects are not that spectacular either . 
<s>  while vampire disintegration scenes are intriguing to watch , other cgi ( computer generated imagery ) effects are almost slapped together , which is surprising when given the amount of time the film was given to be released ( the film's release date was pushed back multiple times ) . 
<s>  scenes with computer generated blood look extremely fake , knocking the believability factor down a few notches ( but then , i'm really hard to impress ) . 
<s>  the film's r rating comes from gory violence , but the lack of 
<s>  realism made me wonder why it got such a rating ( for realistic violence , 
<s>  watch " saving private ryan " ) . 
<s>  the overuse of cgi in films has made me yearn for the days of director george romero and makeup wizard rob bottin , both pioneers in the art of gore without extensive use of cgi . 
<s>  still , scenes involving non-cgi special effects do surface ( and look much more impressive ) , such as one particularly gruesome scene where a vampire tries to use blade's sword without deactivating the " anti-theft device " . 
<s>  wesley snipes is the saving grace behind what would have otherwise been a muddled mess . 
<s>  while not talking much , he is a grand physical presence , leaving other comic book superheroes in the dust . 
<s>  a decent ( by comic book film standards ) storyline also helps . 
<s>  quentin tarantino seems to have a knack for giving his stars big careers . 
<s>  after his pulp fiction , many actors began receiving many offers for jobs . 
<s>  john travolta made his come-back and is now one of today's most bankable stars . 
<s>  bruce willis proved his acting chops and is now considered an actual actor . 
<s>  jackie brown , on the other hand , boasts quite a well known cast , except for the main lead : pam grier . 
<s>  most likely you have heard of her and seen her in films , but she's never really had a breakthrough performance ( her first film was in the roger ebert-written beyond the valley of the dolls ) . 
<s>  that is , until now . 
<s>  jackie brown is a highly anticipated feature film from quentin tarantino , whose last film was the huge hit pulp fiction . 
<s>  after mediocre acting jobs , tarantino returns to what made his name a household one : directing and writing . 
<s>  jackie brown is the result , and it is fantastic entertainment . 
<s>  despite excellent direction from tarantino , the cast steals the film , giving one good performance after another . 
<s>  pam grier gives a stunning performance as jackie brown , and she is supported by an incredible mix of talent--samuel l . jackson , bridget fonda , michael keaton , robert de niro , and robert forster . 
<s>  more than likely , you will see a few of these names in the oscar pool come oscar nominations . 
<s>  describing a quentin tarantino film is very difficult , as you really can't say much or you spoil it for everyone else . 
<s>  i will tread lightly . 
<s>  jackie brown opens with an impressive shot of jackie brown ( grier ) in a blue outfit walking through the airport . 
<s>  the camera tracks along with her , and ends up revealing her occupation . 
<s>  we are also introduced to ordell robbie ( jackson ) , who sells illegal guns to interested buyers . . . 
<s>  for a hefty price . 
<s>  ms . brown carries the money from buyer to ordell in order to keep the cops away . 
<s>  however , an fbi agent ( keaton ) and a local l . a . cop ( michael bowen ) are out to find ordell and catch him while taking the money . 
<s>  they try to reach him through beaumont livingston ( chris tucker ) , one of ordell's buyers , but he mysteriously ends up dead . 
<s>  they try again through brown , but she is hesitant to admit to any wrong-doing . 
<s>  but after unknowingly carrying some drugs for one of ordell's friends ( fonda ) , she is caught and sent to jail . 
<s>  ordell pays her bail through a bail bond agent , max cherry ( forster ) , and then wants to find out what she told the cops . 
<s>  after she claims to have said nothing , she reveals the fact that she will tell them about ordell in order to stay out of prison . 
<s>  ordell doesn't like this , but they both come up with a scheme to throw the feds and cops off their track . 
<s>  this scheme seems to be going as planned , but unexpected occurances may or may not foul up their goal . 
<s>  revealing more would spoil the fun of jackie brown , and that's the biggest reason to go see a tarantino film . 
<s>  tarantino seems to have a fascination with hitmen and unusual predicaments ( and slang terms ) , but they are always done very well and believably . 
<s>  his hitmen are normally cruel , but pleasant , in that nasty sort of way . 
<s>  they talk like normal people , except for when doing business , and they are rude to their girlfriends . 
<s>  of course , this is a tarantino film , and you know you can expect some awkward situations to arise . 
<s>  and perhaps the biggest flaw with jackie brown is the slow middle section in which the pace begins to drop . 
<s>  of course , tarantino fixes this by moving onto the climax of the film , adding a lot of his reservoir dogs-style storytelling to it . 
<s>  things are told from one person's perspective , and then from another , and then from another , each time learning more and more . 
<s>  this all leads up to a very interesting conclusion , which decides who is on whose side . 
<s>  on the technical side of jackie brown , quentin tarantino directs it with the same style as he did with his 1994 film . 
<s>  however , this time around it isn't as nearly as impressive or original . 
<s>  the writing , on the other hand , is quite good , although i do find tarantino's use of slang terms offensive . 
<s>  the story jumps back and forth in time as in pulp fiction , but it's much more easy to understand . 
<s>  his previous film needed a second viewing in order to understand the time differentiation , but jackie brown is very simply to follow , especially considering that the time is given during the " leaps " in time . 
<s>  perhaps this is a result of the screenplay being written from the novel " rum punch " by elmore leonard . 
<s>  the dialogue is pretty much intelligent , and all the characters are fully realized . 
<s>  the cinematography is very well done by guillermo navarro ( who has worked with tarantino on previous films ) and the editing is very good . 
<s>  and as with pulp fiction , the music is a highlight , bringing back memorable songs from the 70s and 80s . 
<s>  the acting side of jackie brown is unforgettable . 
<s>  the performances are incredibly rich , with hidden meaning behind every characters' actions . 
<s>  nothing is quite as it seems , and you can't really tell which side one person is on . 
<s>  the real treat , of course , is pam grier who gives an astonishing performance as jackie brown . 
<s>  her poor living conditions are superceded by her superior wits , which play an important role in the film . 
<s>  watching grieg , i could tell what was going through her mind , even if i didn't know what she was thinking . 
<s>  her face portrays a lot of emotion that you can tell when she is sad , happy , or in deep thought . 
<s>  bridget fonda gives a very good performance as a druggie couch potato . 
<s>  i didn't even realize it was fonda until i saw her name in the final credits ( her performance actually reminded me of heather graham's in boogie nights ) . 
<s>  michael keaton comes across very well , as does michael bowen . 
<s>  chris tucker has a small , but effective performance . 
<s>  samuel l . jackson is very good , but it seems to me that he was replaying his jules winnfield character from pulp fiction ( although much less cynical ) . 
<s>  but no matter . . . 
<s>  jackson is very strong in his role . 
<s>  robert de niro is actually a little annoying at times , but overall he does a good job as one of ordell's perspective clients and friends . 
<s>  robert forster gives one of the best performances in the film , as he has one of the most developed characters . 
<s>  he is present throughout most of the film , and he holds his own against jackson and grier . 
<s>  jackie brown is rated r for language , sex , violence , drug use , and some offensive remarks . 
<s>  as a film by itself , jackie brown is a terrific piece of entertainment , with a complex plot to draw viewers in . 
<s>  however , one can not help but compare it to tarantino's pulp fiction , and expect great results . 
<s>  when compared , it comes up short , but not that short . 
<s>  it's a worthy effort , with terrific acting and some impressive writing from elmore leonard and tarantino . 
<s>  perhaps the best thing about jackie brown is the discovery of pam grier as a major hollywood actress . 
<s>  i can't remember seeing her in anything ( except for a small role in mars attacks ! ) , but hopefully she will get many more roles from this one . 
<s>  expect to see her name floating around the oscar nominations ( and hopefully she will even be able to nab one ) . 
<s>  the makers of jurassic park & the director of speed conjure up a storm ! 
<s>   ( reviewed at eng wah's new jubilee cineplex at ang mo kio ) 
<s>   " unlike earthquakes , their fury is precise . 
<s>  unlike hurricanes , their reach is unlimited . 
<s>  unlike fires , there is no way to combat them . 
<s>  unlike floods , their terror is sudden . " 
<s>  - excerpt from twister production notes 
<s>  i'm sure many of us living in this part of the world have never seen tornadoes ( or twisters ) before . 
<s>  i for one , have only seen the devastating effects and footage of tornadoes from news reports on tv and personally , i feel tornado-caused destruction comes no where near the destruction caused by hurricanes and earthquakes . . . . . . . . that is until i saw twister . 
<s>  the destruction caused by twisters may be precise ( not widespread but it moves very fast and its path of destruction is unpredictable . 
<s>  it will suck in cars , houses , livestock , etc . . . . . 
<s>  basically anything in its path that is not firmly rooted to the ground and in twister , you'll get to see all this - close up ! 
<s>  twister tells a tale about a group of storm chasers . 
<s>  these people are basically out-of-their-mind and for the sake of obtaining data on twister-occurrences , they risk their lives by literally chasing tornadoes , trying to get as close as they can . . . . . that 
<s>  is if the tornado does not suddenly decide to change its path towards them ! 
<s>  jo ( helen hunt ) is the leader of this pack of kamikazes . 
<s>  while they are gearing up for the mother-of-all-storms as predicted by satellite recon , bill ( bill paxton ) , a former co- leader of the team returns to settle some divorce papers with jo . 
<s>  apparently , bill has left his rogue-ish days for greener and more practical pastures - as a television weatherman . 
<s>  he catches up with his old-self and follows the pack like the good ole days , bringing his wife-to-be melissa ( jamie gertz ) along , a city-bred woman toting around with a handphone . 
<s>  jo has finally implemented bills initial idea of a device called dorothy which measurement's of a twister may lead to a better understanding on how tornadoes are formed so that a more reliable early-warning system can be implemented . 
<s>  the problem is , the device has to be placed very near the twister , and in its path ( which is practically unpredictable ) of destruction in order for it to function . 
<s>  to add to their current challenge , there is another group of storm chasers that is corporation-funded led by jonas ( cary elwes ) and they too have a similar device . 
<s>  thus begins the race ; jo's cheap government equipment with beaten-up vehicles against jonas's high-tech computers and satellite link-ups with their sleek , black all-terrain vans . 
<s>  plot wise , there are not really anything to shout about . 
<s>  twister is as predictable as any summer box-office hit can get . 
<s>  there is the danger of the twister , the competition with jonas^os more well-off team and of course , the settling of differences between jo and bill ( this part gives the film its human substance ) . 
<s>  helen hunt , bill paxton and the rest of the actors/actresses give only average performances and all of them take back seat to the main thespian in this movie - the twister itself ! 
<s>  thanks to the impressive digital effects by ilm ( lucasfilm's industrial light and magic ) , we get to see the terror and destruction caused by tornadoes up close ; from stripping barns and houses to lifting up livestock ! 
<s>  jan de bont once again proves his visual abiility ( thanks to his years of experience as a director of photography for action films ) for action sequences . 
<s>  like his previous film speed , the tornado sequences ( which are essentially the action sequences ) are well visualised and edited . 
<s>  audiences will be holding tight to their chairs everytime a tornado comes on screen ! 
<s>  the surround sound effects sure does help a lot in stressing the terror of a twister ! 
<s>   ( the cinema must at the very least support digital sound to fully appreciate this ) twister is definitely an effect-dependent movie . 
<s>  now that id4 fever has begun to reside , and people are getting bored of watching will smith whoop et's ass for the umpteenth time . . . . . . twister is your sure bet of 7 bucks well spent ! 
<s>  watch it in a good theatre . . . please .
