<s>  van damme #1 works for the russian mafia in the united states and is killed by some of their operatives . 
<s>  van damme #2 is a police officer in france who finds out that he had a twin brother he never knew about after #1 gets killed in france . 
<s>  the remaining twin ( the french cop ) goes to the united states to find out who killed his brother and avenge his death . 
<s>  once there , he hooks up with his deceased brother's girlfriend , played by natasha henstridge , and the two of them set out to discover who the murderers are . 
<s>  jean-claude's acting abilities don't seem to be up to the usual lackluster standards in this movie . 
<s>  in other words , just in case you missed the sarcasm , his acting is worse than normal . 
<s>  on the upside , natasha henstridge is in this film , and she does what she did best in species -- she gets naked . 
<s>  sadly , this is probably the high point in the movie . 
<s>  she is actually a decent actress , but didn't improve as much as i thought she would after species . 
<s>  this is the typical van damme movie , with jean-claude doing a variety of high end martial arts moves on his opponents . 
<s>  nothing new here , and certainly nothing we haven't seen in every other van damme movie . 
<s>  simply put , there is absolutely nothing new about this movie . 
<s>  it has a retread plot -- this isn't the first time jean-claude has played twins . 
<s>  he still can't act . 
<s>  we all saw natasha's breasts in species ( although this is one repeat performance i'm not complaining about ) . 
<s>  this is pretty much like every movie that van damme has ever been involved in -- sub par . 
<s>  what makes reindeer games even more disappointing than just a predictable , lifeless action flick is the cast and crew who signed onto the project . 
<s>  most of the people involved in reindeer games just came off terrible slumps with excellent comeback performances in their most recent films . 
<s>  john frankenheimer , who made the unforgettable cold war drama the manchurian candidate way back in the early 60's , recently showed critics and fans alike that he still had some magic left in his directorial skills when he created the brilliant car chase scenes in ronin . 
<s>  screenwriter ehren kruger gave a remarkable first impression when he wrote the script for the underrated arlington rd . 
<s>  ben affleck displayed his comedic talents in dogma and boiler room , and even on saturday night live directly after the horrible forces of nature and 200 cigarettes . 
<s>  even charlize theron , who i was convinced couldn't act , did a decent job in cider house rules . 
<s>  when all of these bright stars come together , one would assume that the movie will have great potential to be entertaining . 
<s>  after coming out of the theater showing reindeer games , disbelief was my first reaction ? then frustration . 
<s>  the movie could have premiered on cinemax at two in the morning starring an all-rookie cast and still would have been equally lacking in entertaining . 
<s>  the acting is so pitiful and the script so dull , i may have to rethink some of my opinions on how talented these actors actually are . 
<s>  it seemed like everyone was restricted to just the script and not given a fair amount of improvisational rights . 
<s>  we have all seen ben affleck have some fun on the set , it is so apparent in a number of scenes in good will hunting when he exchanges jokes with his friends at a bar . 
<s>  the actors in that movie were having fun and , from that , the audience had fun . 
<s>  reindeer games is the complete opposite ; the actors don't seem to want to be their characters ( even danny trejo , who will do practically anything , doesn't look like he is enjoying himself ) , causing the audience to quickly lose interest . 
<s>  evidence of public disapproval was noted when a woman behind me yelled " boy this movie is horrible ! " 
<s>  and when there were scattered giggles during the most dramatic moments . 
<s>  the story follows a man , rudy ( ben affleck ) , who is leaving prison in a few days along with his best friend and cellmate nick ( james frain ) . 
<s>  nick has been exchanging love letters with a beautiful woman , ashley ( charlize theron ) , and cannot wait to leave prison and meet her in person . 
<s>  when nick is killed in a prison riot , rudy decides to pretend to be nick and take ashley out on a date for the christmas holidays . 
<s>  unfortunately ashley's brother , gabriel ( gary sinise ) interferes with their relationship . 
<s>  thinking rudy is nick , he kidnaps rudy and threatens to kill him unless he helps rob a casino , which nick use to work at as a security guard . 
<s>  now rudy must pretend to be nick so he can protect ashley from her brother gabriel . 
<s>  confused ? 
<s>  the movie only gets more complex as it goes on , until it gets way , way too complex at its climax . 
<s>  but reindeer games makes its first serious mistake during the first half an hour . 
<s>  the hero commits a greedy , selfish act when he decides to pretend he is his dead cellmate in order to date ashley . 
<s>  some hero . 
<s>  the point of a hero is to do the morally correct thing , a person for the audience to relate to or admire . 
<s>  when rudy lies and cheats his way into trouble , instead of gathering support from me for him to ultimately succeed in getting the bad guys , i felt more like he was getting what he deserved and even wanted to see him fail at times . 
<s>  the most irritating part of the film ( besides the fact that this is a christmas movie released in february ) is the number of chances the bad guys get to kill rudy but fail or delay for some idiotic reason . 
<s>  the routine in which the bad guy must explain his genius plan to the hero before attempting to kill him with some elaborate machine is getting so tired nowadays , especially when i eagerly want to see the hero dead . 
<s>  the only saving grace keeping this movie from receiving zero stars is an amusing but pointless cameo from isaac hayes as a prisoner upset with his food . 
<s>  why he was in this movie for such a pointless role beats me . 
<s>  why any of these people had anything at all to do with this movie beats me . 
<s>   ( dreamworks skg ) running time : 2 hours starring robert duvall , tea leoni and elijah wood directed by mimi leder the first of the two asteroid movies coming out this year ( the second is the macho armageddon ) is actually a dull affair . 
<s>  elijah wood plays leo biederman , who during astronomy class discovers that a large asteroid is heading for earth . 
<s>  tea leoni plays a ( rather crap ) news reporter , jenny lerner , who soon discovers about this asteroid through a very long winded and boring way , and robert duvall plays the leader of a space crew , spurgeon tanner , who are planning to blow the asteroid out of the path of earth . 
<s>  also featuring is morgan freeman as the president , and maximilian schell and vanessa redgrave as jenny's father and mother . 
<s>  while many people will walk into the film expecting a big special effects fest with the asteroid blowing everything up ( as the trailers seem to promise ) , the film is actually more of a character study , if a very poor one . 
<s>  the main problem is that there are too many characters in the film , and not enough time to explore them all . 
<s>  only the space crew are given any depth , jenny lerner , leo and the president are surprisingly 2d , and we never get to know these characters . 
<s>  and because i couldn't care for them , i didn't really give a crap if the asteroid killed them or not . 
<s>  the script by bruce joel rubin and michael tolkin is horribly simple , and never really makes any interesting statements . 
<s>  mimi leder , the former er director and director of the average the peacemaker ( 1996 ) , again directs in a ho-hum style , and never really gets any emotion out of a scene , which is a shame . 
<s>  the cast are seemingly on autopilot , although tea leoni does gives a rather good performance , even if she acts a bit too dorky for her own good . 
<s>  she seems uncommonly stupid for a journalist . 
<s>  robert duvall is on autopilot with a underwritten role , he just seems to be in this film for the money . 
<s>  elijah wood , one of the best child actors working today , is surprisingly average , although his choice of roles lately haven't exactly been brilliant ( i . e . 
<s>  flipper , 1996 ) . 
<s>  his role is also vastly underwritten . 
<s>  morgan freeman , again , is utterly wasted with a ridiculously underwritten role . 
<s>  like duvall , he just seems to be in the film for the money . 
<s>  the supporting cast are all o . k , none making much of an impression . 
<s>  ok , so deep impact may have messed up character wise , but surely the special effects are good ? 
<s>  well , yes and no . 
<s>  although the special effects should be impressive , with a massive tidal wave destroying new york , the special effects look like , well , special effects . 
<s>  sadly , the waves looks like it's been drawn on computer , and doesn't look too good at all . 
<s>  surprising really , when the effects are done by industrial light & magic , who did the effects for the lost world and twister . 
<s>  in the end , deep impact is a wasted opportunity . 
<s>  what could of been a moving movie with good effects turns out to be a dud in both characters and effects . 
<s>  the 2 hours the film had could have been used to much greater effect . 
<s>  once again , dreamworks has churned out another average movie . 
<s>  let's hope armageddon is a bit better . 
<s>  overall rating= review by david wilcock web space provided by geocities 
<s>  seen may 2 , 1998 at 3 : 40 p . m . at the crossgates cinema 18 , theater #13 , with chris wessell and sean o'shea for $5 . 
<s>  [theater rating : * * * 1/2 : very good sound , picture , and seats] 
<s>  the big-budget , mega-hype " event " movie is becoming so trendy now it is becoming a weekly routine instead of a seasonal one . 
<s>  gluttony is hollywood's favorite sin , but it is the movie-goers who pay the price by being dealt the same things over and over on an ever-worsening basis . 
<s>   " lost in space " is the latest such offering - a film so poor it would be twice as good if it were mediocre . 
<s>  it's made up of every element of science fiction , but at no time does it evoke the slightest amount of wonderment the genre was meant for . 
<s>  audiences' attention spans are rapidly decreasing and as is the trend with such films , this one opens with a fast-paced space battle which serves not only as the most interesting scene in the film ( probably because it has " star wars " written all over it ) , but as the producers' way of showing off their budget through the special effects . 
<s>  battle scenes are worthless without tension , and since we have no idea what the setting is it's impossible to care about anything that happens . 
<s>  in essence , the entire segment works like a teaser for an arcade game , not a piece of filmmaking . 
<s>  we meet the robinson family - a family of five that does not get along but has been chosen to act on earth's behalf in effort to find another planet worthy of colonization due to the exhausting of our natural resources . 
<s>  each member of the family has a special trait and personality , and yet none of them seem like actual people . 
<s>  professor john robinson ( hurt ) is the intelligent , quiet leader who has devoted so much time to his work his family and marriage are suffering without his realizing it ( it's obvious what role this aspect will play ) . 
<s>  of course this is all established through extremely melodramatic scenes such as the children and parents arguing and bickering among themselves and with each other , while the necessary problems are " resolved " at the right moments . 
<s>  the only thing worse than the screenplay is the fact it's presented in a completely serious manner without a trace of satire , and is so pathetic it's laughable . 
<s>  the first act is not a building of a story , but a juxtaposition of scenes that serve no purpose other than to plug in all the required elements ( such as plot , conflict , and characterization - god forbid ! ) . 
<s>  we're provided with the minimum amount possible of these elements to keep the film from being completely silent . 
<s>  in fact , it might as well be since the dialogue is virtually non-existent . 
<s>  yes , the characters do speak , but they do not talk . 
<s>  they say things that only relate to the conflict , but they never really interact ( unless it's the cartoony flirting scenes between arrogant major don west ( leblanc ) and uptight , unemotional judy robinson ( graham ) ) . 
<s>  it's amazing that after an hour of trite dialogue and generic plot devices that so little happens . 
<s>  eventually the pacing rapidly increases , but the amount of genuine interest does not . 
<s>  the story finally gains some prospective by living up to its title as the robinsons find themselves lost in space after narrowly managing to defeat dr . smith ( oldman ) , the cartoony villain , and his plans for sabotage . 
<s>  what ensues is a series upon series of completely unrelated conflicts . 
<s>  the first such scene takes place on an abandoned spaceship and what ensues could best be described as " alien " -lite . 
<s>  the story changes again when the robinsons crash land on an alien planet and must act quickly to escape it and survive . 
<s>  but there's never any real notion of suspense here because the script constantly wanders aimlessly . 
<s>  plotlines are developed , but each becomes totally irrelevant as the story changes from scenario to scenario . 
<s>  the atmosphere attempts to be surreal by incorporating time travel and various time paradoxes , but it's presented in such a ridiculous way it's utterly boring . 
<s>  by the time the last act rolls around , there is no sense of a payoff building . 
<s>  the ending does not go out on a high note with any kind of climax , instead , it seems to come to a sudden halt ( but at least it ends at all ) . 
<s>   " lost in space " is major film production at its worst . 
<s>  it's frightening that a film so poorly written , directed , and acted might be considered mainstream entertainment . 
<s>  the only thing worse than watching a bad movie is realizing that the film had a lot of potential and could've been effective . 
<s>  such is the case with _urban legend_ , the new horror film from first time director jamie blanks . 
<s>  the idea behind the movie is that the mad slasher of the film muders people according to various urban legends . 
<s>  examples include the killer in the backseat of the car and person getting calls from inside her house . 
<s>  the killer wears one of those l . l . bean parkas with the hood drawn completely up , so you can't see the face . 
<s>  i guess halloween masks are out of style for psychos these days . 
<s>  anyhow , the premise is certainly a nifty one and the opening scene is spooky and atmospheric . 
<s>  it's a very good setup that promises more chills to come . 
<s>  unfortunately , the film never takes off from there . 
<s>  the movie takes place on a peaceful new england college campus . 
<s>  like most slasher flicks , this one also centers around a young female main character whose friends are slowly killed off by a knife wielding maniac ( or in this case an axe wielding maniac ) . 
<s>  i've always wondered why these killers don't save themselves a lot of time and trouble and just go after the person they ultimately aim to kill . 
<s>  after the fine first scene , the movie degenerates into a monotonous series of those annoying you-thought-it-was-the-killer-but-was-just- someone-else scares . 
<s>  these are always accompanied by loud bursts of music . 
<s>  i guess sudden , sharp music chords are what passes for terror these days . 
<s>  the actual killer will attack at about every third music blast . 
<s>  the slasher appears , attacks , the victim is eviscerated , and the tedious cycle appears anew . 
<s>  false scares should always be used in moderation . 
<s>  someone needs to tell director blanks that things like this just aren't as scary as they used to be . 
<s>  this movie commits the biggest sin a horror film can commit--it's not frightening . 
<s>  remember the horror movie cliches that were so mercilessly mocked in _scream_ and _scream 2_ ? 
<s>  this movie still adheres to them . 
<s>  tons of illogical moments about ; more than i really have the inclination to list . 
<s>  and i don't mean illogical in the summer popcorn movie sense . 
<s>  that type of illogical can be fun . 
<s>  this film insults your intelligence more times than i care to remember . 
<s>  the last 20 minutes especially degenerates into such lunacy that you'll be laughing more than you'll be screaming . 
<s>  actually , you won't be screaming at all . 
<s>  at its best , the acting can barely be called " adequate " and the script could've definitely used a rewrite or two . 
<s>  the film still manages to have some strong points . 
<s>  the killings are certainly inventive and plentiful enough to satistfy most gore fans . 
<s>  there are some intentionally funny moments . 
<s>   ( these were exceeded by the unintentional ones . ) 
<s>  the film is well made from a technical standpoint . 
<s>  besides the first part , there is also another good scene , a prolonged cat and mouse chase inside a radio station . 
<s>  if there had only been more sequences like this , that relied on tautness and suspense rather than loud bursts of music , _urban legend_ might've been worth your money . 
<s>  my opinion on a film can be easily swayed by the presence of actors i love . 
<s>  i love ralph fiennes . 
<s>  i love uma thurman . 
<s>  i love sean connery . 
<s>  hell , i'm even a big fan of jim broadbent and fiona shaw . 
<s>  i saw the fantastic preview for the avengers nearly eight months ago , and i've been eagerly awaiting the film ever since . 
<s>  a few months into the summer , however , i noticed that its release date had been changed a few times , and that it had ended up in the mid-august dumping ground . 
<s>  then , in this final week before its official release , i learned that it was not to be screened for critics . 
<s>  and that the actors had not been plugging the film on late night programs . 
<s>  and that it was directed by the same man who brought us the remake of diabolique . 
<s>  my expectations fell to pieces when i learned all of these things . 
<s>  the film i saw today didn't even meet those expectations . 
<s>  this is a lousy , incoherent mess . 
<s>  i would slam it harder , if it weren't for the nifty sets and the mere presence of all these fine , lovable actors . 
<s>  but sets are ultimately empty , and the performances are completely uninspired . 
<s>  that's the main problem with the avengers : for all it's hip-hop flash and tidal waves , none of it feels the least bit energetic or inspired . 
<s>  it's like a chore , a bland exercise in superhero film making . 
<s>  it also feels like its been cut to pieces , clocking in at 90 minutes and forgetting to close some of its own subplots . 
<s>  this is just plain depressing . 
<s>  the avengers is a film version of the popular 60s television show . 
<s>  frequent readers of mine will not be surprised to learn that i've never watched an episode . 
<s>  i wasn't alive then . 
<s>  i don't even watch television now . 
<s>  i'm very sorry that i don't have this perspective , but , judging from the reviews i've already read , knowing the tv show just makes matters worse . 
<s>  i didn't know and love john steed and emma peel , and therefore i was not as upset to see how these actors i love have managed to thrash their roles . 
<s>  i also doubt that familiarity with the series would allow me to understand more clearly the chain of events that do take place in this film . 
<s>  based on what the film told me , i gather that steed ( fiennes ) is some kind of british super guy ( somewhat like james bond ) , and that dr . peel ( thurman ) is just a really smart doctor , who also happens to know a lot about weather and about beating people up while limited by tight leather suits . 
<s>  they are to work together , under mother's orders ( mother is played by jolly jim broadbent , while his co-conspirator , father , is played by the equally-talented fiona shaw ) . 
<s>  it seems that there is a man out there controlling the weather . 
<s>  his name is de wynter ( connery ) . 
<s>  he is a crazy scottish guy . 
<s>  our heroes had better stop him , or else . 
<s>   . 
<s>   . 
<s>  the weather will keep getting colder until they " have to go to hell to warm up " ( one of the film's few funny lines ) . 
<s>  along the way there is subplot after subplot , hinged sloppily together by scenes that go nowhere , feel perfunctory , and ultimately make no sense . 
<s>  for example , our heroes are eventually attacked by a swarm of giant mechanical insects with machineguns attached to their torsos . 
<s>  now , killer bugs don't really go with the weather-controlling theme of the film . 
<s>  the purpose of the bugs , other than to annihilate our heroes , is never established . 
<s>  they're never even directly connected to de wynter ( they're controlled by his crazy henchman , played by eddie izzard ) . 
<s>  the special effects aren't bad , but they're loud , obnoxious , and intrusive . 
<s>  like so many scenes in the film , it seems present only to keep your attention from waning . 
<s>  and i guarantee you , it will wane . 
<s>  i stopped thinking about the story when i realized it didn't do any good to think . 
<s>  the avengers has clearly been chopped up and re-assembled so many times that even the people involved couldn't tell us what happens . 
<s>  there are several scenes in the preview that didn't make the final cut . 
<s>  in addition , many of the sequences have irritating , grainy film quality , which makes it feel low-budget ( the last scene is particularly bad ) . 
<s>  the scenes that don't feature action should be electric , thanks to our wonderful cast . 
<s>  they aren't . 
<s>  the action scenes should be electric , because this is an action film . 
<s>  they aren't , either . 
<s>  and what about this wasted cast ? 
<s>  oh , it makes me weep with disappointment . 
<s>  we're talking ralph fiennes here , one of the best actors working today , one of the best actors * ever * . 
<s>  i love the guy . 
<s>  i've loved all his films , until this one . 
<s>  he seems like he wants to understand the film , but he's as lost as we are . 
<s>  and thurman , in all of her spectacular beauty and talent , can't manage to look at home here . 
<s>   ( i don't blame her completely , for there is a strange subplot involving her evil twin that is never explained in any way , and it can't be easy to deal with such terrible screenwriting . ) 
<s>  connery , however , seems the most out of it , totally lacking any kind of focus , or interest , for that matter . 
<s>  who is to blame ? 
<s>  is it the screenwriter , don macpherson ? 
<s>  perhaps , although i can see a shell of a story here that could have been a good superhero movie had it been handled right . 
<s>  is it the actors ? 
<s>  for god's sake , no -- these people clearly lost interest when they saw the inevitable path of destruction on which this film was travelling . 
<s>  i blame director jeremiah chechik , who shouldn't have been given the task to begin with . 
<s>  his best film , benny & joon , is quirky in the same way that this one was supposed to be , but here it mostly seems like a lot of failed attempts at wit and humor . 
<s>  add to that a lack of experience in big-budget action , and you have the worst choice for director this side of james ivory . 
<s>  if the avengers has a saving grace , it's the set design . 
<s>  the sets ( by stuart craig ) are big , colorful , and often pleasing to look at . 
<s>  i like the final set-piece , on de wynter's island , even if none of it makes a bit of sense .

<s>  i also enjoyed michael kamen's music score , particularly in the opening credits . 
<s>  but this stuff is routine -- good sets and music are nice , but there's a lot more that needs to be here .

<s>  maybe a little bit of cohesion in the story . 
<s>  or a sense of purpose . 
<s>  most of all , though , i would have liked to see these actors relish in their roles . 
<s>  damn this movie for not giving them the chance . 
<s>  if snake eyes were a dog , you'd put it to sleep . 
<s>  if it was a couch , you'd put it out on the sidewalk , where it would sit for a week . 
<s>  if it were your child , you'd be reading military school catalogs . 
<s>  if it were a ship -- no , it wouldn't be the titanic , that would imply glamor and tragedy -- it would be the exxon valdez . 
<s>   ( personal side note : i saw this movie on the road during a houston business trip . 
<s>  for whatever reason , my hotel's cable system wasn't showing the astros-braves game , which featured a randy johnson-greg maddux matchup . 
<s>  this forced me to pay full price for snake eyes instead of watching a perfectly good baseball game for free -- so the invective , deserved as it is , should be seen in that perspective . ) 
<s>  snake eyes is supposed to be a mystery movie , and good mystery movies are supposed to leave you asking yourself questions on the way out of theater . 
<s>  snake eyes is not a good mystery movie , but i had some questions : where's the manager , and how do i get a re-admit pass ? 
<s>  if i fall asleep on the drive home and wreck my rent-a-car , can i sue brian de palma ?

<s>  will someone please ( i'm begging you ) give gary sinise a role worthy of his talents ? 
<s>  and how , exactly does cage end up wearing the exact same shirt and tie as sinise does ? 
<s>  the first and most glaringly wrong thing with snake eyes is the trailer . 
<s>  if you've seen the trailer without seeing the movie , consider yourself fortunate . 
<s>  the trailer is a work of sheer genius . 
<s>  it manages to convey everything worthy of the movie -- the noteworthy steadicam work , the exuberance of cage's performance as a thoroughly corrupt atlantic city policeman , the essential elements of the marginal plot . 
<s>  the expert craftsman who pieced together a fairly good trailer out of snippets of a wretched movie deserves praise and a percentage of the gross . 
<s>   ( is a best trailer category at the oscars that far-fetched , after all ? ) 
<s>  but all it does is set us up for an overwhelmingly disappointing movie . 
<s>  the trailer sets up what should have been a promising plot : detective ricky santoro ( cage ) must solve the mystery of who shot the secretary of defense at an atlantic city pay-per-view boxing match . 
<s>  unfortunately , there are multiple problems afoot . 
<s>  the trailer gives away much , too much of the story . 
<s>  the shooter is killed instantly , so the story revolves around why the secretary was killed and who is involved in the conspiracy . 
<s>  the film's secret is ho-hum at best , and anyone who has watched the trailer and is aware of the law of economy of characters can figure out who the top conspirator is . 
<s>  without an interesting plot , without interesting dialogue , and without much of a reason to care about the characters or the story , snake eyes is a failure on almost every possible level . 
<s>  as much as i hated this movie , i must give brian de palma one tiny bit of credit . 
<s>  de palma is maddeningly inconsistent . 
<s>  he can , on his day , create amazingly well-done movies ( the untouchables , carlito's way ) . 
<s>  on off-days , he can be , well , just horrid ( the bonfire of the vanities , raising cain ) . 
<s>  snake eyes falls into the horrid category , but there are a couple of moments that are worth seeing strictly for their film-school degree-of-difficulty value . 
<s>  the steadicam opening scene does a good job of introducing the cage character and is a virtuoso technical job by both the director and the actor . 
<s>  there is a split-screen chase scene that looks pretty good , and it's followed by a god's eye view of a bank of hotel rooms that's imaginitively done . 
<s>  this is what's called giving the devil his due . 
<s>  but the technical skill doesn't even come close to making up for the sheer evil of this movie . 
<s>  placing plot holes to one side for a moment , snake eyes features easily the worst boxing match in cinema history ( george foreman is in better shape than the movie boxers ) , a hurricane that exists for no other reason than to punctuate significant plotlines with portentuous thunderclaps , and perhaps the worst , most overly drawn out ending in years . 
<s>  snake eyes is a criminal act , an evil waste of time and talent . 
<s>  cage , sinise , and yes , even de palma deserve better . 
<s>  the audience deserves better -- but no refund , no re-admit pass , no free popcorn coupon , can ever restore to us the time we've spent or wash the awful images from our mind . 
<s>  however , we are left with one consolation , that we were warned by the movie's title -- because snake eyes is nothing more than a roll of craps . 
<s>  the last line ( or near to that honor ) is the great butler , alfred ( the ubergod , michael gough ) saying , " i think we need a bigger bat cave , " or something to that note . 
<s>  that's exactly what this film is - too big for its own good because it has too damn much . 
<s>  cut batgirl out . 
<s>  cut one of the villains . 
<s>  it's too much to handle in one dosage . 
<s>  it's so much that characters get left behind . 
<s>  poor elle gets a mere 3 scenes and a subplot which is introduced but never finished in any way , shape or form . 
<s>  and elle deserves better . 
<s>  this is the fourth in the gigantic film series and the second from director joel schumacher . 
<s>  it's also the fourth worst in the series ( and second worst from joel ) . 
<s>  the series has been declining since its stunning debut , followed by the almost-as-stunning sequel and then the anti-climactic third one ( first by joel ) . 
<s>  this one's not anti-climactic - i knew it was gonna suck .

<s>  i suppose i'm not extremely surprised that " virus " comes to us from a deciple of james cameron ( john bruno ) , and if i strain real hard , i could even say that it's an obvious given , particuarly looking from the standpoint of mr . cameron's early works . 
<s>  in fact , " virus " is yet another in the long line of action/horror/paranoia thrillers from the " aliens " vein : a group of people are dropped into a mysterious situation only to find a mortally-threatening entity is out to get them , a textbook example hailing all the way back to the early talkies , and maybe even to the first pictures , albeit redeveloped by cameron in his 1986 blockbuster that earned him esteem and bigger budgets to come in his future . 
<s>  no such thing will happen to bruno , whom i believe worked in some capacity on that quasi-landmark feature ; while bruno may have studied under cameron's wing for years and years , i'm beginning to wonder at what capacity , and what exactly did he learn from him . 
<s>  in fact , " virus " should at least be mediocre ; the fact that bruno could have worked under a man like cameron - a director who , if anything , just knows how to make a movie - and then make a film like " virus " is just another detraction fairly aimed at this z-grade schlockfest of a film , albeit a z-grade schlockfest with a respectable budget . 
<s>  the film seems to not only borrow it's plot from last year's similarly-fated " deep rising , " but also from a clunkish b-movie from the '80s called " leviathan , " an underwater thriller starring peter weller , richard crenna , hector elizando , and daniel stern about a group of miners who stumble upon an alien lifeform that was part " alien , " part john carpenter's twisted remake of " the thing . "

<s>  and it's not the traditional argument for films like these , where you may in fact want them all to be eaten ( even " aliens " played with the karma of the arrogant soldiers , but this was more of a plus-side for the film as a whole than the opposite ) ; instead , as another cliche goes , you just don't give a damn .

<s>  though it has sat on the shelves of universal studios for about two years , waiting until it can be released and make as much money as it possibly can ( read : early january , when everyone's still trying to catch up on the potential oscar-nominees ) , it does show that universal shelled out a pretty penny to make this film : it's laden with complex machinery , boasts respectable production design , and it may even feature believable special effects . . . if , of course , i , or anyone else , could see them .

<s>  it was once said that in order to truly enjoy some of todays movies or novels , you must suspend disbelief .  
<s>  however , there is a distinct separation between opening your mind to ridiculous situations and believing a bunch of flat lies . 
<s>  it came as no surprise to me to learn that huntingburg , indiana ( where the film is set ) , does not have a mcdonald's , a sears store , a statue of a man on a horse , nor even a dam close by . 
<s>  even if you can ignore these somewhat white lies ( even though the dam is crucial to hard rains plot ) ; there is still a bunch of things that just dont gel . 
<s>  firstly , morgan freeman , possibly the greatest actor alive ( after such films as driving miss daisy , the shawshank redemption and se7en ) , was cast as a shifty goon intent on stealing enough money for a healthy retirement . 
<s>  he _should_ have played the town sheriff , an experienced and somewhat intriguing policeman . 
<s>  as a massive flood started by a dam accident overwhelms huntingburg , its residents presumably flee as the water level steadily increases . 
<s>  i say presumably simply because we never know what happened to them ; and it seems a tad strange that an entire town ( with the exception of some folk who get introduced along the way ) can vanish before the flood has actually started . 
<s>  but nether the less , armored guard couriers tom ( christian slater ) and his uncle are carrying three million dollars in the back of their van . 
<s>  with a heavy rainstorm causing depressing conditions and slippery roads , it doesnt take long for the van to end up stuck amongst mud and water off the side of the road . 
<s>  jim ( morgan freeman ) and a small gang of thieves locate the van and attempt to steal the three million dollars . 
<s>  but of course tom is more than willing to save the day , so he takes the money and hides it elsewhere in town . 
<s>  the local sheriff ( randy quaid , whom most will remember as the drunken pilot in id4 ) and a couple of police men investigate the situation , but their morals are soon overpowered by greediness as each character contemplates what he/she would do with their share of the three million dollars . 
<s>  director mikael salomon has made sure that hard rain ends up turning everything topsy-turvy , and whilst the film may at first appear to be a definite goodies versus baddies ,  there are numerous twists in its plot that make this a slightly more enjoyable experience . 
<s>  but by the time these interesting changes occur , its far too late in the film for them to have much affect . 
<s>  hard rains continuos corniness and lack of originality washes out whatever hope the script may have had ; and although its cast is somewhat appealing most of its stars act well below par . 
<s>  not at one stage capturing what could have been a fabulous on screen battle between slater and freeman , we are left to reminisce on films that dared to do something different and achieved more than what was expected . 
<s>  such titles as broken arrow ( slater and john travolta ) and face/off ( nicholas cage and john travolta ) come to mind as films that have mastered silver screen confrontations . 
<s>  strangely enough , they were both directed by john woo and both star john travolta . 
<s>  we can forgive morgan freeman for giving a slightly disappointing performance since he is newish to the action genre , but christian slater could have achieved so much more had the amount of crummy one liners been reduced and some personality added to his character . 
<s>  if you had asked me whether slater could perform well enough to substantially boost a movie prior to the release of broken arrow , my answer would have been a definite no . 
<s>  i now know that he has no excuse , and _can_ do better ( if you dont believe me rent a copy of broken arrow from your local video store ) . 
<s>  although hard rain never really works from the start , i somehow felt feelings of missed opportunity when the credits filled the screen . 
<s>  the addition of an enticing sub-plot would have given the film time to breathe , rather than try to cram 96 minutes of action and disaster into a story that cant handle anything else .

<s>   " some houses are born bad , " goes the haunting's tag line , to which i must add , " some movies , too . " 
<s>  nothing short of hiring a new cast , a more literate screenwriter , and a new director could have saved this tragically misguided adaptation of jackson's meritorious novel . 
<s>  the haunting is late entry summer dreck too slick to be creepy , and its seemingly endless stream of digital trickery and spooky ooky sound effects don't frighten so much as numb the audience into submission-the film is like a rube goldberg contraption rigged to shout " boo . " 
<s>  fragile nell ( taylor ) , bisexual theo ( zeta-jones ) , and smiley luke ( wilson ) are three insomniacs who gather at the reputedly possessed hill house for an extended study on sleep disorders , hosted by professor marrow ( neeson ) . 
<s>  marrow's secretly gathering data on their respective paranoid responses to his recount of hill house's bleak history . 
<s>  he's not prepared for the very real apparitions that terrorize the crew , nell especially , who has some ancestral connection to the manor's previous inhabitants . 
<s>  taylor is thoroughly insufferable in her first big-budget lead . 
<s>  for starters , her consistently dour expression sucks the life out of even the early scenes , when we're introduced to the mansion and all its fun-house trappings . 
<s>  her character is supposed to be depressed , having tended to an unloving mother for too many years , but taylor plays nell as supernaturally lame , alternately grouchy , mopey , wiggy and pathetic , and i kept wondering why the other characters didn't just ditch this bitch . 
<s>  as for the obscenely photogenic zeta-jones , she breezes through her scenes with a wink and a smile and takes the scenery with her . 
<s>  unfortunately , she's saddled with some of the most unlikely dialogue the screenplay has to offer . 
<s>  theo's assessment of the house ? 
<s>   " i love it ! 
<s>  sort of charles foster kane meets the munsters . " 
<s>  who on earth would say that in place of " citizen kane meets the munsters " ? 
<s>   ( furthermore , would you gladly spend a single night in a house befitting that description ? ) 
<s>  both actresses fare better than neeson , who looks embarrassed to be a part of this ensemble ( and for good reason ) , and his character is the most bland . 
<s>  as luke puts it , dr . marrow pulls the old " academic bait and switch " on his subjects , but he breaks down and confesses to this the second he's accused . 
<s>  later , he risks his life by climbing a crumbling stairwell to save nell ( it's amusing to hear neeson shout " nell " repeatedly , given his starring role in the 1994 jodie foster vehicle of the same name ) . 
<s>  why was this nice , helpful , and redemptive researcher so absent of ethics at the start ? 
<s>  the haunting was well designed by eugenio zanetti . 
<s>  his sets are obsessively detailed , and even before the cgi kicks in , they seem alive , never quite still . 
<s>  i do have one beef with this aspect of the production : the real life mansion used in exterior shots , nottinghamshire's harlaxton manor , is so vast that one has trouble believing that nell and company , no matter how much running away they do from ghosts and goblins , always finish up in locations that were established in act one , as if all the action has been confined to one wing of hill house . 
<s>  eighty million dollars was spent on the haunting , and despite a powerhouse box office debut , i doubt it will recoup its costs ( including marketing ) domestically .

<s>  his images , well-lit though they are , have an unmistakable been there-done that quality ; in fact , whole sequences , not to mention the cloaked , airy ghoul who owns the climax , feel lifted from a much smarter and infinitely more enjoyable spectacle from three summers back , peter jackson's the frighteners . 
<s>  i don't mean to suggest de bont is a plagiarist , i mean to suggest that he's a hack , having found no new ways to give us chills . 
<s>  play it to the bone is a punch-drunk mess of a movie . 
<s>  containing a good cast but awful acting ; an interesting premise but terrible execution , ron shelton ( white men can't jump ) gives us a rocky story with not one rocky but two .

<s>  the film is divided into two sections .

<s>  once in vegas , the movie settles down to the effectively staged fight sequences between vince and caesar .

<s>  because of the weak characters and the lack of screen chemistry between them , the film flounders with all the appeal of a dead fish until the boxing match actually begins . 
<s>  but even then , because the outcome is so predictably obvious , the suspense factor is negated and we are relegated to just watching two men pummel each other .

<s>  as it is , the scenes which require the characters to actually talk to one another are weak and laughable . 
<s>  the title is actually the most interesting aspect of the film . 
<s>  the phrase , " play it to the bone' is a reference to seeing something all the way through or not quitting until you've achieved your desired goal . 
<s>  that is a biblical principle . 
<s>   " know ye not that they which run in a race run all , but one receiveth the prize ? 
<s>  so run , that ye may obtain . " 
<s>  1 corinthians 9 : 24 [kjv] 
<s>  achieving anything worthy in life requires " playing it to the bone " . 
<s>  we need to develop fully persuaded mindsets and commitment levels in order to endure and persevere past the obstacles and distractions which lay between us and our stated objectives . 
<s>  this is true in practical matters of our physical lives as well as the in the developing maturity of our spiritual lives . 
<s>  as a movie , play it to the bone is hardly worth our time . 
<s>  but as a principle of life , the phrase " play it to the bone " are words to live by .

<s>  ving rhames also makes an appearance in this movie , and though he has great screen presence ( although so do connery and zeta-jones ) and the most interesting character in the film , not even he can rescue this film from the depths of the boring film abyss ( a concept i invented just to describe this picture ) .

<s>  i can picture amiel patting himself on the back , thinking to himself " it'll leave the audience wondering for days : how did he do that ? "

<s>  the ads for " batman and robin " scream " the event of the summer is here " and that's the problem . 
<s>  the producers were apparently so intent on creating a spectacle that they forgot to put an actual movie inside of it . 
<s>   " batman and robin " is 126 minutes of lavish sets , flashy costumes and big , confusing fight scenes with barely a hint of substance . 
<s>  it's like one of those cheesy kings island stage shows ; bright , busy and visually diverting , but not very much fun . 
<s>  it wasn't always this way . 
<s>  tim burton's " batman " was an epic story of obsession and duality , of darkness and revenge . 
<s>  the film , while far from perfect , was a striking mood piece with an otherworldly feel . 
<s>  batman was a creepy , brooding creature of the night . 
<s>  the joker , brilliantly overplayed by jack nicholson , was at once charismatic and repellent . 
<s>  batman and the joker were opposite sides of the same coin , battling inner demons and one another over gotham city's breathtaking gothic skyline . 
<s>  those days of the dark knight are gone , replaced by a psychedelic ice capades run amuck . 
<s>   " batman and robin " has far more in common with the campy 60's batman tv show than with tim burton's tale of darkness . 
<s>  the blame lies with director joel schumacher . 
<s>  a former window-dresser , schumacher is adept at decorating sets and dressing people in exotic costumes . 
<s>  unfortunately , when it comes time to have those people walk and talk , he hasn't the faintest notion of what to do . 
<s>   " batman and robin " is overstuffed with intricately choreographed fight scenes so poorly edited that it's often difficult to tell who's whacking who . 
<s>  while the characters flail at each other , one-liners and bad puns are tossed about like confetti . 
<s>  a few carefully placed jokes can set an action movie sailing , but too many wisecracks can undermine the momentum of a film . 
<s>   " batman and robin " doesn't merely lose momentum , it stalls out completely on several occasions . 
<s>  it's rare to see an action flick as sluggish as this one . 
<s>  ironically , the parts of " batman and robin " that work are the ones showing the characters in street clothing , and most of those succeed because of george clooney as bruce wayne . 
<s>  easily the best batman yet , clooney's expressive eyes and weary smile gives the character a sense of depth that the script doesn't even hint at .

<s>  alas , moments are simply that , moments , which are not enough to lift this fantasy/comedy above its one-joke premise . 
<s>  granted , that one joke is initially amusing . 
<s>  when wayans's darryl witherspoon , an economics major at stratford university , hits some dire financial straits , he becomes a guinea pig for a experimental drug that heightens all five senses .

<s>  at this point , the film sounds more like senseful than senseless , but through some turns of the plot , darryl finds himself only able to use four of his five senses at once , essentially leaving him--yes--senseless . 
<s>  this sets up some showcase moments for wayans's gift for physical comedy , especially when darryl loses his sense of feeling and his body goes completely , hilariously limp .

<s>  wayans approaches each go-round with gusto , but by this point he's simply treading water for the rest of the film's unfunny duration .

<s>  once his wb television sitcom the wayans bros . comes to an end , the genuinely funny marlon wayans has a promising big-screen future ahead of him .

<s>  there are very few aspects of the film that move the story and those that do don't make sense .

<s>  anyone with half a brain would be able to see that his intelligent flying automaton is worth billions . 
<s>  it's unbelievable that his lover ( well , probably not a lover -- after all this is disney ) starts dating croft after the aborted wedding . 
<s>  there's not one appealing component of this man . 
<s>  after the professor discovers that smearing a golf ball with the gunk causes it to bounce uncontrollably around his lab wreaking havoc , i cringed as he picked up a bowling ball . 
<s>  this guy is beyond forgetful , venturing into the certifiable . 
<s>  co-writer john hughes used to direct light-weight but thoughtful teen films . 
<s>  the care behind " pretty in pink " and " the breakfast club " all went out the window after his " home alone " franchise heated up the box offices . 
<s>  looking much like " home alone 3 1/2 " , " flubber " even features a couple of vapid goons who get banged around and a cute little boy who screams a lot . 
<s>  in some ways , it's difficult to judge this film . 
<s>  i have a suspicion that i'm not it's target audience . 
<s>  after all , i measure my age in two digits . 
<s>  ever watch a very young child try and tell a joke that is beyond his , or her , sophistication ? 
<s>  it's full of stops and starts and usually , the punch line is ruined . 
<s>  i felt the same way watching drowning mona . 
<s>  skip a stone across water and you approximate the depth of this attempt at an ensemble comedy . 
<s>  there are some slightly successful attempts at humor , but they only serve as window dressing . 
<s>  there is a running gag about the town , verplanck , n . y . , being a test town for the then new yugo . 
<s>  everyone drives a yugo , differentiating their cars with personalized license plates . 
<s>  even the police chief drives one . 
<s>  there is a certain sublimeness to the image of a lights and siren decked out yugo skittering its way through the town streets . 
<s>  there also is a running gag about one of the characters , jeff , missing a hand and how it occurred . 
<s>  it pokes gentle fun at the notion of urban legends . 
<s>  it turns out the truth is more horrifying than any legend . 
<s>  there are some sight gags that pop up as well , such as mona's tombstone , which reads " demoted " , instead of devoted . 
<s>  still , the core of the story maintains the flatness of a still pond . 
<s>  the lynchpin of the film falls on the redundant and sporadic scenes involving mona ( midler ) . 
<s>  each scene with her is the same : scream at someone , hit someone , then scream some more . 
<s>  there's no uniqueness or modulation to her or explanation for her meanness . 
<s>  anyone off the street could have played the role , such as it is . 
<s>  the other characters are walking cardboard cutouts . 
<s>  each one is defined by one trait and no further attempt is made at deeper characterization . 
<s>  there is a burly , female car mechanic , so of course , there is a forced lesbianism gag . 
<s>  mona's son , jeff ( marcus thomas ) is a simpleton , hence you can predict his dialogue before it even plods its way from his mouth . 
<s>  chief of police rash ( devito ) likes broadway musicals and loves his daughter . 
<s>  there's nothing more to him . 
<s>  elle , the chief's daughter ( campbell ) , is bland personified , a dutiful girl with no higher aspiration than to have a child and be married . 
<s>  mona's husband phil ( fichtner ) jeckle and hydes from shirking coward to reptilian letch . 
<s>  bob ( affleck ) , elle's betrothed , and business partner to jeff , is a mumbling , obvious dullard . 
<s>  there is no contrast to any of the characters . 
<s>  by having at least one character with some wit , or wits , to serve as counterpoint to the others , perhaps steinfeld's attempt at satirizing a small town infested with ambitionless people might have come off better . 
<s>  ostensibly a murder mystery , drowning mona gives you almost all the clues immediately , then lets you sit back and feel superior as you watch the cast of paper people fumble their way to finding the killer , who could be anyone due to mona's loving manner with everyone on town . 
<s>  even that aspect of the film fails , throwing in a convenient , ridiculous and unsatisfying wrap to things . 
<s>  it's been a while since i walked away from a movie theater in an angry mood . 
<s>  what makes it all the more remarkable is that i rarely remember a comedy making me so angry for wasting my time at it's ineptitude . 
<s>  what are we going to do with jim carrey ? 
<s>  viewers of television's " in living color " know this one-man cartoon from such characters as fire marshall bill . 
<s>  viewers also know that " in living color " is a skit-show and that a little of jim carrey goes a long way . 
<s>  unfortunately , this fact was forgotten by the makers of the carrey comedy ace ventura : pet detective . 
<s>  three writers , including carrey , worked on the slapstick story , which sends a self-styled " pet detective " on the trail of a stolen dolphin .

<s>  he leers and sneers , craning his neck to funny effect . 
<s>  he even does his captain kirk impersonation . 
<s>  again . 
<s>  all of this is pretty harmless stuff up until the point that you realize that the writers have absolutely no intention of focusing on anyone * other * than carrey . 
<s>   ( suggested alternate title--jim carrey : will do anything for a laugh . ) 
<s>  export it to france and you may have a hit . 
<s>  as it stands , ace ventura isn't even good kid's stuff . 
<s>  the profanity count , alone , is too high . 
<s>  which is ironic , since children are , probably , carrey's best audience . 
<s>  the film doesn't even have the goofball charm of chris elliott's recent no-brainer cabin boy . 
<s>  sure , carrey has his moments . 
<s>  but what can you say about a film whose high-points include watching carrey slink around to the theme from " mission impossible ? " 
<s>  ace ventura has one glaring incongruity . 
<s>  amid the butt-jokes and double-takes , the script takes great pains to set-up an elaborate and rather funny " crying game " gag . 
<s>  and , for * this * intended audience , that takes ( ahem ) cojones . 
<s>  there are some pretty impressive stars in lost in space - it's just that none of them happen to be actors . 
<s>  the stars i'm referring to are the computer generated ones that make up the movie's " outer space " ; the stars that the less impressive actors hurtle thru as they try to find their way home .

<s>  well , more like a falling star . 
<s>  kinda pretty , short-lived , and pretty much dead . 
<s>  lost in space , as if you really didn't know , is based on the 60's sci-fi television series of the same name . 
<s>  it's the year 2058 , and earth's precious resources are quickly being usurped by the needs of its massive population . 
<s>  john robinson ( william hurt ) is the scientist leading a mission program to colonize a foreign planet . 
<s>  earth's entire existance is contingent upon a successful mission , but nobody , whether it be john's family or hired battle pilot don west ( matt leblanc ) , seems too enthusiastic about leaving their home planet for several years . 
<s>  john's family consists of his wife maureen ( mimi rogers ) , his atypical teenage daughter penny ( lacey chabert ) , his ingenious son will ( jack johnson ) , and his beautiful scientist daughter judy ( heather graham ) . 
<s>  despite everyone's reluctance , the jupiter 2 spacecraft abandons planet earth and makes its way into the vast eternity of space . 
<s>  unknown to anyone but the audience , there is an evil doctor stowaway determined to sabotage the entire mission . 
<s>  dr . smith ( gary oldman ) has been hired by a group of rebel conspirators to turn the expedition sour , and dr . smith has re-programmed a talking robot to " destroy robinson family " ! 
<s>  when everything that could go wrong does go wrong for both sides , the spaceship is warped to an unknown destination , and now the premise of being lost in space is complete . 
<s>  as for the audience , you will likely be lost in boredom by this point , wondering if the plot , like the jupiter 2 , will ever get off the ground . 
<s>  it's hard to tell who deserves the most blame - the incredibly bland and corny characters or the horrifically lame script ? 
<s>  chabert is basically the only one to overdo it , sounding like a whiny munchkin on helium . 
<s>  if you , like me , were convinced by commercials that her voice was altered for some sort of plot twist where her body would be taken over by aliens , you're wrong ! 
<s>  that's just her normal voice ! 
<s>  in yet another example of a " friend " faltering on the big screen , leblanc is so incredibly dull and yet so obviously trying so hard to be so incredibly charming ( make sense ? ) , it makes you want to shove his ass out the escape pod corridor without an escape pod . 
<s>  graham is a babe - thank goodness there was something for me to think about during this film . 
<s>  hurt , the black hole of excitement , sucks up any energy that might have been left . 
<s>  if hurt were available in tablet form , he would be a prescription strength sleeping pill . 
<s>  johnson isn't dull , he's just lame as the young know it all who winds up saving everybody's ass all the time . 
<s>  want an example of how cool this kid can be ? 
<s>  how about when he convinces the robot to think with its heart and reconsider killing the family ? 
<s>  hey , don't laugh - the thing actually listened to the mr . rogers-would-be-proud sentiment . 
<s>  but alas , if you thought a character couldn't be much worse , there was rogers as the epitome of generic ( or , mother as she was known ) . 
<s>  why hire an actress ? 
<s>  they could've had a white cardboard cutout with the word mom printed on it . 
<s>  now that would've had some pizzazz ! 
<s>  lost in space luckily doesn't suffer in every single category that it could have . 
<s>  the special effects are crisp , clear , and at least mildly captivating , unlike any of the presences onscreen save it be oldman , who plays his evil character with a great deal of fun and finesse . 
<s>  unfortunately , oldman is locked away for most of the film , giving us nothing but ample mocking opportunities to enjoy . 
<s>  while the special effects are pleasing to the eye , they are nothing you couldn't find in most modern sci-fi films . 
<s>  contact , for example , far exceeds this film in terms of imagery and imagination . 
<s>  lost in space just has too many shortcomings to ever be considered a work of cinematic art , with numerous contradictions ( the time travel aspect was horribly flawed ! ) , wooden and corny acting , worse dialogue , and an ending so disappointing , you'd be happier to have seen the entire robinson family get blown to smithereens . 
<s>  then again , with an ending like this film has , it's obvious a sequel is already being considered . 
<s>  what an awful note to end on , knowing there could be more of this in a year or two . 
<s>  the attempt to be family oriented is commendable , but lost in space is lost with the illusion that special effects and the nostalgia of a classic tv series being revisited is enough to satisfy all age groups . 
<s>  well , danger potential movie goers ! 
<s>  danger ! 
<s>  this movie crash lands without ever breaking thru the atmosphere of mediocrity . 
<s>  so , it's thirty years later , and oscar and felix are together again . 
<s>  that might have been an exciting notion if it wasn't for the fact that the " odd couple " of jack lemmon and walter matthau have been reunited in several recent movies : 1993's " grumpy old men , " 1995's " grumpier old men , " and 1997's " out to sea " ( i . e . 
<s>   " grumpiest old men " ) . 
<s>  so , " the odd couple ii " ( i . e . 
<s>   " the grumpiest old men of all , really " ) seems just another entry in a tired series . 
<s>  the plot is even similar to that of " grumpy old men " in that lemmon and matthau's mismatched characters are brought together by a romance between their children . 
<s>  oscar's son ( jonathan silverman ) and felix's daughter ( lisa waltz ) are getting married , and former roommates felix ungar ( lemmon ) and oscar madison ( matthau ) meet at the airport and decide to share a car . 
<s>   . 
<s>   . 
<s>  then hilarity ensues . 
<s>  well , a few chuckles ensue anyway . 
<s>  neil simon , the award-winning playwright who created oscar and felix , provides the screenplay , which is a shock , because the script is a piece of talentless hackwork from beginning to end . 
<s>  unlike the original play/movie , " odd couple ii " doesn't find its humor in the personality conflict of its characters . 
<s>  instead , it depends upon a series of humorous situations : oscar and felix lose the car over a cliff , are caught smuggling mexicans over the border , take up with two women on the run from their violent husbands ( the women are played by christine baranski of " cybill " and jean smart of " designing women " ) , and hitch a ride with a man who dies in the desert . 
<s>  the original 1968 movie " the odd couple " remains a classic comedy . 
<s>  it introduced the motif of roommate-as-spouse that has provided gags for movies and sitcoms ever since . 
<s>  it was the second outing for the lemmon/matthau team ( which debuted in 1966's " the fortune cookie " ) , and they made a couple more worthwhile comedies , " the front page " ( 1974 ) and " buddy buddy " ( 1981 ) , before going their separate ways . 
<s>  the reunion of lemmon and matthau in " grumpy old men " six years ago was delightful , and its sequel seemed appropriate because it tied up some loose ends from the first movie . 
<s>  but " out to sea " and " the odd couple ii " are just beating a grumpy old horse . 
<s>   ( you can add lemmon's " my fellow americans , " i . e . 
<s>   " grumpy old presidents , " to that list , too . ) 
<s>  let's hope that hollywood offers these two actors something fresh to do . 
<s>  let's hope also that we see neil simon's name on movies that do it justice ( this is his first since 1993's " lost in yonkers " ) . 
<s>  except for a few bright moments of good verbal comedy , that old feeling is embarrassing to sit through . 
<s>  bette midler and dennis farina play lilly and dan , actress and author , once married , now violently divorced , and back together one last time for their daughter molly's ( paula marshall ) wedding . 
<s>  lilly and dan hate each other passionately -- so passionately that they have sex at the wedding and fall in love again . 
<s>  each ditches his or her current spouse of 14 years and runs off with the other . 
<s>  molly , married now only 24 hours , runs off in search of her irresponsible parents while her husband keith ( jamie denton ) tries to console the abandoned spouses . 
<s>  in molly's search for her parents , she somehow falls in love with lilly's paparazzo joey ( danny nucci ) . 
<s>  meanwhile , the newlywed keith ends up consoling dan's wife rowena ( gail o'grady ) in bed . 
<s>  the audience i saw this with apparently thought that all the adultery was hilarious . 
<s>  i'm no dan quayle , but i thought it was a bit creepy . 
<s>  the message seemed to be " ignore your responsibilities unrepentantly and have fun fucking who you wish . " 
<s>   " family values " aside , there's something cruel about all this . 
<s>  perhaps this movie would have played well as a black comedy , but the movie is a romantic comedy . 
<s>  we are supposed to be rooting for these creeps . 
<s>  reiner and screenwriter leslie dixon tried to make it easier on us by making the victims unlikeable . 
<s>  lilly's husband is a new-age flake who rambles about " emotional valet parking , " so we can write him off as irrelevant . 
<s>  dan's wife is vain , manipulative , and jealous so we can write her off as a bitch . 
<s>  molly's husband is a career-conscious , self-centered republican politician who thinks she's too fat ( and just for good measure , he also fucked dan's wife ) , so we can write him off as a prick . 
<s>  everyone else falls in love . 
<s>  but still , that somehow doesn't justify the actions of the movie's main characters . 
<s>   " he's a prick " or " she's a bitch " is no defense . 
<s>  the movie is somewhat redeemed by some funny dialog -- often during heated arguments -- and by above-average performances by midler and farina ( breaking out of his character-actor mold ) . 
<s>  other than that , it's a standard romantic comedy with a very substandard gimmick .

<s>  a film review by michael redman copyright 2000 by michael redman 
<s>  there's a world of difference between artists and technicians . 
<s>  the artist has a vision to create something new . 
<s>  he may not do it well , it might be sloppy , but it's something you've never seen before . 
<s>  a good technician can make it look good , but without direction from his own inner artist or someone else , it's going to be just a xerox . 
<s>  obviously successful films need both skills . 
<s>  brian de palma is a masterful technician . 
<s>  he's spent his career copying others , most notably hitchcock . 
<s>  he usually knows exactly what to do to make a scene work , but only because he has learned it by rote . 
<s>  aside from rare flashes of originality , his films are often soul-dead . 
<s>  in de palma's latest , he turns his attention to stanley kubrick . 
<s>  to tell the truth , i enjoyed portions of this movie , but i liked it a lot better over 30 years ago when it was called " 2001 " . 
<s>  i enjoyed it even more when it was titled " close encounters " . 
<s>  nasa has set its sights for mars . 
<s>  when the first crew meets with disaster , a rescue mission is sent to the red planet . 
<s>  they don't do so well either , but eventually meet up the lone surviving astronaut-gone-rasta and solve the mysteries of the universe . 
<s>  and it's all so boring . 
<s>  there are so many scenes that just don't work , it's difficult to begin . 
<s>  when the first crew is a few feet away from a raging massive upside-down martian tornado ( which looks remarkably like a sandworm from " dune " ) destroying everything in its path , they just hang out watching . 
<s>  error . 
<s>  the most interesting character ( and that's not saying much ) is killed off . 
<s>  error . 
<s>  the alien is laughable . 
<s>  error . 
<s>  the rest of the characters are the dullest people imaginable . 
<s>  error . 
<s>  there's some nice eyecandy . 
<s>  the face on mars , which turns out to be a giant metal thai buddha head , looks cool . 
<s>  a three-dimensional holographic planetarium is more fun to watch than anything at disney world . 
<s>  maneuvering in space suits outside the ship seems realistic . 
<s>  but there's so much more that feels as if we've been there before . 
<s>  from " 2001 " , there's the rotating space station , the blinding white room . 
<s>  >from " close encounters " , they solve a sound puzzle and play it to the aliens . 
<s>  the list goes on . 
<s>  the actors are mostly mobile wooden statues . 
<s>  even gary sinise and tim robbins can't muster enough emotion to convince us they are breathing .

<s>  you won't either . 
<s>  the absolutely worst sin is the blatant product placement as dr . pepper , with a 20 foot tall logo , saves the day . 
<s>  they should save the commercials for those insipid bits before the film . 
<s>  mulholland drive did very well at the cannes film festival . 
<s>  as you can see from the rating it did not do very well from me at the toronto international film festival . 
<s>  it may not be clear to the viewer why i am so negative on this film for most of the running time . 
<s>  in fact it is an interesting mystery story told on the backdrop of the hollywood film industry . 
<s>  toward the end of the film i think everything that has been built falls apart . 
<s>  the film was to be a pilot for a tv series but writer and director david lynch did not sell his tv pilot and i think he decided that he wanted to do something else with it . 
<s>  something else is what he did . 
<s>  the film opens with a woman ( played by laura harring ) about to be killed in a car when a car crash saves her life . 
<s>  she crawls away from the accident with a concussion and finds herself a bungalow with an unlocked door to sleep . 
<s>  meanwhile young vivacious betty ( naomi watts ) arrives in hollywood from canada . 
<s>  she wants to build a career as an actress . 
<s>  betty is a little surprised to find a woman sleeping in the borrowed bungalow . 
<s>  she does not know who the woman is . 
<s>  she is even more surprised when the woman awakes and does not herself know who she is . 
<s>  they fix on a name rita for her , but are not sure if this right or not . 
<s>  meanwhile local director adam kesher ( justin theroux ) has problems of his own . 
<s>  he is trying to cast one actress for his new film and is getting pressure from the producers and from crime figures to cast someone else , cammie rhodes ( melissa george ) . 
<s>  these two threads are joined by a third one in which there is a strange and comic murder that goes terribly wrong . 
<s>  there is also a strange character called the cowboy ( monty montgomery ) adding to the confusion . 
<s>  in what was probably intended for the television pilot the film opens with a great vibrancy showing dancing 60s style under the credits . 
<s>  a lot of mulholland drive starts out fun . 
<s>  lynch wants you to know he could make an enjoyable stylish film . 
<s>  he just chooses not to . 
<s>  as with any david lynch film there is strange material added for little reason . 
<s>  there are no earthworms , but there are some decidedly strange david lynch touches . 
<s>  the film is a little long for the subject matter . 
<s>  toward the end it gets into some heavier violence and sex scenes , clearly not intended for the tv pilot . 
<s>  unfortunately some of the most important comments to make about this film would be spoilers . 
<s>  i will not mention them in the main body of the review but i give mulholland drive a 4 on the 0 to 10 scale and a low 0 on the -4 to +4 scale . 
<s>  mulholland drive spoiler warning . 
<s>  i have rated this film fairly low . 
<s>  you should read this only after seeing the film or deciding that you will not see the film . 
<s>  david lynch is in large part a dark satirist . 
<s>  most of his work is done in familiar genres but in some way shows their underside . 
<s>  in mulholland drive i think he is having a laugh at the expense of the crime film genre . 
<s>  what he does with this film is ( are you sure you want to read this ? ) 
<s>  playing off the audience expectations that there will be a simple explanation for what is going on . 
<s>  the first 80% of the film he tells a simple multi-thread crime story with clues sprinkled throughout . 
<s>  then suddenly at the end he turns the story on its ear with a large number of clues that appear that they should add up to something . 
<s>  the audience expectation is that they will add up . 
<s>  but he has given clues that are self-contradictory . 
<s>  lynch wants the audience to argue about what they have seen afterward and come up with theories . 
<s>  in fact , the pointers are noticeably contradictory and until i hear a better explanation , i think lynch is merely playing a joke . 
<s>  there is a visual curiosity that was popular in the sixties . 
<s>  mad magazine called it a poiuyt . 
<s>  other sources called it a tri- pronged u-bar . 
<s>  look at small portions of it and makes sense . 
<s>  look at the whole figure and it does not . 
<s>  this film is , in my estimation , the cinematic equivalent of a tri-pronged u-bar . 
<s>  ingredients : possessed plastic dolls in love , plastic dolls having sex 
<s>  starring : jennifer tilly , voice of brad dourif , katherine heigl , nick stabile , john ritter 
<s>  synopsis : this is the fourth film in the chucky series , which debuted in the late 1980s . 
<s>  basically , chucky is a plastic doll that can walk and talk because it is possessed by the spirit of a slain murderer . 
<s>  in bride of chucky , chucky's longtime girlfriend tiffany ( jennifer tilly ) dies and her spirit inhabits a female plastic doll through voodoo . 
<s>  dolls tiffany and chucky get married and embark on a quest to reach a cemetery in new jersey , where a mystical gem might enable them to be humans . 
<s>  the dolls stow away in the back of a vehicle driven by a newly eloped couple , so in the side plot , the couple suspects each other of being a murderer . 
<s>  opinion : bride of chucky is an attempt at horror with humor , but doesn't succeed . 
<s>  somehow , chucky moaning about mid life crisis , and how he should have gotten married does not make for a very scary chucky . 
<s>  and tiffany harping about mid life crisis , and how she should have gotten married does not make for a very scary tiffany . 
<s>  the suspenseless bride of chucky relies mostly on jennifer tilly's cleavage to keep attention during the first half , and on occasional puns to keep attention during the second half . 
<s>  the best that can be said about bride of chucky is that it is sarcastic . 
<s>  watching the movie , i vowed to subtract half a star from the review because the filmmakers included a saccharine syrup , cute 'n cuddly , computer-generated monkey . 
<s>  if the monkey died , the movie got an extra half star . 
<s>  alas , the monkey showed up at the end , unharmed , to the wet sickly sound of gagging and rolling eyeballs . 
<s>  what that means is that lost in space actually deserved 2 stars . 
<s>  that's pretty generous , considering the movie's camp lacked any hint of tongue in cheek . 
<s>  when will robinson ( jack johnson ) teaches his pet robot about friendship , you are actually supposed to buy it . 
<s>  so why such a seemingly high rating ? 
<s>  there are a few reasons that made me unable to throw away the experience with the garbage . 
<s>  first , we saw the movie on opening night of the first day of operation of a brand new theater . 
<s>  the sound and screen kicked ass . 
<s>  nobody in the country enjoyed the movie as much as my audience did ( and i don't necessarily mean that in a good way ) . 
<s>  also , there were more than zero scenes where i found myself rooting for the robinsons , or getting caught up in the movie's tension . 
<s>  i even liked the computer-generated settings . 
<s>  i usually prefer to see models or sets , but the cg was more detailed than i've seen in a lot of movies ; it looks like someone spent a little overtime to render some of the futuristic cities . 
<s>  also , gary oldman is never a bad actor , even though he is typecast as a villain . 
<s>  william hurt isn't too bad either . 
<s>  neither actor had a great role , but their performances were watchable . 
<s>  and perhaps i shouldn't admit this , but something about the tone and outlook of the movie brought me back to my childhood . 
<s>  there is very little swearing or blood ; there is a strong moral message , saccharine though it is ; there is a bit of romance ( whose culmination after 2 hours is a " real " kiss -- no sex ) . 
<s>  it felt like one of those disney movies that i so looked forward to when i was six . 
<s>  those movies were probably as bad as lost in space , but at the time , they were manna from heaven . 
<s>  that type of moviemaking is a lost art . 
<s>  now for the bad news . 
<s>  worst and most unforgivable was the incredibly bad dialogue . 
<s>  it's squeaky-clean , family fun , trying hard to be as hip as pulp fiction . 
<s>   " you better hold on to your joystick , " is one such line . 
<s>  and when a robinson is called upon to deliver a line about warp conduit thingamajigs , they inevitably stumble badly enough to embarrass even the lowliest star trek ensign . 
<s>  second worst , and closely related , is the screenplay . 
<s>  the story's exposition takes place at a press conference , which allows the writers to explain what's happening with the least amount of creativity , effort , or interest . 
<s>  once the story gets going , i do concede a momentary burst of interest once in a while , but on the whole , the situations that arise are silly and contrived . 
<s>  when gary oldman easily reprograms will's pet robot to kill the robinsons , my friend summed it up perfectly : " he flipped the switch to 'evil . ' " 
<s>  then there's the tone of the movie . 
<s>  the colorado daily said the film would have been more interesting if the central character was will robinson and not his father john robinson . 
<s>  then it could be an adventure movie . 
<s>  they're mostly right , except that johnson ( will ) wasn't a good enough actor to carry it off . 
<s>  still , that the film has the robinson patriarch as our hero shows a lack of imagination . 
<s>  just because a movie is tame enough for kids doesn't mean that we have to bow to a " promise keepers " notion of who's the center of a family .

<s>  the camera zooms in incredibly close . 
<s>  it focuses on the closed eyes of a person presumed dead . 
<s>  all of a sudden , with a thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse , his eyelids open . 
<s>  the camera zooms in incredibly close . 
<s>  it focuses on one of the characters desperately running for her life . 
<s>  then , with a thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse , she bumps into the killer . 
<s>  the camera zooms in incredibly close . 
<s>  it focuses on a door from where seemingly strange sounds emanate . 
<s>  all of a sudden , with a thunderous sound effect and an eerie sounding musical pulse , the doors swing open to reveal what's inside . 
<s>  close-up thrill-shots such as these seemed to elicit more laughter from the audience rather than genuine fear , which is a pretty good sign that you're not watching the thriller that the director had originally envisioned . 
<s>  rather , you adopt the opinion that the characters are so goofy and so unaware of the trouble that they're in , that you stop caring about who lives , who dies and where the story goes . 
<s>  instead , you become more interested in how the characters get killed off . 
<s>  the four young teenagers who are the potential sacrificial lambs for this movie are helen and barry and julie and ray - two couples and dear friends to one another . 
<s>  during the summer just after high school graduation , they take a fateful drive down a dark mountain highway . 
<s>  suddenly , without warning , their car hits someone whom the teens presume was killed as a result of that collision . 
<s>  fearing jail time and possible manslaughter charges if they confess , they instead decide to dump the body into the ocean and make a pact never to discuss the episode again .

<s>  and apparently , neither can someone else . 
<s>  someone begins to send letters to all four of the teens with the frightening message : " i know what you did last summer . "

<s>  as with any gen-x mtv movie ( like last year's dead man on campus ) , the movie is marketed for a primarily male audience as indicated by its main selling points : sex and football .

<s>  he got a paycheck from jerry bruckheimer last year for the rock , and if there's one thing you can count on from a bruckheimer production ( even without his late partner don simpson ) , it's that you can count on seeing everything you saw in the _last_ bruckheimer production .
