<s>  in the rock , cage appeared to be having the time of his life jumping into the action fray for the first time . 
<s>  that sense of discovery has been replaced by a wry self-awareness . 
<s>  while the plot of con air finds poe a parolee on board a hijacked prison transport plane whose goal is just to get home , cage's goal is different but just as simple : to get out of the film with some measure of dignity intact . 
<s>  audiences , too , should know what they're getting themselves into with a bruckheimer production . 
<s>  in fact , the marketing people are counting on it . 
<s>  no one who loathed the rock for its swear-grunt-blast repetitiveness will be converted by con air ; no one who loved the rock for exactly the same reasons will be dissuaded . 
<s>  director simon west ( yet another tv commercial auteur plucked by bruckheimer from the advertising equivalent of the schwab's soda fountain ) delivers exactly the kind of adrenaline/testosterone cocktail which could launch an endocrinology lecture ( it's perversely appropriate that one sympathetic con spends most of the flight nearing a diabetic coma ; like insulin , con air does the work of a gland ) . 
<s>  what he doesn't deliver is a moment of suspense . 
<s>  a bruckheimer film has no use for hitchcock's notion that showing you the bomb under the desk creates a more interesting scene than just blowing up the desk ; a really , _really_ big desk and a really , _really_ big bomb will serve the purpose nicely . 
<s>  if either west or bruckheimer were interested in genuine tension , they might have done something with con air's creepiest set-up .

<s>  in fact , con air usually opts for too much of something when the tiniest measure of restraint would have been an improvement -- too many characters , too much editing , too many dopey punch lines , too much of the cheap , ugly appeals to machismo which characterize too many bruckheimer efforts . 
<s>  it is that kind of exhausting excess to which cage is responding with his detached performance . 
<s>  while malkovich goes for the outrageous and john cusack ( as a u . s . marshal ) goes for earnest , cage looks like he just wants to go to sleep . 
<s>  his recycled raising arizona performance is a means of escape , his chase after a stuffed bunny a continuation of his pursuit of that big box of huggies . 
<s>  it doesn't bode well for cage's appearance in face/off later this month ; perhaps he already realizes that all he can do in action films is more of the same over and over .

<s>  after making " mission : impossible " , brian de palma has a lot to live up to . 
<s>  by making an epic science fiction and inviting great cast and talented crew , he hopes to reach the modern audience . 
<s>  and the possibilities are certainly there , but the result is a great disaster . 
<s>  starting in a near future , with a prologue copied from " apollo 13 " , de palma slowly builds up his " story " .

<s>  but de palma manages to do that . 
<s>  it is not a very good achievement . 
<s>  as we follow this expedition to mars and watch them slowly float in space , the hardest thing to do is stay awake . 
<s>  the film's major problem is that it tries to seem more clever than it is . 
<s>  david mamet's dialogue , while trying to seem natural , is distant and simply fake .

<s>  the result is more like an unsuccessful mutation of kubrick's " 2001 : a space odyssey " , " apollo 13 " and " godzilla " .

<s>  sometimes it gets so cheesy , that you'll start laughing when you're supposed to cry and cry when you're supposed to laugh .

<s>  sure , there are plenty of pop star film vehicles out there -- from the beatles' a hard day's night to the spice girls' spice world -- but none have been so vapidly pointless or laughable as glitter .

<s>  patch adams a film review by michael redman copyright 1999 by michael redman 
<s>  mediocrity is a pox on civilization . 
<s>  in our heavily consumer oriented society , there is an enormous demand to churn out " stuff . " 
<s>  what would happen to our economy if we didn't feel the need to have more things ? 
<s>  to make us buy more , businesses need to produce a ton of product . 
<s>  the sheer volume of items necessitates that most of them are of dubious quality . 
<s>  the film industry is like any other . 
<s>  in order for studios to survive , they have to make money . 
<s>  the prevailing attitude is that more films equal more profit . 
<s>  some movies obviously exist only to put wares on the screen and to do that , less talented people are used . 
<s>  there aren't enough great directors and actors to create the number of films necessary . 
<s>  for some reason , it's never crossed anyone's mind that the real equation is quality films = more profit . 
<s>  often , mediocre films are more of a pain for the audience than the horrendous ones . 
<s>  at you can have a good time making fun of bad movies . 
<s>  i'm not suggesting that " patch adams " was tossed out just to rake in the bucks . 
<s>  my guess is that someone was asleep at the wheel . 
<s>  it features an accomplished actor and a potentially engrossing story , but it's as dull as could be . 
<s>  hunter " patch " adams' ( robin williams ) desire to become a doctor has an unusual genesis . 
<s>  checking himself into a mental institute after a suicide attempt , he discovers that he can help the other patients by clowning around . 
<s>  patch could be a poster boy for co-dependency . 
<s>  he explains that he likes devoting himself to others because then he doesn't focus on his own problems . 
<s>  he decides that he wants to be a physician , leaves the place and a couple of years later enrolls in the medical college of virginia . 
<s>  as a med student , patch's antics at the school's hospital catch the attention of his soon to be arch-enemy , straight-laced dean walcott ( bob gunton ) . 
<s>  the dean is so opposed to the goofiness that he wants patch kicked out of school although he's one of the top students . 
<s>  he writes in patch's academic file that he shows " excessive happiness . " 
<s>  i walked into the film knowing little about its history and wondered about its odd mechanical pacing . 
<s>  there also seemed to be no reason that it is set in the early seventies . 
<s>  then it struck me . 
<s>  it must be based on a true story . 
<s>  the movie is an adaptation of a book by hunter adams who founded the gesundheit institute , a free clinic . 
<s>  robin williams is an amazing actor . 
<s>  while he is adept at dramatic roles , his forte is over-the-top free spirits . 
<s>  that's what makes his failure here so remarkable . 
<s>  patch is exactly the character he should be best at , yet even the scene where he and another mental patient are battling fierce imaginary squirrels falls flat . 
<s>  something holds him back . 
<s>  most of the rest of the cast is two-dimensional . 
<s>  for a film that champions seeing patients as human beings , it's curious that the ones here are cardboard characters . 
<s>  peter coyote as a man dying of cancer is refreshing because he seems like a real person . 
<s>  unfortunately he's in the film for only about two minutes . 
<s>  the audience is blatantly lead by a ring in its nose from scene to scene . 
<s>  we're not left to our own emotional decisions : we're hit over the head with them . 
<s>  shaved-headed children with cancer , an elderly woman whom patch makes laugh , a beautiful woman who can't love because of her abusive history . 
<s>  when a group of students fix up an old house to use as a clinic in the andy hardy " hey , let's put on a play ! 
<s>  we can use the barn and my mom can make the curtains ! " 
<s>  mode , they laugh and roll around while painting each other . 
<s>  there might as well be giant signs flashing : " feel good now ! " 
<s>   " feel bad now ! " 
<s>   " patch " is a good title for the film . 
<s>  it is a patchwork of every manipulative scene you can think of . 
<s>  the full-of-life student fights stodgy establishment types . 
<s>  there's a touching death . 
<s>  then there's another . 
<s>  the film doesn't trust us to get it the first time . 
<s>  the dean tries to kick patch out and later he tries again . 
<s>  worst of all is the final courtroom bit . 
<s>  scary-looking old men sit in judgment of a man who only wants to help people . 
<s>  the room is packed with patch's supporters . 
<s>  williams makes a supposedly impassioned speech about the humanity of all . 
<s>  it has as much emotion as his earlier statement " humans are the only animal that kills members of its own species " contains truth . 
<s>  most of the blame must be placed with the director tom shadyac and screenwriter steve oedekerk . 
<s>  shadyac also directed the first " ace ventura " movie . 
<s>  oedekerk directed the second one . 
<s>  need i say more ? 
<s>  the real adams is to be admired for his devotion to treating patients as people rather than diseases . 
<s>  the film has a number of worthy messages about the state of the modern medical business with hmos and managed care . 
<s>  the " doctors are not gods " theme will resonate with a number of people , but it's so poorly produced that no one will care . 
<s>  young einstein is embarrassingly lame , but that didn't stop it from becoming a phenomenon in australia , where it became the third largest box office hit of all time . 
<s>  in the u . s . , warner brothers is hoping the movie will follow in the footsteps of paul hogan , inxs , and shrimp on the barby to become the latest rage from down under . 
<s>  personally , i'm hoping americans everywhere will rise to the occasion and make young einstein a box office bomb . 
<s>  young einstein sprang from the twisted mind of yahoo serious , who not only wrote , produced , edited , and directed the film , but also starred and did his own stunts . 
<s>  his creation is about as stupid and contrived as you'd expect from someone named yahoo . 
<s>  the movie takes substantial historical liberties in recreating einstein's youth . 
<s>  whereas the scientist actually hailed from germany , the film finds him still living with his parents on tasmania , a remote australian island . 
<s>  in addition to deriving the formula for energy and the theory of relativity , albert invents surfing , bubbles in beer , and the electric guitar . 
<s>  yahoo plays einstein as a naive and unrefined country hick--a clown with an insatiable curiosity . 
<s>  although yahoo's performance is at first endearing , the one-dimensional characterization loses its novelty faster than you can say e=mc2 . 
<s>  yahoo has created a charming family for albert , and the scenes on tasmania are often clever . 
<s>  but after the first twenty minutes , the movie quickly plummets and degenerates into a poor excuse for a comedy . 
<s>  young einstein is hampered by its lethargic pace and inane plot . 
<s>  yahoo must be an mtv addict because his movie features an omnipresent soundtrack ; unfortunately , the music is altogether gratuitous and quickly becomes overbearing . 
<s>  almost every other scene includes a blaring rock song that leaves you wondering whether you are watching a movie or a music video . 
<s>  the instrumental score , on the other hand , is generally playful ; yahoo uses such classics as the " 1812 overture " and the theme from the good , the bad and the ugly to great comic effect . 
<s>  halfway through young einstein , i knew for sure the movie was a stinker . 
<s>  but it wasn't until the very end that i finally put my finger on why : the comedy takes its roots not from whimsical film fantasies ( such as young sherlock holmes ) but from cheesy prime-time sitcoms . 
<s>  in fact , young einstein might have been more at home on network television , where its sophomoric humor wouldn't raise any eyebrows . 
<s>  this is the last carry on film with its almost intact regular cast and it is the swansong of hattie jacques and sid james . 
<s>  dick turpin ( sid james ) and his gang which includes harriett/harry ( barbara windsor ) and tom " doc " scholl ( peter butterworth ) , terrorise the countryside by staging highway robberies : " stand and deliver ! " 
<s>  owing to the increased occurrence of turpin's robberies , captain desmond fancey of the bow street runners ( kenneth williams ) and his sidekick sergeant jock strapp ( jack douglas ) visit turpin's area of influence to bring him to justice . 
<s>  they are under the express orders of sir roger daley ( bernard bresslaw ) . 
<s>  their intellect does not count for much and when they increasingly become suspicious of reverend flasher aka dick turpin ( sid james ) , whom they confided in earlier , they still cannot believe that the rector has any part in these robberies . 
<s>  however , once they catch harriett and put her in jail , and sir roger daley takes complete charge , it seems that there is no hope for dick turpin . 
<s>  then again , sir roger has assigned the dimwits fancey and jock strapp aswell as the old dithering constable ( kenneth connor ) to keep an eye on their prisoner ! 
<s>  there is no doubt that this is a 'sid james' carry on movie . 
<s>  he excels in double roles ( as in 'carry on- don't lose your head' ) and his performance as flasher and turpin is hilarious . 
<s>  barbara windsor is also funny as harriett the sex mad housemaid and member of the gang , and hattie jacques' small but effective role as the rector's housekeeper martha hoggett is played to perfection . 
<s>  jack douglas plays a milder version of his excruciatingly annoying on-screen persona and kenneth williams is given a rather mundane part . 
<s>  peter butterworth is not allowed to shine in his boring performance as tom , and bernard bresslaw's character appears only briefly in the film . 
<s>  the only notable performance from the support cast comes from joan sims as madame desiree , who is travelling around the country escorting her starlets the 'birds of paradise' and sporting a fake french accent . 
<s>  when her girls and her are robbed by turpin , she is determined to catch him and helps the reverend to find the culprit ! 
<s>  a carry on by the numbers , this movie is only notable for the great performance by sid james in his last carry on movie . 
<s>  the jokes are bluer , the script is poorer ( it is the last script written by talbot rothwell ) , but the music is a marked improvement . 
<s>  although nearly all the regulars appear , they seem to be just going through the motions . 
<s>  none of the high spirits of the earlier films are apparent here . 
<s>  just a selection of crude jokes and repititive double-entendres . 
<s>  one of the first films of 1999 is this mtv pictures release which marks the first leading feature role for james van der beek , the star of the wb's runaway hit dawson's creek . 
<s>  following in the foot steps of mtv's two other live action films , joe's apartment ( 1996 ) and dead man on campus ( 1998 ) , varsity blues is a bad film and is unlikely to cause much of a sensation in the marketplace . 
<s>  set in west cannan , texas , the film examines the small town obsession with high school football through the eyes of second string quarterback john " mox " moxon ( van der beek ) . 
<s>  we know he's smart because he reads kurt vonnegut instead of the playbook . 
<s>  coach bud kilmer ( jon voight ) has been around so long there is actually a bronze statue commemorating him . 
<s>  the star quarterback , lance harbor ( paul walker ) , is a handsome , blonde , hero who has his own billboard in his front yard and dates the sexy head cheerleader , darcy ( ali larter ) . 
<s>  also on the team are an enormous guy ( ron lester ) with some health problems and the token african-american team member ( eliel swinton ) whose only real dialogue scene deals directly with the color of his skin . 
<s>  when lance is seriously injured , mox gets his chance to shine and he runs with it , undermining kilmer with his unusual playing strategies . 
<s>  his relationship with his dutiful girlfriend , jules ( amy smart ) , is threatened and there's a big game at the end . 
<s>  guess who wins ? 
<s>  nothing about varsity blues is inspired and the whole film simply moves through the sort of conventional motions that coach kilmer would love . 
<s>  there's a chance for some smart satire on small town obsessions but the humor here is decidedly lowbrow . 
<s>  van der beek does a decent job of carrying his first film although a silly accent trips him up sometimes . 
<s>  also , the role isn't very much of a stretch from his dawson leary character . 
<s>  he's still a pseudo-intellectual , whiny , nice guy , except here he also happens to be a jock . 
<s>  voight is a terror as he chews up every single piece of scenery and spits it out . 
<s>  the other adults are all notably awful while the younger performers don't fare much better . 
<s>  on the positive side , walker is a charismatic actor who is due for a breakout role following this and his supporting turn in pleasantville ( 1998 ) . 
<s>  scott ( son of james ) caan has some lively moments as tweeder , the team's wild man . 
<s>  larter , as a gorgeous seductress looking for a one way ticket out of texas , gets to show off the film's most interesting costumes , including a very eye-opening " whipped cream bikini . " 
<s>  it's interesting to note that the film definitely earns its r-rating with a lot of harsh language , alcohol abuse and an unusually high amount of nudity ( including a gratuitous trip to a strip bar that reveals a not very surprising surprise ) . 
<s>  all this is likely to come as a shock to the young female fan base of dawson's creek , presumably the target audience for the picture . 
<s>  director brian robbins previously helmed the kids feature good burger ( from nickelodeon films , a sister company of mtv ) and changes directions here a bit but still fails to make much of an impression . 
<s>  the look of the movie is as bland as the town and characters who populate it . 
<s>  the football scenes are generally unexciting and the entire film looks a bit washed out . 
<s>  there's an ok soundtrack featuring music from collective soul , foo fighters , green day and aaliyah but it's not as impressive as one would expect from a mtv film . 
<s>  susan granger's review of " america's sweethearts " ( columbia/sony ) 
<s>  what a waste of a talented cast ! 
<s>  billy crystal and co-writer peter tolan have concocted a sly , provocative premise and , as the opening credits roll , it's obvious that they're attempting an old-fashioned romantic comedy . 
<s>  the story involves a veteran publicist ( billy crystal ) who is summoned to orchestrate a press junket in las vegas when an arrogant director ( christopher walken ) holds a megabuck movie hostage in his editing room , refusing to show it to anyone . 
<s>  he figures that by giving the journalists juicy hints of a possible reconciliation between the film's once-married-but-now-estranged stars , gwen and eddie ( catherine zeta-jones , john cusack ) , they'll be so distracted that they won't remember they didn't see the movie or it wasn't what they expected . 
<s>   ( and crystal thought of this long before a sony exec concocted the phony critic/david manning quote scandal ! ) 
<s>  for help , he turns to gwen's personal assistant/sister ( julia roberts ) . 
<s>  but the laughs are few and far-between . 
<s>  crystal's glib , cynical flack isn't wickedly funny enough with a few amusing one-liners . 
<s>  after six months under the care of a depak chopra-like guru ( alan arkin ) , cusack's character's too emotionally fragile , lacking the necessary charisma . 
<s>  zeta-jones's vain , narcissistic diva is undeveloped and one-dimensional . 
<s>  only hank azaria , as zeta-jones's much-macho spanish lover , and stanley tucci , as a studio exec , and roberts manage to whip up any farcical froth . 
<s>  basically , we don't like these ego-driven , stereotypical characters , let alone root for them to unwind their romantic entanglements , and joe roth's direction is predictable , formulaic and telegraphic . 
<s>  on the granger movie gauge of 1 to 10 , " america's sweethearts " is a contrived , shallow 4 . as a screwball satire , it's strictly superficial . 
<s>  susan granger's review of " jeepers creepers " ( mgm/ua entertainment ) 
<s>  this nasty , little horror film begins as a bickering brother ( justin long ) and sister ( gina philips ) are driving through the desolate countryside on their way home from college and spy a man dropping wrapped-up bodies down a drainage pipe . 
<s>  when long decides to investigate , there's nothing but trouble . 
<s>   " you know the part in scary movies where somebody does something really stupid and everybody hates them for it ? 
<s>  - well , this is it ! " 
<s>  philips warns . 
<s>  what he finds in the basement of an old , abandoned church is a dying boy with a horrifying , jagged-stitched incision from his neck to his navel , plus hundreds of other mutilated bodies , stitched together on the walls and ceiling like a disgusting tapestry . 
<s>  long flees but now the monstrous , winged creeper ( jonathan breck ) is after both of them ! 
<s>  eileen brennan appears briefly as the cat lady and patricia belcher is jezelle , a psychic who explains the evil creature's bizarre feeding habits . 
<s>  on the granger movie gauge of 1 to 10 , " jeepers creepers " is a fiendishly visceral 2 with an extraordinarily gruesome conclusion , giving new meaning to the old song " jeepers creepers . " 
<s>  and now - as paul harvey would say - for the rest of the story . 
<s>  what's more scary than the cruelty of the satanic film itself is the fact that writer/director victor salva is a convicted child molester who videotaped himself having oral sex with a 12 year-old actor in california . 
<s>  sentenced to three years in prison , he served 15 months and completed parole in 1992 . 
<s>  when salva made " powder " ( 1995 ) , the story of an albino boy with supernatural abilities , disney studio executives claimed that they did not know about his prior conviction as a pedophile . 
<s>  and now , once again , in this mgm/ua film , that fact is conspicuously absent from his press kit bio . 
<s>  this independent film written and directed by eric bross has the look and feel of all those other troubled blue-collar youth films that have inundated the market in recent times . 
<s>  it is hard to tell what is independent about this film ; it might as well have been made in hollywood or on a home videocam . 
<s>  it is the debut film for the director , who tells his personal story about italians growing up with heavy new jersey accents and remaining tight with each other as they grow into young adults , a tale which could have been rewarding to see in the 1950s , where the mind-set of all the characters depicted is grounded , but to see it in the 1990s is a different story : it is old news . 
<s>  the love story between the simple girl waiting to get married and her luckless boyfriend turning nasty on her doesn't mean much , since their relationship remained undeveloped . 
<s>  the introduction of the wise-guy angle and the loyality among buddies bit , are not moving enough emotional experiences or intelligent enough dramatics to elevate this film above its limited story line despite the tour-de-force performance by the star of the film , adrien brody as ray . 
<s>  ray is the only son of a low-level mobster once arrested for running an illegal casino operation out of his bloomfield , new jersey , suburban basement . 
<s>  ray sr . ( vincent ) is now trying to make a go of it by running a small scale home-repair business . 
<s>  his son lives with him and works unhappily as a shoe salesman , dreaming of getting rich quickly so he can open a business and marry his long-time waitress girlfriend joanne ( sybil ) . 
<s>  the title of this film refers to the shoe size of paul newman-10b , which really has nothing to do with explaining anything about the film . you 
<s>  should be aware that there are a lot of things about this film that don't make sense : its constant brainless chatter between the buddies , their uneventful growing pains , and the despair of their lives , make it very difficult to feel any empathy for them . 
<s>  desperate to make his dream come through , ray goes to a loanshark , humorously and menacingly played by james e . moriarty , and borrows 10 grand to bet on a " sure thing " at freehold raceway . 
<s>  the horse loses and now ray has big problems , as the loanshark comes after him with his muscle to get his dough . 
<s>  there is nothing i have seen so far to like about ray . 
<s>  he is undependable , mean-spirited , and stupid . 
<s>  so when his best friend mike ( gallagher ) , the narrator of the film , gets a chance to sleep with his girlfriend--who cares ? 
<s>  the director must be kidding himself if he thinks we do . 
<s>  as for ray's gambling debt and his dilemma of how to pay it off , the story is too predictable for anything other than what you would expect to happen . 
<s>  his buddies , the college student mike and the dependable butchie ( gillan ) , and his old man , who he has this love/hate relationship with , rally to his aid . 
<s>  and the film ends on an obligatory artistic note of ambiguity , that seems to be the way it is for all those wannabe artistic films , as ray is off to florida all by his lonesome self to try to put his life together . 
<s>  there was just no energy or spark or anything relevant in this superficial film to keep it interesting , though adrien brody showed signs that he could be a future star . 
<s>  because of his intensity and looks , he reminds me of sean penn . 
<s>  come on hollywood , surprise me . 
<s>  stop giving us these poorly written thrillers with banal dialogue , sketchy characters and plots as predictable as the sunset .

<s>  capsule : the much anticipated re-adaptation of the pierre boulle novel comes to the screen as a dark and a little dreary film with lots of chases and fighting , but very little intelligence .

<s>  pierre boulle , author of the bridge on the river kwai , wrote planet of the apes ( a . k . a . monkey planet ) , the novel , as a social satire . 
<s>  it reads a lot like a fifth book of gulliver's travels . 
<s>  humans discover a planet in which the roles of apes and humans have been reversed , not unlike the roles of horses and humans on jonathan swift's island of the houyhnhnms . 
<s>  the novel moves somewhat slowly to create some suspense in revealing all the things most film fans know to be true about the nature of the planet . 
<s>  it seems to me there is also a statement about human cruelty to animals , but perhaps i was just looking for that . 
<s>  when rod serling adapted the novel into a film released in 1968 , he added a number of serling touches , familiar from episodes of the twilight zone and changed the ending to make it more serling-ish . 
<s>  the final irony of the original version has become film history . 
<s>  without it there could never have been a " planet of the apes " film series . 
<s>  i can surmise only that serling ran into serious script problems in how to handle the tricky question of language . 
<s>  in the book the apes had their own language and the human eventually learned that language . 
<s>  that could have been done in the film , but that would have required the entire film to be subtitled for the non-ape-speaking . 
<s>  serling avoided this by having the apes speak english and , of course , there is some justification for that by the end of the film . 
<s>  justifying why the apes spoke english may have even been the inspiration for his surprise ending . 
<s>  but serling never tackles the all-important question of why a supposedly intelligent human never shows any curiosity or even surprise that the apes speak his own language , a language they had no opportunity to ever hear . 
<s>  few viewers questioned this serious plot hole , however , and the film has become well respected in cinema history . 
<s>  partial credit at least should go to jerry goldsmith whose extremely inventive score is one of goldsmith's best if not his best . 
<s>  when the film's success called for sequels , the filmmakers turned up the violence and they added well-intentioned , though not very subtle , political messages about what was happening in the united states of the 1960s and 1970s . 
<s>  while the first film had a little shooting of guns and what was there seemed a little half- hearted , by the second film , beneath the planet of the apes , there was a good deal more violence and from that point on the series had a lot of violence and chases . 
<s>  the series concluded with battle for the planet of the apes in 1973 . 
<s>  now director tim burton tries his hand at adapting the original book again . 
<s>  for those who thought that the 1968 version was not very faithful to the book , burton's new version is even less faithful . 
<s>  first , he does not really reverse the roles of the humans and the apes . 
<s>  he has them both be intelligent , articulate races battling for a dominance of the planet currently in the hands , uh , make that paws , of the apes . 
<s>  that could be a good story too , but it is not planet of the apes . 
<s>  as with the mission impossible films and so many other cinematic homages to the third quarter of the last century , the title makes promises that the filmmakers have no intention of honoring . 
<s>  in 2029 leo davidson ( mark wahlberg , not this world's most expressive actor ) works on a space station increasing the intelligence and usefulness of apes . 
<s>  then a convenient time storm sweeps him up wizard-of-oz-fashion and drops him on an alien planet . 
<s>   ( yes , he survives this storm , but then no storm is perfect . )

<s>  and the language they talk is earth- english . 
<s>  apparently it does not even occur to leo that there is a mystery that needs to be explained about that . 
<s>  the fact it does not occur to leo and apparently didn't occur to tim burton either is the heart of the real horror of this film . 
<s>  both just assumed that if apes were going to talk the language they would speak would be english . 
<s>  in any case having one talking race dominating another makes this not a look at human-animal relationships and more one of the master-slave relationships . 
<s>  outside of sudan and a few other countries this is a less relevant topic . 
<s>  leo is captured to be used as a slave but also is discovered by ari , played by helena bonham carter .

<s>  she is bent on making the world a better place .

<s>  in any case with makeup that stifles her usual pout , carter is just about as attractive as she has ever been in a film . 
<s>  she may want to consider this to become her standard look from this point forward .

<s>  this is a further abandonment of the source material . 
<s>  the chase severely limits the interplay of ape and human and the examination of each's place in this reversed society , each important in the book . 
<s>  we cannot see how the society works because most of the screentime society has broken down . 
<s>  we see the humans either separated from the apes or fighting them . 
<s>  burton chooses visceral thrills over cerebral ones at almost every turn . 
<s>  this is a miscalculation , as characters so lacking in empathy value are difficult ones to place much emotional investment in . 
<s>  they are basically chess pieces and the viewer has little reason to root for them to win .

<s>  chambers is good , but if anyone had a chance to best him it would have to be baker .

<s>  this is my first review that i post to this newsgroup , and i kind of feel like i have to say something negative about this film .

<s>  however , even if one thinks of it as fiction , " the prince of egypt " remains shallow . 
<s>  but i'll begin from the beginning . 
<s>  the biggest difference between the original , biblical story and this version is that moses has some semblance of divinity in the bible , whereas the animated version gives the impression of a reluctant hero . 
<s>  maybe it's just me , but if i knew i had god on my side , i'd have a little bit more confidence .

<s>  let's talk about the movie itself . 
<s>  it features a moses who , in the interests of making the character more human , lacks any divinity whatsoever , which isn't convincing at all to anyone who knows who god is .

<s>  for " original sin , " the road to the screen has been rocky .

<s>  kiss of the dragon , jet li's second consecutive american misfire , plays like one big miscalculation , and fails even as the most rudimentary entertainment .

<s>  and now , " starship troopers " director paul verhoeven adds one more image that will live in our memories forever : doogie houser doing a vulcan mind meld with a giant slug . 
<s>   " starship troopers , " loosely based on the robert heinlein novel , is the story of an interstellar war between humans and giant insects . 
<s>  in the hands of verhoeven , the mammoth sci-fi battle flick is one of the most astonishingly bad films ever made , a monument to inept filmmaking on a colossal scale . 
<s>  to put it simply , it's a bug bomb . 
<s>  in " robocop " and " total recall , " verhoeven displayed a gift for creating an entertaining mix of violence , special effects and social satire , and " starship troopers " starts off in similar fashion , with a tongue-in-cheek futuristic military recruitment ad that shows promise . 
<s>  things go downhill fast , though , as we meet our heroes , a group of buenos aires teens preparing to graduate from high school . 
<s>  inexplicably , johnny rico , carmen ibenez , dizzy flores and xander barcalow are played by square-jawed anglo kids who look like they just stepped out of a mountain dew commercial . 
<s>  it's a veritable " alpha centuri 90210 " as we watch the love-smitten teens squabble in the name of love . 
<s>  michael ironside plays their teacher , who waves around a cheesy fake severed arm while lecturing about civic responsibilities . 
<s>  eventually , the kids join the military , with dreams of glory in their addled little minds . 
<s>  one of their classmates , carl jenkins ( " doogie houser's " neil patrick harris , ) snags a job in military intelligence because of his strong psychic abilities . 
<s>  he displays his gift by psychically ordering a pet ferret to crawl up his mother's leg . 
<s>  a long , dull boot camp sequence follows , enlivened only by an extended coed shower scene where the recruits swap snappy banter as the " showgirls " director's camera roams over their buff bodies . 
<s>  finally , a full hour into the film , the war finally starts and we meet the enemy . 
<s>  the bugs hail from klendathu and colonize planets by hurling their spores into space . 
<s>  they attack starships by spinning around and firing deadly plasma blasts from their rears . 
<s>  yes , incredible as it seems , the bugs actually kill with cosmic farts . 
<s>  a phenomenally large amount of money was spent creating the computer animated insects and the results are mixed at best . 
<s>  sweeping distant shots depicting hordes of giant bugs racing to attack are both impressive and scary , but the close-ups are a different matter . 
<s>  the insects have an odd , artificial look , like origami creations with a mottled plastic coating . 
<s>  the attack scenes are intensely violent , as one would expect from verhoeven , but the overall look is too phony to generate any real tension . 
<s>  while the action is frantic , the military strategy , wildly illogical even by hollywood standards , grows tiresome quickly . 
<s>  verhoeven tries to spice things up by throwing in more satiric news coverage , but the faux-jingoistic scenes of children " doing their part for the war effort " by squishing roaches on a sidewalk aren't enough to make up for the long stretches of sheer dreck . 
<s>  one can only guess what paul verhoeven was trying to do here . 
<s>  his customary one part satire , two parts ultra-violence formula is way out of whack , and most of the film just flounders . 
<s>  in " showgirls " fashion , some scenes are almost bad enough to be good . 
<s>  an intergalactic kegger party , with jake busey playing " dixie " on a green plexiglas fiddle , has a certain bizarre appeal . 
<s>  a sex scene between two of the teens achieves a smarmy charm , enhanced a few minutes later when the female receives a fatal jab from a bug , but tells her hero that she doesn't mind dying . 
<s>   " it's okay , " she gasps , " i got to have you ! " 
<s>  and then , of course , there's doogie's mind meld with a bug . 
<s>  it's possible that verhoeven was attempting to create an homage to the era of the original novel . 
<s>  heinlein's pre- " stranger in a strange land " books were aimed at adolescent males , and " starship troopers " has the antiseptic retro-future look of late 50s/early 60s sci-fi . 
<s>  the one cityscape shown is a jetsons-like gleaming metropolis , with flying cars whizzing past an obvious matte painting . 
<s>  the hairstyles are retro too , straight from the frankie avalon , annette funicello school of fashion . 
<s>  ultimately , verhoeven's motives are irrelevant . 
<s>  he has produce a gargantuan film that fails as an action film or as a social satire . 
<s>  it even fails to be an entertaining bad movie . 
<s>  avoid " starship troopers " at all costs .

<s>  the swirling sick feeling hit me just a few minutes into " heartbreakers . "

<s>  suddenly , i had an out-of-body experience as my internal way-back machine swept me to the mid-1960s . 
<s>  all across america , the counter-culture was growing like wildfire , but there was scant evidence of it on tv . 
<s>  while young people were challenging traditional values on the streets , frustrated teenagers like me were stuck at home , sulking while our parents enjoyed the latest bob hope special . 
<s>  women in skimpy bathing suits would prance onscreen while hope made growling noises and leered at their breasts . 
<s>  on another channel , dean martin made wisecracks about " booze and broads " and peter lawford , decked out in love beads and a nehru jacket , purred suggestive one-liners as he ogled the go-go dancers . 
<s>  the adults laughed and laughed . 
<s>   " heartbreakers " reeks of that stagnant mentality , from its lingering shots of jennifer love hewitt's vah-vah-voom breasts to its leaden screenplay , which paints women as haughty schemers and men as drooling buffoons too sex-obsessed to realize they are being manipulated . 
<s>  in addition to liotta and hewitt , the cast includes sigourney weaver , gene hackman , jason lee , nora dunn and anne bancroft .

<s>  if so , they were sadly mistaken .

<s>  last summer , a feature-length version of the avengers hit theaters to the tune of a unanimous critical panning . 
<s>  based on the famous 60's television show , the film was an enormous box-office flop and a huge disappointment for warner bros . a year later , the studio is up to their old tricks again , with the unnecessary revival of the robert conrad program the wild , wild west .

<s>  intelligent writing , which is evident early on , is replaced by hackneyed drivel . 
<s>  special effects take over as the plotline devolves into incoherent silliness . 
<s>  but all that is just in preparation for the ending , which is inexcusably awful . 
<s>  this is the time-honored deus ex machina device used to its worst effect . 
<s>  i left the theater feeling cheated by the way crichton and his screenwriters had chosen to end the film . 
<s>  there is some promise , but it's all in the setup . 
<s>  we're introduced to norman goodman ( dustin hoffman ) , a psychologist who once wrote a $35 , 000 report for the government about what to do in the event that a crashed space ship is discovered . 
<s>  when one is found in the middle of nowhere , 1000 feet below the surface of the pacific ocean , norman is called in to be part of the welcoming committee . 
<s>  on the team with him are beth halperin ( sharon stone ) , a biochemist who was once his student and lover ; harry adams ( samuel l . jackson ) , a mathematician who earned his first doctorate at the age of 18 ; ted fielding ( liev schreiber ) , an astrophysicist who is awed by the opportunity to explore alien technology ; and harold barnes ( peter coyote ) , the government operative in charge of the mission . 
<s>  together , the five descend into the bowels of the ocean , where they rendezvous with a temporary sea base on the ocean floor from which they will attempt to make first contact . 
<s>  for a while , sphere had me fooled into thinking it was going to take an astute approach to the man-meets-alien situation . 
<s>  the overall scenario is not without promise and several plot twists ( such as the revelation that the enormous craft is actually an american space ship , apparently from the future ) offer intriguing possibilities . 
<s>  then , right around the one-hour mark ( that's the time to sneak into the theater next door and check out whatever's left of titanic ) , the virtually non-stop action begins , and , once it starts , the script becomes superfluous . 
<s>  this might be acceptable if director levinson generated some legitimate tension , but , instead , he relies on loud , overbearing music , strange camera angles , and quick cuts to make things " exciting . " 
<s>  additionally , because none of the characters are well-formed ( a common failing in anything penned by crichton , who's more interested in technology than people ) , viewers don't develop much of a rooting interest . 
<s>  it makes sitting through sphere a frustrating and pointless experience . 
<s>  what about that a-list cast ? 
<s>  not surprisingly , the most energetic performance is given by samuel l . jackson , but his harry isn't a person ; he's a walking plot device spouting occasionally-witty dialogue . 
<s>  dustin hoffman isn't lively or particularly good -- it's ironic that this , which may be his worst work in a decade , has arrived in theaters on the heels of his best actor nomination ( for wag the dog ) . 
<s>  sharon stone and peter coyote are both flat . 
<s>  their characters exhibit little evidence of emotion ; automatons would have been as effective . 
<s>  then there's queen latifa , who , despite getting fifth billing in the credits ( ahead of liev schreiber , who boasts at least quadruple her screen time ) , has less than a handful of lines and almost nothing to do other than inflate the body count . 
<s>  i like to think that levinson and hoffman , recognizing how uninspired this movie was likely to be , chose to make wag the dog as a sort of penance ( the low-budget picture was filmed during sphere's lengthy pre-production phase ) . 
<s>  if that's the case , forgiveness is granted . 
<s>  i'm less inclined to look favorably upon crichton , although he has a few enjoyable titles on his resume ( jurassic park and the levinson-directed disclosure come to mind ) . 
<s>  even if his novel was butchered in the adaptation process , crichton's credit as a producer disallows him absolution . 
<s>  he was a willing participant in a creative travesty . 
<s>  no wonder sphere is being released in february , in the midst of the early year's cinematic wasteland . 
<s>  it deserves no better than to get sunk by the unstoppable titanic , which should plow sphere under on its way to a ninth-consecutive weekend atop the box office heap . 
<s>  shakespeare in love is quite possibly the most enjoyable period piece ever made for the silver screen . 
<s>  it is both humorous and romantic in a very unique blend that can successfully entertain any audience for the nearly 2 and and a half hours that it occupies . 
<s>  that is , however , not to say it is a good film , a quality production or anything of the sort . 
<s>  shakespeare in love is an incredibly cheap illusion that truly pans out to be very little quality or original work . 
<s>  the finest sign of this may be the plot , in looking back , there seems to be little more than a thin , predictable plot that is only carried by the portrayal of people that we revere in our history books . 
<s>  philip henslowe ( geoffrey rush ) owns 1 of the 2 theatres in london . 
<s>  it is at the peak of the royal theatre era , and queen elizabeth ( the recently damed judi dench , by , appropriately enough , queen elizabeth ii ) is very much a fan . 
<s>  however , to directly quote the film , he has " cash flow problems . " 
<s>  through a long set of events , it becomes apparent that his entire life is dependent on his next show doing well enough to pay off his debts . 
<s>  so , mr . henslowe employs the young playwright , william shakespeare ( joseph fiennes ) to pen a comedic production . 
<s>  however , the young writer has a severe case of writer's block , and blames it on the fact that his love life is struggling as well . 
<s>  he has the title in mind , romeo and ethel , the pirate's daughter ( even that joke loses steam after a while ) but can't seem to put words to paper . 
<s>  then , as only hollywood could have it , through a long set of twisted events , he meets viola de lesseps ( gwyneth paltrow ) and falls madly in love , thus curing his writer's block . 
<s>  there are many other little issues that mr . henslowe encounters , but they all pan out to be much ado about nothing .

<s>  ironically , that couldn't be truer here . 
<s>  the great scenes that will sweep audiences away are not the scenes that fit in the plot , but rather the recitals of shakespearean lines by actors playing actors .

<s>  so it is that i am offended by the fact that marc norman and tom stoppard are credited with writing this production , and the name william shakespeare is no were to be seen beyond a character's name in the credits . 
<s>  the acting in this entertaining yet poor film is often thin to the point that it would not have survived even in queen elizabeth's theatres . 
<s>  joseph fiennes may just be the worst of fall though .

<s>  and rupert everett was cute in his small part as well . 
<s>  but not even they could save this sad excuse for a film , so it remains plagued by poor performances . 
<s>  when all is said and done , shakespeare in love is only worth the trip if you want to be entertained . 
<s>  however , as the film so kindly pointed out , entertainment may be fun , but it isn't necessarily quality . 
<s>  and this certainly isn't quality . 
<s>  perhaps this may be best compared to a john grisham novel , as a dear friend of mine often does compare things to his work . 
<s>  simply put , it is far-fetched , poorly crafted , but very entertaining .

<s>  working in the motion picture industry must be a constant source of frustration for a front-line african american actress like jada pinkett smith . 
<s>  despite being one of the freshest talents available , pinkett smith has often been relegated to playing thankless supporting parts ( a low down dirty shame , the nutty professor ) . 
<s>  the problem is , of course , that there aren't many good roles available for black women . 
<s>  take away the likes of waiting to exhale , set it off , soul food , and eve's bayou , and all that's left is a chance to be someone's girlfriend , a local whore , or a murder victim . 
<s>  as a result , for pinkett smith's first opportunity atop the marquee , she is stuck in a stupid , formulaic romantic comedy with the unpromising title of woo . 
<s>  actually , woo , the latest directorial effort from daisy v . s . 
<s>  mayer ( party girl ) , could have been worse than it is . 
<s>  the film offers a few funny ( albeit juvenile ) moments and the on-screen relationship between pinkett smith's woo and tommy davidson's tim is appealing on those rare occasions when the two aren't forced to play it dumb for the sake of an endless barrage of cheap gags . 
<s>  unfortunately , huge portions of the movie are insulting to the intelligence of anyone with a triple-digit i . q . 
<s>  the situations are painfully contrived , the main characters are lifted right out of sit-coms , and the supporting players are so incredibly stupid that i wondered whether they all participated in some kind of " free lobotomy " lab experiment . 
<s>  woo is a spontaneous , energetic young woman who has been looking for love in all the wrong places . 
<s>  her latest relationship , with a testosterone-overdosed drug-dealer , came to an abrupt end when she refused to wear a beeper . 
<s>  now , her transvestite/medium friend celestrial ( girlina ) predicts that she's about to meet mr . right , and that he'll be a virgo . 
<s>  later that day , woo is given an opportunity to go out on a blind date with tim , a shy man with a penchant for neatness and order , who just happens to be a virgo . 
<s>  it's not love at first sight , however . 
<s>  things get off to a rocky start when tim makes an awkward pass , and they get even worse when the pair arrives at a swanky restaurant to enjoy a " quiet " dinner . 
<s>  in the one-hundred year history of motion pictures , there have been a ton of bad " white " movies about mismatched lovers , so i suppose it's only fair that we get a " black " effort of the same low caliber . 
<s>  as in all romantic comedies , we know from the beginning that woo and tim are going to end up together . 
<s>  the question is , are their courtship rituals entertaining ? 
<s>  in a good entry to the genre , the audience becomes caught up in the love story , no matter how familiar it is . 
<s>  in woo , the constant reliance upon unfunny , moronic humor sinks the project . 
<s>  for those who enjoy spotting continuity gaffes , there's a huge one in woo involving a corvette with a broken window that miraculously repairs itself ( added to that is the mystery of how the car looses its top ) . 
<s>  sadly , that's one of the film's most enjoyable sequences , and the entertainment value is entirely unintentional . 
<s>  despite exuding charm from every pore , there's little that pinkett smith and davidson can do to save their characters or david c . johnson's script . 
<s>  since it misses the mark by so much , a better name for woo might have been whoops . 
<s>  there is a scene early in jakob the liar that hints at how much better it could have been . 
<s>  the scene is set in a jewish ghetto in poland circa 1944 , where a one-time cafe proprietor named jakob heym is walking resolutely through the streets , fists stuffed into coat pockets . 
<s>  to one side of him , residents scavenge for food in the street ; to the other side , german troops beat a group of jews . 
<s>  jakob , however , never stops moving . 
<s>  it's an efficient , effective set-up for the character , who is clearly nobody's idea of a hero at the outset . 
<s>  he is a man who has responded to the horror of his surroundings by withdrawing from them , excising his moral peripheral vision . 
<s>  the set-up is critical because fate will turn jakob into a reluctant savior . 
<s>  after a visit to a german commandant's office and a moment alone with a turned-on radio , jakob learns that russian troops are quite near . 
<s>  when he brings this first news of the war in years to his fellow jews , they become convinced that he must have a radio , which is a punishable offense in the ghetto . 
<s>  the good news brings hope to the ghetto ; the everyday specter of suicide vanishes . 
<s>  a private man of limited creativity finds himself burdened with creating stories of russian military progress just to keep his neighbors alive . 
<s>  this promising story of an ordinary person doing the extraordinary is burdened from the outset by casting : the " ordinary person " in question , jakob heym , is played by robin williams . 
<s>  i am of the depressing opinion that williams is growing less assured as an actor in his " serious " roles with every passing year . 
<s>  compare his dramatic scenes in the world according to garp and moscow on the hudson with what dreams may come or patch adams , and see how much more mannered he has become ( or , at the very least , how much less sensible at choosing material ) . 
<s>  jakob the liar depends on the notion that jakob has to struggle to craft his fictions , but williams always looks like he's struggling _not_ to craft them . 
<s>  when he improvises a radio address by winston churchill for ailing 10-year-old orphan lina ( hannah taylor gordon ) , he seems relieved that he can finally get wacky . 
<s>  oh yes , and then there's that little girl . 
<s>  some viewers will undoubtedly consider the hero's fanciful stories for a young charge too reminiscent of life is beautiful , but those scenes aren't problematic because they're familiar . 
<s>  they're problematic because they're jarring and distracting , introducing a cutesy relationship into a film that shouldn't have been about cutesy relationships . 
<s>  jakob's character arc may be about his willingness to act for the benefit of others , but there are plenty of others without poor little lina . 
<s>  every scene with her feels contrived , pulling jakob the liar away from its central story of hope coming to a previously hopeless people . 
<s>  it is a pleasant surprise to find that jakob the liar is a much grittier production than you might expect from a hollywood-ized holocaust , combining the weighty subject matter with dark humor in some effective ways . 
<s>  director peter kassovitz , working from jurek becker's novel , crafts some nice scenes between jakob and the other townspeople , and draws solid performances from armin mueller-stahl ( as a once-revered doctor ) and bob balaban ( as a barber drifting into depression ) . 
<s>  there are just too many things going on that prove distracting , whether it's the sketchy romanctic angle involving liev schreiber as an earnest former prizefighter , or williams' incongrous presence , or a sweet but utterly irrelevant little girl . 
<s>  jakob the liar deals with too delicate a subject for such fumbling , and has too compelling a central character to waste . 
<s>  and after one wonderful early scene , you can see the film wasted and fumbled away .

<s>  she and her friends make a demo tape of interviews with the women of miami . 
<s>  the film itself is sprinkled with these real interviews throughout , both as part of the plot and as commentary on the situations of the main characters . 
<s>  the fact that they are real provides a refreshing break from some of the more melodramatic moments in the film . 
<s>  there are several moments of bad acting , corny dialogue , and emotional overextension . 
<s>  in a low-budget independent film from a first-time director , these faults can sometimes be forgiven , if the screenplay is fresh and solid . 
<s>  that is not the case here . 
<s>  the script suffers from random plot developments . 
<s>  there are four or five of these turns in the plot , each one raising the question " where did that come from ? " 
<s>  at one point , a character has a lifelong reconciliation with her mother . 
<s>  we are supposed to be moved , but since the scene is completely un-led-up to , we really don't care if she and her mother get along . 
<s>  we've never seen her mother before . 
<s>  we never see her again . 
<s>  who cares ? 
<s>  what's worse , these sudden developments are supposed to engage our sympathy . 
<s>  at another point , a character announces that she can't have children . 
<s>  apparently , this is devastating . 
<s>  we wouldn't know this because she never talked about having kids before , but we are nevertheless expected to be devastated for her . 
<s>  the scene feels like an afterthought , its emotion manipulative and shallow . 
<s>  these scenes grow worse and worse , culminating in an absurd climax .

<s>  thinking on these scenes , it is hard for me to admit that the film has redeeming qualities . 
<s>  but it does . 
<s>  first , it is original . 
<s>  we men often wonder what women talk about when they are alone in groups , and i imagine this film gives me a pretty good idea . 
<s>  it's something i don't think has been the subject of a film . 
<s>  second , the interviews of the miami women are sincere . 
<s>  taken together , they form a mosaic picture of miami beachwalkers and bistro diners . 
<s>  the mosaic is made of sound bites and stereotypes , but each tile is some woman's real experience . 
<s>  neither the picture of women , nor their picture of men , is truly representative , but the point is that both sets of generalizations are telling in their own way . 
<s>  at some level , the stereotypes that emerge can be called true .

<s>  and that makes it even harder to forgive the bad acting , corny dialogue , and emotional overextension .

<s>  i read the new yorker magazine and i enjoy some of their really in-depth articles about some incident . 
<s>  they will take some incident like the investigation of a mysterious plane crash and tell you what happened in detail . 
<s>  it becomes a real education in what agencies get involved and how theories are suggested , and what kind of pressure the investigators are under , and just about any other aspect you can think of . 
<s>  frequently i get the feeling that the article sounded exciting , but i am being told in more detail than i really wanted to know . 
<s>  often i get to the middle of a story and say , ok , it sounded good but i now have invested more time than i am willing to spend on this subject . 
<s>  film is a different medium . 
<s>  it is a visual medium . 
<s>  that slows down the telling of stories much more than people realize . 
<s>  i frequently am surprised to find out how short a film script is and how much of the pages are empty space . 
<s>  the magazine article and the film script are two very different media . 
<s>  the insider is a film adaptation of the vanity fair article " the man who knew too much " by marie brenner . 
<s>  it is too much an adaptation of a magazine article slowed to the pace of a film . 
<s>  it really verges on being tedious at least at times . 
<s>  for years the seven big companies knew that they dealt in an addictive drug that caused a host of unhealthy side-effects . 
<s>  but they pretended for the public that it was unproven and they did not really believe it . 
<s>  the business was incredibly profitable and the proceeds translated into the political power to squelch and discredit any political movements against big tobacco . 
<s>  the tide turned when a former vice-president of one of the companies was convinced by the cbs 60 minutes news team to tell the public how much the tobacco companies really knew about the health effects of smoking . 
<s>  the resulting pressure to stop the story created a small civil war at cbs . 
<s>  who were the major people involved , what were their motives , how was the story almost killed , how did it get aired anyway ? 
<s>  that is the story covered in surprising detail by the insider .

<s>  and in the end , he failed .

<s>  terrorists can grab the headlines , but the tobacco companies have the real position of power .

<s>  also added to the pointless proceedings is some would-be humorous shenanigans involving quinn's dimwitted deputy ernie attempting to engage in clandestine patrol car sex with his girlfriend donna ( karen sillas ) . 
<s>  with a half hour ( if even that long ) remaining , director william ryan and writer john hughes ( yes , john hughes of '80s youth films and _home_alone_ ) finally approach something close to a point . 
<s>  turns out robin still pines for his high school sweetheart lise ( brooke langton ) , who has long gone on with her life , and hughes's main concern at long last reveals itself as a tired " live in the present and for the future " message . 
<s>  most moviegoers , however , will likely be asleep by that time .

<s>  such a glorified workshop may have its rewards for the actors , but it leaves audiences with a booby prize .

<s>  in my mid-teen years , i had a horrendous re-occurring nightmare . 
<s>  behind the wheel of a car , i was driving down a straight road in the middle of a desert . 
<s>  no scenery except the horizon line and the converging parallel lines of the highway . 
<s>  no matter what i did , the view didn't change : travelling but not getting anywhere . 
<s>  each time i awoke in a sweat , terrified . 
<s>  you don't have to be carl jung to understand that dream . 
<s>  powerless to make changes , trapped in a boring situation with no hope of rescue , this is the stuff of nightmares whether we are asleep or awake . 
<s>  this is exactly how you will feel 15 minutes after " battlefield earth " begins . 
<s>  for all of its flash and style , l . ron hubbard's science fiction epic is the earliest and best entry for the dullest summer film of 2000 . 
<s>  dull " and " stupid . 
<s>  in the year 3000 , the psychlo aliens have ruled our planet for 1 , 000 years . 
<s>  humans either work as slave labor in mining operations or live as barbarians . 
<s>  there's no hope . 
<s>  the future is bleak . 
<s>  then the psychlo make a mistake and capture feisty jonnie goodboy tyler ( barry pepper ) who organizes a revolution against chief of security terl ( john travolta ) and the alien race . 
<s>  it's an archetypal post-apocalyptic plot full of promise . 
<s>  considering some of the talent involved and all the millions thrown at the screen , it's difficult to see how it could have failed so miserably . 
<s>  but it does . 
<s>  the story is so full of holes that it falls apart within minutes of the opening credits . 
<s>  are we really supposed to believe that after a millennium of looking for gold , the psychlo never discovered fort knox ? 
<s>  or that fighter planes are still in pristine condition after all that time -- and gassed up ? 
<s>  or that the cavemen become such expert pilots in seven days that they can easily down the advanced alien ships ? 
<s>  or that the psychlo spy cameras somehow don't notice that their slaves are missing for days ? 
<s>  travolta prances across the screen hamming it up for all he's worth and is almost entertaining . 
<s>  almost . 
<s>  the rest of the actors are wooden mannequins trying not to laugh while delivering lines that no person -- " man-animal " or not -- would ever utter . 
<s>  some of the film _looks_ good , but it also looks so familiar . 
<s>  a race of large hulking ape-like creatures has taken over the world while our cities lie in ruin . 
<s>  sound like something charlton heston might be in ? 
<s>  the psychlo look like overweight klingons in gear from " dune " . 
<s>  the final air battle between the air force fighters and the psychlo ships in their high-tech city is something george lucas might have been associated with . 
<s>  it's too loud . 
<s>  it's too oppressive . 
<s>  it's too slow . 
<s>  it's too long . . . far 
<s>  too long . 
<s>  and on it goes . 
<s>  the list of the problems with " battlefield earth " is endless . 
<s>  it's difficult to find anything in the film that does work . 
<s>  oh yeah . 
<s>  the color scheme is nice . 
<s>  the real question is how this movie ever got made . 
<s>  could it have something to do with the fact that l . ron hubbard was the founder of scientology ? 
<s>  and that john travolta is a member of the church . 
<s>  that might explain why travolta bought the rights to the novel years ago . 
<s>  but it doesn't give us a clue as to why first-time screenwriter corey mandell's atrocious script was used . 
<s>  or why the high-profile project was entrusted with roger christian who had never before directed a major film . 
<s>  or why no one looked at this thing before it was released and realized there might be problems . 
<s>  the one bright spot is that no longer will kevin costner's " the postman " ( which i begrudgingly admit as a guilty pleasure ) be " the " big budget science fiction failure . 
<s>   " battlefield earth " has the honor sewed up . 
<s>  often reviewers will recommend that you skip mediocre films and wait for the video . 
<s>  that's not the case here . 
<s>  you can act now and make the decision to not see it on the big screen or on the small one . 
<s>  don't hesitate . 
<s>  strike now while the iron is cold .

<s>  for richer or poorer is a moronic farce about a rich married couple ( played by tim allen and kirstie alley ) who seek refuge in an amish community after their bumbling accountant ( wayne knight , best know as newman on tv's " seinfeld " ) gets them in trouble for tax evasion . 
<s>  what ensues is a badly scripted and horribly directed 114 minutes of cinema hell . 
<s>  what makes this all wrong is that nobody seems to have what the film needs . 
<s>   . 
<s>   .

<s>  alley is absolutely unwatchable , and the chemistry between her and allen is about as believable as my chemistry homework from tenth grade ( which , i inform you , was total b . s . ) .

<s>  even the best comic actor is at the mercy of his or her material , as this subpar submarine comedy proves . 
<s>  down periscope stars kelsey " frasier " grammer as an inept navy captain who is given command of his own ship as part of a corrupt officer's ( james coburn ) plan to get him out of the navy . 
<s>  like any lame emsemble comedy , the officer assigns him to a group of misfits like the guy who wants to be kicked out , the fat guy who eats all the time , the beautiful woman who doesn't belong there ( lauren holly ) , the second-in-command who does everything by the book ( rob schneider ) , the crazy old guy who freaks everyone out ( harry dean stanton ) and so on . 
<s>  then comes the transparent plotline . 
<s>  first grammer has to fix up the delapidated korean war ship the navy has given him , and that comes courtesy a sad sight gag montage that includes a guy with a mop knocking schneider overboard . 
<s>  after the ship is fixed up come the early drills , where everyone seems completely inept , like the electrician who can't connect wires so instead lets the current run through himself every time grammer gets on the phone . 
<s>  finally , and this covers the final hour of the movie , grammer has to lead his men ( and holly ) to overcome the other ships in a wargames exercise . 
<s>  and he has to be a clever rebel to do it , in scenes that stretch all levels of believability . 
<s>  first they're singing " louie louie " like a bunch of drunk sailors to throw the radar of the other ship off , then thirty minutes later , they're making whale mating noises to throw the radar of the other ship off . 
<s>  the whole while , evil captain coburn is overacting underwater , cursing grammer ( as most people watching the movie probably are too ) . 
<s>  it's all predictable without any original humor to redeem it . 
<s>  the jokes are right out of " mchale's navy " and other cut-rate sitcoms of the past . 
<s>  there's one scene where schneider looks through the ship's pantry in disgust , holds one food can up and announces , " this expired in 1966 ! " 
<s>  i yelled back at the screen , " so did these jokes . " 
<s>  i watched this movie with the whole family and everyone hated it . 
<s>  my mom was so bored she brought out the coupon book midway through and , around the start of the second hour , i started writing my will . 
<s>  the blame can't really be placed on the stars , though . 
<s>  kelsey grammer is good in this , he just doesn't have anything to work with . 
<s>  his character is said to have gotten so drunk one night that he had " welcome aboard " tatooed on his penis . 
<s>  grammer probably did something even worse -- got really drunk and agreed to appear in a movie he knew nothing about . 
<s>  same for holley ( save the penis part ) , who is likeable in down periscope just because she's so gorgeous . 
<s>  as for schneider ( whose character is downright annoying ) , there was nowhere to go but up after surf ninjas , although he's still in the depths of the comedy ocean after jumping the " snl " ship . 
<s>  my theory is that down periscope is one of those movies that got the green light before the script was even written as a formula comedy ( " okay , it's police academy in the navy with frasier at the helm and the chick from dumb and dumber . " ) and after everyone was signed on turned into a disaster . 
<s>  judging from the video box , most other movie critics agree with me . 
<s>  the only quote the down periscope copy writers could dig up came from the prevue channel's jim ferguson . 
<s>  i guess even jeff craig from " 60 second preview " ( who said tank girl " kicks butt ! "

<s>  movies don't come much more ridiculously titled than " i still know what you did last summer , " but since the movie in question is best described as ridiculous , the title sort of works as a warning . 
<s>  more than a silly-sounding mouthful to blurt out to the ticket vendor , this horror sequel's moniker also contains a grievous oversight that anyone who saw the original will be able to spot : what " you " did _last_ summer " you " actually did the summer _before_ last summer , and since " i " knew about it _this_ summer as well as _last_ summer , it's really illogical to say that " i " _still_ know what " you " did _last_ summer . 
<s>  the filmmakers would have at least made sense with the shorter " i still know , " the longer " i still know what you did two summers ago " or the appropriate " stupid people getting hacked to bits . " 
<s>  that last suggestion is the preferable one since the characters in this film do things that are the polar opposite of smart . 
<s>  for example , if your roommate is plagued by terrible nightmares as a result of being stalked and nearly murdered not long ago , would you sneak into her room late at night and hide in the closet , even if it was just to locate and borrow a cute little dress ? 
<s>  probably not , but that's precisely what college student karla ( pop diva brandy ) does to best friend julie ( jennifer love hewitt ) , resulting in the first in a long line of phony frights . 
<s>  julie , you'll recall , was one of the sole survivors at the end of 1997's surprise hit " i know what you did last summer , " after a slasher with a grudge to bear - it's a _long_ story - began trying to pick off her , her buddies and various others in their coastal carolina village . 
<s>  in this installment , the plot picks up as karla wins a trip to the bahamas , and julie , yet racked by guilt , decides that maybe a tropical getaway will help ease her mind .

<s>   " mercury rising " has numerous flaws , but there is one that really stands out : its central plot device is unnecessary . 
<s>  that's right . 
<s>  the major aspect of the film , that which is supposed to make it different from other routine government conspiracy / action flicks could be dropped from the beginning , and the movie would turn out exactly the same , if not better . 
<s>  this central device is the fact that a nine-year-old boy is autistic . 
<s>  his name is simon , and an evil government bureaucrat named nicholas kudrow ( alec baldwin ) wants him dead because he unknowingly cracked a supersecret government code slipped into the back of a puzzle magazine by its programmers just to see if someone could beat it . 
<s>  simon is intended to be the heart and soul of the film , and we are supposed to feel for him because he is a poor handicapped child thrown into a violent , unfair world against his will , with only a renegade fbi agent played by bruce willis to protect him . 
<s>  the fact that he is autistic does nothing for the emotional intensity or the plot necessities of " mercury rising . " 
<s>  i suppose the original novel upon which the movie was based did much more with this aspect of simon's character and his relationship with willis , but here it is lost . 
<s>  miko hughes , the young actor who plays simon , goes through the prescribed motions of being autistic : he walks slowly , drawls his words , kicks and screams when he's touched , and has a hard time looking at other people .

<s>  movies that present no admiration , no captivation , no richness and vague interest in what children are being subjected to . 
<s>  and kids will continue to see films like spawn , simply because they are unable to differentiate what makes an imaginative , wondrous film from an insipid and wasteful one . 
<s>  children are not muppets . 
<s>  and spawn unapologetically targets children . 
<s>  it's not a bad thing to update old stories . 
<s>  it's done all the time in the oral tradition . 
<s>  the difficulty with this film is not that the tale has changed , it's that it's dry . 
<s>  the new cinderella , danielle ( drew barrymore ) is not sitting around waiting for her prince to come . 
<s>  she's a woman of the late twentieth century albeit situated in sixteenth century france . 
<s>  when her father dies , she stays on in his house even though she is mistreated by her wicked stepmother rodmilla ( anjelica huston ) . 
<s>  she works by day , but reads sir thomas more by firelight at night . 
<s>  although the story is updated , you know the plot . 
<s>  danielle meets prince henry ( dougray scott ) , goes to a ball disguised , is later found out and they live happily ever after . 
<s>  the movie is often like watching a filmed play . 
<s>  theater in real life is engrossing . 
<s>  theater on the screen is usually lifeless . 
<s>  there doesn't seem to be much going on . 
<s>  the camera can be a star of films . 
<s>  here it's a co-conspirator . 
<s>  danielle's convictions are compromised . 
<s>  a socialist and a feminist , she pretends to be royalty to get her man . 
<s>  a kind woman , her last act in the movie is one of revenge .

<s>  in all fairness , my companion loved the film .
