<s>  it is certainly a date film . 
<s>  nearly the entire audience was couples . 
<s>  oh well , maybe it's good for something . 
<s>  i suppose it's unfair to criticize a movie like hudson hawk , which has been panned by reviewers and moviegoers alike since it's 1991 release . 
<s>  michael lehmann's action-comedy was quick to win the title `biggest box office flop of all time' , or close thereof . 
<s>  the movie stars bruce willis as renowned cat burglar hudson hawk , who's just been released from sing sing prison after many years in isolation ( `let me put it this way , ' he explains , `i never saw et' ) . 
<s>  greeting him is his old friend and partner in crime ( played by danny aiello ) , who becomes the subject of many amusing fat jokes . 
<s>  these are rather welcome in a movie filled with so many completely unfunny sight gags , cartoonish villains and unbelievable coincidences . 
<s>  it appears as if director lehmann didn't know when to stop all the absurd silliness , and he piles on layer after layer of utter ridiculousness as the movie propels itself toward the finish line . 
<s>  if at some point during hudson hawk you make the assumption that things couldn't get goofier , you'll soon be eating your words . 
<s>  but , i'm inclined to say that this film is not quite as terrible as it's box office numbers suggest . 
<s>  it's fast-paced and entertaining , if you've got incredible patience and a warped sense of humor . 
<s>  for the first portion of this review , i'm going to try and center on the positive aspects of hudson hawk . 
<s>  wish me luck . 
<s>  first and foremost : bruce willis is a good sport . 
<s>  while i'm not entirely sure what he was smoking when he co-wrote this script , willis is quite aware that the entire project is a big , fat , ugly joke . 
<s>  he constantly gives deadpan reactions to things that are very silly and out-of-place , which means he has more than his share of deadpan reactions . 
<s>  another plus is the appearance of andie macdowell as a schizophrenic nun and love interest for the title character . 
<s>  they meet when hudson goes on a mission to steal a priceless book from the vatican , and their relationship escalates in interest from there . 
<s>  it's unfortunate that mcdowell's one-note character is used just as an excuse for there to be a predictable plot-twist , and she offers absolutely no encouraging chemistry with willis . 
<s>  but now i'm rambling on again about the negative things , aren't i ? 
<s>  enough of the charade - for the most part , hudson hawk is an excruciating experience . 
<s>  it's stupid , pointless and repetitive . 
<s>  i can only wonder what bruce willis fans thought after exiting the theater , because this film really doesn't have the potential to please anyone . 
<s>  action fans should take note that hudson hawk is composed of 90% comedy , and even the action sequences are skittery , rushed and poorly edited . 
<s>  and those expecting a hearty laugh or two will find it difficult even to smirk during all of the headache-inducing hi-jinks . 
<s>  don't get me wrong , this film is not devoid of laughs . 
<s>  it's too bad most of them are unintentional , or just plain forced . 
<s>  the impressive cast looks suitably embarrassed . 
<s>  it's understandable to see willis and aiello in a movie of this caliber , but as for the presence of future academy award winner james coburn i'm not entirely sure . 
<s>  coburn plays a former nemesis of the hawk who again comes into play , and he looks unsure of his place the entire movie . 
<s>  especially when he resorts to martial arts during the final showdown , and has a fight with willis that would look right at home in a jackie chan film . 
<s>  things get more bizarre when we're introduced to his team of rejects named after chocolate bars , including future nypd blue star david caruso as the speechless , card-flipping kit-kat . 
<s>  if that's not enough for you , there's richard e . grant and sandra bernhard hamming it up as a deranged couple on the brink of a convoluted economic takeover . 
<s>  their crotch-biting pooch provides a couple of the big laughs here . 
<s>  wait , maybe the only big laughs . . . 
<s>  i'm not sure what kind of movie everyone had in mind when filming hudson hawk . 
<s>  i can't even begin to start about the film's absurd plot ; but let's not get into that . 
<s>  i suppose there's some amusement viewers could derive from the ridiculous premise , if they were that desperate . 
<s>  but hudson hawk never even has a clue of where it's going from minute one , and from there it's 90 minutes of pure cinematic muck . 
<s>  if there were a subject just screaming to be made into a film , it was studio 54 , the late steve rubell's infamous new york discotheque , which came to symbolize the taboo-smashing excesses of the disco era's heyday : easy drugs and even easier sex between everyone , all set to a thumping dance beat . 
<s>  so when miramax started production on _54_ last year , the buzz of hype and resulting anticipation began : an edgy film as down-and-dirty as the club itself , written and directed by a promising first-timer ( mark christopher ) and starring some hot young talent ( salma hayek , neve campbell , newcomer ryan phillippe , and mike myers in his dramatic debut ) . 
<s>  my , how easily does the worm turn . 
<s>  hype turned into damage control when word got out about 11th-hour reshoots ( wrapped only a month ago ) , a rash of studio-imposed edits that left virtually the entire cast and crew ( especially christopher ) unhappy , and the very likely possibility that miramax would not screen the finished film for critics . 
<s>  at the last minute , though , miramax did decide to screen the film ( so hastily scheduled was the screening that myers's last name was misspelled on the invitation , not to mention the numerous typos in the press notes ) for a media audience that came away noticeably less than impressed , myself included . 
<s>  and with good reason--somehow , some way , the supremely disappointing _54_ has made the historically hip haven of hedonism . . . 
<s>  boring . 
<s>  although christopher has distanced himself from the finished film , he still must shoulder some of the blame for _54_'s lifelessness . 
<s>  _54_ focuses , for the most part , on a tight-knit trio of employees at the club : coat check girl/aspiring disco diva anita ( a wasted hayek ) ; her busboy husband , greg ( breckin meyer ) ; and , most prominently , the fresh-from-jersey shane o'shea ( phillippe ) , who enjoys a quick rise from busboy to head bartender . 
<s>  these characters are about as generic as those descriptions . 
<s>  in focusing on the hired help , christopher really missed the boat . 
<s>  with the exception of the flamboyant , always-woozy rubell ( myers , in a well-modulated turn ) , the meaty stories to be told at studio 54 are not the workers' but those of the people who went there to party ; not necessarily the numerous vip guests , but the wild eccentrics who managed to be picked from the crowd by the club's famously hard-ass doormen and dance ( among other things ) the night away with the rich , famous , and infamous ( the only taste of the crowd comes by way of ellen dow's feisty dottie , a disco- and drug-crazed granny , but she's a peripheral character at best ) . 
<s>  as such , aside from the expected overhead crowd shots , there is precious little actual _dancing_ in _54_ . 
<s>  what is a disco film--especially one about the pinnacle of the movement--without the dancing ? 
<s>  even whit stillman's _the_last_days_of_disco_ , which wasn't so much concerned with disco as it was witty dialogue within a group of hip-to-only-themselves club-hopping preppies , featured at least one extended dance scene . 
<s>  dancing isn't the only thing glazed over in _54_--so is the sex , but that may not be entirely christopher's fault . 
<s>  from what i've heard , his original vision was something considerably more dark and daring , starting with the shane character : he was conceived ( and actually filmed ) as a wild , morally ambiguous bisexual , which would have made an efficient springboard to cover the pansexual pleasure palace aspect of studio 54's legend . 
<s>  but somewhere between principal photography and the final cut , shane was defanged and quite literally straightened out ; consequently , so was the film . 
<s>  aside from a brief glimpse of erotic encounters toward the beginning of the film , shane's fleeting dalliance with seductive socialite billie ( sela ward ) , and an abbreviated bedhopping montage , the sexual dimension is just about ignored . 
<s>  shane , in this incarnation , is sanitized to the point of blandness , an idealistic do-gooder who pines for a frequent guest at the club , julie black ( campbell ) , a worldly soap star with , yes , a heart of gold . 
<s>  this tacked-on " romance " would have been slightly less tedious if either campbell or phillippe made some connection with each other or the audience . 
<s>  they fail on both counts . 
<s>  ultimately , _54_'s failure comes down to three letters : f-u-n . 
<s>  as in , there isn't any to be had for the audience . 
<s>  too much time is spent with the boring shane , and too little is spent on the club floor , where all the action took place . 
<s>  anyhow , though , whatever time is spent on the 54 floor is not used very effectively . 
<s>  when anita finally gets her big break and perform onstage at the club , it should be a euphoric height , for her , the crowd , and the audience ; however , the moment doesn't get a chance to reach that level , for it is cut short by a moment of forced sentimentality , which also mars the film's conclusion ( one of the last-minute reshoots ) . 
<s>  strangely upbeat and wistful , the resolution is wholly unconvincing and unsatisfying . 
<s>  there is an interesting portrait of studio 54 out there--two of them , in fact--but _54_ is not one of them . 
<s>  they're on cable tv : a couple of documentaries produced by e ! and vh1 . 
<s>  these two fascinating looks at the club and all the sordid goings-on within it show that there's still a great disco movie to be made . 
<s>  the problem is , after the critical and certain box office failure of _54_ , the subject may have run its hollywood course . 
<s>  a hotshot lawyer gets an obviously guilty child molester acquitted , and shortly after during the victory celebration gets offered an opportunity to show his prowess in new york city . 
<s>  the lawyer , kevin lomax ( keanu reeves ) is not offered a job yet , he is asked to simply pick a jury . 
<s>  he accepts . 
<s>  the jury he selects work out well and before long he is offered a job with the firm . 
<s>  making his decision easy is the fact that not only is he offered big money , but a gorgeous apartment . 
<s>  he convinces his wife , mary ann ( charlize theron ) to make the move to new york . 
<s>  the first case given to him is a big test ; a " winless " case concerning a man who sacrifices animals in his basement . 
<s>  the charge was health code violations and kevin once again shows his skill and earns an acquittal . 
<s>  his new boss and partner in the firm , john milton ( al pacino ) is quite impressed and takes kevin under his wing , explaining many of his philosophies on law , women and sex , and angles the promise of a blissful , wealthy life . 
<s>  kevin's next case is a dream case , given to him by milton himself ( much to the chagrin to his colleagues ) , defending a triple murder suspect who has had a history of problems with the law . 
<s>  although kevin's career is taking off , his home life is not doing very well . 
<s>  mary ann is starting to have numerous problems . 
<s>  she is experiencing severe depression over kevin's long hours , and before long is having horrible dreams and hallucinations of people turning into ghouls , their faces becoming horribly disfigured . 
<s>  kevin does not help matters by dismissing his wife . 
<s>  he does not spend more time with her as he explains to milton that he needs to spend as much time on the case as possible to get it over with , then focus all of his attention on his wife . 
<s>  not helping matters is the fact that kevin is having ideas about a possible affair with a sexy lawyer ( connie nielson ) also working with the firm . 
<s>  mary ann falls deeper into her madness as kevin spends more time away from home . 
<s>  kevin eventually looses control of his life and has to institutionalize his wife , and gets disturbing news from his mother ( judith ivey ) about the mystery concerning the identity of his father . 
<s>  he also starts to lose control of his case . 
<s>  kevin learns that all of his problems have been caused by the work of one man . 
<s>  that man is his boss , mr . milton , a truly evil character who just may be the devil himself . 
<s>  kevin must somehow confront milton and thwart whatever diabolical plan he has in store . 
<s>  but how do you defeat the devil ? 
<s>  why is it that most courtroom scenes in the movies are absurd ? 
<s>  do filmmakers really believe that " normal " courtroom drama doesn't fit the bill and they have to juice them up ? 
<s>  the courtroom scenes in this movie would never happen in a real courtroom , which wouldn't have been too bad if it weren't keanu reeves trying to pull it off . 
<s>  i give reeves credit for trying hard , but throughout the movie i never saw the kevin lomax character , just an actor trying very hard to play kevin lomax and coming up short . 
<s>  charlize theron defines the term " over-the-top " in her performance as mary ann lomax , a disappointment in contrast to her good performance in " 2 days in the valley " . 
<s>  the only good performance in the movie is by al pacino , but i kept asking myself what the heck he was doing in this mess ? 
<s>  maybe he felt it would be interesting playing the devil , and you can tell he is having fun doing so , but his skill as an actor cannot save the poor performances and lackluster script that surround him . 
<s>  it's pretty standard stuff , including the fact that the hotshot lawyer appears to be the only competent person on the planet who can do anything right in the courtroom . 
<s>  please read no further if you do not want the ending spoiled , but i have to get something off of my chest . 
<s>  in 1986 i remember watching a movie called " wisdom " with emilio estevez and demi moore , and the ending of that film did the worst possible thing that a movie could do . 
<s>  what i like to call " guess what , it was all a dream " scenario . 
<s>  in " wisdom " the two lead characters are killed at the end , only to have one of the characters " wake up " from an apparent and say " gosh , i'm glad that didn't really happen ! " . 
<s>  i considered it inexcusable the way the audience was toyed with . 
<s>  well , the same thing happens in " the devils advocate " , and although arguments could be made surrounding whether it was actually a dream ( perhaps milton went back in time to try a different route for his plan , since it failed and he is the devil ) , but the point is that the last 90% of the film didn't happen . 
<s>  i know it's a stretch , after all it is a movie and nothing really happened , but i just get annoyed to get toyed with like that . 
<s>  of course , the dream ending could almost be forgiven if the story that precedes it was at least an interesting one . 
<s>  as i recall , " wisdom " was a decent film . 
<s>   " the devil's advocate " is not .

<s>  when did banality and pandering become okay ? 
<s>  just steal from hong kong , the matrix , and a kitschy tv show from the mid-1970s and that's a movie ? 
<s>  charlie's angels is one of the worst examples of action film homogeneity and shameless duplicity in any film i've seen in ages . 
<s>  charlie's angels is dumb . 
<s>  just plain dumb . 
<s>  as we all know , three of the hottest females on the planet -- drew barrymore , cameron diaz , and lucy liu -- are three super-agents working for the mysterious millionaire named charlie . 
<s>  they all drive fast cars , look oh-so-fabulous even in the morning , and don't seem to get a scratch even when fighting armed men , having buildings explode ten feet in front of them , or flying through the air in matrix slow-motion . 
<s>  and while the entourage spends 90 minutes romping around in cleavage-busting wetsuits , cleavage-busting waitress uniforms , and cleavage-busting wet t-shirts , they scarcely succeed in resembling so much as a group of annoying , drunk sorority girls , the kind who hit on everybody at a party . 
<s>  the actual plot revolves around the ridiculous story of a millionaire computer engineer -- the great sam rockwell -- who gets kidnapped by a mysterious rival computer company . 
<s>  of course , the rival wants control of his new personal identification system , which involves such latter-day buzzwords as gps , cellular tracking , and even mainframe . 
<s>  the amazing crispin glover lends his acting chops as a crazed henchmen involved in all the nasty things that happen to the angels -- like battling each of them in many round-robin matrix rip-off ( again ) fight sequences and harboring a strange attraction to sliced-off locks of the angels' hair . 
<s>  the coup de grace is bill murray as bosley , serving as charlie's manservant , or , more to the point , the angels' pimp . 
<s>  the rest of the movie comprises a revenge arc , enough costume changes to fill three productions of les miserables , carbon-copy fight sequences that would lend credible evidence to a jackie chan and the wachowski brothers lawsuit for intellectual property theft , and the strange transformation of sam rockwell into mickey rourke's long-lost brother . 
<s>  charlie's angels starts off with a bang and ends up being a soggy burrito left out overnight . 
<s>  nothing is difficult , plausible , or believable in any of the angels' actions . 
<s>  it feels like the matrix , mission : impossible 2 , and cleopatra jones and the casino of gold all rolled into one . 
<s>  diaz is a knucklehead . 
<s>  barrymore is the " dangerous one , " mean and tough and about as believable as katie holmes in the role . 
<s>  liu is just . . . 
<s>  lucy liu , looking good in a skin-tight black leather suit . 
<s>  the list of movies from which charlie's angels is directly lifted is equally astonishing . 
<s>  the writers apparently ran the copier all night stealing scenes from armageddon , lethal weapon ii , all of jackie chan's movies , the great escape , saturday night fever , revenge of the nerds , payback , darkman , dr . no , the matrix ( as mentioned ) , and even tv's friends .

<s>  then again , what can you expect from a director known solely as " mcg . "

<s>  i have always been a fan of director neil jordan , from his early work , such as 1984's " the company of wolves , " to 1992's " the crying game , " and 1994's " interview with a vampire . " 
<s>  his latest film , " the butcher boy , " is a return to his roots in ireland , but unfortunately , it is not a successful homecoming . 
<s>  told through the eyes of a 12-year-old irish boy , francis ( newcomer eomann owens ) , this peculiar film follows him as we learn a little about his decidedly unstable life . 
<s>  his father ( stephen rea ) is an indifferent alcoholic , his mother ( fiona shaw ) is mentally ill and always in and out of hospitals , and francis himself delights in terrorizing the mother of one of his friends after he is forbidden to see him anymore . 
<s>  francis is the type of boy who always has a lot to say , but mostly fluctuates between sarcasm and frightening honesty , and it quickly becomes apparent that he may very well be a little psychotic , even capable of brutal murder . 
<s>  the premise of , " the butcher boy , " is one that could have very well been turned into a thought-provoking , disturbing motion picture , but somehow nothing works . 
<s>  francis is in almost every scene , but we learn very little about him , as if the film was distancing itself away from him when , i suspect , we were actually supposed to sympathize with him . 
<s>  this is definately not young owens fault , however , because he gives a brilliantly accurate performance , and is able to also seem menacing as well . 
<s>  the fact that we don't get close to his character is because of the sloppy screenplay . 
<s>  the supporting characters are no help , though . 
<s>  rea is wasted , and has practically no scenes where he actually talks to his son , or to anyone else for that matter . 
<s>  he usually seems to just be sitting watching the television throughout . 
<s>  shaw has a little bit more to work with , since she has one touching scene in which she talks to francis in a time of despair , but is out of the picture just as we are beginning to know her . 
<s>  and singer sinead o'connor appears rather effectively as the virgin mary who occasionally gives francis advice . 
<s>  the pacing is all off in , " the butcher boy . " 
<s>  although the story could have been dynamite , it moves at a deadeningly slow rate , and i found my mind wandering every once in a while . 
<s>  it is also very episodic , because the developments in the story fly by with no satisfying payoffs . 
<s>  at one point , francis is sent away to a juvenile prison , and an odd , possibly sexual relationship begins to develop between a priest and himself , but nothing comes of it . 
<s>  i'd rather think of , " the butcher boy , " as a brief diversion for director jordan , rather than a total misfire . 
<s>  he has already proven to be a strong director , but he lucked out with this latest film . 
<s>  what could have been a courageous , unsettling character study of an emotionally disturbed young boy , only manages to be an ineffective , uninvolivng bore .

<s>  with that said , you can pretty much predict what my opinion on " the 13th warrior " will be . 
<s>  the film is based on the michael crichton " eaters of the dead " , in which ahmed ibn fahdlan is banished from his country for looking at a wife of a king . 
<s>  after tarveling for many months , he comes across a gang of norsemen , who are forced to pick 13 men to protect a town from mythical monsters who travel in the fog . 
<s>  so , they start picking men , and are left without 1 , thus ahmed is choosen . 
<s>  so far it sounds interesting right ? 
<s>  not when all of this takes place in 15 minutes . 
<s>  after that , they basically run around killing .

<s>  if i were one of those arrogant critics who thinks his review has some great impact on the success or failure of certain films , i might say that i review movies that don't look particularly good because i'm doing a service to my readers by warning them against seeing it . 
<s>  if that were true , i could put a banner at the top of my site that reads : " shay casey : seeing bad movies so you don't have to . "

<s>  the film takes place aboard the medical space vessel " nightingale . " 
<s>  the crew includes captain a . j . 
<s>  marley ( robert forster ) , his new second officer nick vanzant ( james spader ) , head medical officer kaela evers ( angela bassett ) , medical technicians yerzy penalosa ( lou diamond phillips ) and danika lund ( robin tunney ) , and computer technician benj sotomejor ( wilson cruz ) . 
<s>  there are some attempts at " characterization , " but all that means is that nick has a shady past involving a drug addiction , which puts kaela on edge , yerzy and danika have a relationship that requires them to make kissy-faces at each other every five minutes , and benj ( apparently gay ) is in love with the computer ( apparently female ) . 
<s>  don't expect any more explanation , because you won't get it . 
<s>  anyway , the crew gets a distress call from a location deep in space to which a failed mining operation had been sent . 
<s>  during the dimension jump ( i think that's what it's called , but don't hold me to it ) , the captain is killed and the man who sent the distress signal ( peter facinelli ) is brought on board . 
<s>  he calls himself troy larson , making him the supposed son of a man kaela once had a relationship with .

<s>  have you seen " alien ? " 
<s>  have you seen " event horizon " ( a lame movie in its own right ) ? 
<s>  good . 
<s>  then you've seen " supernova . " 
<s>  post-production cuts or not , there is nothing original about this screenplay , and nothing unpredictable either . 
<s>  after all , no one's going to think for a second that troy won't turn out to be a villain . 
<s>  but the bigger problem with " supernova " is that it can' t just stick to the simple plot it's afforded . 
<s>  numerous re-writes ( the script may be credited to three people , but it's a gross underestimate ) have crammed this lean 90-minute film with tons of extraneous plot threads that all remain underdeveloped . 
<s>  was there something about a limping robot shaped like a fighter pilot ? 
<s>  did the ship's computer learn something about humanity ? 
<s>  what was that glowing lava lamp artifact troy brought on board with him ? 
<s>  and just what does the film's title signify , if anything ? 
<s>  as far as i can tell , it refers to a very small plot detail that isn't developed , just like the rest of these unnecessary story elements . 
<s>  character relationships in this film also make very little sense . 
<s>  for some reason , every person in this film keeps having sex . 
<s>  we get an unusually early sex scene between phillips and tunney within the first 10 minutes . 
<s>  bassett and spader's characters start off hating each other . 
<s>  fifteen minutes and one bottle of pear brandy later , they're engaging in some hanky-panky . 
<s>  when troy the creepy stranger shows up on the ship , of course both female crew members will fall in love with him . 
<s>  every single shift in character interaction happens extremely suddenly , which is only one of the many obvious clues to how much this film has been cut . 
<s>  the most prominent example , however , may be the fact that when the film starts , there are no opening credits ! 
<s>  furthermore , the end of the film looks like they took what were originally intended to be the opening credits and spliced them in right before the real end credits . 
<s>  maybe that's why the film's title is mentioned twice during the end credits , right between james spader and robert forster . 
<s>  right after you get over the shock of not being told what movie you're seeing ( lest you decide to walk out upon making that discovery ) , you might notice that the movie seems to have dropped you right in the middle of a scene , with little-to-no introduction to any of the characters or situations . 
<s>  the rest of the movie feels like they skipped over the middle stuff in the character changes ( you know , where they explain things ) and just went from point a to point b . point a : danika is thoroughly enamored of yerzy and is ready to have his baby . 
<s>  point b : tunney is now shagging troy and yerzy is unusually obsessed with the lava lamp thing . 
<s>  doesn't make sense . 
<s>  since i didn't understand anything about these characters' motivations , did i care when troy abruptly starts murdering them one-by-one ( and he does , knocking off three of them in about 10 minutes ) ? 
<s>  not a whit . 
<s>  it's a shame , because this cast contains a lot of talented actors looking for something to do . 
<s>  they don't find it . 
<s>  bassett and spader say every line in the same monotone voice with the same blank expressions on their faces . 
<s>  sexual tension ? 
<s>  more like constipation . 
<s>  maybe they're just embarrassed at having to utter such howlers as " this thing was made by someone more powerful than god and a whole lot less nice . " 
<s>  not that we ever find out who that is , mind you .

<s>  phillips broods . 
<s>  cruz flirts with the computer . 
<s>  then they all die and a star blows up or something , but i really wasn't paying much attention by then . 
<s>   " supernova " is pretty awful , but i'm cutting it a little slack merely because i expected less than what i got . 
<s>  that's it . 
<s>  if you expect it to be good ( for whatever reasons you may have ) , you'll probably hate it more than i will . 
<s>  even the special effects are fairly unimpressive , nothing you haven' t seen before , and suffice to say the script isn't going to save the film . 
<s>  honestly , though , what do you expect from a film with about a dozen writers and a director who had his name removed and replaced with a pseudonym ? 
<s>  it usually results in a bad movie , and that's what " supernova " is .

<s>  review written on : september 29 , 1993 
<s>  opinions expressed are mine and not meant to reflect my employer's . 
<s>  the obvious reason for producing a sequel to an immensely popular movie is to acquire continued profits . 
<s>  the rationale is sound , but in many cases of this and recent years , the sequel is a shoddy product that's exposed for the cash-milking vehicle it really is . 
<s>  last year's speed 2 and scream 2 , as well as this year's species ii have all been products that have been decisively less than satisfactory . 
<s>  in some cases , a sequel can even discredit its predecessor , as with the latest neo-slasher flick , i still know what you did last summer . 
<s>  whatever uniqueness the original might've had now seems trite and overplayed when paired with this abominable thriller . 
<s>  julie james ( jennifer love hewitt ) and ray bronson ( freddie prinze jr . ) are back from the original to star in i still know , reprising their roles in typical fashion . 
<s>  julie and ray experience a rather predictable falling-out at the beginning of the movie , leaving the door wide open for newcomer will benson ( matthew settle ) . 
<s>  will and julie hit it off , and along with friends karla ( brandy norwood ) and tyrell ( mekhi phifer ) , the foursome heads off to a radio station-giveaway vacation in the tropics . 
<s>  unfortunately , things aren't so peachy once they arrive , and with a regularity you could set your watch by , the infamous fisherman ( muse watson ) is back with his hook . 
<s>  it's another bloody showdown , complete with cliffhanger ending . 
<s>  there's not much that's original about i still know , and with the market saturated by gen-x thrillers like this one , it's unlikely that i still know will get any recognition other than that of a bad sequel . 
<s>  for die-hard fans of the genre , this will be required viewing material , but the bottom line is that the material here is just recycled from the original i know what you did last summer . 
<s>  the aura of thrillerism surrounding the plot isn't heightened by skillful scripting or camera work , but rather a tense , string-based score and manipulative editing . 
<s>  the man with the hook ends up becoming very belittled this time around when the script gives him too many lines of dialogue -- he goes from being a scary figure to a nutcase in a few short and painful moments . 
<s>  much of the mystery is dropped for the sake of getting the point . 
<s>  the whole reason the plot exists - julie and karla must guess the capital of brazil in order to win the trip from the radio station - is a dead giveaway , lessening suspense and creating a hurry-up-and-wait timing problem . 
<s>  and , whereas the killer's identity might've been a question in the first movie , it's almost a given here , which changes the dynamic of the movie drastically . 
<s>  three or four teens run automatically from a man in a rain slicker they nonchalantly refer to as " the killer . " 
<s>  they're almost used to it , and the performances show it - not hewitt , nor prinze , nor brandy , nor phifer give a decent show . 
<s>  and so , in the end , it's left wide open for a third movie and - most likely - a brand new supporting cast . 
<s>  god help us . 
<s>  i'm a dedicated fan of writer kevin williamson's work . 
<s>  he always finds a clever way to spice up old material with witty dialogue and fresh ideas that stem from his inventive brain . 
<s>  with teaching mrs . tingle , his directorial debut , williamson has reached the end of his rope . 
<s>  what used to be intelligent about his films is hopelessly stale here . 
<s>  the components are all there , including an encouraging premise that all high school students can relate to . 
<s>  but where are the thrills ? 
<s>  the laughs ? 
<s>  both are supposedly absent from this draggy exercise in elaborate revenge . 
<s>  and what a shame that is . 
<s>  i loved the scream films - heck , i even enjoyed the sci-fi goofiness of the faculty . 
<s>  kevin williamson was the reason horror films were such a big draw at the box office . 
<s>  teaching mrs . tingle , a black comedy that will leave a gaping void in his optimistic followers , may put an end to his reign . 
<s>  or perhaps it will encourage him to spend more time perfecting a script than to worry about his directing duties . 
<s>  i still have my faith , but i fear the name of kevin williamson may soon be a forgotten echo of the past . 
<s>  the title character of his pet project is a vicious , uncaring history teacher who is played deliciously over-the-top by british actress helen mirren . 
<s>  mrs . tingle is basically every student's worst nightmare : a heartless human being bent on distributing poor marks to even the most hard-working of her pupils . 
<s>  the principal ( michael mckean ) is horrified of her , and she is unanimously despised among her fellow staff members . 
<s>  i enjoyed the fact that everyone in the hallway quickly steers out of her way . 
<s>  mirren's performance is one of the very few delights in this distressingly hollow black comedy that goes down like a flat soft drink . 
<s>  in other words , it's a poor substitute for williamson's best work . 
<s>  the plot is a big problem here . 
<s>  material that could have been enjoyable is rendered totally ridiculous by poor handling on the part of the director . 
<s>  the likable katie holmes plays leigh ann , an over-achiever hoping to get a college scholarship . 
<s>  but typical mrs . tingle says her history project , which she worked on for countless hours , is laughable . 
<s>  later on while studying in the gymnasium , a classmate ( barry watson ) offers her a photo-copied duplicate of mrs . tingle's final exam . 
<s>  leigh ann's best friend ( marisa coughlan ) encourages her to use it . 
<s>  alas , the old hag herself finds the three scheming , and snatches the test , and prepares to talk to the principal in the morning . 
<s>  in the morning . . . 
<s>  how convenient ! 
<s>  the three students head to mrs . tingle's house , attempting to set the facts straight and clear leigh ann's name . 
<s>  things get out of hand , and the teacher gets knocked unconscious in a tussle . 
<s>  the plan is to tie her to a bed and try to get some reasoning out of her . 
<s>  of course , not everything goes entirely to plan . 
<s>  besides pointless sub-plots involving the football coach ( jeffrey tambor , horribly wasted ) , there is little by way of actual progress . 
<s>  there is no urgency to the situation ; little tension or laughs are involved . 
<s>  the humor is completely inconsistent . 
<s>  after many of the jokes , the theater was so silent i could have heard a fly sneeze . 
<s>  you continue to await some momentum in the story , something that could possibly revive the slow pace . 
<s>  a moment like that never arises . 
<s>  williamson also does a handsome job of wasting some of the key supporting players , including the talented mckean and larry sanders' vet tambor . 
<s>  and the beautiful vivica a . fox has one lifeless scene as a caring guidance counselor , and then williamson disposes of her character entirely . 
<s>  on the plus side , holmes and coughlan are admirable ( with the latter giving a frighteningly believable exorcism impression ) , and molly ringwald has an amusing cameo appearance as a substitute teacher . 
<s>  while everything is pretty lifeless , teaching mrs . tingle remains watchable . 
<s>  there are a few promising ideas that pop up now and again , but anything remotely interesting is squandered by the inane script . 
<s>  mirren is easily the best reason to keep watching . 
<s>  she is convincingly evil and fun to watch , but even her gifted delivery can't save individual scenes that flounder in boredom . 
<s>  if there is one word for the movie surrounding her , it would be `disappointing' . 
<s>  basically , kevin williamson is his worst enemy here . 
<s>  his uneventful direction prevents any aspects of his screenplay to be appreciated ( not that his writing here is especially good ) . 
<s>  we will see , when rookie screenwriter ehren kruger writes the third installment in the scream franchise this christmas , whether williamson is for real . 
<s>  a film that means well , but is too pushy in promoting its belabored point and too sentimental to be compelling as a drama . 
<s>  it's jeroen krabb ? 's melodrama about a community of jews in antwerp in 1972 who can't forget their bitter past . 
<s>  the heroine is an attractive , carefree , nonreligious 20-year-old , chaja ( fraser ) , who wants to forget her jewish roots by getting involved in student demonstrations , screwing a student rebel leader , and living with her gentile friends away from her nagging mother ( s ? gebrecht ) and her self-absorbed , eccentric father ( schell ) . 
<s>  her parents are survivors of the holocaust concentration camps , and her home life is filled with angst . 
<s>  her mother is in denial about the past always busying herself by cooking soup and baking cakes and complaining about everything , while her father is more openly loving but has recently been absorbed in searching for two suitcases filled with mementos , a family album , silverware , and his old violin . 
<s>  he buried them in a garden during the war while fleeing the nazis , but can't locate them now due to all the changes in the city . 
<s>  out of frustration after quitting her job as a dishwasher and facing eviction from her apartment , she reluctantly accepts a job as a nanny with an hasidic couple that an old man in her parents' apartment building , mr . apfelschnitt ( topol ) , tells her about . 
<s>  the hasidics are ultra-orthodox : they don't go to the cinema or watch tv , adhere to strict dress codes , and strictly observe their religious laws . 
<s>  chaja is at first put off by the way they expect her to follow their rules , but soon finds the wife , mrs . kalman ( rossellini ) , to be kind and she becomes attached to one of her 5 children , a 4-year-old named simcha ( monty ) who doesn't talk . 
<s>  the stern mr . kalman ( krabb ? ) is not friendly to her and considers her to be a whore because of the way she dresses . 
<s>  to hammer home the point of how anti-semitism hasn't gone away there's a barrage of overdone and uninvolving scenes with a sneering concierge ( bradley ) , who keeps making nasty remarks about jews and tries to make things inconvenient for them by preventing the jewish family from using the elevator . 
<s>  the film is done in by its ham-fisted script as the story , adapted from carl friedman's book " the shovel and the loom , " goes from one false note to another until it gets lost in all the goo of its sentimentality . 
<s>  it starts off telling chaja's story of how she's a lost jewess trying to find her identity , then to her nanny role as she loves a mute child stuck in an insulated environment , and then it makes it a story about the lingering effects of the bitter past that can't be forgotten . 
<s>  the effort seemed heavy-handed , as the film kept delivering too many obvious messages that it ponderously kept delivering through the stock characters . 
<s>  the supporting cast consists of all wooden characters who give their roles a cartoonish flavoring : chaja's parents are given no human shades , while the janitor villain was a particularly annoying role that was one-dimensional and falsely acted . 
<s>  the only ones who fought through the script and showed some feelings were fraser , whose effervescent face was expressive of both the trying times she was going through and the joys she felt -- but most admirably showing how she could be so mistaken as to think that she could forget her roots ; while rossellini gave a warm performance of a woman suffering in silence , but is strong in accepting her faith . 
<s>  topol's reassuring performance as the wise man who says all the right things to fraser , acts as the true voice of the filmmaker in explaining all the sufferings with common sense . 
<s>  the film brazenly uses little simcha to get across its agenda of pointing out how the patriarchal world can be cruel when it can't love : it starts out by showing how under chaja's loving care he's taken to the duck pond and soon starts jabbering away , beginning by saying 'quack , quack' and then going on to ask the four questions during a passover seder . 
<s>  but by showing how the boy is so terrified of his strict father that he wets his pants in his presence , refuses to speak because of his stern dad , and eventually becomes the victim of a tragic accident , the film thereby exploits the boy's sufferings and his story just becomes tiresome and not sincerely done . 
<s>  i felt i didn't just see a movie , but i attended a lecture for the whole 100 minutes of this serious but unappetizing story . 
<s>  it was the kind of movie that you hoped would somehow end soon , as it seemed to be in the habit of rehashing its same viewpoint unnecessarily--the message it keeps sending was already received . 
<s>  in the last shot where father and daughter are hopelessly digging for the lost luggage , one has the impression that no one in the film learned anything about themselves or the past . 
<s>  that seems strange , since i thought that was what this film was supposed to be about . 
<s>  unless i was mistaken and the film's real aim was to make us cry over simcha . 
<s>  the tagline for this film is : " some houses are just born bad " . 
<s>  so i didn't expect too much from this . 
<s>  but i had preserved a little spark of ope as i entered the theatre . 
<s>  i thought : liam neeson , cathrine zeta jones and jan de bont . 
<s>  i thought , mabe it will be fun ? 
<s>  and in fact the beginning was rather intriguing . 
<s>  but by the end of it i thought : why liam neeson and cathrine zeta jones , jan de bont ? . 
<s>  these great actors are basically helpless with this muddled mess that defies any rationality . 
<s>  here is the story : in the monstrously over-decorated mansion known as hill house , visitors are tricked by an unknown doctor ( liam neeson ) into being guinea pigs in a fright experiment under the guise of an insomnia investigation . 
<s>  among them is a sophisticated bisexual ( cathrine zeta jones ) , a cynical dope ( owen wilson ) and a gentle and emotional lady ( lily taylor ) . 
<s>  actually , the doctor is researching the " primordial fear reaction " and intends to plant disturbing ideas in his subjects and watch what happens . 
<s>  but he gets unexpected help from the house itself . 
<s>  it rumbles , hums and belches forth remarkable sights . 
<s>  portals become veiny stained-glass eyeballs . 
<s>  a fireplace guarded by stone lions gapes like a sinister mouth . 
<s>  filmy cherubic spirits take shape under sheets and billowy curtains . 
<s>  but the computerized spooketeria rarely feels real , placing an emotional wall between audience and screen . 
<s>  the second half of the film is basically about the main heroine running back and forth from the sinister lamps and evil furniture . 
<s>  is that exciting or what ? 
<s>  the worst thing about it is that it didn't have to be bad . 
<s>  it's based on a great book , ``the haunting of hill house , '' by shirley jackson . 
<s>  a 1963 adaptation of the book was scary and intelligent . 
<s>  it played with the greatest fears of our sub conscience . 
<s>   " the blair witch project " , that cost less than an old car , managed to shock and terrify the audiences from their senses . 
<s>  and with a $70 mill . 
<s>  budget , de bont and screenwriter david self make hash out of a perfectly lovely piece of terror . 
<s>  de bont has a style of filmmaking so out of line with the material that it is , in itself , frightening . 
<s>  he is the master of the extravagant special effect and the big visual adrenaline rush . 
<s>  but why give him a more serious material ? 
<s>  in the end " haunting " will only haunt its fledgling studio ( dream works skg ) and de bont's career as a director . 
<s>  yet it wouldn't be fair to say that everything is bad . 
<s>  the effects are truly impressive and the house is wonderfully decorated -- beautiful , mysterious , magical and spooky . 
<s>  but this is where the good things end . 
<s>  the music is blaring , the floors moving , the ceiling morphing and the pictures on the walls screaming -- and all of this , every second , every moment of screen time , is absolutely without life . 
<s>  it's nothing more than a special effects-extravaganza ; visually impressive , but intellectually hollow thriller that simply doesn't engage . 
<s>  at first you do not know what's going on . 
<s>  is this part of the experiment ? 
<s>  are these hallucinations ? 
<s>  projections of the subconscience ? 
<s>  paranoia ? 
<s>  but in the end it shows out that this is actually happening . 
<s>  the house is actually possessed . 
<s>  it is at that point when all your hopes for a good entertainment disappears out of the window . 
<s>  for ever , i sat in anticipation for a decent climax and that's what i got ? 
<s>  i believe hichock once said that " it's better to wait for a climax , than to see one " . 
<s>  this may be true , and it might actually work , but there is only one problem -- jan de bont is not hichock and the things that he shows are not scary , only stupid . 
<s>  they are impossible to take seriously . 
<s>  any paralells that you might have heard before , linking this picture to kubrick's " the shining " , are absolutely baseless . 
<s>   " shining " had class , style , story , acting , but most of all talent and originality . 
<s>   " haunting " has only special effects and art direction to boast of . 
<s>  and those elements alone are not enough to make it a good film . 
<s>  casting good actors for small , pale parts only makes things worse . 
<s>  but i guess that no matter what i or other critics say or write , most of you will see this film anyway , even if the tagline would say : " some films are just born stupid " . 
<s>  porter stoddard ( warren beatty ) is a successful architect married to successful fabric designer ellie ( diane keaton ) for twenty-five years . 
<s>  they and best friends mona ( goldie hawn ) and griffin ( garry shandling ) are about to face marital crises in a film most well known for its torturous path to the screen , " town and country . " 
<s>   " town and country " has a pedigree befitting it's title with an all star cast photographed by oscar nominated cinematographer william fraker and mouthing the words of screenwriter buck henry ( " the graduate " ) under the direction of peter chelsom ( " funny bones " ) . 
<s>  after years of reports of budget overruns and reshoots and the racking up twelve different release dates , the media has been prepped for beatty's next " ishtar . " 
<s>  so , is it that bad ? 
<s>  the answer is no . 
<s>  but it's not very good either . 
<s>  the major problem with " town and country " is that it's unstructured and random . 
<s>  stoddard is immediately established as a philanderer , having just bedded a flaky cellist ( nastassja kinski ) . 
<s>  next scene finds him and ellie celebrating their anniversary in paris with mona and griffin . 
<s>  then mona spies griffin hustling a redhead into a motel and begins divorce proceedings ( buck henry cameos as both couples' divorce lawyer ) . 
<s>  ellie thinks she's overeacting , but sends porter to support mona on a trip to check out her family's mississippi manse . 
<s>  the two childhood friends end up in bed together , making us wonder why they'd never become a couple to begin with . 
<s>  back home , their second coupling is interrupted by ellie bursting in to tell mona she thinks porter's cheating on her . 
<s>  porter goes off on a trip with griffin to sun valley , idaho to have more comic misadventures with wacky women as griffin attempts to tell him that he's gay . 
<s>  the four friends , along with every woman porter's dallied with , all end up back in new york city somewhat happily ever after . 
<s>  although the film begins promisingly , resembling a woody allen take on new york city wasps , too many strands drift off into nowhere . 
<s>  the stoddard household is huge , containing two adult children ( josh hartnett , " the virgin suicides " and tricia vessey , " kiss the girls " ) , their colorful bedmates and a maid who's just imported her shirtless boyfriend from the rainforest back home . 
<s>  after an amusing early scene that has porter overhearing three bouts of lovemaking while in search of a nocturnal snack , the six supporting players are dropped except for an out-of-nowhere appearance by the formerly forgotten son . 
<s>  porter's romantic misadventures with women ( other than mona ) are equally mishandled . 
<s>  once the marital discord begins , the film seems as if it was editted with a machete , stopping and starting , never regaining its rhythm . 
<s>  while beatty gets off a few tart observations , his character is mostly passive and bemused . 
<s>  maybe we're supposed to feel sympathy for an adulterer who doesn't initiate his own sex romps ? 
<s>  keaton's ellie has a trusting nature that's a result of her own self involvement resulting in an unlikeable character . 
<s>  hawn smartly recycles her mature sex kitten wives of " the out of towners " and " the first wives' club " while shandling's relegated to true second banana status . 
<s>  kinski is bland and unmotivated . 
<s>  andie macdowell takes a weirdly unappealing role and does what she can with the screenplay's most bizarre subplot , which finds charlton heston as her rifle toting , billionaire daddy and marian seldes as her alcoholic , wheelchair-bound , foul-mouthed mother . 
<s>  heston and seldes are fun , as is jenna elfman as a sun valley bait and tackle salesgirl who brings porter and griffin to a halloween party . 
<s>  oscar nominatored cinematographer william fraker gives the film a nice look , but director chelsom shows none of the quirkily and blackly humorous depth he brought to films like " hear my song " and " funny bones . " 
<s>  the script is this film's weakest link - it's telling that most of the ( few ) laughs come from old-fashioned physical slapstick and the sight of beatty in a bear suit . 
<s>  while " town and country " isn't exactly painful to sit through , it mostly just lays there .

<s>  the plot of 8mm is similar to the 1977 paul schrader film hardcore , a surprisingly decent and engrossing tale . 
<s>  in fact , it was everything that 8mm is not . 
<s>  in the opening minutes of 8mm , we see private detective tom welles ( nicolas cage ) working on a case for a prestigious member of the u . s . government . 
<s>  keep this fact in mind , cage is trusted with an important case , which he solves . 
<s>  he returns home to his wife and new daughter , and even finds time to rake his yard ( keep that in mind too , it's important as well ) . 
<s>  he's hired by a rich elderly woman to solve a mystery . 
<s>  after her husband's death she comes across a film in his private safe . 
<s>  it appears to be snuff film , a sort of urban legend of the pornography industry in which someone is actually brutally murdered for the camera . 
<s>  the woman wants welles to locate the young girl in the film , hopefully to disprove that it is in fact a snuff film . 
<s>  so he sets off on a journey into the sordid underworld of sleaze to discover the truth about the film .

<s>  tv's buffy finds herself on the other side of the supernatural spectrum in " simply irresistible . " 
<s>  sarah michelle gellar , that never-ceasing crusader against never-ending evil every tuesday night on the wb network , here plays a down-on-her-luck chef suspected of dabbling in witchcraft after her flailing restaurant receives help in the form of magically scrumptious meals . 
<s>  taste test results : some vampire slaying , though out of place , would have really livened this excruciating movie up . 
<s>   " simply irresistible " is actually quite easy to deny , a disaster of culinary and other proportions pretty much from the opening on . 
<s>  gellar's amanda finds herself falling for harried henri bendel exec tom ( sean patrick flannery of powder ) around the same time she discovers an uncanny ability to mystically manifest emotions in her cooking , a secret ingredient that arouses both his interest in her and the public's in her tiny tribeca eatery . 
<s>  all this love and sorcery have a lot to do with the telekinetic crab that also figures into the story , a tale that at times plays like an american spin on 1993's mexican classic " like water for chocolate . " 
<s>  several differences : one , " like water " didn't have a telekinetic crab , and two , " like water " was a good film . 
<s>   " simply irresistible , " on the other hand , is about as challenging as an easy-bake oven . 
<s>  amateurishly staged scenes cancel each other out in their badness , from an embarrassing seduction in a literal vanilla fog to an impromptu dance sequence where tom and amanda do their best fred and ginger - though fred and ginger never took part in anything this garish . 
<s>  the intrusive musical score distracts from the flat dialogue at regular intervals , but it's not like you're were going to miss much . 
<s>  in fact , take away the few instances of salty language and this has made-for-disney channel written all over it . 
<s>  but a majority of " simply irresistible " 's resistibility factor has less to do with the afore-mentioned overkill than the bland leads - tom and amanda are so thin and ambiguously defined that there's just no fun rooting for their inevitable " happily ever after . " 
<s>  nor do the otherworldly powers that serve to bring them together make sense , so we're left with a ho-hum relationship based on enchanted eclairs ; it's not going to last long , people . 
<s>  perhaps sensing this , the filmmakers have piled on weird supporting characters for acting vets like betty buckley , dylan baker and patricia clarkson , but they don't go anywhere either . 
<s>  in fact , nothing in " simply irresistible " goes anywhere save for gellar , and she doesn't go somewhere so much as you wish she'd go _somewhere_ - like to a better movie . 
<s>  already proving major talent with relatively few big- and small-screen roles , she's the sole reason this overcooked souffle isn't completely fit for the garbage disposal , looking smashing in her todd oldham-designed duds and investing much more in her perfunctory part than she ever gets in return . 
<s>  it's certainly a dish best not served in it's current condition , but one can only guess that , without gellar , " simply irresistible " would be strictly unwatchable . 
<s>  the 13th warrior reeks so badly of melodrama and poor acting that it carries a worst scent than a canine's least appetizing residue .

<s>  my vote goes for the ending credits , where you can start trying to put the awful experience behind you .

<s>  the movie proves to be a new low point for banderas , who's acting seems closer to that of his role as the lover and caretaker for a dying gay man in 1993's philadelphia , than that of a warrior .

<s>  and finally , " will the manager give me a refund ? "

<s>  they've stacked the deck with two big stars ( val kilmer , michael douglas ) , a bigger production design , beautiful photography ( by academy award winner vilmos zsigmond ) , and a score so overblown that it makes the lion king soundtrack sound like chamber music .

<s>  movies can do the two big es very well : educate and entertain . 
<s>  in the best of all possible worlds , they accomplish both . 
<s>  on the red planet , they fail entirely . 
<s>  in the near future , a manned mission is sent to mars to observe primitive plant growth . 
<s>  this film does a remarkable job of demonstrating exactly how exciting watching algae grow would be . 
<s>  after some mumbo-jumbo about an ecological disaster on earth and an interminable wait to reach the fourth planet , the ship falls apart almost as fast as the movie does . 
<s>  the ground crew of people you couldn't care less about is trapped on the surface without food , water or air and stalked by a deadly rogue cyberdog . 
<s>  the one potentially interesting character ( carrie-anne moss ) spends her time alone in the orbiting ship talking to a computer .

<s>  alexander dumas' the three musketeers is one of the most often-adapted literary works , and for good reason : the swashbuckler is a legend rather than just a story . 
<s>  perhaps the musketeer , a new film that " reimagines " the novel in the spirit and style of the matrix , is one adaptation too many . 
<s>  it's just awful : spiritless , silly and unforgivably boring , transforming the timeless classic into a mish-mash of old-as-time clich ? s and incoherent , repetitive action sequences . 
<s>  this time , d'artagnan is played by calvin klein model justin chambers , who can't even pronounce his character's name . 
<s>  as a boy , he watched his father get killed by febre ( tim roth ) , a lackey of power-hungry cardinal richelieu . 
<s>  he vowed to have vengeance . 
<s>  after undergoing intense training under an expert swordsman , he goes looking for his enemy . 
<s>  on his quest , he embroils himself in a struggle for control at the highest levels of the french government . 
<s>  the royal musketeers have lost their gusto , what with their jobs being taken over by the cardinal's own guards . 
<s>  only a few loyal swashbuckers remain , among them athos and portos ( who are only figureheads in this movie ) . 
<s>  together with d'artagnan , they fight to extricate the queen ( catherine deneuve ) from the traps that febre and richelieu are trying to plant . 
<s>  oh , and as an afterthought , d'artagnan falls in love with the poor maid at the local inn ( mena suvari ) . 
<s>  just thought i'd mention that . 
<s>  now , look : i don't know whose idea this was , but whoever is responsible deserves a severe tongue-lashing . 
<s>  i have nothing against " modernizing " classic works of literature - at the very least , they can inspire viewers to actually read the book - but films as dull as this have no positive side effects . 
<s>  director peter hyams , known for such masterpieces of modern cinema as timecop and end of days , has jettisoned everything that was great about dumas' masterwork : the sense of excitement , cause , and camaraderie . 
<s>  instead , we get impressively choreographed but somehow vacuous , uninvolving action sequences that emerge from emptiness and lead to nothing . 
<s>  when the musketeers finally get to holler " all for one , and one for all , " i could have sworn that was dumas rolling in his grave that i felt . 
<s>  maybe the reason for the utter lack of suspense here is the hyams's tone , which is unreasonably dark and brooding when you consider the reader's digest condensed version of the story that he gives us . 
<s>  it's as though anything that may have been construed as " fun " was purposely expunged from the production . 
<s>  the joylessness of the proceedings , from the oppressively shady lighting to the mechanical fight scenes , can be felt in every frame . 
<s>  chambers can't act ; suvari , roth and deneuve can , but aren't given the chance . 
<s>  and when push comes to shove , the use of stunt doubles is distractingly obvious , though at least roth gets to play a villain without having to wear an ape suit . 
<s>  some movies seem sloppy and careless , clearly made for a quick buck . 
<s>  with the musketeer we get the sense that it was meticulously crafted to be awful . 
<s>  the film is intricate , stylish and precise , hitting the wrong note every single time .

<s>  although some of the destruction is entertaining for a while , it gets old fast .

<s>  when i first saw the preview for cruel intentions , i turned to my friend and said , " dangerous liaisons for kids ! " 
<s>  it was clear to me that the film would be an obvious chunk of plagiarized nonsense , owing everything it is to stephen frears' 1988 masterpiece . 
<s>  imagine my surprise to see that writer/director roger kumble has given credit to his source material : choderlos de laclos is recognized for his novel les liaisons dangereuses in the opening credits . 
<s>  and i was impressed . 
<s>  in fact , i was much more impressed with this recognition than with the actual film , which is an appalling excuse for a movie . 
<s>  it's kiddie-porn hackwork , complete with earthy sex-talk and fully-clothed hand-jobs . 
<s>  i suppose this kind of movie was inevitable ; with all the teen high-school angst movies coming out , there was certainly room for a pretentious and laughable movie about a bunch of teenagers who think they're smarter and more beautiful than all the other people on earth combined . 
<s>  cruel intentions is a mess in every possible way , and it fails primarily in the way i expected it to : i hated all the characters , and i hate everything they do . 
<s>  i also hate ryan phillippe , so perhaps my opinion is not as objective as it could be . 
<s>  phillippe plays ( check out this name ) sebastian valmont . 
<s>  wow . 
<s>  isn't that a memorable name ? 
<s>  i could just say it over and over again . 
<s>  sebastian valmont . 
<s>  it kind of rolls off the tongue , in the spirit of phrases like sanguine vapors and velvet sandwich . 
<s>  sebastian valmont is the coolest guy who ever walked the earth ; there is no woman he can't have , no material object out of his reach . 
<s>  he has all the money , all the sex -- all at his fingertips . 
<s>  and , luckily , his parents never enter into his life -- no , in the world of cruel intentions , adults don't really exist . 
<s>  the ones who do are irritating . 
<s>  sebastian valmont lives with his stepsister , kathryn merteuil ( sarah michelle gellar ) , the bitch-queen of the universe , and also the woman every man wants . 
<s>  since these two rich kids are so bored , they only thing they can do is challenge each other with meaningless sexual liaisons . 
<s>  kathryn wants sebastian valmont to de-virginize cecile caldwell ( selma blair ) , a naive dork-chick who has somehow wronged kathryn . 
<s>  but it's too easy for sebastian valmont -- he wants to nail annette hargrove ( reese witherspoon ) , the " paradigm of chastity and beauty . " 
<s>  so , sebastian valmont and kathryn make a deal ( which is too explicit to state here ) . 
<s>  but -- dear god ! 
<s>  -- sebastian valmont actually begins to fall for poor annette hargrove . 
<s>  dangerous liaisons is a great movie because the characters are all believable , and because of its masterful acting . 
<s>  cruel intentions is bad for many reasons , but it lacks both believable characters and masterful acting . 
<s>  kathryn merteuil is simply a hateful witch , a girl so loathsome that i would probably enjoy pouring hot lead on her . 
<s>  she is supposed to be mean , but glenn close gave the character some depth in dangerous liaisons . 
<s>  gellar , while aesthetically pleasing , is one-dimensional and utterly repulsive . 
<s>  witherspoon has a truly beautiful face , but her character isn't the moral staple she's supposed to be : sure , she won't have sex until she's in love ( is this really a * moral * issue ? ) , but she does some things in the last few scenes that are more than a little reprehensible . 
<s>  but i can't forget mr . phillippe , who continues to exceed my expectations with his impenetrable , invulnerable blandness . 
<s>  i have to give him credit and say that he did , in fact , manage to change his facial expression about three times during the course of cruel intentions . 
<s>  and there's one point in the film in which he shouts , thereby defeating my hypothesis that he is vocally monotone . 
<s>  true , he is bad , but it doesn't help that he has no character to work with . 
<s>  kumble has drained all the interesting aspects from this character , leaving us with a sex-crazed lunatic who is supposed to be sympathetic because he falls in love with a moral flower and shuns the wicked bitch . 
<s>  the film fails in every other way , too . 
<s>  first of all , nobody talks like this . 
<s>  even the " intellectuals " i know don't bother with this kind of pointless and pretentious yammering . 
<s>  for a while , the movie looks like it might play itself for laughs , but it ends up taking itself so seriously that there's no way we can join it . 
<s>  cruel intentions also manages to come off as soft-porn in more than one scene . 
<s>  earlier i mentioned a fully-clothed hand-job ; this occurs between kathryn and sebastian valmont , both of whom are intended to be hateful at this point in the movie . 
<s>  so , if we hate them , then what's the point of an extended sex scene ? 
<s>  titillation , of course . 
<s>  it can't even work under the pretense of " meaningful love scene , " because we hate the characters . 
<s>  it's interesting to note some of the parallels between cruel intentions and dangerous liaisons .

<s>  eliot ( corbin allred ) reader .

<s>  the film is one big battle of wills between mother and daughter over their dreams .

<s>  tomb raider .

<s>  exciting ? 
<s>  challenging ?

<s>  deep rising demonstrates all the originality and vitality of something scripted by a computer .

<s>  i suppose deep rising's gallery of grotesque images represents fun stuff for those who love the macabre , but it doesn't do much for me . 
<s>  on the surface , and that's about the only level at which this film can be analyzed , deep rising feels like tremors grafted onto titanic ( everyone else is citing the equally valid aliens/titanic connection , since james cameron directed both ) . 
<s>  in going for the big disaster angle of titanic and the tongue-in-cheek mayhem of tremors , deep rising somehow misses both marks by a wide margin . 
<s>  the film is not humorous , tense , or exciting . 
<s>  in fact , it's downright boring , and , despite being half the length of cameron's current box-office champ , deep rising feels like the longer movie . 
<s>  is it really necessary to say anything about the plot ? 
<s>  probably not , since it's easy to guess , but i'll go ahead and oblige anyone who wants a synopsis . 
<s>  the film opens by introducing us to a gang of bad guys on board a mercenary ship . 
<s>  in addition to the usual cast of psychopaths and lunatics , there's finnegan ( treat williams ) , the boat's pilot , who's supposed to be an indiana jones knockoff ; joey ( kevin j . o'connor ) , the inept sidekick who's supposed to be lovable and funny ( but is really just irritating ) ; and hanover ( wes studi ) , the " mastermind " ( and i use that term lightly ) of the operation . 
<s>  their goal : attack a cruise ship , clean out the safe , then sink it using some illegally-acquired torpedoes . 
<s>  the problem is , by the time they reach the argonautica , the titanic-like luxury liner has turned into the marie celeste . 
<s>  aside from a beautiful jewel thief ( famke janssen ) and a couple of crew members , there's no one on board . 
<s>  the reason soon becomes obvious -- the ship has been taken over by a bad special effect that is supposed to resemble an octopus with teeth and more than eight tentacles . 
<s>  the cast , which is led by treat williams , is primarily comprised of has-beens and probably-never-will-bes ( two exceptions : wes studi , best known as the villain in the last of the mohicans , and djimon hounsou , amistad's cinque ) . 
<s>  williams , once a " can't miss " prospect in hollywood , has fallen so far out of favor that the best he can do these days for a lead role is a film like deep rising , and his inability to create a charismatic or interesting figure here may sink whatever is left of his sputtering career . 
<s>  famke janssen , who will forever be known as xenia onatopp from goldeneye , is the perfect bland match for williams .

<s>  meanwhile , kevin j . o'connor , who has entirely too much screen time , exhibits all the appeal of fingernails scratching a blackboard .

<s>  this is a lesson that writer/director stephen sommers ( who previously helmed the live-action jungle book ) needs to learn . 
<s>  the days of jurassic park , when viewers were astounded by the mere spectacle of seeing something big and imposing on screen , are past . 
<s>  now , movie-goers are looking for the sophistication of titanic -- visuals that are so well-incorporated that it's impossible to tell where they end and where " reality " begins . 
<s>  in deep rising , the monster , like everything , is artificial and unconvincing . 
<s>  unfortunately , the fundamental problem audiences are faced with here isn't so much the idiotic monotony of this individual picture , but the poor quality of the entire bankrupt genre ( although , to be fair , deep rising is a particularly bad entry ) . 
<s>  even once this film has sunk out of sight , the knowledgeable viewer knows it won't be the last of its kind . 
<s>  like the slimy , slithering things that inhabit the air vents and pipes of these movies , more are waiting just around the corner in ambush . 
<s>  and that consideration , unlike anything on screen , is truly horrifying . 
<s>  this is an adaptation of h . g . wells' acclaimed novel 'the invisible man' . 
<s>  the actors are kevin beacon and elizabeth shue . 
<s>  the director is paul verhoven . 
<s>  that , plus a quick demonstration of the amazing special effects in the trailer , should be enough to lure us into the theatre . 
<s>  the problem is to keep us there . 
<s>  i can't imagine anyone who would like to see this movie a second time . 
<s>  working on a top secret military project , sebastian caine ( kevin beacon ) -- an eccentric genius , that calls himself " god " , has discovered the secret to invisibility . 
<s>  the first two faces are completed . 
<s>  now , it is time for " the next logical step " -- human . 
<s>  caine volunteers for this risky experiment . 
<s>  but when he is made invisible , something goes wrong . 
<s>  while his ex-girlfriend linda ( elisabeth shue ) desperately tries to find something to return him to normal , he learns that invisibility is more of a prison than a superpower . 
<s>  but that's not the bad thing -- an unexpected side-effect of the drug sends him careening into paranoid megalomania . 
<s>  he is naturally given a couple of modest superpowers , just enough for him to survive immolation from a flame thrower and an explosion of about a quart of nitroglycerine . 
<s>  soon every sense of decency is forgotten . 
<s>  the little intelligence that was left disappears as verhoven looses control and the film turns into an alien-rip-off , where caine is walking like a half finished terminator , spooking , scaring and killing everybody . 
<s>  though it's based on a novel called 'the invisible man' , the title has been ironically changed to 'hollow man' that sums up the film very nicely . 
<s>  this is a very silly production . 
<s>  laughable , actually . 
<s>  apparently verhoven's imagination doesn't stretch too far . 
<s>  for him the only worthwhile reason to become invisible is so you can case the girls' locker room undetected . 
<s>  it is this primitive schoolboy mentality that eventually kills the movie . 
<s>  being invisible , gives you the opportunity to be who you are , to do what you want without being influenced by society . 
<s>  in many ways it gives you an illusion of having a life without consequences . 
<s>  the nature of man and his place in society is what the novel is truly about . 
<s>  all that , the depth and true horror of the book is gone and only special effects make you remain in your seat . 
<s>  caine does use his power voyeuristically in hollow man . 
<s>  but since this is a modernization , in other words a dehumanization , he doesn't stop there . 
<s>  he becomes a rapist . 
<s>  and then , of course , a murderer . 
<s>  you'll start wondering why such actors as beacon and shue found themselves in such film in the first place . 
<s>  shue's talent is barely seen , josh brolin is underused and the rest of the cast suffer mostly for the lack of talent . 
<s>  kevin beacon is the only one that performs gracefully . 
<s>  his face is not seen for the most part of the film , and the only way he exists is as a disembodied voice . 
<s>  there are times when his presence actually saves the film from being completely embarrassing . 
<s>  in the end the effects are the only reason to see this film in the first place . 
<s>  being probably the best technical achievement since " jurassic park " , they are absolutely amazing . 
<s>  we observe the layers of skin , muscle , tissue , and bone being peeled away as a body is slowly rendered invisible . 
<s>  we see a beating heart , inflating lungs , and veins pulsing with newly-pumped blood . 
<s>  there are a couple of inventive shots with smoke , fire , air and water , but are a few scenes like that worth attending a movie for ? 
<s>  what is truly disturbing is that with a great book , talented actors and a grand budget , this could have been so much more . 
<s>  pretty much like jan de bont ( " twister " , " haunting " ) , paul verhoven has never made anything extraordinary . 
<s>  he was responsible for several good films ( " basic instinct " and " starship troopers ) " and some incredibly bad films ( " showgirls " , " total recall " ) , but he has never made anything that was great . 
<s>  in a way " hollow man " fits perfectly in this collection . 
<s>  it's not better or worse than verhoven's average film .

<s>  and so , instead of depth and chills , verhoven inserts some of his trademarks : stupid dialogue , and lot's of dull action with blood and naked bodies .

<s>  and attempt to run towards the exit in slow motion ) .

<s>  the answer is simple . 
<s>  though hollywood is a movie producing machine , the business of moviemaking has to be about something more than money . 
<s>  it has to be about telling stories , not marketing them . 
<s>  it has to be about transporting us to a different place , to dazzle us with magic and cleverness . 
<s>  to make us care , to make us think and feel . 
<s>  verhoven has obviously missed that point and this film is a proof of that .

<s>  drew barrymore is beginning to corner the market on playing the girl outside - the one who's the awkward klutz or the spunky do-it-yourselfer ; the one who just doesn't fit in with the others . 
<s>  she has perfected these characters in movies such as " the wedding singer " and , most notably , " ever after . " 
<s>  now she's back , starring in what could be called a modern-day cinderella fable - " never been kissed . " 
<s>  you know it's a fable because she plays a copy editor at a newspaper who has her own office as well as a secretary . 
<s>  trust me on this one , no copy editor has seen the inside of a private office since gutenberg ( and i don't mean steve ) invented the printing press . 
<s>  the premise is simple . 
<s>  barrymore's josie geller , at 25 the youngest copy editor ever to be hired by the chicago sun-times , is assigned to go undercover and return to high school to do an expose on what today's teens are feeling and doing . 
<s>  josie ( she says she was named after the '70s cartoon character ) was a geek in high school , so she jumps at the opportunity for a second chance . 
<s>  this time , she thinks , she will get it right and be accepted by the in-crowd . 
<s>  now , what kind of adult - with a good job and a successful career - would actually look forward to reliving the hell that was - and is - high school and adolescence . 
<s>  these are among the many problems that plague " never been kissed . "

<s>  their script has her capriciously switching from confident adult to ditzy , blubbering woman-child at the least provocation . 
<s>  and the fact that an adult would put so much stock into trying to become tight with the vapid airheads who are supposedly south glen high school's most popular girls leads you to question her maturity and mental stability . 
<s>  ok , so " never been kissed " is not a sociological expose of today's high school scene .

<s>  among the movie's problems is the ill-conceived conceit that josie would seriously strive to climb the high school food chain and , in the process , lose focus on her assignment .
