<s>  since director steven zaillian previously wrote the powerful screenplay for 1993's steven spielberg drama " schindler's list " and directed 1993's intelligent " searching for bobby fischer , " his new film , " a civil action , " should most likely be looked upon as an unfortunate misstep in an otherwise prosperous career . 
<s>  what doesn't make sense is how such high-profile and superb actors as john travolta , robert duvall , william h . macy , and kathleen quinlan got involved in this project , which is both dull and completely ineffective . 
<s>  the film , which involves a small community of children who mysteriously died of leukemia , certainly contains the type of story to be emotionally-charged , but somehow all signs of feeling have been completely removed from the proceedings , leaving us with nothing more than a poorly-done courtroom drama . 
<s>  based on a book by jonathan hart , which was consequently based on a true account , " a civil action " is set in 1982 in the town of woburn , mass . , where personal injury lawyer jan schlictmann ( john travolta ) decides to take on the case of eight families who simply want an apology for their children's death from leukemia due to unknown causes . 
<s>  jan originally decides to drop the case , but when he stumbles across to corporate giants , grace and beatrice foods , who have plants located near the families' homes , he sees all of the pieces suddenly fall into place : the two companies have been leaking harmful chemicals into the nearby lake which , thus , goes into the city's drinking water . 
<s>  suddenly , after hearing about the families' heartbreak and personal stories , he begins to care for them and becomes determined to get to the bottom of the mystery , even though he is warned by his staff accountant ( william h . macy ) that no money is coming in to them , only going out . 
<s>  also figuring into the story is jerome facher ( robert duvall ) , beatrice foods' corporate counsel , who finds himself in heated waters when jan will not accept his $20-million offer to settle the case . 
<s>  coming from such a talented writer , director , and cast , not to mention one of the most interesting film composers , danny elfman , " a civil action " is an astoundingly empty-headed drama , one that includes an intriguing story and somehow transforms it into an admittedly tiresome and occasionally even boring experience . 
<s>  perhaps one of its major problems was that in its attempts to be a relatively uncommercial motion picture , zaillian has misplaced its refreshing unconventional attitude with an absence of magnetism and even meaning . 
<s>  watching the film , i couldn't help but notice its similarities with 1997's far , far superior film " the sweet hereafter , " which dealt with a lawyer , played brilliantly by ian holm , investigating a school bus accident that killed a number of children . 
<s>  in his attempts to find someone who may have been responsible for the accident , holm interviews the grieving parents , as well as the sole surviving passenger , a teenage girl , which starts to remind him of his own teenage daughter , a young drug-addict who has run away from home . 
<s>  not only was the plotting similar to " a civil action , " but it also had the same exact running time of 115 minutes . 
<s>  considering this , it is amazing how fulfilling and truthful " a sweet hereafter " was , not only concentrating on the school bus accident , but delving deeply into ian holm's character and his own personal demons , as well as the teenage girl . 
<s>  in " a civil action , " however , i have no idea where the running time went , since the film is virtually two hours of nothingness . 
<s>  we do not get to know the parents very well , nor any of the main characters . 
<s>  through its whole duration , i did not learn one thing__not one thing__about travolta's lawyer character , jan schlictmann , who doesn't appear to have any sort of life or purpose outside of his job . 
<s>  every scene is tediously related directly to the premise , and therefore , there was no one for me to care about or root for . 
<s>  you've got to work pretty hard , actually , to not get an audience to become involved in the parents' plight , since their children are dead , but that is exactly what " a civil action " does . 
<s>  to be honest , i would be fairly hard-pressed to state an aspect of the film that i actually liked . 
<s>  aside from one flashback to when a man's young son died on the way to the doctor , i remained unmoved and passive about what was going on in the scenes , and more than once found my mind wandering . 
<s>  i could say the performances were good , but who's fooling who ? 
<s>  since every character is one-dimensionally written , no one's acting abilities are challenged in any way . 
<s>  travolta plays a lawyer well enough , but that's about all he does . 
<s>  duvall virtually sleepwalks through his role , apparently only appearing to give one-liners at every chance he gets . 
<s>  and what in the world is kathy bates doing in the picture's final scene , as a judge ? 
<s>  she appears unbilled , since it is just a cameo , but why did she even agree to do it in the first place ? 
<s>  finally , when the conclusion arrived and the end credits began to role , the film left me with another question : what was the point ? 
<s>  abruptly ending without any susceptible momentum , where none came before that to begin with , " a civil action " seemed to me , at least , to be an example of how not to make a courtroom drama , and it certainly did not do justice to the very serious subject matter the film deals with .

<s>  comments : when todd mcfarlane left marvel comics ( where he had made a name for himself as a first-rate comic book penciller on the " spider-man " titles ) to join the newly-formed , creator-owned image comics , a new comic book legend was born : spawn . 
<s>  mcfarlane's " spawn " immediately became a commercial and critical success and a defining comic book series of the 1990s . 
<s>  mcfarlane created a hero who was not only original but visually intricate , allowing mcfarlane to utilize his knack for artistic detail to the max . 
<s>  the early " spawn " issues brilliantly capture mcfarlane's genius at illustration and show his early attempts at writing . 
<s>  with the popularity of " spawn " and the success of the current warner bros . 's batman film franchise , a movie version of some sort seemed inevitable for spawn . 
<s>  in the summer of 1997 , hence , new line cinema released spawn , a live-action film based on the groundbreaking series . 
<s>  this topheavy exercise in violence and special effects unfortunately topples quickly and leaves fans of the comic book , like me , numbed by how much spawn misses the mark . 
<s>  what happened ? 
<s>  why is spawn so bad ? 
<s>  todd mcfarlane himself executive produced this disappointing misfire and even appears in a cameo . 
<s>  i don't think , however , that his presence necessarily hurt ( or helped ) the film . 
<s>  i place the blame , in part , on the recent hollywood trend , fueled by public demand apparently , for special effects blow-out movies utilizing the latest computer technology . 
<s>  these films focus upon the effects at the expense of everything else : character , plot , dialogue , etc . spawn , reflecting this trend , shows the audience one gratuitous scene after another populated with morphing characters and filled with unnecessary pyrotechnics . 
<s>  hardly a minute goes by in this film without fires , explosions , knives and chains appearing out of nowhere , glowing eyes , or constantly transforming demons . 
<s>  a lot of it is visually interesting and technically solid , don't get me wrong , but , because the script and cast aren't engaging , spawn ultimately comes across like overwrought wallpaper ( the surface may capture the eye , but nothing exists underneath ) . 
<s>  spawn's translation of the comic book suffers the most at the storyline level . 
<s>  mcfarlane's spawn was a tortured hero . 
<s>  a mercenary by trade , al simmons was nonetheless a warm man in love with the beautiful wanda . 
<s>  having died and journeyed to hell , he made a pact to return to earth to be with wanda . 
<s>  simmons , however , discovers that his memories are fragmented , his body a creepy mess , and his wife married . 
<s>  despite his sometimes violent nature , readers couldn't help but feel sympathetic toward his plight as the spawn of the underworld . 
<s>  spawn attempts to show all of this but does not spend nearly the time it should to do so . 
<s>  when the characters are developed , they seem absurd rather than touching . 
<s>  the cartoonish dialogue and implausible subplot ( a general possesses the antidote to a supervirus called heat-16 which he wishes to unleash to enslave the world ) do not help matters . 
<s>  spawn , in an apparent attempt to duplicate the success of batman , also unwisely spends too much time on a villain , the violator ( batman favored the joker over batman ) . 
<s>  john leguizamo , like jack nicholson in batman , receives top billing in the cast as the violator ; michael jai white ( al simmons / spawn ) is second . 
<s>  i ordinarily find leguizamo an intensely annoying presence in films which seems to make him a perfect candidate for the violator . 
<s>  the film , however , spends so much time on the violator's offensive antics that they grate on the nerves . 
<s>  apparently meant to be the comic relief in the film ( as nicholson was in batman ) , especially when contrasted with the sullen spawn , the violator's lines are oftentimes grotesque and unfunny , leaving the audience wishing he would leave . 
<s>  leguizamo does a satisfactory job in the role , but he is seen far too often in the film . 
<s>  michael jai white , a relative newcomer to theatrical releases , seems to be an appealing actor , and he handles his role adequately , but we see little of him without various masks on . 
<s>  more time needed to be spent on white's character before he became spawn for the movie to pull at the heartstrings . 
<s>  a special note should be made about martin sheen as the over-the-top , obnoxious , evil general wynn . 
<s>  easily the hammiest performance in the movie , it's hard to imagine how sheen mucked up his role so much ; after all , he played a vietnam assasin brilliantly in the great apocalypse now . 
<s>  sheen's excessive demeanor do not help the audience accept him as a mastermind villain and comes as a surprise considering his extensive career in film . 
<s>  many other elements conspire with the disappointing script and abundant special effects to drag spawn down . 
<s>  mtv-style , jerky , in-your-face editing is one of them . 
<s>  flames , for example , roll across the screen sometimes to announce a shift in setting . 
<s>  cogliostro , unlikely wannabe guide for spawn , serves as a poor narrator for the film . 
<s>  he goofily tells the audience , at one point , that " how much of [spawn's] humanity is left remains to be seen , " as if the audience really cares as one violent sequence leads to another . 
<s>  the music , finally , assaults the audience as much as the manic violence and offensive dialogue . 
<s>  loud and obnoxious hard rock fused with drum loops dominate some scenes . 
<s>  to be fair , however , marilyn manson's " long hard road out of hell " effectively compliments spawn's return to earth , while filter and the crystal method's " ( can't you ) trip like i do " proves a surprisingly fitting theme song . 
<s>  for as good a comic book as it is , " spawn " did not spawn a good movie . 
<s>  spawn , instead , suffers from too much pomp and circumstance , and too little plot and character development . 
<s>  it receives two stars for its technically well-done special effects . 
<s>  many other films , though , have equal , if not superior , special effects and are much better . 
<s>  rated pg-13 , spawn seems more violent than many r-rated movies and probably wouldn't be appropriate for the very young . 
<s>  i can't recall a previous film experience where the fairly good time i was having turned as sour as quickly as it did during feeling minnesota .

<s>  feeling minnesota is a film that made me feel violated , as though i had trusted writer-director steven baigelman to bring me a cool glass of water and instead he threw acid in my face . 
<s>  feeling minnesota tells the story of a topless dancer named freddie ( cameron diaz ) who finds herself in deep trouble when her boss red ( delroy lindo ) suspects her of stealing from him . 
<s>  red's punishment is to force freddie to marry his bookkeeper , sam clayton ( vincent d'onofrio ) , who is far from the man of freddie's dreams . 
<s>  enter jjaks ( keanu reeves ) , sam's estranged younger brother , who arrives at the wedding just in time to catch freddie's eye and have sex with her in the bathroom . 
<s>  united in their mutual attraction and their mutual loathing of sam , jjaks and freddie take off together , but sam isn't ready to let them go without a fight . 
<s>  freddie , meanwhile , isn't ready to let sam's money go without a fight , and thus begins a series of violent confrontations . 
<s>  there is both style and substance to the beginning of feeling minnesota , as baigelman opens with an effective montage showing jjaks and sam's intense sibling rivalry as boys , and their mother ( tuesday weld ) sending jjaks away to live with his father . 
<s>  it does a great job of setting up jjaks' unstable life , a life which has landed him in trouble for petty crimes and always trying to please his family ; reeves' wounded look is just right for jjaks . 
<s>  the wedding sequence includes a number of nice moments , most notably the aforementioned bathroom scene in which a simple question is given a very funny spin . 
<s>  most important , baigelman begins to establish the connection between freddie and jjaks with humor and economy , as in a scene where they both spontaneously begin singing along to the replacements' " i will dare " on the car radio . 
<s>  you would have every reason to expect that relationships -- both familial and romantic -- would be the focal point of feeling minnesota . 
<s>  unfortunately , you would be dead wrong . 
<s>  i suppose i should have expected daisies and valentines after an early scene in which red threatens freddie as she tries to avoid the wedding , but i certainly didn't expect what i got . 
<s>  what i got was yet another in a long line of recent films trying to ride the tarantino wave by mixing gags and brutality , or rather creating gags about brutality . 
<s>  suddenly , the story of romantic entanglements and family conflict becomes a story about a corpse , and everything which had come before degenerates so completely that virtually nothing is recognizable . 
<s>  the sibling rivalry not only becomes little more than an excuse for one round of beatings after another , but there is no consistency to the characterizations . 
<s>  vincent d'onofrio turns in a manic performance as sam , whose jealousy , competitiveness and apparent sense of inferiority seem far more in keeping with what we know about jjaks , while reeves turns into a framed hero too reminiscent of chain reaction , and both of them spend most of the second half of the film screaming and covered in blood . 
<s>  there are films which have managed to employ a radical shift in tone successfully ( jonathan demme's something wild and neil jordan's the crying game come to mind ) , but they didn't try to draw an audience with the promise of relatively innocuous entertainment . 
<s>  i don't want to dismiss baigelman's successes out of hand -- he gets a fun performance out of dan aykroyd as a crooked cop , and some well-crafted comic moments -- and it is not his fault that fine line has chosen to promote feeling minnesota as a light-hearted caper . 
<s>  it _is_ his fault that he violates his own characters for the sake of shock value , and that he can't make his two halves into a whole . 
<s>  feeling minnesota left me feeling used , and there's not much funny about that .

<s>  i wish more films would take on issues of faith and morality in the modern world . 
<s>  and i wish that film-makers would use commandments as a blueprint on how _not_ to do it . 
<s>  writer/director daniel taplitz has created a bizarre conglomeration of satire and soul-searching in this tale of seth warner ( aidan quinn ) , a man of faith who runs into a streak of bad luck which usually inspires country-western lyrics : his pregnant wife drowns , his home is destroyed by a tornado , he loses his job and his dog is crippled by a bolt of lightning . 
<s>  convinced that god has broken his half of the covenant , seth decides to break his , and sets out to turn every " thou shalt not " of the ten commandments into a " thou shalt " ( and vice versa ) . 
<s>  his wife's sister rachel ( " friends " ' courteney cox ) wants to help seth ; rachel's selfish husband harry ( anthony lapaglia ) , who tends to break a few commandments of his own , thinks seth is a lunatic . 
<s>  thus begins a film which picks the wrong tone for every occasion . 
<s>  taplitz isn't interested in treating seth's tragedies as genuinely tragic , making it impossible to sympathize with him . 
<s>  composer joseph vitarelli provides a score full of whimsical woodwinds , turning seth's sacrilegious mission into an amusing lark ; quinn's performance as seth is all wild-eyed fervor without any genuine pain . 
<s>  the actual breaking of the commandments is almost treated as an afterthought , with one through five dispatched in a five-minute montage . 
<s>  the result is a character whose actions feel less like the authentic responses of an anguished man than the machinations of a high-concept movie plot . 
<s>  it's not even entirely clear that commandments is about seth . 
<s>  corporate attorney rachel is given a case which is supposed to soften a hard heart we see no indication she has , while harry gets his comeuppance as part of seth's " false witness . " 
<s>  only courteney cox strikes a note of reality in a solid performance ; she is sane center around which too equally troubled men revolve . 
<s>  even she can't force taplitz to decide whose story this is , or what we should have learned about dealing with the struggles in our lives and our relationship with the infinite . 
<s>  by the time seth makes a singularly biblical reappearance late in the film , it has become clear that taplitz is aiming for a fantastical fable which makes no connection with real human experience . 
<s>  commandments is a bad comedy which could have been a decent drama if daniel taplitz had had the guts to take faith -- and the loss thereof -- at all seriously .

<s>  topless women talk about their lives falls into that category that i mentioned in the devil's advocate : movies that have a brilliant beginning but don't know how to end .

<s>  an american werewolf in paris is a failed attempt to recapture the humor and horror of john landis' 1981 feature , an american werewolf in london .

<s>  wizards is an animated feature that begins with a narration of epic proportions .

<s>  movies based on video games , such as street fighter or mario bros . , have never generated much interest at the box office . 
<s>  but when the first mortal kombat movie came out in 1995 , it did surprisingly well . 
<s>  with a simple story , a pulsating soundtrack , and lots of awesomely choreographed fight scenes , the movie moved quickly and displayed lots of energy . 
<s>  it got my vote for 'the movie where i expected the least and got the most' . 
<s>  and , if you haven't had the opportunity , i would definitely recommend that you see it on video . 
<s>  in the world of mortal kombat , based on the popular arcade game , dark forces from outworld try to infiltrate earth's realm with the ulimate goal of total conquest and the destruction of humanity . 
<s>  the mortal kombat refers to a competition , fought by human mortals against outworld's minions , which if won , will guarantee earth's safety for another generation . 
<s>  mk2 picks up almost immediately after the humans return victoriously from competition . 
<s>  despite their victory , however , a gateway has somehow opened , and outworld continues in its quest to conquer earth . 
<s>  outworld's warriors include an impressive collection of fighters , including shao kahn , mintoro ( a centaur ) , sheeva ( a four-armed ogre ) , and sindel . 
<s>  earth's mortal warriors , under the leadership of the benevolent god , lord rayden , includes liu kang , princess kitana , sonya blade and jax , who must fight against outworld's forces . 
<s>  it's an easy enough premise , but unfortunately ( very unfortunately ) , the writers try to do too much with the movie . 
<s>  it is only a video game , after all , but the on-screen version tries to go beyond it's comic book boundaries by adding depth , a conceptualization of self-worth , and worst of all , a love story . 
<s>  this becomes very awkward , because all of the players are fighters and nothing more . 
<s>  they are likable and impressive when they are showcasing their martial arts and fighting skills , but look extremely awkward and uncomfortable when they are required to actually act . 
<s>  this becomes embarrassingly apparent , for example , as the movie tries to develop a romantic bond between liu kang and princess kitana . 
<s>  the original mk was smart in letting the players do what they do best . 
<s>  they spoke little , but fought a lot . 
<s>  thus , the movie was easy to digest . 
<s>  however , mk2 tries to give these players a certain amount of depth , an element that was lacking in the first movie , but the attempt here fails miserably . 
<s>  this uneasy feeling is readily apparent , for example , whenever you hear lord rayden speak . 
<s>  not only does he talk in riddles and offer enigmatic ( e . g . 
<s>  useless ) advice , but he speaks so slowly as if to simulate infinite wisdom . 
<s>  try reading this half as fast , and you'll hear what i mean . 
<s>  but the movie is not a complete fatality . 
<s>  fight scenes are well-choreographed , highlighted by terrific acrobatics and agility . 
<s>  and players of the game will be rewarded with the inclusion of practically every character from the video game , although their screen time amounts to nothing more than a cameo . 
<s>  even if you're not familiar with the video game , each fighter has their own costume and unique weaponry to easily differentiate themselves . 
<s>  but it's just too little of what movie-goers and especially fans of the game will expect . 
<s>  oddly , the inclusion of the human element actually pollutes the purity of the mortal kombat essence . 
<s>  and the poor acting results in a muddled movie that offers the viewing audience little chance for survival .

<s>  rent the first one , but the sequel is for kombat fans only .

<s>   ( her single comic moment is also the best shot of the film : she bashfully reveals bare bumcheeks through the peek-a-boo flap of her pyjamas . )

<s>  smith's a better reactor than actor , which is why he was so thoroughly engaging in men in black-he didn't start out a hero . 
<s>  in wild wild west he's required to exude eastwood cool and amuse at the same time ( and from frame one ) , a difficult feat i'm not sure any living performer could pull off . 
<s>  smith is ill equipped , for example , to handle the moment in which jim west performs stand-up for some rednecks at his own hanging . 
<s>  what attracted sonnenfeld to this material ? 
<s>  this isn't the first time he has adapted a tv show for the big screen ( the addams family , anyone ? ) , but it's the first big stinker of his career as a director . 
<s>  wild wild west is poorly-paced bombast , full of doa gags ( ted levine shows up as a general who uses a gramophone horn for a hearing aid ; levine played buffalo bill in the silence of the lambs-he's too intense to get an intentional laugh ) , lousy special effects ( the bluescreening is amateurish-foregrounds are never proportionate to the backgrounds ) , and frequent illogic . 
<s>   ( to wit , its ridiculous villain so badly wants jim west out of the way that he . . . drops 
<s>  him onto a steel platform to do battle with some generic , ugly henchmen , instead of shooting him at point blank rage with one of the many guns on board the tarantula . ) 
<s>  wild wild west's bright spots , such as the cool opening credits sequence , bai ling's all-too-brief appearance as a femme fatale , or the brilliant " his master's voice " joke , are all part of the film's first half , which is more clever and enjoyable , at least , than its second . 
<s>  when , towards what seemed like the end of wild wild west , gordon proposes the idea of building an airplane and west rejects it , there was a collective groan among audience members : it meant we were going to have to sit through another loud action sequence before gordon builds the glider , the invention of which would inevitably lead to the proverbial whiz-bang finale . 
<s>  if you have ever seen fox tv's special car chase programs , you'll have a good idea about the content of ronin , the new action " thriller " from director john frankenheimer . 
<s>  the film involves a mysterious briefcase , that several groups of terrorist want to get their hands on . 
<s>  an irish women , dierdre ( played by the truman show's natascha mcelhone ) , hires a group of mercenaries to assist her in getting the briefcase . 
<s>  among the people she hires are sam ( robert de niro ) , vincent ( jean reno ) , and gregor ( stellan skarsg ? rd from good will hunting ) . 
<s>  dierdre's groups assignment is too seize the briefcase while the current owners are transporting it . 
<s>  they accomplish this task , but a traitor is in the bunch and the briefcase is soon on the run again . 
<s>  the briefcase stays on the run , as the movie leads the viewer through several plot twists that are badly executed . 
<s>  the writer seemed to be attempting to make a smart action movie , but failed to understand that just because there are surprises , it doesn't add too the credibility of a senseless script . 
<s>  the plot twists get no reaction because they come at a time where no one cares what is going on , after the apparent climax of the film . 
<s>  but to add to the excitement , as i mentioned earlier , there are endless car chase scenes . 
<s>  they are unrealistic and fail to add anything to the story . 
<s>  don't get me wrong , i love car chases , but they were overdone and too long here . 
<s>  we never do find out what's in the briefcase , but i doubt anyone cares by the time they finish sitting through this two hour long attempted thriller . 
<s>  the happy bastard's quick movie review 
<s>  wild wild west 
<s>  a better name for this movie might've been " wild wild waste " . 
<s>  warner bros . , in an attempt to get their own men in black style of movie , had managed to lasso in some big names ( actor will smith and director barry sonnenfeld , the duo behind mib's success ) in order to get their own fourth of july blockbuster , a contemporary big-screen update to the classic western/sci-fi series the wild wild west starring robert conrad . 
<s>  but somehow , they ran into a problem along the way . 
<s>  they were so busy trying to fill specific roles that they forgot one in general that would've made all the difference- a story writer . 
<s>  wild wild west's story and script was compiled by six different people , rather than just the one who put the brilliant touches on men in black , ed solomon . 
<s>  if warner bros . had gotten him , the movie would've possibly been five times better than what it is . 
<s>  heck , ten times . 
<s>  as is , however , the story and screenplay is a mess , filled with dead laughs , enough racist and sex jokes to make even will cringe as he's performing them , and a complete lack of chemistry that made the tv show work so well . 
<s>  here's the story : us army member james west ( will smith ) teams up with creative genius artemus gordon ( kevin kline ) to take on a ruthless villain by the name of arliss loveless ( kenneth branagh ) , whose lower half was blown off during the civil war , leaving him to roll around in a steam-controlled wheelchair . 
<s>  they catch onto a plot of his involving a superweapon that can basically be considered an 80-foot tarantula ( although it looks bigger than that ) , hellbent on destroying anything in its path . 
<s>  as i said , the way the script unfolds is a complete mess . 
<s>  but the acting doesn't help either . 
<s>  kevin kline is miserable as gordon , failing to display even a smidgeon of care as he did in the 1985 western silverado . 
<s>  smith seems to be having a better time as west , although he's not nearly as charming as he was in mib . 
<s>  branagh goes excessively over the top as the villain , perhaps to the point where we can't even stand to look at him or his strange beard . 
<s>  and salma hayek is along for the ride to search for her missing father , but mostly she exists just for sexual attention . 
<s>  her acting is barely passable , but what a " breath of fresh ass " . 
<s>  director barry sonnenfeld isn't of great help either . 
<s>  even though he shows some good creativity at some points , his overall urgency for directing is lost . 
<s>  it's as if he feels he's directing a tv movie , a big no-no when you're helming what's supposed to be a big-screen hit . 
<s>  last but not least , there are huge gaps of logic that are just plain unacceptable . 
<s>  at one point , smith defies gravity when first boarding kline's train . 
<s>  he jumps on the back , gets launched straight up in the air , and somehow manages to land three cars ahead on the train- while it's still in motion ! 
<s>  also , he seems to be strangely comfortable talking about racism in front of a lynch mob , particularly considering the fact that his family was killed by the likes of such folks . 
<s>  last but not least , why is he still making kissing faces when he knows he's not kissing a woman as he's looking through a peephole at the enemy ? ! 
<s>  the only saving grace for wild wild west come mostly in the form of special effects . 
<s>  the huge mechanical spider is a technical marvel , very authentic looking and considerable to the creativity of the show . 
<s>  there's also a good sequence involving metal magnet neckbraces and spinning saw blades , but , again , a logic question comes into play regarding their polarity . 
<s>  i would say sit back and have a good time with wild wild west , but it really isn't possible . 
<s>  if the racist and sex jokes don't bother you , the performances will . 
<s>  if the performances don't bother you , the story will . 
<s>  if the story doesn't bother you , the racist and sex jokes will . 
<s>  there's no end to the vicious circle . 
<s>  go rent men in black instead and pretend smith and tommy lee jones are wearing cowboy hats . 
<s>  you'll have a better time . 
<s>  if you do go , keep an eye out for robert conrad in a role as president grant . 
<s>  i bet he wishes he were somewhere else . . . 
<s>  old soldiers never die , they just turn into cliches 
<s>  soldier a film review by michael redman copyright 1998 by michael redman 
<s>  the warrior and the lover are two personality aspects that find it difficult to exist in the same body . 
<s>  jungian archetypes , these two opposites need each other to create a whole , but it's difficult to integrate both . 
<s>  often we'll encounter lovers who think everything is just wonderful and , with the help of jung's magician , sit around imagining grand schemes . 
<s>  without the drive to manifest their plans , much less the wisdom to recognize the darkness , all they have are dreams . 
<s>  warriors on the other hand , are ready to go to war at the drop of a hat , and will do combat with every last bit of their energy . 
<s>  they don't care enough about anything to know what's worth fighting for : gladiators who live only for the battle . 
<s>  this dichotomy not only describes individuals that we all know , but can also illustrate societies . 
<s>  america during the late sixties was a conflict between old style cold warriors and the new hippie lovers . 
<s>  todd 3465 ( kurt russell ) is a living , breathing archetype . 
<s>  chosen from birth as a soldier , he is raised by the government to be a killing machine . 
<s>  his childhood is cruelty and competition . 
<s>  he is indoctrinated with the big rules . 
<s>  never question authority . 
<s>  winning is everything . 
<s>  strength beats knowledge . 
<s>  a veteran of numerous intergalactic wars , todd is 40 and he's obsolete . 
<s>  a new generation of genetically engineered soldiers are faster and stronger . 
<s>  left for dead after a test battle with the best of the new killers , caine 607 ( jason scott lee ) , he's unceremoniously dumped as trash on arcadia 234 , a garbage world . 
<s>  obviously our hero is still alive . 
<s>  he finds a group of shipwrecked settlers abandoned on the planet who nurse him back to health . 
<s>  when the peace-loving colonists get a good look at who todd is , they are afraid of him and he is exiled to live by himself amid the junk on an environmentally hostile world . 
<s>  they are the other good guys . 
<s>  these lovers find that they need a warrior when the military coincidentally chooses this world to conduct exercises for their improved human weapons . 
<s>  todd finds himself in the role of protector . 
<s>  what could have been a fascinating look at the roles played in our culture and the fears of an ultra-right wing future is ruined by turning the film into a cartoon . 
<s>  the effects are mostly second-rate explosions or jerky slow motion . 
<s>  the plot is old hat . 
<s>  we don't get even a glimpse at the society that created the soldiers . 
<s>  hardly anything makes sense . 
<s>  the film's science fares badly . 
<s>  with all the remarkable advances we've made in just 37 years ( the film takes place in 2036 ) , we're still stupid . 
<s>  after conquering the stars , for some reason we use vast amounts of energy to load up huge space ships with rubbish tote it to a landfill light years away . 
<s>  even stranger , the garbage barges appear to double as time machines . 
<s>  virtually all the trash is vintage 1960 . 
<s>  there is nothing in the story that is not predictable . 
<s>  the first thing that todd sees after coming back to life is sandra ( connie nielsen ) , the woman just a little too beautiful to be living in such harsh conditions who is taking care of him . 
<s>  it doesn't take a genius to foresee that her husband isn't going to be around much longer . 
<s>  is it a shock to find out that the film's climax is an unarmed battle between todd and caine ? 
<s>  who would you guess wins ? 
<s>  some of the scenes would work if this were a comedy . 
<s>  todd's first awakening of human emotion comes when he glimpses connie's nipple poking through her thin blouse . 
<s>  later as he sits by his lonely campfire , a tear rolls down his dramatically lighted cheek in slow motion . 
<s>  supposedly this clich ? isn't meant to be humorous . 
<s>  dastardly col . mekum ( jason isaacs ) with a pencil-thin mustache is as real as snidley whiplash . 
<s>  responsible for last year's quirky and visually enticing but problematic " the fifth element " , director paul anderson sees the film as " shane " in outer space . 
<s>  maybe , if shane were played by sylvester stallone in rambo mode . 
<s>  the movie doesn't even work as an action film . 
<s>  there is never a question as to the outcome . 
<s>  somehow the new superior soldiers don't prove much of a match for todd . 
<s>  the acting isn't anything to write home about . 
<s>  nielsen almost comes across as a real person but is soon relegated to a background victim . 
<s>  russell is buffed-up and does a credible job but it's not much of a challenge . 
<s>  uttering around 100 words during the film , mostly what todd does is hit things and stare grimly into space . 
<s>  gary busey as todd's commanding officer is completely wasted in his low-key role . 
<s>  everything blows up and occasionally it looks cool . 
<s>  sometimes the sets are impressive . 
<s>  unfortunately " occasionally " and " sometimes " don't make a film . 
<s>  most disappointing is that the screenplay is by david webb peoples who wrote " blade runner " , possibly the best science fiction movie ever made . 
<s>  sharp-eyed viewers will notice a few obscure references to that film . 
<s>  peoples says that this is not a " blade runner " sequel , but a " sidequel " that takes place in the same universe . 
<s>  although that may have been the intent in his original script , the result is more like a bad television series that the " blade runner " replicants watch to pass time . 
<s>  perhaps those artificial humans would find this entertaining . 
<s>   ( michael redman has written this column for over 23 years and wants to wish everyone an appropriate halloween . . . whatever 
<s>  you'd like it to be . ) 
<s>   " what is this , a homicide or a bad b-movie ? " 
<s>  that is the prophetic question asked by one of the leads in one of the early scenes of this movie . 
<s>  let me clear things up for you cupcake , this isn't a bad b-movie , it's a really bad b-movie . 
<s>  so bad , it's almost good . 
<s>  almost , but not quite . 
<s>  the movie starts off in the 1950's with space aliens sending a botched experiment down to earth . 
<s>  it is a bunch of slug-like creatures that kill people and take over their bodies . 
<s>  the slugs' first and only victim in the fifties is cryogenically frozen where he is of no danger to anybody . 
<s>  that is , until two loser university students unfreeze him in 1986 . 
<s>  he , and the slugs inside him , promptly begin wreaking havoc and turning more co-eds into slug zombies . 
<s>  a slightly crazed cop ( tom atkins ) and the requisite girl with the face of an angel ( jill whitlow ) join these two geeky university students ( jason lively and steve marshall ) to do battle with the slugs . 
<s>  it more or less falls on the four of them to make the world safe again from the evil slugs . 
<s>  the acting is bad with a capital b . the story is worse . 
<s>  and the special effects are somewhere between an old rerun of star trek and what you see in a home movie . 
<s>  the only saving grace was the requisite tit-shot courtesy of jill whitlow . 
<s>  it had absolutely nothing to do with the story -- but i liked it . 
<s>  actually , it was the high point of the movie for me . 
<s>  of course , that isn't really saying much . 
<s>  the story moves around in a hap hazard fashion . 
<s>  which gives it a leg up on some other horror films . 
<s>  unlike most movies of this genre , there actually is a story . 
<s>  not a great one , but it is there . 
<s>  this is one in a long line of movies from the 1980's that were thrown together to capitalize off the success of the friday the 13th , halloween and nightmare on elm street movies . 
<s>  you could randomly select a movie out of the horror section of you local video store and probably luck into something just as good if not better . 
<s>  but night of the creeps might make a nice addition to a b-movie horror marathon . 
<s>  just don't be too upset if you can't find it . 
<s>  you really won't be missing that much . 
<s>  there's a scene early on in " jawbreaker " where a character utters the unintentionally prophetic line , " that is * so * not funny " . 
<s>  how right she was . 
<s>  this pathetic tale of three high-schoolers who accidentally kill their best friend in a birthday kidnapping prank gone horribly awry is never even remotely funny . 
<s>  or fun . 
<s>  or original . 
<s>  not content with the too-obvious " heathers " heisting , the filmmakers proceed to lift freely from a staggering variety of sources , including " carrie " , " bride of frankenstein " , " blue velvet " , and even shaw's pygmalion , itself recently remade as " she's all that " . 
<s>   " jawbreaker " is a pastiche , and not even an enjoyable one . 
<s>  i find it extremely telling that the most engaging part of the film is the credit sequence , a jawbreaker factory montage inexplicably backed by veruca salt's " volcano girls " ; serving as a blueprint for the rest of the film , the song has absolutely nothing to do with the footage we're watching . 
<s>  just close your eyes and pretend you're listening to an alt-rock station ; you won't be missing anything . 
<s>  the blame for a mess this big has to be spread around among the principals . 
<s>  rebecca gayheart , following roles in " scream 2 " and " urban legend " , should have known better than to take yet another role in yet another teen body count movie . 
<s>  pam grier has totally wasted any credibility she might have gotten from her role in quentin tarantino's " jackie brown " . 
<s>  and rose mcgowan should just quit acting . 
<s>  she has no charisma , no presence , and no acting skills other than rolling her eyes and looking disaffected . 
<s>  mcgowan manages to be upstaged by her real-life boyfriend , rocker marilyn manson , whose fifteen second role here is far more interesting than anything any of the " real " actors are doing . 
<s>  manson , sans trademark makeup & contact lenses , and with an obviously fake moustache , looks eerily like nicholas cage ; who woulda thunk it ? 
<s>  that crack about direction by committee wasn't merely a pithy sound-bite . 
<s>  stylistically , thematically & narratively , " jawbreaker " is all over the map , varying wildly in tone & content from scene to scene . 
<s>  though credited solely to writer/director darren stein , one gets the feeling that no two scenes here were actually guided by the same hands . 
<s>  if stein was indeed responsible for the whole of this atrocity , someone needs to get the man some drugs , pronto . 
<s>  prozac , lithium , kava , ritalin , something , anything . 
<s>  he's quite obviously in desperate need of chemical help . 
<s>   " jawbreaker " is a monumental waste of effort and resources , and quite likely one of the single worst films i've ever seen . 
<s>  to call " jawbreaker " garbage would be to insult garbage . 
<s>  bad flicks for the rest of the year are safe ; i've already got my pick for worst film of '99 . 
<s>   " jawbreaker " runs approximately 90 minutes , though it feels longer than " titanic " , and is rated r for language , sexual situations and graphic violence . 
<s>  not recommended for kids , teens , or anyone else . 
<s>  can you say " dated " ? 
<s>  you can if you've seen rosemary's baby which , like the exorcist , was a thrilling horror film in its time but seems boring and laughable in the decades that have passed since its original release . 
<s>   " mystery science theater 3000 " has skewered the bad films of the past , but let me tell you , it could do a number on the " good " ones too . 
<s>  rosemary's baby stars mia farrow ( from the time she was actually good-looking ) as an innocent housewife and her not-so-innocent husband ( john cassavettes ) , an actor who takes an easy , albeit evil , road to success . 
<s>  it all seems so harmless in the beginning . 
<s>  mia and john move into an apartment where several past murders have been committed . 
<s>   ( there's also a skull in the living room , but it's only for decoration . ) 
<s>  their elderly neighbors pop in for a housewarming . 
<s>  all's well for about the first hour of this slow-moving film , until mia eats some of the neighbors' chocolate mousse and passes out . 
<s>  when she comes to , she finds herself in a darkened room with a bunch of people yelling and dancing like savages and a big , evil man raping her -- a foreshadowing of her future life with woody allen . 
<s>  it seems like a dream and , when she finds herself pregnant , she almost forgets about it . 
<s>  and everyone's helping with the pregnancy . 
<s>  the neighbors have some wonderful vitamin potions for her to drink , a good-luck charm for her to wear around her neck , and the name of an obstetrician who's been in the business 66 . 6 
<s>  years . 
<s>  meanwhile , mia begins having chronic stomach pains and losing a lot of weight . 
<s>  before too long she looks just like the lead singer of the cranberries . 
<s>  that's when you know your health's failing . 
<s>  the only person in the movie who's the least bit suspicious of all this is an old friend ( maurice evans ) who calls mia up to give her the bad news -- and immediately falls into a coma . 
<s>  by about the two-hour mark i felt the same way . 
<s>  rosemary's baby is way too long , and leads up to a payoff that's about as boring and laughable as the rest of the movie . 
<s>  i guess someone put a spell on this movie . 
<s>   " the 44 caliber killer has struck again . " 
<s>  starring john leguizamo , mira sorvino , adrian brody , jennifer esposito , michael rispoli , bebe neuwirth . 
<s>  rated r . 
<s>  summer of sam will be remembered as a waste of spike lee's abilities . 
<s>  lee is a great filmmaker , often exhibiting kinetic visual flair on par with brian depalma and martin scorsese and a storytelling ability comparable to steven spielberg . 
<s>  but here , he gets himself into a bind . 
<s>  his latest effort is a case of a director pretending he has something to say when in reality there is little of substance to absorb from his work . 
<s>  the summer of 1977 was an unusual summer in new york city . 
<s>  it was the hottest summer on record . 
<s>  to boot , new york's first serial killer was on the loose : calling himself the son of sam , david berkowitz killed 9 people in the new york area and frightened the whole city population . 
<s>  so it was understandable that when nyc was hit with a citywide blackout , people went berserk , causing billions of dollars in damage to the city . 
<s>  the movie's focus is on a group of twenty-somethings during that fateful summer : vinny ( john leguizamo ) , a club-hopping , adultrous hairdresser , his benevolent wife dionna ( mira sorvino , looking young ) , ritchie ( adrian brody ) , a punk who becomes an outcast as well as a son of sam suspect , a gang of small time mobsters and a few more minor characters . 
<s>  we follow them through their roller coaster lives , thrown out of whack even more by the recent killings . 
<s>  vinny and dionna have marital problems because vinny cheats and dionna tries to please him , make him stay faithful to her . 
<s>  ritchie gets shunned by his group of friends because he has started to become more and more " eccentric , " and has degenerated to the point of dancing in gay night clubs and making porno films with his girlfriend . 
<s>  tensions build and conflicts arise as the anniversary night of son of sam's first murder looms ; the night he promises he will strike again . 
<s>  a local gang with too much time on its hands makes a list detailing all of the people that its members think might be suspects . 
<s>  at the top of the list is ritchie . 
<s>  vinny , an unwilling part of the said group , is called upon to set a trap for his friend . 
<s>  as we watch these proceedings , some of which are painfully graphic , the dreaded " so what ? " 
<s>  question springs to mind . 
<s>  from the way this movie is made , i'd have guessed that spike lee was trying to tell us something , but as i searched deeper it became clear that there is very little there to find . 
<s>  lee touches on so much -- the media , the 70's punk scene , the details of the actual killings , as well as the characters' very personal dilemmas -- but he doesn't bring all of his topics together to form a coherent theme or make a discernible statement . 
<s>  all is not lost if a movie turns out to be hollow ; it can be a saving grace for the film to be enjoyable . 
<s>  too bad summer of sam doesn't get any help here . 
<s>  frankly , it's a bore , a redundant and repetitive two hour and twenty minute film that doesn't entertain beyond its first half hour . 
<s>  there is no suspense because the film refuses to be fully about the murders and little involving drama because the film is too muddled and its focus too vague . 
<s>  leguizamo's turn as vinnie is annoying and whiny . 
<s>  the script makes it clear that we're supposed to believe that his character is flawed , but still a good guy . 
<s>  you'd never guess from his performance . 
<s>  adrian brody and especially mira sorvino fare better . 
<s>  sorvino gives a riveting , touching performance in a banal movie ( i'm tempted to think that i liked her because nearly everything else around her was inane ) ; her character is affecting and her emotions true-to-heart . 
<s>  brody , too paints an effective portrait of a young guy desperate for attention who gets a little more than he bargained for . 
<s>  summer of sam has some superficial elements of a good film : it looks great , it has a few notable performances and i suppose it's pretty well directed , in a purely technical way . 
<s>  but it's also empty , pretentious and boring . 
<s>  like last year's the thin red line , it's a movie by a director who doesn't know what he wants to say but goes ahead and says it anyway .

<s>  the summer of 00' wasn't a very good one for devout cinephiles . 
<s>  it offered no blair witches or sixth senses ; the best big budget hollywood could do was an efficient x-men adaptation and a flawed but entertaining shaft update . 
<s>  nurse betty signals the unofficial end of that dreadful summer movie season and the commencement of a potentially brighter fall movie season , that battery-charging ( at least for critics who have to sit through every piece o' shit that moseys into multiplexes ) time of year when all those oscar contenders ( read : " quality " films ) compete for audiences . 
<s>  alas betty has the dubious distinction of being the first overpraised junk heap of the new season . 
<s>  it's also indie director neil labute's first attempt at something resembling a mainstream picture , and i'm sad to report it's a resounding failure ( at least on this web site ) , a mess that's as hopelessly saccharine as people have accused labute's previous films of being unrelentingly masochistic . 
<s>  i went in expecting something decent , for betty was gleefully praised , it's screenplay even winning an award at cannes , but i exited shaking my noggin in bewilderment . 
<s>  are critics so desperate for something unique that they're blind to how derivative the particular brand of " uniqueness " betty dolls out is ? 
<s>  for the first time labute is working from a script he has not written , and he seems unsure of how to handle the material . 
<s>  betty tries to be hip like pulp fiction ( this is another flick featuring a pair of strangely bright and articulate hit men ) , enchanting like the wizard of oz ( of which this film makes several allusions to ) and heartwarming like [stick in your favorite loveable misfit movie] , but by the end it left me cold with its calculated desperation . 
<s>  it's labute's half hearted attempt to make a crowd pleaser and he doesn't even seem to have half that heart in it . 
<s>  nurse betty concerns a soap opera addict , betty ( brilliantly played by renee zellweger ) , who witnesses the killing of her husband , del ( aaron eckhart playing the most casually loutish husband since richard benjamin in diary of a mad housewife ) by two hit men ( morgan freeman and chris rock ) . 
<s>  she happens to have her most beloved soap on in the background and somehow merges the two realities . 
<s>  she's blocked out her husband's death and thinks she's a character in her favorite soap , a reason to love . 
<s>  betty sets out on the road to la ( with some drugs unknowingly stashed in her car trunk ) searching for her soap boyfriend dr . david ravell ( greg kinnear ) while the two bickering hit men follow in not so close pursuit . 
<s>  the labute who birthed the extraordinary in the company of men , slipped a bit ( but not much ) with his sophomore effort , your friends and neighbors , then fell straight on his ass with bash , a play he penned that was recently aired on showtime . 
<s>  the play demonstrated no forward movement as an artist , only labute's persistence in wallowing in the horrid things " average " people do to each other , usually with out realizing how horrid they themselves are . 
<s>  in the play , paul rudd , as an obnoxious jock , delivers a monologue detailing how he once followed a gay man into a bathroom and beat him maybe to death , while his clueless girlfriend essentially regards his sadistic behaviors as something along the old maxim " boys will be boys " . 
<s>  another character , schlubby businessman reacts to the loss of his job by actually killing his own baby ! 
<s>  what was once so powerful about labute's work , the casual , nonchalant cruelty and selfishness ( often elements we all have in us amplified to a disgusting degree ) had become so over the top it was borderline comic . 
<s>  obviously , at this point , labute could use a dose of some different kind of material before he pigeon holes himself further , but nurse betty isn't it . 
<s>  he clearly has little passion for what he's doing here , instead replacing his mojo with strained quirks ( one of the hit men is a huge soap fan , and the character of betty would be little more than a one joke gimmick if zelllweger hadn't managed to transcend that ) tailor made to appeal to the widest possible audience . 
<s>  nearly every scene between chris rock and morgan freeman fatally slows the picture down , as the two are made to enact soft-boiled tarantino-esque dialogue . 
<s>  they evince little chemistry , with rock constantly in over the top rant mode , acting more like an angry comic than any thing resembling a hit man ( an occupation that's represented far too frequently in movies nowadays ) . 
<s>  i think rock is a great comic yet he hasn't been able to bring his feral intelligence to movies , whenever he acts , and no matter the part , it's like he's doing the damn chris rock show . 
<s>  surprisingly ( at least considering her work in me , myself and irene ) renee zellweger gives a revelatory performance , building on her baby faced , apple pie looks . 
<s>  that wide-open face and helium voiced earnestness suggests a little girl not fully grown into her thirty-year-old body . 
<s>  it's the best work she's ever done . 
<s>  freeman is effective as always , though his performance nonetheless suffers because it seems at odds with where the movie wants to take it . 
<s>  the actor plays the role in his usual calm , collected manner , though the flick tries to insinuate a symbolic kinship between his character and betty's , suggesting that both are controlled by their fantasies rather than reality . 
<s>  that's interesting but the movie doesn't do anything with it other than crash land the sub-theme into a labored speech in the midst of a badly staged gun battle . 
<s>  the film has good moments ( many of the scenes involving a very good greg kinnear , especially his confrontation with zellweger ) , an almost soothing , lyrical score ( and you know a movie's in trouble when the score sticks out as one of the best things about it ) but nothing jells , it's parts , good or bad , are so disparate as to be opposing . 
<s>  the film might have worked had it settled on being one type of film , a mainstream , female forrest gump or an oddball art film , but as both if it falls as flat as diet coke . 
<s>  betty's screenplay makes the mistake of relying too much on concurrence , without which betty wouldn't make any progress in the film . 
<s>  nurse betty is a film driven by coincidence rather than charter , like how betty becomes a nurse in the film , a job that she takes in order to get closer to her imaginary lover ; she happens to be at the hospital at the exact moment that a drive by shooting takes place and miraculously knows how to take care of the victim's wound because she happened to see how on tv , which leads to her being offered a room with the victim's girlfriend who eventually gets betty into a party where she meets kinnear ? ? ? a little too tidy , don'tcha think . 
<s>  betty has an interesting theme , though it doesn't even seem aware of this . 
<s>  the current state of tv has been leaning towards reality television what with the enormous success of survivor and moderate success of big brother , with more on the way . 
<s>  this is a film about a women so deluded as to think that her favorite soap opera is reality ( ironically real-life survivor sean kennif has taken a part as a doctor on the soap opera guiding light ) . 
<s>  instead of exploring this timely matter in a way relating to the current tv craze ( since the film does largely appear to be a satire of television , albeit one that would feel more appropriate in the '80s than the '00s ) , the film simply uses betty's delusions as a plot device to get her from point a to b . no progress is made and little is unearthed except that maybe labute could use a bit of rest and a lot of contemplation . 
<s>  what do you get when you rip-off good movies like woody allen's bananas and martin scorsese's after hours ? 
<s>  you'd think you'd get the best of both films . 
<s>  instead you get woo . 
<s>  falling in somewhere between def jam's how to be a player ( which was awful ) and booty call ( which was ok ) , woo is yet another in the embarassing genre of showing african-americans to be nothing more than sexual buffoons . 
<s>  the whole film plays out as a black version of after hours , as wild woman woo ( jada pinkett smith ) goes out on a blind date with straight-laced tim ( tommy davidson ) . 
<s>  mayhem follows them . 
<s>  for some unknown reason ( read : contrived screenplay ) davidson puts up with all of woo's antics for the entire night , which include her destroying his bathroom mirror , stealing things from his house , violently questioning him ( accusing and belittling him actually ) about previous girlfriends , causing a riot in an elegant restaurant , and other various infuriating things that any normal person wouldn't tolerate . 
<s>  but for the sake of this bad movie ? 
<s>  sure , why not ? 
<s>  there are a few chuckles in the film , the best being the scene swiped directly from bananas . 
<s>  in this case , davidson is running from thugs , gets into a subway car as the doors are closing , starts to taunt the thugs , then the doors open back up again . 
<s>  a good joke , but a stolen one . 
<s>  another chuckle is provided by billy dee williams' cameo as himself . 
<s>  movies like woo are seemingly released every three months or so , and not one of them has ever been a hit . 
<s>  woo won't be one either . 
<s>  so why was it made ? 
<s>  and more importantly , isn't there anyone else besides me who thinks these films are offensive ? 
<s>  everyone involved should really reconsider their careers at this point .

<s>  wild things is a way to steam up an otherwise dreary early spring day ? provided , of course , that you're the victim of a frontal lobotomy . 
<s>  there is , in fact , no doubt about who this motion picture is aimed at : movie-goers in their late teens and early twenties -- the most lucrative target group . 
<s>  this is film noir for the mtv generation : fast-paced , slick , flashy , gleefully mindless , and hollow to the core . 
<s>  wild things is easily one of the five dumbest movies to arrive in theaters during the first eleven weeks of 1998 . 
<s>  i've seen more convincing drama ( with nearly as much bare flesh ) on that pinnacle of narrative quality , baywatch . 
<s>  wild things wants to dupe viewers into thinking it's a thriller with a real story . 
<s>  what it is , however , is a series of increasingly- improbable and shockingly predictable plot twists . 
<s>  everything in between those serpentine moments is filler -- a flash of a breast , a spatter of blood , and some of the most idiotic dialogue this side of a steven seagal movie . 
<s>  the film tries so hard to surprise its audience that the twists end up being easy to guess -- just take a stab at the most unlikely thing to happen , and that will probably be it . 
<s>  using this approach , i was right three times and wrong only once . 
<s>  that's not a good average for a production that wants to keep viewers in the dark about what's around the next corner . 
<s>  the ad campaign uses two things to sell this movie : the hot , young cast and the old standby , sex . 
<s>  both have an abundance of screen time , although i'll admit that the film's erotic content is somewhat less impressive than i expected . 
<s>  nothing about wild things is exceptionally risqu ? . 
<s>  the soft-core sex sequences are generic , and don't generate much heat . 
<s>  the lesbian kisses can't hold a candle to those in bound . 
<s>  theresa russell and denise richards have only token topless appearances ( neve campbell , possessing an iron-clad " no nudity " clause in her contract , keeps her clothes more or less on ) . 
<s>  the film's greatest curiosity is a full frontal shot of kevin bacon climbing out of the shower .

<s>  kevin bacon ) is familiar with . 
<s>  the director of wild things is john mcnaughton , whose last effort was the finely-tuned psychological thriller , normal life . 
<s>  that movie featured copious sex , a pair of real characters , and a powerful script . 
<s>  it's difficult to believe that something this shallow could come from the same film maker . 
<s>  but i suppose we all need to put food on the table . 
<s>  mcnaughton appears to have completely lost his way here , in what is obviously a stab at mainstream success ( his previous wide-release picture , mad dog and glory , was a box-office disappointment ) . 
<s>  quick cuts and pretty sunrises can't even begin to cover up this movie's flaws . 
<s>  the main character ( and i use that term lightly , since no one in wild things shows more than an occasional flash of personality ) is sam lombardo ( matt dillon ) , a guidance counselor at florida's blue bay high school . 
<s>  a student , the deliciously curvaceous kelly van ryan ( denise richards ) , has a crush on him .

<s>  after confessing to her mother ( theresa russell ) that she was raped , she goes to the police station , where she tells her story to detectives ray duquette ( kevin bacon ) and gloria perez ( daphne rubin-vega ) .

<s>  meanwhile , sam , convinced that he's being set up , goes to a shyster lawyer ( bill murray ) for help . 
<s>  the acting in wild things isn't very good , but none of the principals have much to work with . 
<s>  this is definitely not a character- based motion picture . 
<s>  not only does the ludicrous screenplay ignore the possibility that someone in the audience may have a triple-digit i . q . , but it doesn't bother to give any of the on-screen individuals even a hint of depth . 
<s>  the men and women populating the picture are there to look nice , but nothing more .

<s>  like a good action film should , " metro " has action that keeps you involved .

<s>  but " metro " is one of the best action films in a while . 
<s>  it is hip , sharp , nifty , and has nice little pieces of suspense and comedy .

<s>  and this invites me to mention last year s " the nutty professor , " which was his blessed revival back to the position at which he used to be .

<s>  that is because " metro " takes itself seriously , but doesn t prevent itself from having a little fun .

<s>  in " metro " he plays a hostage negotiator , so negotiation is his job , not his hobby or his preferred way out of trouble . 
<s>  his character in " metro " takes himself seriously .

<s>  murphy plays scott roper , and as i previously mentioned , he is a san francisco hostage negotiator .

<s>  murphy handles the scene seriously , without his usual happy-go-lucky , misfit humor .

<s>  there are also some other good scenes in " metro " that a lot of films would rather choose not to have . 
<s>  scenes like the one with roper and his new partner are at the horse track roper is a gambler who knows all the tricks and roper teaches his partner a few little methods of betting and winning . 
<s>  of course , the writers tried to disguise the scene as being insignificant by having roper draw parallels between hostage negotiation and gambling .

<s>  and it works as an action film , where it does have a tendency to occasionally go all-out .

<s>  roger ebert asks in his review of sexy beast , " who would have guessed that the most savage mad-dog frothing gangster in recent movies would be played by . . . 
<s>  ben kingsley ? " 
<s>  my response would be that anyone who has seen alan arkin in wait until dark , henry fonda in once upon a time in the west , or anthony hopkins in the silence of the lambs should have guessed it . 
<s>  they should know that the way for a film to create a really creepy sociopath is cast someone who generally plays mild , sympathetic , or even ineffectual character roles . 
<s>  the same characteristics that make an actor seem gentle in most of his roles can work in his favor when a role calls for him to be fierce and vicious . 
<s>  that is the principle that works for kingsley in sexy beast .

<s>  but his paradise is about to be shattered by a one-two-punch . 
<s>  the first punch is a boulder that comes rolling down the hill next to the villa .

<s>  in the meantime don knows just how to get under everybody's skin .

<s>  no only could they have let the water out of the pool and avoided the complication altogether , but there is by far too much water to be accounted for by what was in the pool . 
<s>  in spite of the provocative title , the story is cliched and overly familiar .

<s>  it is an old plot dressed up to look new .

<s>  the plot may be new to british crime films , but it would be overly familiar as a western . 
<s>  further respectability comes from ben kingsley's high-powered performance .

<s>  susan granger's review of " american outlaws " ( warner bros . ) 
<s>  thomas edison's " the great train robbery " ( 1903 ) was the first western ever made and " jesse james under the black flag " ( 1923 ) first introduced the outlaw folk hero . 
<s>  now , more than 20 similarly-themed pictures later , jesse james and his notorious gang of outlaws ride again in a banal mtv spin on an american legend . 
<s>  the story begins as jesse ( charasmatic colin farrell ) and his brother frank ( gabriel macht ) , cole and scott younger ( scott caan , will mccormack ) and trusty comanche tom ( nathaniel arcand ) , after four years of fighting for the rebs in the civil war , return to liberty , missouri - only to discover union troops are occupying their hometown . 
<s>  and an avaricious east coast railroad baron , thaddeus rains ( harris yulin ) , is forcing farmers to sell their land at less than true value , aided by allan pinkerton ( timothy dalton ) and his infamous detectives who , back then , were just thugs who provided security . 
<s>  but when ma james ( kathy bates ) becomes one of their victims , jesse and the rest of the guys ( gregory smith , ty o'neal , joe stevens ) form the james-younger gang to wreak revenge by attacking the railroad's supply lines , sabotaging track and robbing the banks where the payroll is kept . 
<s>  plus there's romance - between jesse and a spunky hometown gal , lee mimms ( ali larter ) . 
<s>  working from a politically-correct , clich ? -drenched , sanitized and revisionist screenplay by roderick taylor and john rodgers , director les mayfield keeps the action fast-paced and goes for lightweight laughs when he can . 
<s>  the choppy editing hurts but russell boyd's cinematography , luke reichle's designer duds and trevor rabin's music lend authenticity . 
<s>  on the granger movie gauge of 1 to 10 , " american outlaws " is a galloping , formulaic 3 . 
<s>  it's the wild west re-visited as a date movie . 
<s>  dear god , this is a fantastically bad film ! 
<s>  regardless of what i say about knock off , you can't grasp its awfulness from my words . 
<s>  you have to see it and experience it for yourself . 
<s>  here's the kicker , though -- i suggest that you do so . 
<s>  yes , this is a bad film -- easily one of the most incompetent films of the year -- but it has a certain misguided charm that makes it a unique kind of disaster to endure . 
<s>  in fact , i enjoyed myself for most of its brief running time , despite the dreadful acting and a completely incomprehensible story . 
<s>  don't get me wrong : i'm not excusing knock off . 
<s>  it reaches an unacceptable level of badness ; it's so incoherent that i wonder if it was hacked up worse than the avengers was . 
<s>  it also features some truly terrible performances from lela rochon , michael wong , paul sorvino , and -- of course -- jean-claude van damme . 
<s>  it does , however , have the entertaining presence of rob schneider , and the excessively inventive and pretentious direction of tsui hark . 
<s>  as i watched it , i occasionally wondered if it was aware of its own awfulness . 
<s>  now , in retrospect , it seems clear that it wasn't , but it's still a fascinating kind of mess . 
<s>  i don't like writing plot descriptions ( it is , by far , the most boring part of writing a review ) , but , in this case , i'm off the hook : there is no way i could write an accurate synopsis for knock off . 
<s>  for the sake of comparison , i had no trouble understanding the usual suspects during my first viewing . 
<s>  i paid closer attention to knock off , and the only thing i am able to say about it is that van damme plays a dude named ray , and is accused by the cia ( i think ) of selling knock off products ( knock off products are , of course , products that look like name-brand materials but are generic and cheap ) . 
<s>  i don't know what any of this has to do with martial arts , but there are lots of martial arts in the film . 
<s>  ray is good at martial arts , so when he has to beat up bad guys , there's no problem . 
<s>  rob schneider plays his sidekick , although i had no idea who he really was by the end of the film . 
<s>  lela rochon is just some woman who accuses them of stuff , while paul sorvino is both the good guy and the bad guy at once ! 
<s>  in fact , every character goes through so many shifts from good to bad that the end provides absolutely no insight into what any of them really do . 
<s>  in that order , knock off is completely incoherent and makes absolutely no sense . 
<s>  but what a strange mess it is . 
<s>  it was written by stephen e . de souza , who also wrote die hard and 48 hours . 
<s>  can this be the same man ? 
<s>  i don't see how , unless , of course , huge chunks of the film have been removed for the sake of running time . 
<s>  knock off seems to have an interesting premise ( as far as action films go ) , but there's no semblance here . 
<s>  for instance , van damme is introduced , and then seconds later he's running a chariot race through the streets of hong kong . 
<s>  why ? 
<s>  who knows . 
<s>  what are the implications of this ? 
<s>  i have no idea . 
<s>  most action films abandon depth in favor of action , and this is normally a problem . 
<s>  knock off , however , is the first film that i would have preferred to see with all of the talky sequences cut . 
<s>  the acting is embarrassingly bad : rochon , in particular , delivers each of her lines with stiff and talentless insincerity . 
<s>  sorvino , in addition , deserves better than this . 
<s>  van damme is bad , but he's charming in that bad way , and so i can't say that he's hard to watch ( although i rarely understood what he was saying ) . 
<s>  the only exception is rob schneider , who is actually quite funny a lot of the time . 
<s>  tsui utilizes so many tricks that he makes john woo look tame by comparison . 
<s>  they're all pointless gimmicks though , such as shots of the inner-workings of a knock off running shoe . 
<s>  but his action scenes are never boring : one particular piece inside of a fruit factory ( a fruit factory ? ) is well-choreographed . 
<s>  lots of the scenes are pitched well to comedy , such as our heroes' first encounter with the rochon character . 
<s>  but did tsui know that his film is beyond ludicrous ? 
<s>  i hope he did , for the alternative is a frightening thought . 
<s>  knock off has the feel of a truly terrible exercise in camp mania . 
<s>  if it were boring , i'd give it zero stars . 
<s>  but it's not boring : it's loud and excessive and completely incoherent . 
<s>  it's also funny , even when it isn't meaning to be funny . 
<s>  a bad film that succeeds as entertainment doesn't deserve to be fully lambasted . 
<s>  i recognize knock off for its irrefutable badness , but i can't deny it's zany , useless charm . 
<s>  oh , i know , they're just action scenes looking desperately for a real story , but they're fun action scenes amongst a crowd of laughably inane concepts . 
<s>  it's fun to admire the awfulness of a film like this , but that doesn't excuse the fact that it is , indeed , awful .

<s>  synopsis : the president of a company wants to test his self-appointed successor , who's psychotic , and thinks it's a great idea to spend a week with him and their wives in an isolated cabin a hundred miles from civilization with no dependable transportation or means of communication after a heavy snowfall . 
<s>  comments : tracks of a killer had a couple of strikes against it before i even began watching it . 
<s>  strike one was the fact that someone had scrawled the word garbage on the videotape's sticker in black marker ( not typically a good sign when you rent a film ) . 
<s>  strike two came while the previews played . 
<s>  did you ever get a sinking premonition about a movie's quality ( or lack thereof ) while watching the trailers that come before it ? 
<s>  well , the cheesy films being advertised before tracks of a killer were films that no one has ever heard of starring people no one knows , and they all looked bad ( definately not a good sign ) . 
<s>  tracks of a killer itself completed the strikeout .

<s>  by the time the characters arrive at the cabin , this film begins to become tedious .

<s>  but , then again , what do i know about business ?

<s>  this leaves the movie with an hour to go and only three characters , which really isn't enough to sustain it .
