<s>  there should be a requirement that a potential viewer be under a certain film iq in order to see " mission to mars . " 
<s>  there are probably quite a few people who are going to enjoy it , and most of them will probably be those who have seen very few films of its kind . 
<s>  but there are those who will not , and those will most likely be people who have already seen one or more of the following movies : " 2001 : a space odyssey , " " armageddon , " " apollo 13 , " " the abyss , " " close encounters of the third kind , " " e . t . 
<s>  the extra-terrestrial , " " alien , " and " aliens . " 
<s>  why ? 
<s>  because there is not one original idea in " mission to mars . " 
<s>  all of it is cribbed from other films ( and in most cases , better films ) . 
<s>  if this is the sort of thing you don't mind , you might like the film . 
<s>  of course , there are other reasons not to like " mission to mars , " the main one being a script written by people who seem to assume their audience is filled with people who haven't used their brains in some time , and who don't intend to start during the film's running time . 
<s>   " mission to mars " manages to be both stupid and boring at the same time . 
<s>  the plot , cribbed greatly from " 2001 , " concerns a team sent to mars , the first manned trip ever made to the red planet . 
<s>  luke graham ( don cheadle ) leads the team , jointly formed of americans and russians . 
<s>  the team encounters a mysterious monolith that emits a strange pulse ( this being nothing like the pulse-emitting monolith in " 2001 " -- that one was on the * moon * ) , but when they try to study it , a giant sand tornado comes out of the top and swallows them ( all except luke , who survives long enough to send a garbled message back to the rotating space station , which looks strangely like the rotating space station in " 2001 " ) . 
<s>  a rescue mission is planned with husband & wife team woody blake ( tim robbins ) and terri fisher ( connie nielsen ) , obligatory pilot with a troubled past jim mcconnell ( gary sinise ) , and extra crew member phil ohlmyer ( jerry o'connell ) along for the ride . 
<s>  after some zero-gravity dancing , they run into problems when one of their engines is blown , forcing them to attempt a desperate landing aboard a supply vessel . 
<s>  now stranded on mars with minimal supplies , the team must decide whether or not it can risk entering the monolith or if they should return home . 
<s>  after all , that monolith just might contain information about how life originated on earth . 
<s>   " mission to mars " is one of those films that makes a critic wonder where to start when talking about all the things that are wrong with it , so let's start with one of the things that does work : director brian de palma manages to create some eerie tension in a few scenes during the middle of the film . 
<s>  that's it . 
<s>  everything else fails . 
<s>  the failure isn't de palma's fault ; he's working from an atrocious script . 
<s>  only during the sequence aboard the ship ( looking an awful lot like the jupiter vessel in " 2001 " ) where the rescue team's air begins running out and they must frantically search for the hole and patch it up does " mission to mars " come to life . 
<s>  a scene where they attempt to save a comrade floating away into space also provides some tension , until you realize that the entire danger/more danger/attempted rescue sequence has absolutely nothing to do with the rest of the film ; it's just a contrived way to generate thrilling scenes . 
<s>  take it out , and the plot isn't affected in any way . 
<s>  the sequence also suffers from a few plot holes ( as does the rest of the film ) : why is the ship's computer ( which sounds strangely like hal from , uh , " 2001 " ) able to detect a hole in the main chamber but not one in the engine ? 
<s>  why did tim robbins' character have to go outside the ship when the solution easily presented itself from inside ? 
<s>  shouldn't the astronauts be better trained to deal with a hull breach ? 
<s>  why are the characters such idiots ? 
<s>  because the script makes little attempt to properly develop them . 
<s>  all the " conflict " is clumsily delivered in excruciatingly obvious exposition in the opening scene ( which rips off orson welles and robert altman by utilizing a long opening tracking shot ) during which the characters repeatedly tell each other about things all of them should already know : " jim , it's too bad you can't go on this mission because you were determined 'psychologically inadequate' because your wife died right before you were to go on the mission together " -- does anyone really talk like this ? 
<s>  can't we find out these things in a less grating matter , like maybe in a flashback ? 
<s>  the whole film is like that . 
<s>  the filmmakers are not content to merely show us something and assume we know what's going on ; they must * tell * us exactly what we're looking at * every * time . 
<s>  sample dialogue from the film : ( shot of mars ) astronaut a : " look , there's mars " astronaut b : " you sure that's mars ? " 
<s>  astronaut a : " yeah , that's mars all right . " 
<s>  astronaut c : " hey , are you guys looking at mars ? " 
<s>  that exchange isn't actually in " mission to mars , " but i wouldn't be surprised if it were . 
<s>  for all their cribbing from kubrick , spielberg , james cameron , and even ron howard , the makers of this film haven't learned to do something all those directors did very well : show and don't tell . 
<s>  de palma used to know how , but seems to have forgotten . 
<s>  this is mentally-challenged filmmaking ; they assume the audience won't get what's going on , so they explain everything five times over . 
<s>  fourth-graders may appreciate this , but more learned viewers will have their intelligence insulted . 
<s>  the principal actors sleepwalk their way through " mission to mars , " never managing to do away with an apparent " i'm just here to get a paycheck " attitude . 
<s>  cheadle stumbles over his awkward lines . 
<s>  armin mueller-stahl manages to thoroughly embarrass himself in an unbilled cameo . 
<s>  robbins puts his game face on and phones in his standard " decent guy " performance . 
<s>  and sinise hams it up with " wistful " facial expressions while watching tapes of his dead wife ( played by kim delaney , who only has one scene during which she still manages to deliver some ridiculous dialogue in a heavy-handed monologue about the meaning of life ) , and especially during the stolen-from-no-less-than-three-movies ( a lollipop to whoever names them ) conclusion , which combines endless , obvious explanation and sub-par cgi effects with gagging sentimentality and is sure to alienate any viewers who had been enjoying the show up until then . 
<s>  and of course , these aliens from mars who facilitated the evolution of life on earth are entirely different from the aliens in " 2001 " who facilitated the evolution of life on earth ; those aliens were from an * unknown * world . 
<s>  it could be said that fans of brainless action films might enjoy " mission to mars , " but such a comment ignores the fact that the film is also incredibly slow-going . 
<s>  leisurely pacing might have helped a film with a little more substance to it , but all of the substance of " mission to mars " has been stolen from other films , and those other films dealt with their ideas in a much more thoughtful fashion and generally contained more engaging characters . 
<s>  supposedly we're intended to choke up when one character decides not to return home at the end of this one ( totally different from the one-character-decides-not-to-return ending of " armageddon " ) , but i suspect most people will either be laughing or groaning . 
<s>  me , i alternated between the two . 
<s>  there is only one good thing about the way " mission to mars " finally ends : the fact that the movie is over . 
<s>  underwater science fiction stays submerged 
<s>  sphere a film review by michael redman copyright 1998 by michael redman 
<s>  one of the most unpleasant experiences that can occur in a movie theater is when a cast of fine actors end up in a film that wastes their talents . 
<s>  you keep thinking what they might have accomplished with the time they squandered . 
<s>  psychologist norman goodman ( dustin hoffman ) is called to the middle of the pacific ocean to work with the survivors of a plane crash . 
<s>  when he arrives at the site , he discovers that there is no plane , but rather an enormous spacecraft that has been sitting 1 , 000 feet below the surface for almost 300 years . 
<s>  having written a paper for the bush administration on how to handle first contact , he is chosen to head up the team of scientists investigating the ship . 
<s>  his group as outlined in his report , consists of beth halperin ( sharon stone ) , a biochemist ; harry adams ( samuel l . jackson ) , a mathematician ; and ted fielding ( liev schreiber ) , an astrophysicist . 
<s>  unfortunately it turns out that the writing was a blow-off project for goodman who did it for the money and named his then-colleagues to the team . 
<s>   " after all , " he explains , " who reads government documents ? " 
<s>  lead by harold barnes ( peter coyote ) , a top secret federal operative , the group descends to a mobile undersea headquarters set up next to the alien vessel . 
<s>  once there they stroll over , knock on the door and explore the still-operational ufo . 
<s>  discovering the surprising origin of the ship and the crew finds an astonishing gigantic golden liquid metal sphere . 
<s>  when adams enters the sphere , the weirdness unfolds . 
<s>  a storm rolls in on the surface and the team is forced to remain below just as an unseen presence begins to communicate through their computer . 
<s>   " my name is jerry . 
<s>  i am happy " flashes across the screen . 
<s>  this is unsettling for the psychologist . 
<s>   " what happens if jerry gets mad ? " he asks . 
<s>  barnes is more pragmatic : he needs a last name because he can't put in his report that they made contact with an alien named jerry . 
<s>  then the situation turns bad . 
<s>  deadly beasts appear from nowhere . 
<s>  a gang of jellyfish kills one of the navy personnel . 
<s>  lethal sea snakes attack goodman . 
<s>  a giant squid batters the habitat just as adams is reading " 20 , 000 leagues under the sea " . 
<s>  the suspicious scientists turn against each other . 
<s>  this has all the makings of a first-rate thinking man's science fiction film . 
<s>  however even the finest ingredients don't go very far in the hands of a chief who doesn't seem to care about his product . 
<s>  director barry levinson has churned out a mish-mosh that doesn't engage the audience beyond a few skillful suspense scenes . 
<s>  the first of the film zooms by as the situation and players are introduced without any characterization or justification . 
<s>  it's much like speed-reading a novel and realizing that you missed the nuances . 
<s>  it doesn't get any better when the action scenes begin . 
<s>  while the actors do an adequate job with their limited roles , the people are still flat . 
<s>  oddly they hardly have reactions when deaths occur around them . 
<s>  after adams experiences the interior of the sphere , no one bothers to ask him what happened . 
<s>  their history together is an intriguing plot device but is barely exploited . 
<s>  even goodman and halperin's ill-conceived affair when she was his student is just mentioned in passing . 
<s>  her psychotic tendencies are talked about but never convincing . 
<s>  there's a truism that items shown early in a movie must be used before the ending , but here they are far too obvious . 
<s>  when an emergency mini-sub is explained , you know what's going to happen . 
<s>  the movie affectations are nothing more than distracting . 
<s>  chapter headings that divide the movie have no function . 
<s>  the shaky camera work muddies already perplexing chaos . 
<s>  much of what goes on is confusing and difficult to follow . 
<s>  although some of the disorientation eventually is understandable , a great deal of it isn't . 
<s>  even a science fiction film must be internally consistent . 
<s>  there's too much here that doesn't make sense . 
<s>  are the manifestations real ? 
<s>  the jellyfish kill queen latifa ( in a throw-away role ) and the squid nearly destroys the outpost , but the bites of the fatal snakes have no effect . 
<s>  a scene in the sub suggests that it's illusion , but earlier episodes indicate that it's not . 
<s>  not everything has to be explained to death , but there are major questions that the film never answers . 
<s>  where the ship came from is clarified , but how it ended up on the ocean floor in 1709 is merely alluded to .

<s>  it's undoubtedly an interesting visual , but it would have been nice if its use actually amounted to something .

<s>  jakob the liar is a confused , muddled little movie ; a generically " uplifting " film with a fundamental contradiction : the message it delivers is depressing as opposed to inspiring and the movie doesn't realize it . 
<s>  williams plays jakob haim , a jew imprisoned in a polish ghetto during world war ii . 
<s>  one night he wanders outside after curfew and is promptly sent to the office of a high-ranking german officer for his punishment . 
<s>  jakob gets off easy and he gets to hear approximately 30 seconds of a radio broadcast . 
<s>  the announcement ( in english , but punctuated by a triumphant " heil hitler ! " ) is that russian troops are only miles away from jakob's ghetto . 
<s>  liberation ! he thinks . 
<s>  the next day , jakob tells the news to his closest friend , a volatile prize fighter named misha ( liev schreiber ) , who despite being sworn to secrecy passes the message along . 
<s>  soon , it is a common assumption in the ghetto that jakob has a radio hidden in his home -- a crime punishable by death . 
<s>  this is absurdly false , but the more jakob tells the people of the ghetto this , the more convinced they become that he is abreast of the latest developments in the war that is to decide their fate . 
<s>  the danger , of course , is that the germans allegedly have informants throughout the ghetto , and rumors about the radio can get out and put jakob in great danger . 
<s>  in a curiously irrelevant subplot , jakob finds a 11-year old girl who has separated from her parents and decides to hide her in his small home . 
<s>  apparently he is afraid that she will be discovered , and goes to great length to make sure of that -- just why the idea frightens him is never made clear . 
<s>  he and the girl build an uninvolving , generic relationship that never goes anywhere and is as irrelevant at the end as it was in the beginning . 
<s>  the moral of the story is that hope is the best medicine . 
<s>  but jakob the liar forgets that the hope that jakob brings to his ghetto is false . 
<s>  such hope inevitably leads to expectations of its realization and when those expectations aren't met , the results are far worse than if there was no hope . 
<s>  that's the film's biggest detriment : it is based on a false assumption and thus comes off as painfully false . 
<s>  it's never moving because it doesn't give us anything to be moved by . 
<s>  jakob the liar fails to tug any heartstrings which destroys its purpose for existing . 
<s>  robin williams doesn't inject the film with life , as a matter of fact , he seems a little out of it , as if crippled by his fake accent . 
<s>  he is stragely unenthusiastic ; his character is one who spreads hope but his performance is lifeless , hopeless . 
<s>  not since good will hunting has he abandoned his signature style to this extent ; this isn't the robin williams we know and love . 
<s>  in good will hunting he became a serious actor and won an oscar for it . 
<s>  here , he is more of a wannabe serious actor ; an impostor .

<s>  not just one or two . . . thousands of them . 
<s>  the deedles are assigned to eliminate the p . dog menace , not knowing that it all is part of a fiendish plan by disgraced former head ranger frank slater ( dennis hopper ) . 
<s>  the brothers deedle aren't supposed to be out-and-out stupid , like the team from dumb and dumber , or bill and ted . 
<s>  instead , their brains just operate in a different , simpler , realm . 
<s>  a more accurate comparison would be with carrot top in chairman of the board , a film which , unfortunately , this one resembles in several hideous ways . 
<s>  the central problem with meet the deedles is that it simply just isn't funny . 
<s>  there's a moment when phil utters the line , " insert laugh here " , which nearly sums up the entire meet the deedles experience . 
<s>  the result isn't bad in a run-shrieking-from-the-theater type of way . 
<s>  instead , it's merely bad in an excruciatingly boring sort of way . 
<s>  the cast seems decent , but they're never asked to do anything remotely interesting . 
<s>  instead , the film inundates the audience with countless shots of people and/or cars rolling downhill in the forest , and with constant annoying references to other disney films . 
<s>  you'll have much better luck finding a good spot to surf in wyoming than finding entertainment in meet the deedles . 
<s>  adam sandler isn't known for appearing in deep , thought-provoking films , but he's still a really funny guy . 
<s>  most of his movies are successful not because of the film making behind them , but because they let sandler do what he does best without a stupid plot to drown him out . 
<s>  big daddy is the first film in which the story seems more important than sandler's comic performance , and it's a miserable failure . 
<s>  sandler plays a thirty-something loser who gets attached to an orphaned young boy ( played by cole and dylan sprouse ) . 
<s>  as one might expect from the synopsis , director dennis dugan resorts to the usual bag of manipulative and sentimental sequences , including a repulsive courtroom battle and a lot of teary scenes in which characters say " good-bye " to one another ; in addition , there's a ridiculous amount of disgusting toilet humor ( urine and vomit both get more screen time than sandler himself ) . 
<s>  there's a hilarious running joke featuring a female doctor who previously worked at hooters , and the film features passable performances from sandler , joey lauren adams ( as the love interest ) , and the two young boys , but the film on the whole is trite and disappointingly unfunny . 
<s>  at the end of an action scene in " lara croft : tomb raider , " a wall collapses near the nubile warrior . 
<s>  with her face on the floor , she gazes into the rubble , then grins abruptly and says " oh , my car keys ! " 
<s>  i mention this scene because it was the only moment in the whole damned production that made me smile . 
<s>  based on an incredibly popular video game , " lara croft : tomb raider " is a lousy movie . 
<s>  the structure goes like this : poorly-staged action sequence , boring exposition , poorly-staged action sequence , boring exposition , etc . etc . , the end . 
<s>  basically , the film exists to showcase angelina jolie's puffy lips and enhanced tits . 
<s>  close-ups are framed oh-so-carefully to include her million dollar bazooms . 
<s>  running scenes highlight her bouncing breasts in vintage " baywatch " fashion . 
<s>  there's even include a shower scene that offers a brief side view of them . 
<s>  but the filmmakers are so inept they can't even flash the audience correctly . 
<s>  the one extended display of nudity is of - get ready for this - a guy . 
<s>  for no particular reason , a muscular supporting character strolls around naked for about 30 seconds , with each shot composed to barely cover his package , ? la " austin powers . " 
<s>  now , i enjoy a good looking male body as much as the next gay guy , but what the hell is beefcake doing in a t&a flick aimed at heterosexual males ? 
<s>  of course , what else should one expect in a film that does virtually nothing right ? 
<s>   " tomb raider " sets up elaborate action set pieces , then renders them incomprehensible with needless jump cut editing ( a promising dual bungee cord battle is ruined by excessive cuts ) . 
<s>  it promises a series of exotic locales , then delivers cavernous sets and grimy matte paintings with smoggy skies . 
<s>  throw in some bargain basement computer graphics and you end up with the ugliest movie to come down the pike in many moons . 
<s>  intended to be a rousing " indiana jones " style adventure , " tomb raider " lacks any sense of tension . 
<s>  the low point comes when lara is " threatened " by statues of monkey warriors and a giant multi-armed shiva figure that come to life courtesy of cgi . 
<s>  easily the lamest menaces i have ever seen , the creatures move like snails and fall apart with a single shot from a gun . 
<s>  if you ever have to be chased by monsters , pray that you get the monkey warriors . 
<s>   " tomb raider " tells a story , sort of . 
<s>  once every 5 , 000 years , the planets align . 
<s>  a group of very bad men are out to find two halves of an object that , if reassembled just as the planets align , will give them control over time itself . 
<s>  lara's goal is to stop them and rescue her long-missing poppa ( jon voight , jolie's real life dad ) . 
<s>  none of this matters though , because stunning gaps in internal logic assure that the plot of " lara croft : tomb raider " is as lame as ever other aspect of the film ? except angelina jolie's lips and breasts . 
<s>  when robert forster found himself famous again after appearing in " jackie brown " , he immediately signed up for a little film called " american perfekt " . 
<s>  this was almost two years ago . 
<s>  i waited patiently for the film to be released , but it never was .

<s>  i immediately rented it and with a certain amount of glee , rushed home to view it .

<s>  the storyline is non-existent . 
<s>  it took me half the movie just to figure out what was going on .

<s>  i'll give you an example , without giving too much away .

<s>  and if you do rent it , don't bother trying to figure out what's going on in the hopes that everything will be resolved by the end . 
<s>  this doesn't happen . 
<s>  and no explanation is given for the misspelling of " perfect " , either . 
<s>  you'd think that after awhile hollywood would stop trying to make movies out of video games . 
<s>  it hasn't worked so far . 
<s>   " street fighter ? " 
<s>   " super mario brothers ? " 
<s>   " wing commander ? " 
<s>   " mortal kombat ? " 
<s>  not a watchable film in the bunch . 
<s>  still i held out some hope for " tomb raider . " 
<s>  after all , the game's premise is heavily influenced by the indiana jones trilogy and all the mummy movies , so there are cinematic elements imbedded in the concept . 
<s>  however , despite the potential of the project , " tomb raider " proves to be yet another bomb . 
<s>  the plot is a convoluted accumulation of nonsense probably borrowed from a dozen bad movies . 
<s>  there's a once-ever-5000-years alignment of planets coming up , and the illuminati have to find both halves of an ancient triangle that controls time in order to take over the world . 
<s>  of course , the ancient folks who divided the triangle buried the halves in tombs on opposite sides of the world .

<s>  she figures that if she gets the triangle , she can bring her dad back from the dead . 
<s>  of course , no one was expecting much of a plot from this movie anyway . 
<s>  in both video games and action movies , the plot is just an excuse for the action sequences . 
<s>  however , the action in " tomb raider " shows little style or originality . 
<s>  there's lots of shooting and some kung fu fightin' , but none of it progresses beyond the level of a cheap direct-to-cable flick . 
<s>  the other goofy archeologist flick of the summer , " the mummy returns , " was much better ; it had its flaws , but its action was creative and large-scale . 
<s>  since winning her academy award for " girl , interrupted , " jolie hasn't taken any projects that would display her acting talents .

<s>  considering the rumors of incest that hang over jolie and her supposed obsession with death , having lara be obsessed with resurrecting her dead father ( and uninterested in any of the living males around her ) seems a poor choice .

<s>  i have never liked john carpenter and his style .

<s>  in the interest of being generous , i want to start this review with the scene that i liked in meet joe black . 
<s>  sir anthony hopkins , playing a super-rich media mogul , has gathered his family around him for dinner . 
<s>  his oldest daughter ( played by marcia gay harden from millers crossing ) , who has been obsessively planning his sinfully extravagant birthday party , presents him with three superbly decorated little cakes , which are supposed to be scale models for his big birthday cake . 
<s>  the daughter asks hopkins to pick the one he likes . 
<s>  hopkins , frustrated by the weight of planning for the whole elaborate affair , does what any man in his position would do : he punts . 
<s>  whichever one you like , dear , he says . 
<s>  and the daughter does exactly what any woman in her position would do : she cries . 
<s>  i liked that scene for two reasons . 
<s>  first , the cakes looked really cool . 
<s>  second , it was , perhaps , the only scene in the movie where people acted as you would expect people to act . 
<s>  meet joe black is chock-full of odd performances , people doing things for no discernible reason at all , and doing them in slow motion over the course of three hours to boot . 
<s>  it's easy to watch meet joe black for the abundant eye candy of the palatial homes and the beauteous claire forlani , but it's even easier to sleep right through it ( two people on my row managed it quite nicely ) . 
<s>  the difficult part of the movie is understanding the characters and their motivations and why someone thought three hours was an appropriate length for this overwrought mess . 
<s>  i know my audience had problems with the movie , because they thought it was a comedy . 
<s>  case in point : everyone should know by now that brad pitt plays the angel of death in this movie . 
<s>  however , the first we see of him is as a young lawyer in a coffee shop hitting on the glamorous claire forlani . 
<s>   ( it's not clear from the movie whether you need a law degree to become the angel of death , but it makes a certain kind of sense . ) 
<s>  it shouldn't take long for the observant moviegoer to realize that bad things are about to happen to mr . pitt . 
<s>  and indeed they do ( after a hideously prolonged sequence where pitt looks over his shoulder at the retreating forlani and forlani looks over her shoulder at the retreating pitt ) , because pitt walks into the road without looking and suddenly gets squished . 
<s>  well , when that happened , the audience howled with laughter , and continued to laugh at every comment that was remotely humorous . 
<s>  so , if you think that sudden violent death and sarcastic drawing-room humor are funny , i encourage you to go see meet joe black immediately . 
<s>  anyway , the deceased lawyer's body , no worse the wear from its massive injuries , is possessed by the angel of death and brad pitt takes over that role . 
<s>  the idea is that death ( given the pen name of joe black , so as not to disturb others ) wants to take a holiday and experience the world . 
<s>  if this weren't hollywood , we might get an interesting metaphysical discussion of life and death , but since it is , we get scene after scene of fish-out-of-water humor , just as if death is george of the jungle or crocodile dundee or some other poor schmuck who's wandered in from the jungle or the outback or whatever and doesn't know how to act in our society . 
<s>  it also doesn't help that the character of death is written so inconsistently . 
<s>  he claims to be on vacation , but he never does anything except hang around the seriously attractive claire forlani ( just try to get your travel agent to book that one ) . 
<s>  he speaks very slow and halting english but perfectly fluent jamaican patois . 
<s>  he knows everything about some characters , nothing about others . 
<s>  and as played by brad pitt , he's not especially menacing or charming or glamorous or intriguing , he's just there . 
<s>  it's as if someone told pitt , " never mind about acting in this picture , son , just stand there and look pretty . " 
<s>  it's as if pitt is doing his keanu reeves impression throughout the movie . 
<s>  i've used the phrase " angel of death " in this review very deliberately to contrast pitt's performance with this year's best angel performance , nicolas cage's in city of angels . 
<s>  where pitt is cold and unfeeling , cage is as warm and empathetic as the situation allows . 
<s>  where cage is genuinely curious about the nature of man , pitt is aloof and arrogant . 
<s>  cage struck instant chemical sparks with co-star meg ryan , where the chemistry between pitt and forlani is only understandable if you accept the notion that forlani's character is so shallow that she can't see beyond pitt's good looks . 
<s>  the movie's other top name is a much better actor , but that doesn't save meet joe black . 
<s>  sir anthony hopkins isn't given much better material to work with , unfortunately . 
<s>  he plays one of these good-hearted multimillionaire media moguls that only exist in hollywood . 
<s>   ( one wonders what might have happened if they had made hopkins's character more realistically evil . ) 
<s>  hopkins is marked for death due to a bad ticker , but death steps in and grants him some extra time in exchange for being his guide in the world . 
<s>  of course , no one can be sure of how they will act when death taps on their shoulder . 
<s>  but i have to wonder ( and in this movie , you have a very long time to wonder ) how you or i would act in a similar situation , especially if you or i were a multimillionaire . 
<s>  hopkins pretty much goes to the office -- and the major subplot revolves around who will control the corporation . 
<s>  fans of corporate intrigue will be fascinated , i'm sure . 
<s>  i stayed awake all the way through meet joe black , and i'm asking myself why . 
<s>  movies about death should encourage you to live life to the fullest , which is what i'm going to do now . 
<s>  go spend time with your family , go volunteer for a local charity , heck , go take a nap . 
<s>  don't go see meet joe black , because all it will do is move you three long hours closer to death .

<s>  the preceding has been the plot of approximately twelve thousand and six action films ; this one just happens to be called metro . 
<s>  i have learned to expect little from films like metro , and consequently i am bored by them more often than i am genuinely disappointed . 
<s>  with eddie murphy on board , however , you hope for something extra , some kind of spark . 
<s>  when a film makes watching eddie murphy a tedious experience , you know it is doing something terribly wrong . 
<s>  murphy stars as scott roper , a hostage negotiator for the san francisco police department who is exceedingly good at his job . 
<s>  with his personal life , he is considerably less successful , facing an unhappy ex-girlfriend named veronica ( carmen ejogo ) , a gambling problem and a mountain of debt . 
<s>  then his professional life gets a jolt as well when a friend and colleague ( art evans ) is murdered while investigating suspected jewel thief michael korda ( michael wincott ) . 
<s>  finding korda becomes very personal to scott , and he joins with new partner kevin mccall ( michael rappaport ) to foil korda during an attempted heist . 
<s>  but all is not well even with korda in jail , as scott , veronica and kevin all continue to face life-threatening danger . 
<s>  metro ( the title , in case you are wondering , means absolutely nothing ) is so badly put together that even the most casual viewer may notice the miserable pacing and stray plot threads . 
<s>  in the first place , korda's rage over being discovered before he can make his big score is rendered completely pointless when he proceeds to hit the target anyway ( and , incidentally , to screw it up ) . 
<s>  a reference to payoffs in the police department , followed by a conspicuous decision to keep scott off the korda case and a couple of pointed glances , is dropped abruptly with no resolution after about forty-five minutes ; even the relationship between scott and new partner kevin is so perfunctory , with kevin disappearing entirely after taking a bullet for scott , that you may yearn for bickering buddies . 
<s>  worst of all is a plot structure which places the main villain ( the always menacing michael wincott ) behind bars for far too long , leaving a lot of time to kill with the tedious reconciliation of scott and veronica . 
<s>  you can't blame murphy for being unable to muster any enthusiasm for the scenes with his bland leading lady , but he should have known better than to take this role at all . 
<s>  scott roper exists in an uncomfortable middle ground between the kind of street-wise fast-talker murphy has built a career on and an actual three-dimensional character , and murphy is never able to reconcile the two . 
<s>  the script seems to have been doctored for him , with a gambling problem turned into a bit of character color and his supposed inability to form relationships turned into a cause for gags rather than actual conflict , yet there is still too little comedy for murphy to work with . 
<s>  for much of the film , he walks around with an intense frown , and it is over 90 minutes into metro before you hear that trademark laugh for the first time . 
<s>  murphy is stranded with too few solid punch lines , and nearly all of the ones he does have bounce of ejogo and fall to the ground limply .

<s>  confucius once said , " governing a nation is like cooking a small fish -- don't overdo it . " 
<s>  his maxim might be easily applied to writing a comedy script , for quantity over quality is one of the worst mistakes an amateur scribe can make . 
<s>  granted , mike judge , writer-director of the workplace satire office space isn't exactly an amateur ( his most infamous work , the mtv series " beavis and butt-head " was pure gold for its network ) . 
<s>  but unfailingly , judge manages to make some rather inexcusable mistakes in office space by spreading an iffy plot over too much ground . 
<s>  the iffiness in judge's plot -- a group of coworkers plan the downfall of their despicable boss -- is not in its appeal . 
<s>  in fact , based on the popularity of scott adams' cartoon " dilbert , " which will soon have its own television series , a satirical view of the american workplace is a hot item in hollywood .

<s>  the most convincing evidence of this are the trailers for office space , which feature almost all of the movie's top content ; this leaves the actual picture appearing very deflated . 
<s>  other evidence of office space's failure to work are its lack of good jokes . 
<s>  the comedy is marginally funny at best , but not enough to get a packed house of theater-goers to laugh out loud . 
<s>  the material in the movie is on-key for an older demographic than judge is used to targeting , and this could partially explain his work here .

<s>  what better for the farrelly brothers , famous for writing and directing comedies with offensive subject matter , than to make a movie about a guy with a split personality ? 
<s>  it's exactly the sort of thing the brothers relish : poking fun at something serious ( in this case mental illness ) , throwing all care to the wind to get a laugh . 
<s>  jim carrey's signed on too ? 
<s>  even better . 
<s>  the national alliance for the mentally ill even helped out by levying complaints against the brothers' new film before its opening , claiming it was misrepresenting the condition of split personality , labeling it incorrectly as " schizophrenia , " and so forth . 
<s>  such a protest seemed like just the sort of thing that would , of course , only add more fuel to the farrelly brothers' fire , proving that some people just couldn't take a joke , and that the farrellys would be helping the more enlightened viewers to yet another dose of their brilliantly subversive comedy . 
<s>  yes , it all seemed perfect , but one thing went wrong : their movie isn't funny . 
<s>  it's not for lack of trying . 
<s>  the farrellys utilize in " me , myself & irene " their most high-concept premise ever : carrey plays charlie baileygaites , a man who after being dumped by his wife for a midget limo driver , decides to bury all his aggressive feelings deep down inside and never release them . 
<s>  this , of course , means all his neighbors exploit his entirely too-forgiving nature , making his job as a rhode island state trooper increasingly difficult . 
<s>  soon enough , charlie's repressed aggression manifests itself into a second , independent personality named hank , a deep-voiced , boorish ogre unafraid of taking the assertive actions his predecessor had been unable to muster . 
<s>  this guy isn't above crashing a car through the wall of the barber shop in which he's been insulted , or holding a little girl's head underwater because she refused to stop jump-roping in the street . 
<s>  then things start getting lost in the most complicated plot the farrellys have ever attempted , and the film runs off its tracks . 
<s>  some have suggested that this isn't a problem , because the farrelly brothers' brand of humor doesn't require plot to work . 
<s>  they're wrong , of course : plot was greatly instrumental in building up the kind of rollicking comic energy that infused the farrellys' last effort , 1996's " there's something about mary . " 
<s>   ( 1999's " outside providence " was technically an earlier project . ) 
<s>  the brothers' earlier film wasn't funny merely because it contained outrageous gags ( despite what some newsmagazine articles would have you believe ) , but rather because its most outrageous gags were entirely unexpected . 
<s>  in " mary , " the farrellys managed several times to pull off a neat sleight-of-hand trick : they'd have you thinking the story was going one way , then reveal its real direction in delightfully surprising fashion . 
<s>   " me , myself & irene , " by contrast , seems to have been made by folks who looked at " mary " and saw only the surface grossness , missing all of the subtle machinations that really made it work . 
<s>  having been produced by the same guys who made " mary , " " irene " seems like an even bigger disappointment . 
<s>  the brothers pile on the offensive humor , taking shots at race , midgets , albinos , mental illness , and all manner of bathroom jokes . 
<s>  but they haven't come up with a way to make any of it fresh ; most of " me , myself & irene " comes off as rote , by-the-numbers , adolescent comedy . 
<s>  the plot , with carrey forced to drive alleged fugitive irene p . waters ( renee zellweger ) , who's in more trouble than anyone knows , back to new york , has an ending that's entirely predictable from the get-go . 
<s>   ( think charlie and irene will fall in love ? 
<s>  yeah , me too . ) 
<s>  the farrellys then introduce scores of different characters , and none of them ever manage to do anything you haven't already expected them to do , no matter how outrageous their actions might be . 
<s>  compared to the curveballs the farrellys are used to throwing , this stuff is almost entirely soft-tossed , presenting an obvious problem : when gross-out humor loses its shock value , it's no longer funny , merely gross . 
<s>  the jokes that do work are milked over and over until their effectiveness runs dry . 
<s>  take , for example , the subplot involving charlie's three black sons ( anthony anderson , mongo brownlee , jerod mixon ) . 
<s>  the incongruity of it all is funny for a while , with three burly black men discussing higher math in ghetto language and white-bread carrey mouthing said language with an entirely too-pleasant smile on his face . 
<s>  but by the end of the film , they're still doing the same schitck ; it hasn't been elevated to another , funnier level , and it hasn't been dropped either . 
<s>  that's too bad , because it ceases to be amusing about halfway through . 
<s>   " me , myself & irene " reeks of wasted opportunities . 
<s>  there ought to be more focus on how other people react to charlie's new personality , and on how charlie deals with the consequences of hank's actions . 
<s>  this doesn't really happen ; nearly every supporting character learns about charlie's condition early on , so they don't have any opportunity to be surprised by it .

<s>  perhaps carrey can take solace in the fact that his supporting actors fare no better .

<s>  after viewing the shapeless mess that " me , myself & irene " eventually dissolved into , i was stuck wondering whether or not the farrellys had outsmarted themselves . 
<s>  maybe their kind of comedy can only work for so long until audiences get wise to it and stop being shocked . 
<s>  but i don't believe it -- good filmmakers find ways of surprising their audiences even after people have grown attuned to their style . 
<s>  if the farrellys are indeed good , smart filmmakers ( and i still think they are ) , they'll rebound just fine . 
<s>  even after that happens , though , i'll still consider " me , myself & irene " to be a high-caliber misfire .

<s>  the yet-to-be-released krippendorf's tribe is being marketed as a family comedy , but buyer beware . 
<s>  this movie can't make up its mind . 
<s>  is it a family comedy with vulgar references to both the male and female bodies , menstruation , circumcision , and sex that would make any parents squirm at the thought of having their child next to them ? 
<s>  or is it an adult comedy approached with such immaturity that only adolescents will appreciate the effort ? 
<s>  either way , " unbalanced " is the word to stamp on this hit and miss and miss and miss effort . 
<s>  the premise is catchy - widowed anthropology professor james krippendorf ( richard dreyfuss ) has spent the past two years " getting over " the death of his wife , neglecting key research and squandering grant money on personal living expenses . 
<s>  now it's time to show what he's achieved in those two years , and he has absolutely nothing to show for it . 
<s>  with a fabricated tale of studying a previously undiscovered tribe in new guinea , krippendorf petitions for new funds while hiding the fact that the previous $100 , 000 grant was spent on trips to mcdonald's . 
<s>  but when his " discovery " becomes the latest craze among colleagues , the professor finds he must do more than talk about the tribe - he must create it . 
<s>  with the aid of his three children , the headstrong teen shelly ( natasha lyonne of everyone says i love you ) , the slightly younger mickey ( gregory smith ) , and the nine-year-old edmund ( carl michael lindner ) , the " shelmikedmu " tribe ( named from the first half of each child's name ) is born , and videos quickly produced in krippendorf's backyard are passed off as stunning documentary footage of the newly found new guinea tribe . 
<s>  despite the professor's wishes , the buzz surrounding his discovery only grows , due in greatest part to veronica micelli ( jenna elfman ) , an overly vivacious ( and voluptuous ) anthropologist who barges her way into the discovery and basically deems herself krippendorf's main assistant . 
<s>  hungry for recognition , micelli sets up interviews , lectures , etc . in an effort to make this the biggest sociological event in history , a sure fire way to go down in the history books . 
<s>  krippendorf , on the other hand , is seeing himself go down a jail cell corridor , not in history books , and with each new lecture , he must come up with something impressive to unleash about the tribe - mating habits , domestic structure , etc . thru fumbling improvisation , and often some quick thinking from his oldest son , krippendorf makes it thru each new lecture , but only creates more and more interest in the highly unique tribe . 
<s>  on the opposing end is krippendorf's arch rival , ruth allen ( lily tomlin ) , an arrogant professor whose jealousy drives her on a mission to disprove the existance of the non-existent tribe . 
<s>  it's a cute idea , and approached with a more subtle ( and mature ) style , krippendorf's tribe could've been a real winner . 
<s>  sadly , the mostly-misfired toilet humor , overly comical musical score ( by bruce broughton ) , and sugar coated sentiments ( all the key ingredients of a " family comedy " ) just aren't the right tone for this film . 
<s>  cut that crap out , add some razor sharp dialogue and witty sociological perceptions and you've got a good start . 
<s>  at the state it's in now , you've got something along the lines of medicine man meets mrs . 
<s>  doubtfire meets dumb & dumber , and that's not a concoction anyone should be overly anxious to try . 
<s>  the overall product here is a highly forgettable cup of " average " , with a few laugh-out-loud moments and a great big gap in between them . 
<s>  most of the characters are surprisingly two-dimensional , and the only one who seems to exhibit any real acting effort ( lyonne ) seems to go greatly unappreciated . 
<s>  director todd holland has gone about making this film in all the wrong ways . 
<s>  it's stuck in limbo between disney family fare ( jungle 2 jungle ) and potentially hilarious adult comedy ( a fish called wanda ) . 
<s>  it's this unbalanced structure that really knocks it down a grade , and it's a brutal drop . 
<s>  a strong warning to parents : forget the impression given by advertisements , do you want to take your kids to a film that has a woman asking a man if he finds her attractive merely because she's holding his penis ? 
<s>  yes , it's put that bluntly ! 
<s>  just be warned - this is merely one example of the many shocking subjects to be brought up in the film , and others might not be as tame . 
<s>  it's been hours since i returned from the much anticipated sci-fi opus `mission to mars' , and i can still detect the reek of moldy cheddar . 
<s>  why ? 
<s>  the movie is a shoddy cheesefest full of digital eye candy , stapled carelessly onto a flimsy screenplay which somehow manages to leapfrog the great promise of a space opera , instead shooting for the angle of a feel-good science fiction drama more akin to `2001 : a space odyssey' . 
<s>  i got the feeling that most of my fellow movie-going patrons were expecting another `armageddon' . 
<s>  but no , `mission to mars' certainly isn't one large action sequence about colossal disaster . 
<s>  this is a supposedly thoughtful , family-friendly space flick in which the apocalyptic excitement takes a back seat to visual elegance and uplifting drivel . 
<s>  you have been warned . 
<s>  of course , crafting a tightly claustrophobic space drama is not impossible ( see `apollo 13' for an excellent example ) , but few directors possess the skill and craftsmanship to pull it off without seriously scarring their reputation . 
<s>  brian de palma has enough directorial expertise and visual wizardry up his sleeve to pull it off . 
<s>  when he gets his hands on an intelligent , systematically practical script like `the untouchables' or `mission : impossible' , the director has the ability to create a sound technical achievement ( although his overly indulgent style becomes bothersome more than occasionally ) . 
<s>  of course , there's also the inexcusable string of crap that has carried his name ( including `snake eyes' and the notorious bomb `the bonfire of the vanities' ) . . . . 
<s>  all of which makes me want to call de palma the most talented hack in hollywood . 
<s>  that term may be too harsh , but if i were judging him solely on the perpetual waste of talent that is `mission to mars' , my choice of words would have been slightly less lenient . 
<s>  if i were gary sinise , i wouldn't touch de palma with a 10-foot pole . 
<s>  sinise is a wonderful , wonderful actor , but after appearing in `snake eyes' and this vomit-inducing sham , i'm sure he wouldn't want to risk the embarrassment of a third collaboration . 
<s>  the academy award-winner plays nasa astronaut jim mcconnell , a man who recently lost his wife ( kim delaney ) and is apparently psychologically unfit for an upcoming space shuttle mission to mars ( oops , forgot to mention the year - 2020 ) . 
<s>  after a barbecue get-together for the astronauts , we cut to luc goddard ( don cheadle ) and his team , who are already taking measurements and calculations on the red planet . 
<s>  suddenly , a towering formation of rocks and soil - probably best dubbed a `sand tornado' - appears and creates a whirlwind of suction . 
<s>  for some reason , the astronauts just stand there calmly to admire this , as if it were a lovely piece of art . 
<s>  the team is killed within seconds , expect for luc , who was able to send one final transmission and may still be alive . 
<s>  immediately , a second mission - consisting of astronauts mcconnell , husband and wife woody and terri blake ( tim robbins and connie nielsen ) and phil ohlmyer ( jerry o'connell ) - are dispatched to rescue luc and discover the mysterious secret of planet mars . 
<s>  let's put the `secret' on hold for now , and discuss the trip there . 
<s>  it is explained , whether scientifically accurate or not ( probably not ) , that a trip to mars takes roughly six months . 
<s>  i'm not sure why the quartet of screenwriters behind `m2m' didn't capitalize on this juicy opportunity of creating tension and claustrophobia . 
<s>  instead , we join the team during their final days aboard the ship . 
<s>  what happened during the five months prior to this ? 
<s>  did they just play cards and tell dirty jokes ? 
<s>  still , there are few nicely tense moments ( maybe the only in the movie ) during the time-frame involving a fuel leak . 
<s>  depalma's direction is quite good in these scenes , although the score by ennio morricone is largely inconsistent ( organ music in space ? 
<s>  c'mon ) . 
<s>  there's a few good , imaginative ideas in the landslide of cheese , a sad realization that causes me to sigh out loud . 
<s>  it's a colossal bummer that `mission to mars' is poorly assembled and laughably written , with a dubious and supremely silly finale that will only satisfy dedicated optimists . 
<s>  as mentioned before , anyone looking for some disaster-movie carnage is going to feel savagely disappointed . . . 
<s>  maybe even cheated . 
<s>  after the unbelievably hokey final shot ( with the words ? the end' somehow adding insult to injury ) , a few audience members made the effort to boo and hiss at the screen . 
<s>  others muttered obscenities , shaking their heads in disbelief while mumbling `jeez , that sucked . ' 
<s>  okay , it did suck . 
<s>  but you have to show the actors some sympathetic mercy . . . 
<s>  after all , they do pretty well . 
<s>  sinise is sincere and effective in many of his scenes , robbins and nielsen wholeheartedly convince as a loving nasa couple , and funnyman o'connell - well , he has a couple lines are actually amusing ( and intentionally so ) . 
<s>  the digital effects accompanying the sand tornado sequence are quite impressive . 
<s>  so , by golly , where did this `mission' go wrong ? 
<s>  looking back on the appalling experience , i would say in practically every conduit and crevasse it could have . 
<s>  while watching `mission to mars' , my suggestion would be to immediately abort , or better yet , don't even strap yourself in for lift-off . 
<s>  despite its exceedingly well-done visual effects , 1995's original species was one big hunk of sci-fi cheese , from the writing to the feeble performances . 
<s>  so , coming from such b-grade roots , its sequel's stunning ineptitude is not terribly surprising , yet at the same time it is . 
<s>  it would not have been difficult at all for the people behind species ii to top the hokey original , yet they have somehow managed to fabricate something just as bad , if not even worse . 
<s>  something is clearly amiss when the back door left open for a sequel in species--a sewer rat becomes not quite of this earth after eating a body part from the exploded alien/human hybrid sil--is never entered into ( perhaps that was left for species iii--though i'm not giving away anything when i say that this installment has an open back door of its own ) . 
<s>  the alien fun and games begin this time when a three-person astronaut crew returning from mars inadvertently carries within their soil samples deadly alien dna that eventually infects the mission captain , patrick ross ( justin lazard , late of cbs's short-lived soap of a few years back , central park west/cpw ) . 
<s>  this alien dna is not identical to that which created the original film's sil , but it's close enough , and upon arrival on earth patrick is mating like crazy , engaging in bloody sex with just about every woman he can find .

<s>  exclaims one character in the early going . 
<s>  in terms of quality , he's absolutely right , but he's also wrong .

<s>  looks and sounds an awful lot like the x-files's " black cancer " to me .

<s>  aliens sans flamethrowers .

<s>  the rest of the cast also fails to add much , but the writing can be faulted for that .

<s>  but species ii's worst crime is being a thoroughly uninteresting piece of work .

<s>  for all the blood and gore , nudity , and sex thrown in , species ii is , quite simply , a vapid bore .

<s>   " payback , " brian helgeland's inauspicious directing debut ( coincidentally , he previously penned the award-winning screenplay for 1997's " l . a . confidential " ) , is a wildly uneven and thoroughly unpleasant revenge thriller that takes one idea---a movie with non-stop violence , death , and villains---and runs with it , or should i say , barely manages to crawl away with it . 
<s>  mel gibson , in yet another disappointing picture ( " conspiracy theory " and " lethal weapon 4 , " anyone ? ) , stars as the reprehensible villain/hero , porter , a man who becomes determined to get his 50% share of $140 , 000 , which he stole in a robbery , back when his partner-in-crime ( gregg henry ) and drug-addicted wife ( deborah kara unger ) double-cross him , shoot him , and leave him for dead . 
<s>  porter is not dead , however---not by a long shot---as he quickly rehabilitates and , along with his loyal prositute girlfriend , rosie ( maria bello ) , sets out to make everyone involved in the scam pay . 
<s>  the tagline for " payback " is , " get ready to root for the bad guy , " and sure enough , this is true , as pretty much every significant character who appears is crooked in some way . 
<s>  i wouldn't have a problem with this offbeat detail if the painfully thin story had been of any interest , but it wasn't , and therefore , i found myself having an especially laborious time investing myself into a wide array of character that have absolutely no redeeming qualities whatsoever . 
<s>  no attempt is made to flesh the roles into three-dimensional characters , and there are no vacant signs that anyone has any sort of humanity in them . 
<s>  just because the protagonist , a " bad guy , " is played by mel gibson doesn't mean i will " root for him , " and i didn't . 
<s>  quite the contrary , every person in the movie deserved to die a gory death ( although some of them did , anyway , just to spice up the dull proceedings ) . 
<s>  since none of the respectable actors in " payback " actually have human beings to play , only one performance managed to stand out . 
<s>  lucy alexis liu ( of t . v . 's " ally mcbeal " ) , who plays a spicy s&m dominatrix , brightens up every scene she is in , and has a definite flair for comedy , something i would have liked to have seen more of , since most of the humor fell with a resounding splat . 
<s>  meanwhile , gibson , who is perfectly fine here , sleepwalks through a role that is not the least bit challenging . 
<s>  unger , who made an impression in 1997's " the game , " is surprisingly wasted and it is difficult to see why she took such a part since she disappears ten minutes in , and only has two purproses : ( 1 ) to get high on heroin , and ( 2 ) because she plays a key part in an early flashback . 
<s>  finally , kris kristofferson appears in a throwaway role during the climax , and this unnecessary plot development sticks out like a sore thumb ( tellingly , he didn't appear in the original cut of the film , but was cast when extensive reshoots took place months later ) . 
<s>  like most action movies , the star often takes a licking but keeps on ticking . 
<s>  in the course of the 102-minute running time of " payback , " porter is shot three times in the back , hit by a van , beaten up , and has his feet smashed with a sledgehammer . 
<s>  and guess what ? 
<s>  not only does he survive the whole ordeal , but he is happy-go-lucky in the penultimate sequence ( and can still walk ! ) , 
<s>  even though he looks like he had recently substituted for a punching bag . 
<s>   " payback " is not , in any way , an entertaining film , even though i am sure the makers hoped it would be with all the graphic carnage that goes on , but take away that violence and what you are basically left with is a blank screen . 
<s>  perhaps director helgeland would have been smart to consider this , so he could have at least added a few worthwhile elements , like a fresh storyline and characters whom you could even remotely stand to be around for a few hours .

<s>  i must have , because sitting through this movie was sheer punishment . 
<s>  here's the plot . 
<s>  ricky ( jeff goldblum ) is producer of the good-buy network , one of those 24-hour home shopping channels . 
<s>  the new boss ( robert loggia ) plans to can ricky's behind if he doesn't turn the previous months' flat sales numbers around , and to add to his problems , ricky also has to work with kate ( kelly preston ) , the ivy league wunderkind whom the boss has brought with him . 
<s>  kate and ricky don't get along and don't have any great ideas until they meet g ( eddie murphy ) , a spiritualist who sees something positive in everything . 
<s>  his soothing voice and simple logic makes people feel good , and it's this quality that will make g the new gbn television star and the key to the network's success . 
<s>  the first problem is a flaw in the plot . 
<s>  sure , g makes people feel good . 
<s>  sure , we're told that most people feel guilty after buying an impulse item , no matter how wealthy they might be , and i'll even believe that g talks a talk that allows people to feel good about what they've bought . 
<s>  but , hey , that's after they've bought it .

<s>  the cartoon is way better . 
<s>  that's the bottom line on disney's incredibly hyped live action version of its 1961 animated feature . 
<s>  the alliance between disney and slapstick king john hughes has produced a frenetic " home alone " with puppies , and not much else .

<s>  the original cartoon still works , so what's the point ? " 
<s>  the answer , it appears , is to give disney an excuse for yet another massive merchandising campaign . 
<s>  the story , for those of you who missed childhood , is simple . 
<s>  two dalmatians , pongo and perdy , fall in love at first sight . 
<s>  they drag their " human pets " together , and in a short time both couples marry . 
<s>  the heavenly match-ups turn chaotic when pongo and perdy's new-born pups are stolen ; their dog-napping engineered by the evil cruella devil , who wants them for their pelts . 
<s>  everyone in the animal kingdom then joins in a frantic effort to save the puppies . 
<s>  in the original movie , the animated pooches had a broad range of facial expressions and distinct personalities . 
<s>  we also could hear them talk , which quickly established a crucial element to the charm of the film , the dog's view of humans as their pets . 
<s>  in the new version , the dogs are mute and expressionless . 
<s>  hughes attempts to give them character with repeated shots of the dalmatians draping their heads over each other and licking their faces and necks . 
<s>  while he drew the desired " aww , they're so cute " reaction from the audience , it was quickly followed by several people whispering " i wonder what kind of food they smeared on the dog's heads to get them licking like that ? " 
<s>  the canines' lack of personality would be easier to take if the human beings had a little .

<s>  in previous films , daniels successfully played off his white bread persona . 
<s>  in " something wild " , he revealed the rebellious thrill-seeker beneath his neutral demeanor . 
<s>  in " terms of endearment " , his hapless appearance masked a cold , manipulative womanizer . 
<s>  here , he and richardson are so consistently bland that it's a wonder their images even stick to the film . 
<s>  glenn close , however , has no problems establishing a distinct personality .

<s>  close matches the intensity of the animated cruella by becoming a cartoon herself . 
<s>  with a two-tone fright wig , red gloves with long nails attached to the fingertips , garish animal skin outfits and stiletto heels , close bursts through her scenes like a force of nature . 
<s>  she's clearly having a ball playing this monstrous icon , and her wicked glee is infectious .

<s>  the film comes briefly to life . 
<s>   " 101 dalmatians " is crammed with john hughes' typical heavy-handed approach to comedy . 
<s>  after an ingenuous opening showing pongo's morning routine as he gets daniels prepared for the day , the film quickly tumbles into lame slapstick as the pooch drags daniels on a careening trek through a city park . a little slapstick goes a long way , but hughes just keeps laying it on . 
<s>  the second half of the film , where local animals team up to rescue 99 nondescript dalmatian puppies from devil and her henchmen , is a tedious home alone clone , with the bad guys enduring a variety of sadistic assaults worthy of an itchy & scratchy cartoon , including a thug getting his testicles fried on an electric fence . 
<s>   " 101 dalmatians " has cute puppies and a hoot of a performance from glenn close , but not enough to warrant enduring third rate slapstick , bland characters , and unconvincing animatronic raccoons high-fiving one another .

<s>  after a hiatus of about fifteen years , the disaster movie has come back with renewed zest . 
<s>  in early 1997 , there were no less than three movies about volcanoes alone , one on television and two in the theaters , with dante's peak and volcano in heavy competition for the moviegoing dollar . 
<s>  of the two , i had heard that dante's peak was the better film , so i decided to check it out when it was released on video . 
<s>  the film begins with a slow motion scene of people in a third world country trying to evacuate their little town . 
<s>  the town is being covered in ash and sulfuric water from what we presume is a volcanic eruption . 
<s>  flaming rocks of various sizes also fall from the sky , crushing homes and people . 
<s>  we see people panicking , people crying , and even horses rearing . 
<s>  it is a disaster of biblical proportions , signified to us by one person dragging a cross down a road . 
<s>  symbolism doesn't get much more blatant than that . 
<s>  we learn that harry dalton ( pierce brosnan ) , a volcanologist with the u . s . geological survey , was there with his wife when the eruption occurred . 
<s>  harry survived , but his wife did not . 
<s>  a few years later , harry is sent to investigate some unusual seismic activity detected near the small town of dante's peak , washington ( which , we are told , has been voted second most desirable place to live ( under 20 , 000 ) by the readers of money magazine ) . 
<s>  there harry meets rachel wando , a single mother of two who serves as mayor of dante's peak and proprietor of a small coffee shop . 
<s>  although the mayor doesn't seem to be alarmed by the presence of a man sent to determine if the mountain next to their town is going to blow up , a few members of the city council are . 
<s>  they are afraid that harry's presence is going to scare off an investor who has pledged to put millions of dollars into developing dante's peak . 
<s>  they would rather have any news of possible stirrings within the neighboring dormant volcano swept under the rug . 
<s>  however , when an amorous young couple takes a skinny-dip in the local hot springs , they turn up cooked by lava which bubbles up from a small fissure underneath . 
<s>  thus begins a chain of events leading up to the inevitable eruption . 
<s>  this film contains a number of cliches . 
<s>  the amorous couple is one . 
<s>  as soon as they doff their clothes , you know they're going to die . 
<s>  the town busybody and the abrasive mother-in-law make appearances , as does the death-defying dog . 
<s>  countless familiar scenarios only serve to make this film very predictable . 
<s>  watching the movie , i was able to not only anticipate each of the major plot elements , but some of the dialogue as well . 
<s>  unfortunate , since much of the dialog is terrible . 
<s>  for example , harry's boss , paul ( charles hallahan ) , and a team from the u . s . geological survey join harry to assess the situation . 
<s>  paul basically tells the townsfolk that harry's eruption predictions aren't cause for alarm . 
<s>  this causes harry to leave in a fit of rage , only to turn up the next day , ready for work . 
<s>  when paul asks harry why he stayed , he says with grim determination , " cause this town's in trouble and i'm the best man you've got . " 
<s>  even better is when harry is trying to explain the need to jolt the residents into leaving . 
<s>  he likens the situation to how a frog will jump out if dropped into a pot of boiling water . 
<s>  if the frog is in cold water which is gradually heated up , however , the frog won't move and will allow itself to be cooked . 
<s>   " is that your recipe for frog soup ? " 
<s>  asks one of the team members . 
<s>   " it's my recipe for disaster , " responds harry . 
<s>  dante's peak has a singular talent for pointing out the obvious . 
<s>  our heroes are in a boat in the middle of a lake which harry realizes the volcanic activity has turned to acid . 
<s>  mayor wando demonstrates her brilliant powers of deduction by proclaiming , in a very grave tone , " acid eats metal . " 
<s>  thanks for the tip . 
<s>  when we first see the u . s . geological survey building , there's a caption labeling it as such . 
<s>  this wouldn't have been so bad if it weren't for the fact that the caption is right above a sign on the building which reads , in large letters , " u . s . geological survey . " 
<s>  i suppose the caption is for people who can't read signs . 
<s>  although harry and mayor wando become an item by the end of the film , the viewer has no idea why . 
<s>  there is a severe lack of chemistry between the two characters , and the relationship seems rushed because of this . 
<s>  when they get close to kissing , i was asking myself , " why do they want to kiss ? 
<s>  were they even attracted to each other ? " 
<s>  if i were the mayor , i would sure think twice about kissing a guy who doesn't even crack a smile through the whole movie , trying to pull off the rough-yet-debonair act . 
<s>  who does he think he is ? 
<s>  james bond ? 
<s>  the eruption of the volcano feels similarly rushed . 
<s>  there are several " warning signs " prior to the eruption itself , but they are so lackluster and without suspense that we don't feel as if they are leading up to anything . 
<s>  for example , one of the survey team members makes his way down into the crater of the volcano in order to retrieve a remote controlled robot . 
<s>  a tremor occurs . 
<s>  does he plunge headlong to his death ? 
<s>  is he engulfed in lava which shoots up from below ? 
<s>  no , a couple of rocks fall on him and break his leg .

<s>  it wasn't . 
<s>  one plot thread left noticeably hanging was the investment in the town of dante's peak . 
<s>  in a disaster movie , there's usually one guy who's greedy enough to cover up the possibility of eruption/fire/earthquake/explosion/tsunami/tornado/meteorite , and usually gets killed by the disaster . 
<s>  it's okay , of course , because we all think he got what he deserved . 
<s>  if you're going to be unoriginal , you might as well go all the way . 
<s>  in dante's peak , the city councilmembers are concerned , but they don't really try hard enough . 
<s>  maybe the mayor's abrasive mother-in-law should have been the one .
